description:
Went here for my lunch break! I came right when it opened. Staff was friendly, and the ice cream was good! I don't know if $5.50 for a small, plus $1 for toppings can justify the price... but given the quality it was pretty good.

Pictured is Matcha with Almonds, and Cookie Dough and Crisps.
author: Cyrus D.

description:
Ended up getting the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. The ice cream quality was pretty good, and the cookie dough and other items came together pretty well for an overall pretty enjoyable snack.

The line here also feels like it moves pretty fast, and they do deliver ice cream to you pretty quickly after you order it so things move pretty quickly overall.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Is the ice cream good? Duh, it's ice cream.

Is the way they make it different? Yes - there aren't a whole lotta places using liquid nitrogen to freeze up a batch of creamy goodness.

So why the 3 stars? Limited tasting options - you only get tasters of batches that are already made. Also the reason why they have limited flavors (about 5). A small gives you two scoops, but you can't mix and match flavors...that's no fun. For me, these are some of the key reasons why I love going to get ice cream in the first place soo it's a little bit of a buzz kill when I can't have my fun (Mainly because I'm just super indecisive.).

Great ice cream, but for a $5.25 small and these other tid bits I'll probably choose to go elsewhere 95% of the time.
author: Allie L.

description:
Small spot that's built out of a freight container with 4 flavor ice cream maker station inside. They add nitro while they make the ice cream in front of you and it's super cool to watch. (Especially if you have found kids with you) 
The ice cream is Rich and creamy with the right amount of sweetness. I tried cookie dough with pretzels and the salty pretzel mixed in definitely brings out the flavor. It's a combo of sweet and salty which I love. You don't get chunks of it though as some other ice cream places have but I actually prefer not having pieces of pretzels jabbing me.
author: Janet Y.

description: If you haven't ever had Ice cream made to order with NO2 then you need to get your heiny over to this place and give it a try. We used to have a place similar to this by our house in SoCal and I'm stoked to have found a place like it again. The ice cream is soooooooo creamy. This is not just a gimmick. There is science involved that makes the ice cream feel better in your mouth. As usual with today's ice cream places I could do with some more "normal" flavors but I'm still giving it 5 stars cause it's that good!
author: Marcus K.

description: Gave Smitten another chance because a friend wanted to go.  No change for me - still meh.  Yes, it's made upon order but that is no longer a novelty.  I ordered the Chocolate Ganache & the flavor was weak, where was the chocolate??  Plus $4.20 for a couple tablespoons of ice cream is on the pricey side.  Prefer places (Bi Rite) where there are more flavor choices, tastes are provided & 2 flavors may be ordered in 1 cup.
author: Kim S.

description:
Liquid Nitrogen Icecream... COOOOOL!

I was skeptical about how delicious this ice cream was going to be. But it turned out to be so good. 
I wasn't sure what flavor to get, I was torn between Mint Chocolate Chip and a Bourbon Peach  flavor. 
 
Was super happy with customer service when they noticed my dilemma and fixed it by offering a sample of each flavor! The texture of the ice cream had lighter feel and the flavor was very outstanding.  
I ended up going with the Mint Chip flavor only because I'm not a big fan of caramel and the peach bourbon flavor had a hint of caramel and it was too sweet for me. That hint of liquor though was a real treat and tasted very good.
My friend got the chocolate chip cookie dough with prezels mixed in and I regretted not getting that..! The mint chip was good but not as good as chocolate cookie dough .  
All in all I tried 3 flavors and everything was super yummy. 

I HIGHLY recommend getting their home made waffle cone. It melts in your mouth and it isn't too hard where it scratches the top of your mouth like other cones sometimes do. The cone absorbs the ice cream and it's flavor without getting soggy and melts in your mouth. I really think the cone made the ice cream a thousand time better than it already was.

A story to wrap up why customer service was also a great experience is because after 3 hours had gone by and I left the facility, I was about to board the Cal Train to go home and realized I lost my wallet.  
Low and behold I called this ice cream store and they had it waiting for me (: just really appreciate an honest company and good people who don't take advantage of situations like the one I was in.

Can't wait to come back and eat here again.  Awesome first time experience
author: Tori G.

description:
Yummy!!!!!!

Had the banana brown sugar walnut ice cream and it was so creamy and delicious. We actually didn't intend to come here but the ice cream shop we were trying to go to had way too many people. Good ice cream and fun to watch the nitrogen air while the ice cream is in the making
author: Melissa L.

description:
Took a beautiful night stroll in SF then dinner in Hayes Valley with friends. I noticed that the line to Smitten Ice Cream was long but on our walk back to the car there was no line. I thought "this is my opportunity to find out what other people must know about this place"!

Food: oh my goodness. Ice cream made for you with fresh and local products! Total SF for you! Smitten had only 5 flavors. I was intrigued with the peaches and bourbon flavor so I tried it. A little teaspoon was good but I wasn't sure how a whole cup would be so I decided to have the mint chocolate chip. You can order 2 scoops or more. You can have it served in a cup or waffle bowl. I was sharing with my husband so we opted for a 2 scoop bowl. Trying to watch my girlish figure! :)

Price: ok, you're in SF in a trendy area. You have to know that you're going to pay a lot but it wasn't too bad. Expensive - yes. Ridiculous - no. 

Environment: Smitten is located in a refab shipping container which is very trendy and kinda cool. The shop is small with a couple of benches if you're lucky enough to find a seat. If not, there's a park across the street so you can take a walk there or find a bench.

Location: in the heart of Hayes Valley. Parking is tough but possible to find. 

Overall, it's a good place for fun, trendy ice cream. Given the price, I'm not going back. If it was free, I'd definitely eat it again.
author: Melanie A.

description:
First time visiting and I tried out the caramelized banana walnut ice cream. It was pretty good, good solid flavor of banana with real walnuts sprinkled on top. Price was pretty decent for the portion size and similar to other ice cream places. Setup is pretty nice as you can see them whip up your ice cream fresh on the spot. Their menu rotates, so check their website if you're vying for a specific flavor (which still may or may not be what they're actually serving on that day).

No "seating" except a wooden bench-like rail running around the perimeter of the store not occupied by the counters, and no tables, but it was indoors and shaded, so not complaining about that. Staff was nice, but they were either new or super rushed or overwhelmed, because one person spilled a bunch of ice cream mix on the machine and had to wipe it all down and start over, and another guy sent all the walnuts in my order flying just as he was trying to hand it to me over the counter. But he kindly remade it quickly, so overall, the service was great, it just seemed a bit chaotic at times.

All in all, would probably come back if I was in the area :D
author: Jennifer W.

description: That's some damn good ice cream. The chocolate ganace flavor caught my eye when I walked by, and the next thing I knew I was inside looking at the menu and 100% committed to just getting one little scoop of that... Until I saw the cookie dough with pretzels, and that the smallest you can order is two scoops... So I got a chocolate waffle cone with two scoops of that cookie dough ice cream. It was fantastic. Unfortunately I had to power through it because of course my baby started fussing as soon as my order was called, but let's be honest, I'm terrible at pacing myself with desserts anyway.
author: Liz F.

description:
After chowing down on a spectacular feast, it's best to always end your meals with a delicious sweet treat. And make sure you always save room for dessert! 

Smitten is an interesting looking shop. From afar, it doesn't look your average creamery shop. You could easily miss this joint if you're not familiar with the area. 

I had came here with friends one late night evening. We wanted to try out this shop because my friend who lives in the area had recommended this place. 

We got here just when they were about to close up and they had put all the ice cream flavor jugs away. The only thing that were available were the pint size containers so we forced to select the salted caramel. At this point, I believe it's better than nothing!

As soon as my tastebuds touched the surface of this flavor, it was such a delightful experience. The ice cream flavor had this sweet and salty taste. It was the perfect balance of richness. The texture was creamy and smooth. I could definitely say that this was one of my favorites flavors that I had ever had. 

My overall experience here was a memorable one. I shall definitely be back before for more Smitten's!
author: Anthony N.

description:
If you've never had nitrogen ice cream, it's worth a try, but it's not for everyone. It melts quickly in your mouth, which is kind of strange. The best part about Smitten is you can watch them making the ice cream in front of you.
Most locations have some standard flavors with one or multiple specials. I love the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. It's my go-to flavor if I don't want to try one of the special flavors.
author: Emitom H.

description:
What can be better than a chocolate ice-cream? I don't know. I am in love with ice-cream desserts and Smitten Ice Cream is one of my favorite location for ice-cream.  I liked to see how my ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen. It is fantastic and super yummy. Fresh, delicious, amazing flavors and nice service.  
The only one reason because I rated it with 4 stars it is because of the big lines and I was waiitng about 20 min. Generaly, it is a very good place to enjoy ice cream!
author: Elena L.

description:
This place has some amazing ice cream made to order!
A must-go-to if you are in the city! 
Parking is difficult to find and there is no bathroom though. 
There is a small park type of area with benches right by the shop though!
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
Bourbon peach!!! OMG! On their menu the smallest they offer is two scoops. But if you're like me, ask for the kids size, one big scoop of ice cream! You see them mix the ice cream right in front of you and boy was it yummy!!! The boubon is not overpowering and it mixed well with the peach. The texture of the ice cream was super smooth. 

They were located right next to a park in a container look a like thing. Street parking is available but you still would have to walk there. There are no tables, but plenty are outside where the park is. 

If I come back SF I'll see you again.
author: Lotus H.

description: Initially, I didn't like Smitten that much, but I went back today because I was around Proxy for the jazz fest opening, and I have to say--try the caramelized banana flavor at Smitten! All you need is a small size 2 scoops of one flavor for $5. The caramelized banana is delicious and a wonderful treat.
author: Denise C.

description: Honestly, I do think this place is overhyped. I had the Match ice cream with the waffle cone. Yes, the ice cream was smooth and creamy. But Matcha Ice cream should not be overly sweet and use sugar to cover up the matcha flavor. The sugar was definitely overpowering the matcha flavor and that was a disappointment. Another disappointment was their waffle cone. The Waffle cone taste like sugar and does not have any other flavor and it is also quite brittle it breaks so easily. Overall, I am really disappointed with their ice cream and the cone.
author: Jeff H.

description:
If you're an ice cream lover, you definitely have to try Smitten if you're in the Hayes Valley area!!

On this visit I got the lemon cream ice cream and I was beyond satisfied with it!! The texture of this ice cream is smooth and creamy, and it's paired with a clean and fresh flavor! 

I'm a huge fan of lemon flavored things, but I'm aware that it can be too overpowering at times. However, this lemon ice cream is the perfect combo of sweet and tart and leaves a very refreshing feeling on your palate!

For the price, you get a well portioned cup of ice cream that leaves your satisfied and not too full. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone who's an ice cream lover!!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Yikes, maybe I came during an off-night? I was not impressed by the ice cream selection! There were only 4 to choose from - though they weren't all vanilla-flavored, all the flavors were super vanilla...

I was bored just looking at the menu but had hyped up this place so much to my sisters that we decided to try their 3 of 4 flavors: TCHO Chocolate, Salted Caramel, and Strawberry Buttermilk. All were good (spoken in a sudden high-pitched tone) - good as in I could have gotten this at Trader Joe's!

Super confused about why people like this place, but to each his own I guess...
author: Claire W.

description:
I love this delicious ice cream! Every scoop is made to order, and you can definitely taste the freshness. 

I'm addicted to their rich TCHO chocolate, but it's really worth branching out if you have the strength! The berry flavors taste just like the actual fruit, and you always want to upgrade to a waffle cup or cone. 

This part of Hayes Valley is just adorable too. I love the indoor-outdoor setup with the revolving art installation in the center square. Definitely a cool spot to relax if you're in the area.
author: Emma J.

description: My friend (who is now a local to Berkeley) brought my hubby and I here. He had not been but was a mission to bring us here. He says that very often the line for this place wraps around the block. Thankfully it was NOT that way when we came. The menu is not extensive, but the flavors are unique (or just very California). Service was prompt for my husband and I but my friend had to wait a while for his. The ice cream here is flash frozen with liquid nitrogen; supposedly that is what gives the ice cream it's creamy quality. I had the cookie dough, which had caramel and even pretzel chunks. Delicious. Hubby had watermelon cream; he enjoyed his portion. Friend Tom had something that he said was relatively equal to green tea. The shop is not large but they had outdoor seating available. Would I come here on a regular basis if I was a local? Probably not, but it was interesting to taste ice cream that was made this way. Definitely worth a try!
author: Christy M.

description:
Smitten is always pretty good. I believe this is the orginal SF location and it was cool to read about their humble beginnings and the cooling process etc. 

The brrrr machine is cool and the ice cream is made right in front of you. I like the cookie dough and  pieces of pretzel in the ice cream as well. 

There is a park , open area just outside of this venue and it's a nice place to be on a sunny San Francisco day.

So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Recchiuti Confections 
24 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
I'm sure someone has said this before, but I'm pretty smitten with Smitten.  And I really like this location.  Cute little area to hang out on a sunny day.  

My favorites are the cookie dough with pretzels and the TCHO chocolate.  Not much else to say except these folks make some good ice cream.  The smallest size is a whole lot of sweet to eat by myself though and I usually have to toss the last couple of bites so I don't make myself completely sick unless I'm sharing with a friend.  

Thanks for using all compostable ice cream bowls and tiny spoons.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Is this overly hyped? Yes
Is the wait sometimes hellish? Yes
Is it worth it? Yes

Watch ice cream get made. Fight with your fam about who ate more of the shared ice cream. Good times. 

We went with plain vanilla but the arguing we were doing with each other was beyond plain. This is ice cream with fighting over.

Plenty of spots to sit and eat outside. Perfect if the weather is nice and it's a workday.
author: Loli L.

description:
I love this place, it's so good. You should come here, because it not has hella good and creamy nitrogen ice cream, it is also in a nice hipster area in Hayes Valley where you can get yo ice cream on then explore the neighborhood! It gets busy though, but they go through evryone's order pretty fast, fortunately. 

And you get to watch them make the ice cream first ;)
author: Jen K.

description: Decent ice cream freshly made and handed out with a mini-spoon. Nada fancy but still yummy!  Went with the basic vanilla double scoop with caramel. Can't go wrong with a basic choice!
author: Jose M.

description:
Stopped by one afternoon to check out the nitrogen ice cream! I was mostly fascinated by the owner having designed, built and patented the ice cream maker that uses nitrogen. I think that really takes some really serious passion.

I went for the classic: vanilla with a strawberry syrup topping. The strawberry syrup felt really fresh, not overly sweet and had a deep strawberry flavor. The ice cream was incredibly and perfectly smooth, only the fast freeze process using nitrogen can achieve this.

My only advice here is I wish the vanilla had a stronger flavor. I couldn't see any vanilla bean seeds in there and it was essentially a bit light on the vanilla.
author: Thomas L.

description:
My favorite experience about Smitten Ice Cream is that they make the ice cream right in front of you. They use a liquid nitrogen Brrr machine to make the ice cream fresh. You can taste the difference!

AMBIANCE gets an A. This location resembles a pop-up shop, so you basically get in and get out. There is a small park beside the shop with places to sit, which is super convenient. 

ORDERED Cookie dough with pretzel and chocolate chip in a waffle cone. 

FOOD - ok, this is my only qualm. The menu is so small. I didn't like the flavors they had available, so I went with the cookie dough and... pretzels? I don't immediately think of pretzels when I think of ice cream (hell, I thought the idea was gross), but I admired the quality of the ice cream. 

RATING is a flowery four. Head to Hayes Valley one Sunday, enjoy a coffee with a friend, and make your way over to this spot. I've seen the other flavors online, so I look forward to going back and checking those out!
author: Nicholas G.

description:
Definitely a lot of Smittens around SF, but I was conveniently here with my siblings one day so this is the place I'll review.

Pros:
- It's a little pop-up store next to Ritual Coffee and next to a pretty nice area where people can stroll about while their children play in that interesting looking jungle gym made of rope. 
- In an area where you can also find a lot of stores and whatnot.
- Menu is simple, consists of ice cream flavors, number of scoops/size, option of waffle cone or cup, and toppings
- Flavors are not the usual kind, so you should definitely try out some of the unique flavors available.
- Accepts cash/card
- Indoor seating available
- Liquid nitrogen ice cream is the coolest ice cream ~

Cons:
- Street parking is difficult to find, expect to walk a few blocks if you're down to do so.
- Pretty pricey ice cream.
- Only 4 flavors at a time. Although this could be considered a pro for the workers since it's easier for them to manage how they make a particular flavor.
- line gets long.

I has originally ordered their cookie dough but sadly I was given the TCHO chocolate due to miscommunication. It's was definitely rich in flavor and the texture was smooth and easily melts in your mouth. But I don't prefer chocolate so much so maybe next time I'll get my actual flavor.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I love this place. Have been there multiple times. It is so amazing so see them making ice cream in front of me.
All their flavours are so good. My favourite is Chocolate Chip cookie dough with pretzels.
author: Megha S.

description:
Renown for its technology, Smitten certainly had a comparative advantage in creating ice cream from liquid nitrogen, a well known yet innovative concept developed recently. 

Menu was rather simple, either the fixed flavor (chocolate, honey thyme), or a daily special (blueberry lavender on my day of visit), and one can opt for different toppings and sauces to drip on top.  Very creamy indeed, yet very balanced once melt in mouth. 

Extra credit for the baked almond topping!
author: Elaine H.

description:
Adorable little place with old-fashioned ice cream, cool customer interface, friendly service and the requisite "San Francisco" signature (not enough seating) = recipe for success.

I could have ordered any flavor with any topping and it would be fantastic. 

I stopped here when I was with a date and we were headed to a COOKING CLASS. Yes, on our way to cook and eat a massive, gourmet dinner, I felt compelled to stop here so I could consume ice cream. Why? Not just because I clearly have impulse control issues, a massive sweet tooth, no sense of decorum or judgment, and a "why not" attitude to eating, balanced only by part-Asian genes that help me from becoming obese . . . what was I talking about?

Oh, yes. This place is seductive. It will get you. Give in to your base instincts.
author: Karen r.

description:
Wow...really amazing ice cream. Even if you ignore the nitrogen cool factor or shtick depending what you think, the liquid nitrogen really makes smooth ice cream...tiny ice crystals makes super smooth, creamy, rich ice cream. Fantastic fresh ingredients make really fresh, natural and most importantly very tasty ice cream.

Had the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips yesterday and it was among the best ice cream i've ever had in my life. The fresh waffle cone was also super light and fresh an awesome accompaniment.
author: David L.

description:
Cookie Dough with Pretzels and Chocolate Chips all the way!

Smitten is my go-to ice cream store in SF! The texture is so smooth and the flavors so vibrant. Cookie dough, pretzels, chocolate chips sounds almost overwhelming with how many flavors it meshes in, but it's oh so perfect. I've tried tcho chocolate which is quite popular, but I still prefer the cookie dough. 

The staff are pretty nice. If you ask nicely, they may be willing to give you a free sample. The line has been around 5-10 min and then 5 min to get the ice cream. Ice cream is made fresh for you with the Nitrogen gas.

They just ended their Thanx program, but sign up for their email if you want the latest news and occasional deals!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
What an amazing find after receiving a STRONG recommendation from a local San Fran resident! 

We were much in desire for some after-dinner ice cream treats, and this place was right around the corner from where we had dinner! Cute little corner spot that was serving up five delicious flavors. Limited options - but the flavors they do have were *AMAZING*. It was super fun to watch them utilize nitro for quick chilling and made-to-order serves. 

At the time of our visit they were providing the following flavors: Earl Gray, Chocolate, Cookie Dough with Pretzel (infused in ice cream), Meyer Lemon, and a classic Vanilla. 

I opted for the cookie dough with pretzel, and added on their chocolate krispies (which are kind of like over-sized chocolate rice krispies) and it was BOMB.COM. 

I should have asked for a sample of all of their flavors, but I was too awe struck with the scoops I had to think clearly. 

They take credit cards - not much seating but they do have a few benches (no tables) to sit at inside their little hut if you don't want to carry your treat around outside.
author: Courtney W.

description:
Smitten with Smitten! I'm sure everyone says that! On the corner of Octavia and Linden, this little shop makes the cutest and most delicious flavors of ice cream! I'm honestly not a sweets person and I don't normally go for ice cream - but I think Smitten might actually be able to change that! It's really surprisingly good! Their "churned to order" motto using a liquid nitrogen technique is awesome to witness and makes for a really fun experience. 

BLUEBERRY LAVENDER is where it's at! This seasonal flavor was amazing - fresh and bright it didn't feel heavy at all and I just loved the infusion of fruit flavor! I happily chowed down on my beautiful purple/blue round scoop like a kid with my tiny ice cream spoon while my boyfriend enjoyed a TCHO chocolate with salted caramel. That was a gem too. If there was any flavor of ice cream I really wouldn't go for - it's chocolate - yet there is something about the way this ice cream is made - I could totally eat a scoop of the TCHO - it was rich, not overly creamy, but brightly dark (if that even makes sense). Maybe I'd describe it more like a mild dark chocolate instead of those intense bitter ones that make you squirm. The TCHO is good stuff. Even for non-chocolate lovers like myself - this was delicious! (Would still choose blueberry though!). 

It was a cold day when we went actually - and they had small benches to sit (maybe 10 people max) and heated lamps! It was a nice escape from the cold weather and I couldn't believe how enjoyable the experience was despite that! Would totally recommend! We made a special visit coming back from Big Basin for it and it was definitely worthwhile!
author: Deanna S.

description:
I've been to the Berkeley location loads of times, so I pretty much knew what to expect at this location - perfection. 

The location is amazing - everyone was out in the sun and enjoying the day. The store itself has a small sitting area and it's just a really light-hearted environment. It smells AMAZING and the ice cream is churned fresh, made-to-order. 

The best part, in my opinion, are the interesting flavors. I shared a medium order of honeythyme with a couple of friends. I normally hate flower-flavors (honeythyme contained orange blossom), but the ice cream was so interesting. I could definitely taste the thyme, but not in an overpowering way. 10/10 would order again.

I highly recommend hitting up Smitten - any of their locations. You can't go wrong!
author: Waverly R.

description:
My favorite ice cream ever! Texture and creaminess are my top priorities in an ice cream, and Smitten blows the competition away.

They have a short list of flavors, usually only five (chocolate, cream fraiche, etc), but each one is always so so good and rich in flavor.

Note: Cute location next to a small park in Hayes Valley, limited street parking nearby, very busy on evenings/weekends, and fun atmosphere.
author: Michelle B.

description:
This is the best ice cream I have had.  They have a great selection; very limited, but great flavors.  The process is fun to watch and it really demonstrates how quick chilling makes a great texture.  

We had the Earl Grey with the chocolate crisps.  Far too often Earl Grey ice cream doesn't have the flavor.  Here is it perfect.  It is a good punch without being overwhelming.  

The serving sizes were generous and reasonably priced.
author: Neil W.

description:
LIQUID NITROGEN ICE CREAM IN HAYES VALLEY

Smitten is an ice cream stand in the heart of Hayes Valley, perfect for a pit stop in between shopping. They make the ice cream in front of you with their liquid nitrogen machines, which makes their ice cream icy while creamy at the same time. I got their COOKIE DOUGH WITH PRETZELS & CHOCOLATE CHIPS. It's essentially what you want from Cold Stone, but it tastes way better! Their cookie dough is egg yolk free - there are buttery chunks of cookie dough mixed into a malted brown sugar ice cream so that the usual cookie dough texture is not present in each bite. The pretzels are chopped big enough to get a salty and crunchy texture, and the chocolate chips balance out all of these flavors with a subtle sweet flavor. This flavor is a regular of theirs, and I loved it! 

Since there is only wooden bench seating available here, there is no room to sit in the stand, but there are plenty of benches and tables in the surrounding park area.
author: Sophie P.

description:
Believe the hype!  I had the bourbon peach, creamy with a distinct peach flavor and just a touch of bourbon.  my companions had tcho chocolate (incredibly dense and chocolate, almost like a frozen mousse) and cookie dough with pretzels and choc chips, spicy caramel sauce. 
All of them so yummy.  And an exceptional waffle cone.
author: J W.

description:
This is the kind of ice cream place everyone should check out when they come to the city. It's got really cool flavors, mini liquid Nitrogen vats oozing their mysterious vapors behind the counter, a modern feel....not to mention, a dog park across the street!! Bonus points :D

I got the earl grey ice cream and it was so authentic. There were little bits of chocolate and a strong, strong flavor of tea. My friend and I got the same one and both of us were very happy with it. If you like earl grey, this one's for you. It was a bit pricey, at $5 for a small, but because it's so yummy I think it's within reason. 

This is really close to the newly opened Italian restarurant, A mano, and countless other restaurants, so it's really convenient to come here for dessert right after.
author: Julia Y.

description: It was koo!!! But nothing crazy or super yum that i would crave for. Had the cookie dough and the scoops were like baby scoops. There isn't that much of a selection. Worth a shot once but no need to go back for more. The best part was watching them make the ice cream.
author: Theresa M.

description:
My review is for their service, not their ice cream.

My s/o wanted to get their seasonal creme fraiche w/ pear caramel flavor, so we stopped by before I headed over to Salt & Straw.

Their flavors here are fairly plain, with the exception of their seasonal ones (creme fraiche w/ pear caramel + vietnamese coffee), which are $1 more. 

The cashier helping us on Sunday night wanted us to get 4 scoops, each with a $1 upcharge. Two scoops is already about $5 and change (+1 for the seasonal flavor)...so definitely not. As much as I love ice cream, I will not be paying over $10 for 4 tiny scoops. 

Also, the creme fraiche with pear caramel sauce is NOT a new seasonal item, it's been featured before. So not only did he try to give us the worst deal ever on ice cream, he doesn't even know what flavors Smitten has had to offer.
author: Shirley H.

description: The experience is fun. Good place to gather and talk inside or out. We got a cookie dough and fresh mint. It was a good comparison because it shows the strengths and weaknesses of the liquid nitrogen method. The cookie dough was not fantastic. The cookie dough pieces were small and the vanilla was not sufficiently creamy. The fresh mint on the other hand was the best! Probably the best mint I've ever had -- and I usually don't like mint. The freshness of flavor is something you don't find even in the homemade ice creams. Hands down - get the mint. Even if you doing like mint, you will likely enjoy this one.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Who doesn't love seasonal ice cream flavors? This liquid nitrogen goodness serves different flavors every now and then. The last one I tried was the Rosé!. 

My favorite has to be the Earl Grey. Add a few toppings (they also have recommended pairings) and you get different combinations you can try in there. 

Also I want to mention that the ice cream tends to be on the melt-quicker side, and they are soft. Grab one and sit around the park right across from it or shop around the area.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Had to try it for ourselves!  
It was above average.  Very smooth and different.
Went with vanilla in a waffle cone with rainbow sprinkles.  Just loved the flavor.  My daughter got the cookie dough with pretzel bites. Got the flavor of the salt against the sweet cookie dough!  Again good smooth flavor.  And the chocolate sauce was great!
author: Diane M.

description:
This is my favorite place for ice cream in California! I love how they make it in front of you. They only have four flavors everyday, but believe me they taste good! 

Only down is the price! Personally it costs a lot- 5$ for a small and 6$ for regular (3small scoops) and 1.50 per cone. The gentleman in front of me got extremely upset when he saw the size of his small.
But I think the taste it worth it!

Must go!
author: Sandy C.

description:
If you've never been there, go. Now. 

The flavor and mouthfeel of the ice cream is second to none. You won't be disappointed with any flavor you pick, and you can watch them make your own special cup of awesomeness right before your eyes. 

One piece of advice, be sparing on the toppings, since sometimes the flavors can take over and drown out the taste of the actual ice cream a bit. 

Pricey treat, but well worth it if you are on a special date or just feel like splurging on dessert.
author: Mama S.

description:
Nice to stop by for the first time in a while and see some newer, unique flavors!

* Earl Grey - 4.5 stars
Very tasty!

* Sweet Corn - 4 stars
Really nice, and it could have easily been overdone. Definitely the sweeter of the two flavors.
author: Ziyan C.

description: They offer some tasty ice cream (their freshly baked waffle cones smell divine), but if you're going to have ice cream in Hayes Valley, go to Salt & Straw instead! They have more flavors and I think their ice cream is better, too.
author: Cece Y.

description:
Even Darth Vader would give 4 starts to an ice cream shop yet this places has managed to illicit a one star from me. The makers of this ice cream have severely under active tastebuds because this ice cream is unbearably sweet.  I couldn't even finish my small serving and walked away utterly bewildered why such a place would be in the business of selling something so screamingly sweet. 

I'm waiting for the day an announcement is made that they've fired the ice cream maker with faulty taste buds and dramatically reduced the sugar! Until then, they have lost me and many other potential patrons. I even called the shop and complained to the nice employee about their severely over sweetened ice cream.

Get it together Smitten!
author: Qas G.

description:
One of the best icecream
Ever! Really nice ice crystals as they advised, really smoothy texture and creamy flavor, I tried their earl grey flavor today, a big flavor which distinguish itself from others!
author: Christine Z.

description: Absolutely delicious!!! Hands down the best ice cream I've had in a while.... service great && the presentation is very cool... ice cream is MADE TO ORDER... so fresh and creamy. I really liked that there weren't many choices.. basic and straight to the point but absolutely delicious.
author: Daniella G.

description: I got 3 scoops of the TCHO chocolate ice cream. Amazing mouthfeel, especially since it's so freshly made. If you can, get the waffle cone (I didn't and regret my decision; it smelled so good when they were making a fresh batch).
author: Josh L.

description:
Unique flavors made right in front of you. The ice cream is as much of a treat as watching it being frozen with liquid nitrogen. 

The little park in front of the Ice-cream place is great for lounging on the grass, and has a nice play structure for kids.
author: Katherine G.

description:
Smitten has me smitten by their ice cream.  I'm in love.

I am a fan of good ice cream and they had me at first bite.  It was mere hours before I had to catch my flight back from my mini vacation and my local friends decided to make a pit stop for some ice cream before airport.

It was like a small hut and very quaint and simple set up.  The flavors were written on the glass in front of the nitrogen mixer bowl and I was instantly attracted to the "Earl Grey" flavor. Unfortunately, it had sold out for the night and I chose the Classic Vanilla. Nonetheless, it was still awesome.  The cream that they use and the texture of the ice cream was smooth and rich, it was perfect.  As goldilocks of ice cream, this would be considered' just right' 

Now, that I am back to LA, I am still thinking about it and looking forward to my next visit in SF for that Smitten Ice Cream.

Must bookmark and try for ice cream lovers.
author: Cindy W.

description:
WOW, and I really mean wow. They have definitely raised the bar on artisanal ice creams. You really can't beat the amazing texture, taste and delicate balance of the cream and flavors. 

I can't walk past this place without ordering a cup of ice cream.
author: Steven B.

description:
YUM! I love Smitten's ice cream. It is perfectly creamy, the flavors are unique and delicious, and the space is adorable! Located right next to
Patricia's Green, this is the perfect spot to get ice cream on a warm day. At night, there are strings of lights inside, and it gives the place a warm and cozy feeling. The staff is always friendly, and they keep the line moving quickly even when it's crowded!

I can be quite picky when it comes to ice cream, but Smitten has yet to disappoint. My favorite flavor so far is the Earl Grey with Milk Chocolate Chips- they have perfectly captured the flavor of the tea, and the chocolate chips enhance it even more. 

There is a vegan option, but it isn't quite the same as the regular ice cream- they used to have two vegan flavors but they have discontinued the salted caramel and they have a mediocre fudge bar left. I would not recommend this place to a vegan, but if you can handle dairy, it is among the best ice cream you'll ever have!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
If you're at Smitten, forget all of the other flavors and just go for the cookie dough with pretzel.  It's the absolute best and any other flavor has been a disappointment to me (it doesn't seem like you're able to try flavors either).  Also if you're torn on the size, go for the regular because you get 3 scoops instead of 1 for just a dollar more.   

If you're here for the whole nitrogen ice cream gimmick, it's really not worth the hype.  It's kind of fun to watch for the first time, but I personally don't taste that much of a difference?

This location is small compared to the one in Berkeley so expect to pick up your ice cream and continue on with your day.  I find myself only coming back to Smitten because it's in the area and I'm in the mood for ice cream.  Otherwise, I wouldn't make a huge effort to come back.  The Bay Area is tough on the ice cream competition!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Stopped by in the afternoon after a lovely chamber music concert at the SF Symphony. One of my co-workers raved about this place, and so it was one of those "must-try" places on my food list. Their ice cream is made fresh, and I loved how they added the nitrogen and essentially make it in front of you. Of course, I had the internal debate of which flavour to get, but recently I've been into trying the most "out-there"/unique thing on the menu instead of something safe/that I know I would probably like (e.g. good ol' chocolate), so I settled for chocolate passion plantain.

- Chocolate passion plantain: chocolate covered plantain chips in passion fruit ice cream. Wow! The subtle fruity notes played really well with the chocolate plantain chips, and the banana-type flavour was very complementary, not overpowering at all. The texture was perfect and super creamy. Definitely the creaminess blew me away!

The little info boards on the side were quite interesting as well. They documented how Smitten came to be, and why the ice cream tastes so good (well, the "why" without really disclosing the real secrets!). It's incredible how much quality ingredients and brains (for making the ice cream machine!) goes into making the ice cream. It really shows in the flavour and texture of the frozen treats. I'll definitely be back to try the other flavours!
author: Joanna C.

description: Omg so good. Loved the cookie dough/pretzel flavor.  Only have a few flavors and long but fast moving line.  Amazing ice cream and worth seeking out.  I'm still dreaming about it back here on the east coast.
author: Laura S.

description: Except the cool nitrogen ice-cream machine, the ice-cream is quite too sweet. It left a very strong after taste, and it's not a good taste. I had the chocolate ganache, the ice-cream itself was rich and creamy, but the scoop is tiny for the price... Went to Salt and Straw instead.
author: Nhi B.

description: This place is great! It's fun just watching them make the ice cream. I mean you don't see it, but you get to see the fog coming out from the machines which is pretty fun! I had their strawberry ice cream and it was delicious! There's only street parking, but the line here doesn't really get too long. Definitely worth checking it out!
author: Brennen D.

description: Um, ahhhmazing delicious and smooth ice cream. We got the chocolate finches with spicy caramel and almonds. And the upside down pineapple cake when oat crumble and brown sugar caramel. Would definitely go back
author: Pauline G.

description: Creamy rich deep chocolate flavor with slightly bitter crispies for crunchiness on top. With a waffle bowl, the total came out to $7.88 for a small. Great ice cream but sooo expensive for what it is. Today is definitely splurge Saturday!
author: Angie Y.

description:
The line was out the door at this place! And after trying their nitrogen ice cream I know why! The hype is real. 

I came here on a Saturday night and I sat at the park right in front watching how long the line was getting. There was at least 20-25 people waiting for ice cream! So I really wanted to try! Luckily at the time I went I was probably 5th in line, but be prepared to wait!

I went with the Fresh Mint in a waffle cone and it came out within 2 min! I got the smallest size and it was actually real filling; I couldn't finish it. But yes! It was delicious! Super fresh! And the cone?! Omg it was buttery goodness! Definitely go with the cone. 

This place was cool, I recommend Smitten for their fresh, creamy ice cream and just the experience!
author: Meliza M.

description: Right next to some very nice streets with awesome stores to check out as well as a very artsy park! Warning, the building can get quite hot while you're waiting for your ice cream to get liquid-nitrogenized, but good thing you're getting ice cream, right?! They have seasonal flavors that seem to change every year even. I've been visiting the Cupertino store for quite some time now as well as the one in Santana-Row; they're all yummy and worth the time, money, and calories!
author: Murray N.

description:
I usually dislike both overly fancy nitrogen ice cream and cookie dough ice cream but somehow Smitten Ice Cream has made me a believer.  The ice cream here is definitely on the pricy side but, hey, dessert is to be eaten in moderation anyway so what's wrong with shelling out for the food stuff once in a while?
We got the dough my goodness sundae. This is the cookie dough w/ chocolate chips and pretzels ice cream topped with hot fudge and more cookie dough (we skipped the whipped cream). First of all, the ice cream itself is amazing.  It had a great malted milk flavor and had such a smooth texture that made the nitrogen hype worth it for once. The cookie dough itself wasn't rocklike as I've found in other ice creams and actually quite delicious. The pretzel pieces added a nice saltiness and texture. My only gripe is that the pretzels were a bit stale. It would have been even better if there were more crunch to them. 
Overall, I'd totally come here again hands down and I don't even like sweets that much.
author: Amy X.

description:
Wow ! This has to be one of the best hand made ice cream in San Francisco. If you are in Hayes Valley it's a must try don't take my word for it. Try it your self and let me know! 
Oh 
Try the Caramelized Banana Walnut
author: Yankee C.

description:
I got there and there was a bit of line. I thought "it must be worth it if people are lining up." Ordered the fresh mint tasting chocolate chip mint and cookie dough for my significant other with their own made sugar cones ....Omg, so good !! Of the two, I'd say the chocolate chip mint was the best. Will have to revisit this place again & try their other things.

The only weird thing is that they don't mix flavors on the same order. So if you want two scoops, they have to be the same flavor unless you order another cup or cone.
author: Ruby V.

description:
Smitten is the best science experiment on the block. Besides the novelty of the liquid nitrogen ice cream, Smitten does live up to its hype of good ice cream! They have a handful of flavors and the menu offers handy sauce and topping pairings so if you're one of those people that can't decide, check out the menu suggestions!

My last trip here I tried the cookie dough and it was soooOOoOo delectable! I don't mind forking over $6 for ice cream (because you just have to face the realities of SF pricing), but I think it's worth it.
author: Kristie F.

description:
Wait - 10-15 minute wait

Value - $5 / dish.

Dish Size: Small. 

Mascarpone with Apricot Jam - Highly recommend this cocktail if you're looking for something refreshing. It's definitely a well balanced fruity cocktail with a bit of citrus, lemon, and a raspberry flavor. 

Bee Sting - A must order. Essentially an alcoholic version of a Snow Plover*. Beyond tasting delicious, the presentation of the Bourbon Lift is also very striking. There's a large layer of foam "lifting" from the rim of a glass, with only a small metal straw sticking through the foam. 


Smitten Ice Cream is another one Bay Area's essential ice cream shops to try. The difference with Smitten is that their ice cream is made to order, with the help of liquid nitrogen and their patented Brrr ice cream machine. One of the enjoyable experiences of Smitten is watching your ice cream being made with liquid nitrogen. A large fog pillows out of the ice cream maker and suddenly the cream instantly becomes ice cream. 

I'm not sure about the science, but the ice cream made with liquid nitrogen has a creamier texture and denser consistency. Also, the ice cream seems to take longer to melt? The flavors of Smitten are constantly changing but tend to be reinterpretations of classical flavors. Unlike Garden Creamery which tend to be more Asian centric. Some of the more notable flavors have been the Mascarpone with Apricot Jam and Bee Sting. 

The Hayes Valley Smitten is perfect place to stop by after dinner at one of the many nearby restaurants. The place is small as it's setup inside a renovated shipping container. However, you don't actually sit in the shipping container, as there's a small covered patio with limited seating. But there's plenty of seating in the adjacent park or within the PROXY lot. 

Smitten makes good ice cream, but what makes it special is the experience of watching your ice cream being made.
author: Julian L.

description: This was probably the best cookie dough ice cream I ever had. It felt like every bite was actually frozen cookie dough. It's cute little corner joint. Limited seating but surrounding area has enough common space so it's okay. Would definitely recommend grabbing a cone, day or night.
author: Grace A.

description: Loved the place. You can see the ice cream churning. The ice cream lived up to its reputation. I ordered the chocolate ganache with a drizzle of choc syrup. The ice cream was the right amount of dark and the syrup had this wonderful flavor BEYOND chocolaty
author: Vidushi S.

description:
Fantastic ice cream made fresh to order. That's right, they make the ice cream to order, and you get to watch the show! Be prepared to wait a bit if you go for the home made ice cream since it can take 5-10minutes.

The ice cream itself is amazing. How can it not be? Staff -  super friendly and patient as well. I am really glad I stopped by here after dinner. I didn't even know it was there until I crossed the block. Great place, and I hope to see some in NYC sometime!
author: Mike F.

description:
I came here on a late afternoon weekday and was amazed by the quality of ice cream made here. This Smitten location is a small, pop-up like ice cream joint with lots of natural lightning (makes great for those snap/insta posts!). Walk across the street to enjoy your cone/cup at a family-friendly park. Located in the heart of Hayes Valley, it is definitely a go-to if you're around the area or the Mission.

While it was pricy, the shop offers a myriad of flavours that you don't usually find elsewhere. I went ahead with their "cookie dough" flavour and enjoyed it thoroughly. The ice cream strikes the perfect blend of creaminess and sweetness. Along with their casual and 'hipster-esque' ambiance, it was altogether a great experience that makes for a fun family outing.
author: Raymond D.

description: Delicious handmade ice cream, with unique flavors and one of the best handmade waffle cones I've had. Smitten does their thing and is one of the best in SF, unless you're talking Bi-Rite Creamery which gives them a run for their money.
author: Paul L.

description:
Looking for fab dessert after a late dinner at Hayes Valley. Friend suggested this place and of course I had to check the ratings at Yelp! LOL! WoooOOOHH! 1000+ reviews with four star ratings! Smitten it is! 

It was Friday night and the line was long. It does goes quick though. They freshly make 3-4 ice cream flavors and these flavors are really good! Just the right amount of richness and sweetness. That night they had salted caramel, cookie dough, lemon and tcho chocolate flavors. Had cookie dough with tcho crumbles, sooo good! Bit pricey, $6 but so worth it! Can't wait to come back and try their other flavors!
author: Chris S.

description:
Overpriced ice cream... -_-

About $6 for 2 scoops.
Got to chik fil a and get a vanilla ice cream in a cup for $2. you'll thank me later.
author: James S.

description:
Dear Smitten Ice Cream,

Typically I always order the same thing at ice cream shops-  chocolate on a cone or if I'm feeling adventurous with sprinkles. So at first I was a little taken back that you only had three options for flavors, but the engulfing smell of waffle cones helped put me at ease. Having the flavors of the day forced me out my same old routine and I tried the Cookie Dough that had pretzels and chocolate chips mixed in. S w o o n. The sweet and salty combo was so tasty and the o m g that waffle cone. 
I think it's safe to say I'm smitten with you!
author: Daniella C.

description:
YES! I am a fan of this little ice cream shop! I ordered Cookie Dough and it was exactly to my liking! I came here when I was in San Francisco and yes, I was glad that I was passing by this little ice cream place. I've tried many liquid nitrogen ice cream, and their Cookie Dough was top notch. If you like ice cream that has some crunchy taste in it, then viola! Cookie Dough is the one for you! 

Please do come and check it out and you won't regret it!
author: Aldo H.

description:
First time here, tried their Passionate and Lemon Cream.

Loved both flavors, creamy and tasty 

Will be back to try their other Flavors 

Thanks for making quality ice cream
author: Mack A.

description: This is a fancy ice cream joint that specialises in Nitrogen ice-cream. Its made to order and the secret to the creamy ice cream is all in the rapid freezing of the mixture. The liquid nitrogen causes the fat and the water particles to stay very small, giving the ice cream its creamy consistency. The goal is to avoid ice crystals so it's a lot creamy than your regular ice-cream. Keep in mind they only offer three to four flavours each day so it's a hit or miss. I was hoping to try their earl grey ice cream but they only had chocolate, coffee and cookie dough which didn't quite interest me.
author: Cindy H.

description: Went here with my friends and I must say it is sort of a hole in fhe wall maybe? It's not a fancy place but has character. They make your ice cream fresh although it takes a while. I got the vanilla one and it was sooo good. The only missing star is maybe assigning a number for the orders because my two friends ice creams were snagged hy customers after us so we were wondering why it was taking long when we ordered at the same time. They only have a few flavors but they are good!
author: Andrea G.

description:
The ice cream here is really good! I've been here twice and their menu is pretty simple, not a lot of options which was kind of odd in the beginning because there wasn't anything that stood out too much, but in the end it was really good nonetheless. 

The place is really small and is more like a booth so it's like a to-go place, and it wasn't too busy the couple times I came here, their ice cream is really solid and it's liquid nitrogen ice cream. Definitely not the cheapest, but it's cheap enough.  When I came I had the cookie dough with tcho chocolate and pretzels!
author: Christopher L.

description: No matter where I travel this place always comes back to me in my dreams... my mouth is watering just writing this review
author: Jiyu H.

description:
The T-cho chocolate is my shizzz! Its extremely rich and creamy and not overly sweet.

A little pricey for ice cream.. a small cup will set you back $5. But what the hey! It's San Francisco, majority of you guys pay $12 for avocado toast anyways. *shrug
author: Mabel Y.

description:
10:10 right now and it's already closed... so much for open until 10:30... -__-

If you're gonna close at 10:00 you're​ clearly not open until 10:30 smh... Walked a mile to get a shake because I can't eat solid food right now only to be greeted by a shuttered storefront -- thanks for wasting my time because you don't know what "open until" means!
author: Anton G.

description: Amazing ice cream - so creamy and I love that it's not as sweet as other ice cream spots. They have a very simple menu with few flavors. I almost always get the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips, though I've had the coffee flavor and that one is really good as well. Fun to watch them make the ice cream.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Wonderful location with Ritual Coffee and a biergarden next door. I got extremely lucky with parking, but I can see why many prior reviewees had a hard time finding parking. Right across the street from Smitten is a cute little park with beautiful art. 

The ice cream is particularly smooth and not too sweet. I ordered the salted carmel and thought it was just as good as Bi-rites (my favorite ice cream of all time). Although Bi-rite has more flavors to choose from in comparision, but they still had a good selection of about 5 to 6 flavors with one being the seasonal flavor of the month. Lastly, the unique thing about Smitten is their nitrogen ice cream looks cool in the making, and are made-to-order. The down side?  no sampling of any flavors.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I came here on a super chilly/windy day, but got reeled in by my love for ice cream. I was too cold to actually get ice cream, and the waffle cones smelled so good, that I just bought a waffle cone for like 1.50?!?? It was a really good waffle cone, made fresh there, and surprisingly really worth it LOL...if anyone ever wants to know about the waffle cones...

For the ice cream, I tried a bite of my friend's and it  and it was really smooth & creamy in consistency. So, I'd still recommend it...with the waffle cone of course.
author: Vi T.

description:
The hype is fake. OR maybe I'm just not into this type of liquid nitrogen of ice cream. I think its very cool the way they make it and the process is fun to watch. I prefer the traditional method of making ice cream. I think this place is a bit overpriced and hipster. 

When you walk into this place it looks like you are watching a science experiment. In general , this place isn't out of this world but isn't disgusting. A good spot to try out just to try it out.
author: Brian C.

description:
A+ ice cream!! I don't know if it's because I read all the signs of how they make the ice cream or what, but it does taste creamier and less icy. They have some pretty bomb flavors too (I got pretzel cookie dough). 

There's no table seating, just very hipster wooden bar (?) seating. Also, the ice cream is a lot smaller than I thought for its price. They give you a teeny tiny spoon though so you can't tell.
author: Wendy D.

description: Very unique flavors, love the quality ingredients - super smooth and creamy. The LN2 style works for us!!! We will definitely come back to Hayes Valley for these guys + super excited to try the one closest to us in West San Jose/SANTANA ROW :-)
author: Steve S.

description:
There is no other nitrogen ice cream place like Smitten! The consistency is so smooth compared to other spots that do the same thing.

All ingredients are fresh and the ice cream is made with no preservatives or stabilizers. When you purchase a pint, be sure to eat it within a week or it won't taste as fresh as the first day it was churned! That's the nature of fresh food, right? 

My top favorites are cookie dough, TCHO chocolate, and the seasonal balsamic strawberry! The waffle cone / bowl is a must! You can smell it made from outside the store.

Get on the rewards program through Thanx if you like this place as much as I do!
author: Nitar L.

description:
I feel slightly guilty. I've been biased against Smitten for years feeling that their ice cream is hella overpriced for being all fancy because it's made from liquid nitrogen. And then realized that I was willing to pay the same price or more for Salt and Straw (which I admit I have a slight emotional attachment to).

After years of avoiding Smitten, I went today because today was the last day they had the Meyer lemon cream flavor and it sounded delicious. $5 for two scoops + $1 for the special flavor (but who cares). It was one of the best tasting ice creams I can remember. Who knew that you could make the perfect blend of lemon and cream without the tarty sourness but maintaining the lemon flavor. I won't mention the texture because it's in all the other reviews. My only complaint is that they should give harder spoons since mine kept bending while I was eating.

I am really sad that this flavor won't be around any more, but I want to applaud Smitten for keeping their menu down to 6 flavors but focusing and doing a great job on them.
author: Eric Z.

description:
Wow this place definitely lives up to its hype. Located in Hayes Valley in the middle of the park, they almost look like a pop up shop! They have interesting flavors and everything is made out of nitrogen, you can also see them making it inside!

I had their Creme Fraîche with Pear Caramel. It was delicious! The ice cream was SO smooth and wasn't too sweet. The pear caramel gave it a kick and was a great combination. My boyfriend tried their Salted Caramel with chocolate sauce. The ice cream was very good and smooth also. Their chocolate sauce is home made, how I don't really recommend getting it with the salted caramel, it was a little too sweet for our taste. Also their waffle cones are made fresh every day, and is very crispy and good! 

Overall, great ice cream place and worth the stop!
author: Natalie L.

description: This is definitely my favorite icecream in San Francisco. Having visited SF pretty frequently for years and tried at least 15+ icecream shops, I made sure visit this place every time I came to SF. The uniquely handmade and flavored icecream is so smooth and flavorful that you'll not forget once tried.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Dang the ice cream here is so damn expensive. $5 for a small, $6 for a regular, and $11 for a pint. What's unique about this place is that they make their ice cream on the spot with liquid nitrogen which what draws in customers. Lines can get pretty long and parking is quite difficult at night. Spent over thirty minutes looking for a spot to park.

In the end, I admit that the ice cream here is super smooth and creamy but the flavors that they had the night I came was lacking. They don't have a lot of options. I got their earl grey with chocolate chips and tbh it was ok. I wished I got their crème friahce with the pear sauce. Now that was good. However I wouldn't come back anytime soon. Not worth spending an hour looking for parking and waiting in line.
author: Tuyen H.

description: Hands down the best ice cream I've tasted in San Francisco. Cookie dough ice cream + pretzels + Tcho crispies + caramel drizzles = heaven in a cup. Their seasonal flavors are usually pretty tasty too. The ice cream is incredibly smooth/creamy and doesn't melt too fast. There is usually a line and the wait can be quite long since there are only 4 machines, but I would definitely wait in line for 30min for Smitten ice cream.
author: Helen P.

description: The cookie dough with pretzel and chocolate chips was so delicate and yummy! I would totally come back for more :)
author: Jackie Z.

description: Smitten's ice cream is so yummy and staffs are friendly!! Also, this place is located in Hayes Valley. If you go there, you can do shopping and eating ice cream!!
author: Yumiko H.

description:
Friday night dessert - YES please

Arrived to the area and immediately found parking around the neighborhood. Walked about 3 minutes and we arrived to Smitten. This is my first time here and didn't know what to expect. They make the ice cream in front of you with nitrogen; what an exciting science experience. 

That night, I only see 4 flavors on the board: Mojito, TCHO 60.5% Chocolate, Salted Caramel and Sweet Corn with Berries. Very interesting flavors I say. I asked if there were samples that I could try but they don't offer tasting sample. 

Orders: 
1. Mojito with waffle cone
2. TCHO 60.5% chocolate with waffle cone

I love the TCHO 60.5% chocolate; very rich in flavors. The Mojito was just okay for me but I know someone would appreciate it more than me. 

Would return if I am around the area.
author: Maria H.

description:
I was straight smitten after getting this ice cream. First thing's first - this whole place feels like a shipping container. One little building sitting in a field of other shipping containers really drives that aesthetic home.

Liquid nitrogen - pretty cool concept, I don't get the hype though.

Ice cream itself? bomb AF ice cream. I got the chocolate (always gonna be my favorite flavor) along with the chocolate sauce on top. In a cone. The guy I went with decided not to get anything b/c he's straight working out and has lost like 20 pounds in the last few months.

Me? I've gotten to the point that I don't even feel bad when I eat a big ole ice cream cone. What an awesome way to live. What an awesome ice cream to eat.
author: Willy X.

description: OMG!  Fasntastic. I had the peach bourbon and the kids had mint chocolate chip. We all enjoyed a waffle cone.  It was all delish!!!!!
author: Stacy F.

description:
Ice cream, one of the many factors that made me a fat kid - how I love thee. Smitten is one of those shops that utilizes liquid nitrogen to make your creamy, sugar bomb drug. I first tried one of these shops when I was in Hong Kong, and I wasn't that impressed.

The ice cream itself from Smitten was quite tasty, I had the blood orange because blood orange, but the cone it came on was what set it apart. Wow! Great amount of flavor that complimented the ice cream perfectly, and it didn't completely shatter as I was biting into it. No messy cone flakes all over or dropped ice cream on the sidewalk! I can't imagine how many crying kids have been saved because of their cones...
author: Matthew L.

description:
I came here on a cold September day and was greeted with a smile by "Gali", who rang us up. 
She was amazingly sweet and had a genuine smile on her face. 
I enjoyed their waffle cones greatly and I'm definitely excited for the next time I go back with my young sister.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Big fuss for nothing.
The ice-cream is not good at all. And I really mean it because I am an Italian gelato lover... in the sense that I am Italian and I know how gelato is supposed to taste.
This is not good. The texture is not good and the flavor is not that great at all.
Really disappointed.

Plus, an additional question for many of those environmentally consciuous people that crowd this city: could you explain me how making the ice-cream the way they do at this place is good for the environment?
author: Luca R.

description:
This is definitely hipster ice cream heaven but I will have to say that for a city with a rich history in ice cream making (Double Rainbow, Gelato, Swenson's , It's-It, etc.  this place is over-hyped and not worth a return trip for me.

0n the plus side it might be worth a one time experience.  The ice cream is creamy and the experience of watching people make ice cream in the Smitten Brrr machines is neat and interesting to watch.  But this is just a fad like watching the people at  Coldstone make your ice cream.  But honestly the lines get long, the production of the ice cream is slow and inconsistent, and with the high cost of labor, an $11 pint of ice cream is just preposterous!  You can get premium Haagen Dazs or Ben and Jerry's for $3.99 or less at Safeway.

They only had 4 flavors at a time but they do advertise some others like vanilla for root beer floats.  They had Tcho Chocolate, Creme Fraiche, Chocolate Mint , and Cookie Dough with prretzels.  Well we went at about 6pm and there were tons of kids and every time the mom's asked for a root beer float and they didn't have any, the kid threw a fit and lines grew longer!  

Eventually we all got through the hellish process ready to enjoy this new thing.  We all tasted each other's flavors. The overall consensus was "Just okay" "Not worth the hassle."  My chocolate Mint ice cream was way too overpowering and left me with a bad aftertaste all night long. My brother had the same but his was much less minty which speaks to the quality control factor.

Overall an interesting experience, but just give me a Baskin Robins chocolate mint and my smile will be just as wide.
author: Erik H.

description:
I loved the ice cream here! Glad we were recommended to check this place out. 

I had the salted caramel with the tcho crispies. Although I wasn't a big fan of the crispies, the ice cream gets a two thumbs up! 

It was neat to see them churn the ice cream or whatever technique it's called. I wish we had something like this in SD.

I'll stop by again whenever I'm in SF!
author: Amy N.

description: First time going to Smitten's and it was really good! They make the ice cream right in front of you and the flavors change daily. The downside (ish) was I didn't know how small the portions were so I ordered a small size or else I would have ordered a bigger size (lol). I got the cinnamon with shortbread. So good and creamy and rich!
author: Liz M.

description: Freshly made ice cream with 5 daily flavors. The idea is pretty innovative, but the flavor is lacking. Also, because they're freshly churned they start melting before you even get them. Overall, a very average and overrated ice cream experience.
author: Jensen K.

description:
I know it's ice cream but please get the whipped cream, it's delicious.

I ordered the earl gray flavor which was true to taste and delicious. Can't wait to try some other flavors next time.
author: Susan W.

description: Probably top 3 ice cream I have ever had. My first ice cream is probably first because it was the first time I ever got to taste ice cream. The ice cream had a wonderful taste and the texture was a dream. I wish they offered a smaller amount for less money but honestly the quantity and quality price point is good. I didn't have to wait in line because I was a tourist eating ice cream no one was around but it was worth the walk.
author: Cristina P.

description: Came across after I found my favorite Three Twins shop closed :( the passion fruit ice cream is DELICIOUS!! It's a seasonal flavor, so get it before it's gone!
author: Qundeel K.

description:
The best and most fresh ice cream I've ever had. The texture is one of the keys to their success. They make each ice cream individually when you order it. A beautiful little business. My wife is absolutely obsessed.

I recommend the cookie dough!
author: Justin J.

description:
Flavors you have to try - mint chocolate chip. salted caramel. bombdotcom. 

I used to buy pints but when you bring the ice cream home, freeze it, then take out of the fridge to eat it again, it's just not as good. Have it fresh!
author: Dana Z.

description:
Semi cold weather and a full-on family style Thai dinner could not keep my group of friends and I from trying out Smitten ice cream. This was my first time trying Smitten and I was afraid it wasn't going to live up to the hype, but I was pleasantly surprised! 

Tragedy almost struck when I heard whispers that they had just run out of waffle cones while I was a couple of people away from the front of the line. (Nooooooooooo ;___; whyyyyy? /whine lol) I was so sad I wasn't going to be able to get a cone when lo and behold, the waffle gods answered my prayers and the guy taking my order informed me they were able to find the last two waffle cones. Score! I decided on a small size mint chocolate chip ice cream *in a cone* much to the jealousy of some of my friends in my group, lol. 

This is the first time I've had mint chocolate chip ice cream where the flavoring of the mint was not just the pure extract of mint oil, but rather probably the mint leaf in its entirety. It was fascinating to be able to clearly taste the herby/plant matter note along side the usual mint flavor. Way less one-dimensional and 100% delicious!

Also, dude. That waffle cone though! I'm not sure I've ever had such a crisp BUTTERY waffle cone before! Because the ice cream is so rich I don't think I could ever finish anything more than a small by myself, but I'll always have space for a waffle cone! XD
author: Yen D.

description:
The ice cream was good.. I will say that.. that's the only part that deserves the stars.. service wise.. wow terrible!!! 2/3 of the staff were on their phones.. even the one serving me was texting on her phone while trying to take my order. So not okay. Super rude and very uninviting. 
But go there for the ice cream and hopefully you get a smile
author: Snez V.

description: Great staff. Ice cream is made to order. Adorable and tiny. TASTES AMAZING. Homemade cones too. Great little place for dessert. I got their chocolate ice cream because I'm not adventurous with ice cream, but it was BOMBTASTIC. Yes, I just used that word to describe food, what of it? DEFINITELY, come here for dessert after a meal, or during a meal or before a meal, you know whatever floats your boat. 100% recommend.
author: Sam T.

description:
Highly recommending my friends and my family to visit this location.
Bought vanilla flavor for myself food unsurprisingly great always heard about the store
Very high delicacy ice cream with a unique sophicated atmosphere feeling.

Mason Kent
1-28-2018
author: Mason K.

description: My favorite! I eat ice cream so often it is ridiculous. I get the chocolate ice cream with tcho cacao nibs and convince my friends to get the cookie dough with pretzel ice cream. It is really tough because you can only get one flavor because they make it right in front of you so sometimes I convince my friend to get the cookie dough flavor and a bigger size than she can finish. This way if I eat my chocolate ice cream fast enough I can eye her ice cream until she becomes uncomfortable and gives me the rest of her cookie dough ice cream. I highly suggest using this technique when coming. Otherwise come here multiple times and try different flavors!
author: Chika K.

description:
Smitten is so gimmicky!

Liquid nitrogen on ice cream? and they mix it in front of you so you can video it and post it on Instagram?

Ok, here's my $6.50, gimme a small TCHO chocolate with salted caramel topping.

#sucka
author: Janice C.

description: Truly incredible ice cream. The texture and flavor is amazing. My wife and I love the cookie dough pretzel flavor and the classic vanilla. But they also have matcha , watermelon, etc. I believe they have 6 machines and have 6 flavors a day. Please do yourself a favor and go here.
author: Antonio R.

description:
I've been hearing about Smitten for years, with everybody saying that it's the best ice cream ever.  With so much hype, I started to think that it would never live up when I finally tried it.

The whole idea is super cool, literally! The ice cream is made to order, using super cold liquid nitrogen.  What I wasn't expecting was seeing the whole process behind the glass, from pouring the liquid ingredients, to the whirring of the machines, to the ice cream being made right in front of my eyes.

Of course, the experience would mean nothing if the ice cream didn't measure up. I ordered the Tcho Chocolate, watched the making-of, and awaited the impending disappointment.

But the disappointment never came, the hype was well deserved.  The ice cream was astonishingly smooth, with potent flavors.  Luckily I was sharing the ice cream, or it may have been too rich and too much for one man to handle.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
The concept is really cool. Since they make everything to order, you can't taste anything like other ice cream shops. I got the salted caramel topped with tcho crispies and my friends got the white balsamic strawberry. Both were really good. I don't know if it's the nitrogen, but the ice cream was extra creamy. 

The line seems a bit long but it moves some what quickly. The downside is that it's really hard to find parking.
author: Lena V.

description:
So I don't know about you but I normally like all kinds of ice creams...

HOWEVER, my first reaction after taking a bite of Smitten was "Meh, I don't like it." Gasp!

We were here on a Saturday night. The line was out of the door but it moved quickly. The store is pretty tiny and most of the people just stayed inside to finish the ice cream because it's freaking cold outside...

We got two Earl Grey with Milk Chocolate Chips but one was with almond slices and caramel sauce. We thought we had ordered a small, which is one scoop but for some reason, they gave us the regular, which was three scoops...

So to me, it was just too sweet! I didn't taste the Earl Grey flavor until the 5th bite but by then, my tongue was just too tired from all the sweetness. I originally wanted to get it with some kind of sauce but I'm glad I didn't because it would probably have been super duper sweet. I couldn't finish mine and ended up giving away the rest.

Overall, it's actually a 2 and 1/2 Stars for me but I gave it a 3-star because I appreciate their unique flavors. However, I'm not a fan of the liquid nitrogen gimmick. I will probably not come back here again but it was a good one time experience thing though.
author: Alice L.

description: I tried the vegan chocolate pop and it was off the hock. I could taste the coconut oil, it was rich and creamy. Very decadent treat for vegans. Bar was $4
author: Magda G.

description:
I stopped here on a warm sunny day for a quick scoop to cool off. The line was long, but they hand make each order as it's placed, so naturally, it takes a little longer than a typical ice cream shop. It's a quaint little spot, not much seating, but there are lots of benches and tables at the park just across the street.

I ordered the cookie dough ice cream with pretzels. It was tasty, but the pretzels were soggy, and the ice cream didn't have that quintessential cookie dough flavor that I was craving, even though it was good. I think this is because most people who posted 5 stars may like their ice cream with more toppings - the ice cream on it's own is not that impressive. Not bad, but nothing amazing.

My single scoop was a little overpriced. This place is unique because of the way you can build your tasty treat and the fact that they make it right in front of you. They have a menu of a few flavors that you can make your own with toppings and sauces of your choosing. I tend to prefer simple when it comes to ice cream, but the young kids that were ordering their fancy concoctions seemed overjoyed at the options!

All in all, a fun little place for an afternoon scoop on a hot day.
author: Taylor D.

description:
Came here late at night, was so excited to try this place, but it was good, not anything special for me. Yes it's cool that they make it fresh in front of you, but for the price, it was just ok. I tried the strawberry with cacao drizzle (toppings were ridiculously priced) and it was good but not to die for. I felt the texture was odd, but maybe bc of the technique they use. I wanted to like this place but it's just not for me. I like a creamier texture. 

Maybe I need to try another flavor. 
But probably won't be back
author: Monica G.

description: Smitten is a fun experience, since they make the ice cream right in front of you. The ice cream was great too! But for the price, I probably wouldn't come back. I guess it's similar to Benihana- you watch your food get made and it's super fun and exciting, then you get your food, taste it, and realize you could get that same taste elsewhere for much cheaper.
author: Lexi R.

description:
Phenomenal ice cream made to order by the hands of man and liquid nitrogen. Talk about novelty.

They have about four flavors available every day. Their TCHO chocolate flavor is their staple. I like it but it isn't my favorite. The three other flavors change throughout the months. From what I've tried so far, you can't go wrong 95% of the time.
