Salted caramel, vanilla, cookie dough, lemon gingersnap, and creme fraiche w/ pear caramel have all been delicious. I think an iffy one for me was something like caramel apple.

-1 star for the price. It pricey, man. $5 small (1 scoop) and $6 regular (three scoops). Be sure to savor it.
author: Liana F.

description:
I love Smitten's! This location is pretty cute. It gets really crowded during the weekends especially after dinner time! 

It's a pretty small set up so it can be hard to find a place to sit. You can just order it to go and walk over to the adjacent park! 

I prefer the location in the East Bay since it's much more convenient for me personally, but if I'm ever in the city and want Smitten's I wouldn't mind stopping by.
author: Dianna C.

description:
The ice cream is pricey and nobody likes a line. For those two reasons, Smitten is not going to be a regular ice cream spot. But I gotta say, I think it might be some of the best ice cream I have ever tasted.
I was skeptical that that the liquid nitrogen churning process would make much of a difference in taste or texture. I assumed that that once the novelty wore off, the ice cream would taste like any other. But Smitten proved me wrong. The freshly churned ice cream was indeed super smooth and rich. 

The process was interesting to watch, but I lost interest pretty quickly. I couldn't clearly see what was going on behind the smoke & mirrors. It was a very warm day and I was getting impatient. We had been in line for just a few minutes, and the line wasn't getting any shorter. In fact, I think it was multiplying. Then I realized I had nothing to complain about compared to the hard-working servers. Their hands must be freezing and they must be building some serious forearms. I don't blame them at all for the wait. Each order takes a few minutes to execute properly and there are only 3 stations. That easily creates a bottleneck, so they're doing the best they can.  

I chose the TCHO chocolate. I surprised myself, because I usually like to try more interesting flavors. I surprised myself further by getting a cone, because I usually find cones a little cumbersome and messy. I think I was trying to spend all my grocery money on ice cream. Lo & behold, it was good. Expectations exceeded. Be it the smooth creamy texture, or the rich TCHO chocolate flavor, or the buttery waffle cone, or all three, it's just good.
I've also tried Cookie Dough w/ Pretzels & Chocolate Chips, which was also pretty good, but didn't win me over quite as much. 

Because of the price, I will not be making Smitten a habit. A Small is $5 and a cone is $1.25, but the small size appears to be about two scoops. If you can rationalize that it's not that much, or share it with someone, then it won't be such a daunting cost. 

Smitten may have the right idea, not just with the liquid nitrogen, but also with the shipping container setting. Considering the high cost of living and unrelenting population growth, we may all end up living in shipping containers one day. It's not such a stretch from a micro studio.
author: Joy W.

description: Its ok... flavors are pretty basic/normal. Not bad just not special. Nitrogen stuff doesn't really add anything... go down the street to Salt & Straw for the best ice cream ever :P
author: J D.

description: Came here on a whim walking the city on a Monday night.  I ordered a large sweet corn with berries in a cup which is perfect for 2 people to enjoy.  It cost me $7 and some change.  Smitten's Ice cream is creamy yet dense.  Both flavors compliment each other.  Rumor has it, cookie dough is the most popular.  I will be returning:)
author: J N.

description: I would pay a good amount of money for just a pint of their cookie dough and caramel sauce. The ice creams were underwhelming. What does it say about an ice cream place when their toppings taste better than the ice cream? Hmm. I hope there'll be an option to purchase pints of the cookie dough/ caramel sauce in the future! However the 2 stars off is for the hefty price for average ice cream and expensive toppings.
author: Dennis A.

description:
It's more about the cool experience of seeing them make the ice cream than the ice cream itself. The shop is really cute and is definitely worth checking out. It's pretty crowded on Saturday nights but the line moves quickly. 

They only have a few flavors to choose from, which I think change daily or weekly. I had the salted caramel, which was pretty good. It wasn't out of this world good, but was decently good. Not too sweet and not too salty. It was a good balance of flavor which can sometimes be hard to achieve with salted caramel. 

Overall, a good experience but I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to come here. My favorite ice cream place in the bay area is still Ici in Berkeley.
author: Mai Y.

description:
Organic ice cream? Yes please! 

So happened to find this little hidden gem around the corner from where my husband I were having dinner at. Decided to try this place out on a Monday night and glad there was NO line at all during our visit (considering its popularity). So happy to see they use fresh and quality ingredients that are all natural with no added sugar. I decided to try the Strawberry White Balsamic and it was absolutely delectable. You can definitely taste the fine ingredients - nothing tasted artificial. Best of all, I wasn't parched after yearning for water! My husband ordered the Mint flavored ice cream and you can definitely taste the mintyness in it. It was a bit too strong for my liking and honestly tasted like toothpaste! 

Prices are a bit pricey, but to me it was worth every penny. Keep in mind the natural and organic products used in here! This shop is very small with no tables to sit down. It's an outdoor walk-up concept, but there's heat lamps above that will keep you warm if you're near the counter. 

Love, love, love this place and will definitely be coming back when I'm in the city.
author: Mei W.

description: I really enjoyed how all of the ingredients were natural. It was fun to watch it being made.
author: Sue F.

description:
I've always been a fan of Smitten. The first one I tried was in Rockridge, and the place was slightly bigger than the one here in Hayes Valley. I came here today to use some gift tokens I acquired. I got the fresh mint chip cone today and it was SOOOOoOoooooOOoo great. The cone was made on the spot, and eating that mix of cold/warm sweetness melted my soul.

I even got more afterwards to-go ._. Lol, #fatforlyfe. The to-go pints are $11, 1/2 pints $7 and lasts up to 5 days (for great flavor).
author: Juliana P.

description:
As someone who craves ice cream in 50 degree weather, I had to try their liquid nitrogen ice cream. The vanilla is absolutely delicious! They prepare your order on the spot, so the wait may take around 5 minutes. I wish they had vanilla year-round, but unfortunately they rotated this one out during my most recent visit. Their ice cream is so so so creamy and so so so delicious! Definitely on the sweeter side of the spectrum! Steep price for ice cream, but it's liquid nitrogen ice cream made fresh, so definitely worth the splurge every now and then! 

I hate the parking situation, but that can't be helped as they are a little stand/food truck. However, this is the one closest to me, so I'll suck it up and trek the couple blocks.
author: Kristi T.

description:
I LOVED my first time experience here at Smitten Ice Cream! My friend and I ventured out to San Francisco/Half Moon Bay area and was definitely craving some great ice cream and this was a great call to try! Smitten Ice Cream is located on Hayes Street right by a small park. You do have to find parking on the street which can be tough depending on the hour that you go to the city. The store is small but super cute! You can actually see the workers make your ice cream for you once inside, and I think it's AWESOME how they make their ice cream by order with liquid nitrogen. 

They have unique and different ice cream flavors depending on the day. I was there to try their mint chip (one of my favorites) flavor. The ice cream tasted SO refreshing and you can tell they used fresh ingredients. I truly love the idea that they make your ice cream right when you order and there isn't anything pre-frozen about the product. You get fresh product for the price you get, and I definitely thought it was worth it. 

Being there for the first time, I loved the customer service as well! The guy who helped us explained to me how Smitten Ice Cream works and what's so unique about their ice cream. I will DEFINITELY be going back to try more of their unique flavors since I stuck with my typical favorite my first time around!
author: Christina L.

description: 3 nights in a row, wow. I consider myself an ice cream aficionado and this place is just stellar. The flavors are awesome, all of them. I tried 5 (had my friend's too). This ice cream is extra creamy. The small is filling. The cone was good but not amazing. Spicy caramel was really yummy. Can't go wrong here, the ice cream is fresh! Who can claim that?!
author: Chris F.

description:
Am I the only one who does not understand the hype around this place? Yes, it's cool. But it would almost never be my first choice for ice cream. Limited menu, no samples.

It's fine. Worth trying. But not my favorite.
author: Amy M.

description: Yum yum yum!!! I love flash frozen ice cream because it is so delicious and the flavor really comes out.  I had friends suggest this spot as a pre night out meet up and I feel like every night out should start or end here.  If you want something sweet, check it out.  Not a lot of room inside though so plan accordingly
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: Great creamy ice cream. Have rotating special flavors. Made fresh using a nitrogen method
author: Ernest M.

description: Always come here for my ice cream fix - love this place and their eclectic flavors. Especially enjoyed the current early grey flavor!
author: Namrata J.

description:
The cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips is killer. The ice cream was made with organic milk and chunks of hand cut TCHO 60.5% dark chocolate. It was super creamy with the perfect amount of cookie dough chunks and bits of salty pretzel goodness. I loved it so much I ordered a pint ($11) right after my first scoop ($6). 

Yes! They're opened on New Year's day. Good luck finding parking. Ha!
author: Lloyd B.

description: This place was located in a hip location. Ice cream was definitely good, wasn't anything extravagant if you're going for an extremely cool looking ice cream.
author: Blondie B.

description:
Deeeeeelicious! Ahhh! Go go go ! 

My friend and I both got the Cookie Dough. It was unbelievable; I went back twice.
author: Catherine J.

description:
I do like this place a lot. My first Ice cream place in SF. The only reason I gave it four stars was because they didn't have enough flavors. I personally don't like chocolate a lot and most of their flavors were dominated by chocolate. 
Cody was sweet enough to suggest me Earl tea flavor which was nice enough.
author: Abhishek P.

description:
Delicious and creamy ice cream. I ran here before it closed at 11:30pm, phew!

Small cups are $5 for a generous portion. You can also choose medium and large cups. My friend and I saved some money and bought a flight of 3 flavors to share for $9:
-mint chocolate chip 
-salted caramel 
-orange chocolate with cookie (might be a seasonal flavor) 

There was also tcho chocolate flavor which we didn't choose.

Everything was made fresh in front of us and the service was good. Only 4 flavors to choose from but we tried 3 and were really satisfied. Can't wait to come back!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Liquid nitrogen + gourmet flavors + shipping container = Smitten!
The concept isn't new, but Smitten does their ice cream a little better than other liquid nitrogen options in that the flavors are more curated and the texture is very creamy and not at all icy. Unfortunately, flavor menu is limited to four per day and you cannot combine flavors. 

The Earl Grey was pretty great- the chocolate chips are a nice contrast but the actual ice cream flavor is surprisingly strong. Add in the suggested extras (caramel and almonds) for the best experience. If you're really into pumpkin spice flavors, their version with the maple brown sugar is rich and savory. 

Line to order moves quick, this location is extremely small- grab your order and eat at the park across the street!
author: Stefany V.

description:
Cute shop in Hayes valley. What makes their ice cream special is that they use liquid nitrogen to blend their ice cream, which reduces the ice crystals that form. 

A little pricey -$5 for a small that I shared. I think the cookie dough was way too sweet for me. I prefer more subtle ("bougie") flavors like honey lavender (I'm looking at you Bi-Rite!), earl grey, green tea...  Nonetheless, the quality of ice cream is undoubtedly high.

I prefer Bi-Rite's variety of flavors to Smitten, which keeps the menu pretty limited. Space is cute and makes a good snack after a stroll in Hayes at night.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Smitten is well known out here for their liquid nitrogen ice cream. They make it fresh to order and every day they have different flavors. It's a small booth in Hayes Valley. Be aware that the line in the summer is long!

I ordered a small of cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips. It was creamy, and I could taste all the ingredients inside. The only down side was they ran out of waffle cones when I was ordering. Overall still had a great experience! Hands down best ice cream shop in SF.
author: Kristen L.

description: Honestly one of the best chocolate chip cookie dough ice creams I've ever had! The pretzel bits mixed in is a complete game changer!
author: Shawna M.

description:
Best nitrogen style ice cream. I've tried a couple of other varieties but the texture, quality, and taste of Smitten is my favorite. I like that they try different flavor combinations and they have different ingredients depending on the season so you know they are fresh. I haven't had an issue with it melting too fast. All in all, it acts like regular ice cream but tastes more fresh and smoother. It is definitely pricey for ice cream but that's what you get for being trendy. I like the marketing that goes into the company as well. Their branding is on point. I usually don't get any toppings but if I do, the strawberry proseco sauce is really good. 

This place is a really small shop, without much seating inside so it won't be great in the winter time. During warmer weather, it's nice to grab an ice cream and walk around outside afterwards. There is even a small park across from Smitten where there are usually a ton of dogs milling around and an art installation or two. If you live in South Bay, there is also a Smitten location inside the Whole Foods in Los Altos. The lines are shorter and you can eat the ice cream in the Whole Foods.

Positives:
+ Super creamy and tasty ice cream

Negatives:
- Pricey
- Super small shop

Recommend:
+ Crème Fraîche w/ pear caramel
+ Usually any of the seasonal flavors
+ Strawberry white balsamic
author: Angie N.

description:
When they say it's freshly made, it is literally freshly made. Wow. I got fresh mint by itself to taste the ice cream in its purity and it was so stinkin' minty fresh. Did I mention it's fresh?

Even though it was pretty cold outside at night, there were plenty of customers. Only downside is that it isn't really a place where you can sit and hang out for a little bit as there is only some bench seating along the wall.
author: Ling X.

description:
A friend of mine only comes to Smitten's to get the May/June flavor of strawberry white balsamic. She claims it's life-changing. At first, I thought "Pfft! Could such life-changing ice cream exist in real life?" So on a particularly warm day in SF, I decide to swing by this location on my lunch break to try it out. 

*A few days and 5 half-pints later* 

Umm...let's just say I'm convinced that this is a damn delicious flavor! 

The first thing I noted was the light texture. I was able to take a small plastic spoon and carve through the half-pints with ease. Upon first bite, I was able to note how vivid the strawberry flavor was, which is a testament to the fresh strawberries used in the making of this flavor. The white balsamic vinegar also helps to lightly sweeten the ice cream without overwhelming the freshness of it. 

Overall, I really enjoyed this. While I won't go so far as to proclaim it to be life-changing, it is up there with some of the best ice cream I've ever had. (That's saying a lot, since I usually don't eat ice cream all that often).
author: Viet N.

description:
I've had Smitten at the Oakland location as well as this one and I have to say it's a truly unique ice cream experience. There's a sign inside the shop that explains how Smitten's ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen and the unique patented process and machines that are used. The special part of Smitten's ice cream is that it is made fresh to order and from fresh, organic ingredients. There are no preservatives at all. The ice cream is not transported here from a different manufacturing location and it is also not stored over time so that ice develops in it and potentially changes the flavor.

At Smitten, they have four flavors for you to choose from. There are no samples available as everything is made to order but they do have a guarantee so if you don't like the flavor, you can switch out for another one. The ice cream makers pour fresh organic milk into the mixer along with any other relevant ingredients, such as fresh mint leaves for mint ice cream. I got the earl grey with milk chocolate chips! Then, the mixer is left to spin with the liquid nitrogen infusing into and freezing the ice cream mix. The result is an incredibly fresh, authentic and real tasting ice cream. The flavors are phenomenal. 

The experience of Smitten is not only in tasting the ice cream but seeing it made with the liquid nitrogen as well. I loved watching the mixer swirl around with the liquid nitrogen gas floating around my ice cream.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I've been to Smitten a few times now and i've always had trouble choosing a flavor... The ice cream quality is amazing: super creamy, smooth, and flavorful, but the flavors i've tried when i've been here have just been mediocre.

The flavor selection is lacking from day to day. The first time I went, there was tcho chocolate, fresh mint chip, salted caramel, and olive oil with lavender. The second time I went, there was tcho chocolate, fresh mint chip, salted caramel, and vanilla. I've tried the salted caramel and the fresh mint chip. I loved the salted caramel but it did get very rich and sweet after a while. The mint chip literally tastes like a mint leaf, which is pretty cool, but at the same time, I got sick of it after eating a few scoops. I would love it if they incorporated more of a chocolate flavor in there so it wasn't all mint!

I wish I could've tried a fruity flavor because I like those types of flavors more when it comes to ice cream. Please add a fruity flavor to the main lineup!!! 

Also, $5 for a single scoop is a bit pricey. However $6 for 3 scoops seems more worth it... but then you have to finish 3 scoops of ice cream (for some, that is not a problem hahahaha)!
author: Tara A.

description: Smitten for smitten! Amazing cookie dough ice cream - thick and creamy texture. The cookie dough has pretzel pieces which may not suit everyone but I was pleasantly surprised at how well it works. Highly recommend.
author: Maria L.

description:
Had the "hot stuff" sundae and it was amazing! Salted caramel also better than I remember and mint chip was perfection. 

Unrelated to the ice cream but the music here on a Sunday afternoon was so so good! They played Tamia, Nee-yo, and all the best 90's r&b. Made waiting in line that much better :)
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Cool concept but mediocre ice cream.

Got strawberry white balsamic and even though it was good, not $5 good. Really creamy and not overly sweet. 

Music was on point though! Mostly early 2000's rnb music while the workers were jamming to it made it a entertaining experience and musically nostalgic. 

Overall, cool spot to check out with liquid nitrogen ice cream making but pretty pricey for what you get.
author: Angela T.

description:
So disappointed! I haven't been back in town for a year and had good memories of this place, but the ice cream was so grainy! It wasn't even ice crystal grainy that can melt, it was grainy like ground rice grains. The texture was horrible. Not to mention a weird taste and texture in the chocolate chips tasting like sugar substitute chocolate that's been left out for a few years. I couldn't even finish the small. I really hope it's just a mishap, because I had good memories coming here in the past. Went across the street to Souvla for a Greek yogurt which was WAY smoother and so amazing! 

But a star for the good service and ambiance.
author: Alicia C.

description: I love love love smitten ice cream! Every time I'm in the bay, I always crave for Smitten! Rich and creamy! Ingredients taste fresh and it's cool to see the nitrogen right in front of your eyes! I must admit, the Almond coconut macaron was bomb af!!
author: Rachel E.

description: Made a visit to Smitten for the first time yesterday and it was delish! The BEST two scoops of vanilla with caramel sauce I have ever had. I will definitely be returning during one of my frequent visits to San Fransisco.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Smittin Ice Cream has been my place to go since it first opened!! I lived in the city and would train all the way to Cal to get a couple scoops with my friends. All the other brands that have jumped on the bandwagon do not and will never compare to Smittens!
author: Evelyn A.

description:
In light of the gorgeous, yet somewhat blistering, weather from the last few weeks, now seems like the perfect time for another ice cream review.  After all, ice cream is always a good idea, regardless of whether you're going to eat it or write about it!

Although I already popped my Smitten cherry at their Oakland location, I still had been wanting to try this one for quite some time.  Not only because it's their original spot, but also because Smitten was one of the first, and one of the best, "nitro ice cream" joints to emerge around the Bay Area.  Seriously, how could a fan not check out where the craze started?

Having already enjoyed their ice cream a couple of times now, I knew what to expect - delicious ice cream that's milky instead of icy, creamy, and offered in a handful of fun flavors on any given day.  Case in point: COOKIE DOUGH WITH PRETZELS AND CHOCOLATE CHIPS.  Not exactly a flavor you'd likely find in the Dreyers or Haagen Dazs sections of the freezer aisle (which is a shame, since it's awesome).

In a way, this particular flavor was kind of similar to the Compost Cookie from Momofuku Milk Bar in NY, using something salty (and random) to play off the sweetness (which wasn't over the top).  In addition though, the pretzels, along with the chips, added a slight crunch to the otherwise silky smooth texture (the liquid nitrogen freezes the ice cream without forming ice crystals).  Too bad there wasn't more of the cookie dough though!

Quality aside, while the city's other premium ice cream spots are a little pricey as well, Smitten admittedly ranks among the highest.  Although $5 for a small isn't terrible, the portion size is relatively light compared to what you can get at other places.  Then again, there's the novelty and uniqueness of it being nitro ice cream, so it's not like you're paying for the regular sort either!

All in all, FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down for the value as well as the fact that the flavor I had wasn't quite as good as the Lemon Shortbread I had in Oakland, as well as the likes of Bi-Rite and Humphrey Solcombe.  At least I finally got the bitter taste out of my mouth from my first attempt at coming here.  Seriously...how could they run out of liquid nitrogen?!
author: Mike L.

description:
fresh fresh ice cream so yummy and creamy expensive but worth it every bite. You can see them making the ice cream. It was a long line but they were very quick and fast .

If you want fresh ice cream don't hesitate give it a try.
author: Hoa T.

description:
Ok I get it. Everyone loves Smitten.

They definitely have the cool factor with the whole using liquid nitrogen to make their ice cream fast and fresh right in front of you. Great setup. Clouds of smoke fills the counter as it leaves the churners kind of reminding me of witches cauldrons or some mad scientist's laboratory.

The use of organic and lots of natural ingredients are always good though I'm not a big organic stuff kind of guy, natural yes, organic not so much. Or are they the same think!? Nevermind I don't know what I'm talking about.

Ignoring all of the how its made and where it came from it has to come down to that product itself, the end result. I enjoyed how it's smooth and creamy as ice cream should be. And of course it does taste good. I'm a huge fan of chocolate mint anything and had to order the Fresh Mint Chip. It was good, refreshing, and packed with big real mint flavor, a liltte overwhelming, but real good. I'd get it again. I did also taste another flavor but don't really remember if it was the TCHO or Creme Fraiche it was good. You can order their ice cream as is, a float, sundae, cone, or covered in its various toppings like cookie dough, toasted almond, brown sugar/spicy caramel, etc.

I'm a fan however here's why I'm not wowed. The selection of flavors seems limited to only 4 a day but I believe they'll rotate in other flavors. What if I wasn't craving any of the flavors offered for the day and got stuck with settling!? They'll make it fresh but it does seem slower than your traditional ice cream shop where they'll offer a huge variety of flavors and just scope from large batches of ice cream. Does it make a difference having a batch made an hour or two ahead of time vs right when ordered!? Another thing is their portions are small for the price. 

They're good but not amazing. I'll put them somewhere in the middle between 3 and 4 stars. They're lucky I'm a chocolate mint fan lol
author: LJ R.

description:
I got this for dessert recently....It's a simple, small stand with only a few flavors, but it's pretty cool to see the ice cream being prepped in small batches with the liquid nitrogen fog curling out of the machine....I got a small scoop of the salted caramel, while my friend got the maple glazed pumpkin pie. I tried both, and they were both pretty good, but the Salted Caramel was definitely my preference. It's really buttery somehow, whereas the pumpkin can get kind of too sweet and sticky.

I think the small size is pretty adequate since Smitten's ice cream seems all relatively sweet. Although I find the small cup at $5 to be kind of overpriced, I'll admit I'm still hoping to go back eventually to try some of their chocolate flavors because I'm sure it'll be pretty heavenly with how smooth and silky the texture of their ice cream was. :) So it IS still worth a mini-splurge.
author: Diane J.

description: This place was great. You have never known what kind of ice cream they have today if you don't visit. I went here a few times. I love it :)
author: Pinarat S.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I find it hawt when Ice cream is made right in front of you, but I hate when you face the creator or churner or whatever you call them and know that 1. It looks gross 2. It will taste gross and can't say anything about it because you feel bad. 

I have been here a few times and it's usually a hit or miss. The ice cream can either be super creamy or taste super chemichally. I sadly have experience the latter more than I would like. I noticed that this chemical and weird flavor usually happens when I order the flavor of the month so I suggest just sticking to their usual flavors :) other than this, I love the workers here and the way they make their ice cream. It really adds to a beautiful stroll around Hayes Valley!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Cool concept with the nitro frozen ice cream. Not a fan that I can't mix flavors or try them though. I got the cookie dough with salted pretzel and chocolate chips, but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected it to be. Mainly tasted like vanilla ice cream with chocolate chips. Very cute area though and cool spot.
author: Clara S.

description: Freshly made ice cream in 5-6 mins.  Vanilla ice cream with spicy Carmel was one of best ice creams ever had.  Like the atmosphere, service, taste and will def be back. Thumbs up -
author: ben r.

description:
This is definitely the coolest ice cream shop I've ever visited. It's the perfect attraction as well as a treat for tourists. I'm so glad that I did my research, found this spot, and made the whole group come here. It's just a little stand in a mostly residential area, but worth the visit.

There are only a few flavors to choose from. I'm guessing there is a limitation on how many flavors can be created because of the technology used. This isn't the spot for you if you want a large variety of flavors. I don't personally think limited choices are always bad. I had the Fresh Mint Chip and loved it. I could taste the freshness and real ingredients. I enjoyed the truly creamy texture. 

Waiting for our ice cream to be made was an experience as well. Ice cream and a show!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Going back to Smitten, I found myself in love with this place more than I thought I would have been. This place, when visited at the right time, has no line and I think that really has impacted my review. They only have four seasonal flavors at a time and only make a small batch a time due to the specific machine they use.

FOOD: Again, to do the comparison, Tcho Chocolate with Almonds. This time, I found myself enjoying the ice cream more. The way the Liquid N2 works is that at a colder temperature, the crystals that form are smaller than the crystals that we are normally used to. This creates a really smooth texture in the ice cream that cannot be matched by any store bought ice cream. In addition, the quality of ingredient is mighty good. The creaminess of the ice cream itself is what sells the ice cream. One scoop in the mouth coats the tongue in a way that normal ice cream cannot. 

SERVICE: Not bad and pretty attentive to other customers. 

I wish the offerings in the flavors were a bit more varied as they seem to not be as "out there" as I would like. However, if there is no wait and they can make it pretty fast, then why not?
author: Albert H.

description:
Gotta Love Eating Ice Cream in a Shack!

Walking from the Tenderloin to Hayes is such a fabulous walk. It goes from street people living in make shift houses to eating ice cream in a make shift shop. Funny how things aren't so different...but then again they are.

Gotta love Hayes! The ice cream shop looks like a gigantic whimsical bus stop.  I had questions about the menu. The person helping me seemed pretty annoyed. That's cool though because the other guy gave me my toppings (which I paid extra for) after the ice cream was served. I started eating my sweet corn ice cream and a few minutes later I got the sour berries and the cookie toppings in tiny cups.

~Sweet Corn and Berries-2 Stars
Like I said, I got a cup of berry sauce and the cookie toppings in side cups after I was already eating. Seriously,  just give me a refund on the toppings or remake it.

~ Salted Caramel-3 Stars
AOK, but not worth the hefty price. I think the process of using nitrogen is dependant on the person doing the work. This was nothing special for us and my little one didn't finish eating it.

Customer Service and Price-2 Stars.

Overall, a pretty disappointing experience.
author: Nick H.

description:
Let's just say I was not Smitten with Smitten Ice cream.

It does not matter what production method you use to create a product: If the product is mediocre....it's still mediocre without regard to a high tech method.

My Cream fraiche with pear caramel....tasted of neither. The add on toasted almonds were really the star and that is sort of a sad statement.

My friends mint chip really wasn't great either. Flavors were not there or were off.

I get the whole liquid nitrogen, instant, fresh, frozen ice cream notion. However if it comes out like this I think I will stick with Mitchell's, Swensen's, or Bi-rite, as by whatever method their ice cream is produced....it  just tastes....yummers.
author: David G.

description: It's just ice cream but the novelty is that they have a lot of smoke and mixing before they give it to you. Some of the flavors are questionable, I usually just get the cookie dough. Kind of expensive for a scoop of ice cream, too, but it's in a cute location near lots of shops and other food places in hayes valley.
author: RachEl L.

description:
This place was really good although I was expecting more due to the hype. There are three ice cream makers designated for the three featured flavors. The workers are very friendly and I really like the creative exterior. Very rich and creamy ice cream. I got  salted caramel and my sister got original. Salted caramel was so good but got REAL sweet towards the end. Wouldn't recommend it if you don't have a sweet tooth (but I do so hayyyy). 

That chocolate crunchy stuff?? YUMMMM. YOU NEED IT. 

If you're in the area, its worth a try but I don't think its something you need to go out of your way to get.
author: Katherine L.

description: My family and I were on vacation in California a few years ago and we stopped at this place to get some ice cream. None of us forgot it. Amazing flavour and so creamy and rich. Also very unique because they churn the ice cream in front of you using liquid nitrogen.
author: Alayna S.

description: Chocolate ice cream was super rich in flavor, highly recommend!! The peach bourbon had a bit of strong alcohol taste ~~ too much for me but if you love alcohol then definitely give it a go!
author: Food L.

description:
I live too close to this place, it's been a silent culprit to my waistline. But life is short, so don't deny yourself of uh-maze-ing ice cream. 

Service here is fast and these people know how to work a line up for pre-orders on hot days. Someone will walk around with an i-pad to get your order, by the time you're at cash all you need to do is pay and your ice cream is ready for consumption. 

Earl Grey, Chocolate Cookie Dough, Mojito, they're all so freaking good. Can't wait until lemon gingersnap comes back into season. 

Protip: Download the Thanx app and get a free small cup (1 scoop) free (up to $5).
author: Janice K.

description:
When you come to Smitten Ice Cream be prepared for top notch ice cream quality and a limited flavor selection. I'm talking super creamy, rich, smooth, and flavorful ice cream that satisfies your palette with every morsel you devour. This was my first time visiting Smitten and I ordered the creme fraiche caramel pear and was personally satisfied and impressed with just how creamy and refreshing it was! 

However, don't come here expecting the cheapest ice cream. If I have to say, you do get what you pay for and while you CANNOT sample the different flavors of ice cream since each is made-to-order the cashier informed me that if I wasn't satisfied they could whip me up another flavor on-the-house. Talk about customer service! Wooo! 

Another thing you should be aware of is that they don't have a whole bunch of flavors to choose from. During my visit there were about four different flavor offerings for the day, but I was also told that flavors do rotate - if you ever get the hankering to return for some more sweet, creamy, yummy ice cream! 

Overall, I'll have to say I was satisfied with my Smitten Ice Cream experience! Can't say I'll be a regular or that I'd constantly seek out their ice cream, but definitely can see myself returning one day! 

Thanks for the cherry-on-top of another awesome day in San Francisco, Smitten Ice Cream! I'll be back!
author: Janelle V.

description: Ice cream parlors are always staffed with seasonal employees. So when I went here, all the employees were being trained, but they were super friendly and efficient. The jasmine green tea was sooo good, but I didn't like the Meyer lemon too much. It was a bit too tart.
author: Angela M.

description:
YUMMMMMMM. This ice cream is so creamy and delicious! Something as simple as Vanilla..omg. LOVED it. I'm drooling just thinking about it! 

This location is cute and I assume on a busy weekend in Hayes Valley, it gets really crowded. I happened to come on an off day, so I got lucky with no wait time. Since it is made pretty "fancy," the prices are on the higher side for ice cream, but I love it, so I'll pay for it. haha.
author: Melissa S.

description: The best ice cream I've ever had, hands down. Perfect on a sunny day and a stroll around the park / neighbourhood. The brown sugar ice cream w/tcho chocolate bits was really good - flavor was pretty intense (in a good way). It was really cool to see them make the ice cream in front of you. I'm definitely a fan and would come back soon.
author: Valerie L.

description: Went to the Smitten on Lombard. Very cool concept where they make the ice cream in front of you with a little mixing machine so it tastes very fresh. Both the chocolate and vanilla bases are so delish. We asked for them to top it with the little crispier topping but unfortunately we took it to go and they forgot about it. They also got the wrong size so we ended up paying for a half pint but not actually getting it. Was too late once we realized. Delish ice cream, but would've been nice to get the full experience. Came highly recommended though so would say worth trying while in SF if you have some time. Takes a little longer to make.
author: Victoria O.

description:
The place itself looks very cool, and gives off a hipster vibe.  Plus they're dog friendly!  I like that you can see them churn your ice cream right in front of you, too.  I ordered the mint chip ice cream, which was very minty.  It really tasted more like a (non-alcoholic) mojito flavored ice cream, with tcho chocolate chips inside, rather than your standard mint chip ice cream.  This flavor was overwhelming, and I had to throw my cup of ice cream away after only a few bites.

I wish they had a better flavor selection, but maybe I went on a bad day.  I do hear great things about this place though, so I'm definitely willing to give it another go
author: Eric L.

description:
Smitten ice cream today = JOY.

My two cousins and I visited today during the most perfect weather. Hipster music and waffle cones drew us in. Scott B., our brrrrrsta, was pure, wholehearted, and untarnished in his care in crafting the smoothest ice cream for us! He created the most delicious chocolate, caramel, and cookie dough cones that had us utterly melt into the moment.

Scott elevated the ice cream experience with his friendly mixing...like a DJ of nitrogen and ice cream music. Let's call him DJ Nitro. 

Thank you Scott B. (And Duy and JaJa too!) for making this a smitten experience!!

Update: I saw Scott's picture in the Tastemade article about: "9 trendy ice cream treats that go beyond the scoop" which featured Smitten ice cream! Man, Scott is really brrrrrrrrreaking ground!
author: Patty Q.

description: Love this place.  Best place around.  A must for ice cream lover There flavor are always out of this world.   My to go place when I'm in the Bay Area.  The original Smitten.
author: Ron C.

description:
While I would be the first to admit that liquid nitrogen is a fad, it's a pretty damn delicious one + worth the price mark-up when you come across the right shops that actually know what they're doing. Smitten is one of them. Comparing it to other liquid nitrogen places I've tried -- Ice Cream Lab (Beverly Hills), Chocolate Chair in (Koreatown LA), + Scoop Microcreamery (Palo Alto) -- Smitten the best of the best. Or should I say crème de la crème. 

Serving the goods out of a tiny shack (converted boxcar?) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/smitten-ice-cream-san-francisco-3?select=UjuvqzjT9MDYA6G07DnTUg on a lot in Hayes Valley, this little shop is a favorite dessert spot of mine after lunch or dinner in the area... or when I just feel like having dessert for dinner to soothe my soul after a rough day. The menu http://smittenicecream.com/menu/ is limited to 4 flavors, but 3 of them change frequently with TCHO 60.5% Chocolate http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_eYOcA9ghJ7MlXcJQj8--w&userid=6YEnpx-qloIfFX-L9uyfbQ as the anchor. 

A Small will set you back $5, a Regular is $6, and a Pint is $11. 
Seasonal flavors are an extra $0.50. 
Cones are an extra $1.25. 
Additional sauces or chunks are $0.75 each. 

I'd actually recommend trying the ice cream alone in its purest form if it's your first time going. Why? Well, other than the novelty of watching the magical unfurling of the fog http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ggkYGunBn3zgCKBNP-GguA&userid=6YEnpx-qloIfFX-L9uyfbQ when they make the ice cream, what makes liquid nitrogen special is the texture. It's sooooo smooth! And because it's prepared right in front of you, it will always be served the perfect temperature + texture... not sitting in a freezer for days. This explains the $5+ price tag as well.

If you're going with a group, the best bang for your buck is actually the 4-flavor flight http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=AXZJVnJXFLav646fLPzEXg&userid=6YEnpx-qloIfFX-L9uyfbQ, which gives you 4 munchin-sized scoops for $10.50. On this particular visit, that meant getting Strawberry White Balsamic, Salted Caramel, Cookie Dough + TCHO 60.5% Chocolate. The Cookie Dough was the fan favorite followed by the Salted Caramel. 

My personal favorite flavor though is actually the Fresh Mint Chip http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=E5stmtAMqJOhUlCBeLKRSg&userid=6YEnpx-qloIfFX-L9uyfbQ because of how beautifully aromatic on the tongue the fresh mint is. This flavor basically ruined the classic sugary grocery-store version of mint chip for me because it's just that good! 

Highly recommend making a stop here if you're ever in the area. Yes, there is likely to be a line if you're going on a weekend since everything is made to order, but it's worth the wait. And once you've got your little scoop of joy, there's Patricia Green Park right next door to people watch or view the periodically-changing art installation.
author: Janelle Q.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here the day AFTER National Ice Cream Day, but that's okay... I forgive him. I've passed by Smitten many times before but never actually stopped to get any. The menu is very simple, and all the ice cream flavors sound so delicious! Nevertheless, I'm a classic Mint Chocolate Chip kinda girl so that's what I ordered. No toppings this time.

Smitten is located in a tented area with limited seating. In the evening, it's a great place to stay slightly warmer than being outside. During the daytime, there's plenty of public seating around so most people will enjoy the sun while indulging in their ice cream. Either way, it's fun to watch the ice cream being made with liquid nitrogen while waiting for your order.

The ice cream is so light, fresh, and delicious. The serving sizes are small, but honestly one tiny scoop is good enough for me, especially after a heavy dinner. I would imagine that the line gets long during the day, but it's totally worth it. What a fun San Francisco experience! Definitely stop by and try it out if you find yourself in Hayes Valley.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Now I WAS going to give Smitten Ice Cream a 4-star review because they have vegan popsicles available and goshdarnnit they are pretty frikken good ones too. However, I just went over there this past weekend and saw that they raised the price of the vegan pops by A WHOLE DOLLAR!!!

They use to be $3, now they're $4. 

As good as they are, $3 was pretty much the high end of what you should be paying for it. They are overall very small popsicles. They could've raised it by $.25 or $.50 or hell even $.75, but it's weird that they believe $1 increase is the appropriate amount.

They usually have salted caramel pops available, but I've also tried the chocolate.
The flavors are very bold and in your face. Sweet and creamy, with the right amount of 'meltiness' you enjoy when licking ice cream.

Very disappointed with the price increase, hope they decide to re-evaluate that decision.
author: Lanie L.

description: Very hip ice cream store. It's cool how they make the ice cream in front of you. Too bad they didn't have a better selection of flavors. None of the flavors they offered really interested me but I just went with the mint chip. I ordered a regular to share with my boyfriend and it was too much for the both of us. The mint chip had a strong mojito taste. It was nice! But overall, I was a bit disappointed by it. Too many chocolate chips in it, but I guess another person might like that, considering I don't like chocolate much. I'm sure if I chose a different flavor, it might've been more pleasant to eat. I would like to try this place again when they have a fruity flavor available.
author: Annie H.

description:
They make their own waffle cones but as Shania Twain says, 'That don't impress me much.'

Cake cones all the way for me, but they don't have that here sooo...
Salted Caramel in a cup, please. 

I got a small because I'm trying this new thing where I don't eat until it feels like my insides are hemorrhaging but the plan backfired at Smitten because a small is actually pretty small and I definitely could have eaten a whole second scoop, at least.  

They only offer 4 flavors because it's a very size-conscious food stand, but they whip that jazz up right there and it.is.delicious. Worth it.
author: Candice G.

description: Located inside a re-purposed shipping container, they use science to make your ice cream right in front of you. Small batch ice cream, they use a machine to both churn the ice cream and mixin liquid nitrogen to make some pretty awesome ice cream. I had the creme fraiche with pear caramel, and the ice cream was light, creamy, sweet and magical. It also looks like they do outdoor movie showings right outside.
author: Leon K.

description: Very few flavors, but well-chosen. They suggest topping and flavor pairings. I love nitro ice cream places and this one doesn't disappoint.
author: Evan Z.

description:
Great ice cream, super interesting watching the staff make it. I got the "passionate date" ice cream in a cone. Both were excellent!

The vibe of the place is really nice, too. Very well decorated.
author: Katy K.

description:
Simple ingredient, complex flavor, it tastes magical every with every single scoop. My wife and I tried to stop by every opportunity that we get. We have tried different flavor every visit and it has not disappointed. 

If you feel a little adventurous, try the add-ons that they recommend. :) Otherwise, the unique flavor alone will steal your heart and taste bud. We know it's good, cause we didn't even stop to take a photo of it. ;)
author: Will K.

description:
Get the waffle cup! Or cone! Makes all the difference from 5 stars to 5 stars. No seriously, this place is so good.

Flavors change frequently but on the chilly 48 degree windy day that we went, we got the earl grey with milk chocolate chips. No special pairings but we got the waffle cup. Two small scoops for the small size ($5). You can read up on the science behind the ice cream but the jist of it is that there's a taste of creaminess that's unparalleled or at least difficult to find! And with the convenience of this place, you have to try it. Okay, not very convenient in terms of parking but still worth it. It's a fun neighborhood to shop and window shop and this is a great snack :) Highly recommended!
author: Lucy Z.

description: I love this place! Never got anything I didn't like. I like when they have lavender ice cream and olive oil topping with earl gray short bread cookie! Pricey but worth it. The ice cream is churned with nitric oxide.
author: Natasha K.

description:
I love ice cream. So much. Currently hunting down every ice cream spot in the Bay Area, and Smitten is one of the best so far! I love how they have creative flavors, but I still had to get the Salted Caramel which is one of my go-to flavors. The ice cream is SUPER creamy. It's unreal. No weird chunks of cream or ice, just perfect, smooth ice cream. The even better thing about Smitten is their Tcho Chocolate Sauce. I almost never get toppings on my ice cream, but I had to try this after reading reviews. No regrets. They really top off your ice cream with the sauce, and it complements it perfectly! The sauce doesn't even harden too quickly, it's just a really really really great pairing. 

I will definitely be back here, but I wish their ice cream wouldn't melt so fast :( I find myself a fast ice cream eater, but I was racing to finish before all I had was ice cream soup.
author: Ellen M.

description:
I know this place is known for its cool liquid nitrogen process, but the thing that I found most interesting was the flavors. For me it was not interesting in a great way but I can see other people loving it.

The flavors are extremely authentic. For example, I ordered the mint chip ice cream and expected the flavor to be something like your average mint chocolate chip. But no, this mint tasted like REAL mint - think mint leaves or the mint taste you get in mohitos. I didn't realize how fake the mint ice cream I had been eating was until I had this ice cream. I also tried the nectarines and cream ice cream. No sweetened fruit flavor here. It actually tasted like a nectarine - a not quite ripe, slightly bitter nectarine to be precise.

Some people will absolutely love the authenticity of the flavors. I thought I would too. But honestly, I think I prefer the traditional ice cream flavors that have more sugar. I would rather have the less-real-mint chocolate chip ice cream and a sweeter nectarine ice cream. I know this sounds blasphemous in the "authenticity is everything" food space we live in, but frankly I would have preferred regular ice cream.

Combined with the price of $5 for two tiny scoops of ice cream, I probably wouldn't come back here. But if what I'm describing sounds like your jam then check it out! I found the texture of the ice cream itself to be good and creamy,
author: Priyanka N.

description:
$7 for a small vanilla ice cream in a cone with some cookie pieces,
at a place that looks like a small shack,
with a bonus photo opp with a blender enshrouded in what looks like a puff of this morning's fog.

What I find especially startling is that this all seems perfectly normal. Despite burning a liquid nitrogen hole in my wallet, Smitten ice cream really is distinctly smooth and noticeably fresh--I wonder if this is what ice cream in heaven is like. 

I tried the classic vanilla, which was simple and allowed for mindful eating of artisan small-batch ice cream, if that is such a thing. If you think hard enough, you can almost taste the excellent quality of the ingredients. The creaminess was superb, though I did find it too sweet. The sweetness was balanced out with the oatmeal cookie crumble (which I suspect was snickerdoodle since it was very cinnamony and lacked oatmeal), only to resume with the very sweet caramelized waffle cone. 

$5 for the small scoop is not terrible, since you get two small scoops; however the extras add up fast, as my $1.25 waffle cone and $0.75 cookie crumble escalated the afternoon snack to the price of a meal. The special flavor of blueberry pie was a hefty $1.25 extra, and I couldn't help but think of how $1.25 literally gets you a scoop with a cone at John's Ice Cream in Berkeley. 

(Note: To clarify, I believe they only make ice cream in front of you if they don't have an already made batch. My vanilla was scooped out of a container, but I got to watch the ice cream making process because someone else ordered the pricey special.

The verdict? Very good, but very expensive (like many things in SF).
author: Edna C.

description:
As a somewhat ice cream snob I was skeptical on the liquid nitrogen being just a gimmick to attract customers. Smitten Ice Cream definitely proved me wrong in that regard. Gave it a try and encountered some of the creamiest ice cream I've ever had, while also being rich in flavor. Very tasty and to me- worth the price which can come off as a bit steep. Line can be long, but thats just kind of how it goes for San Francisco creameries these days.

The biggest downside for me was that you're not able to sample the flavors. They will let you order and if you don't like it get a different flavor but I'm a fan of sampling so that was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise, amazing experience at Smitten.
author: Kayla U.

description: I really like to eat a tasty ice cream when I have a sunny weather. It's a pretty place. They have a big selection of ice creams. You wanna taste everything. Mint and chocolate ice creams are my favorite. Love this place.
author: Jessie P.

description: Found this place on Yelp and had to give it a try since we were visiting on vacation.  It did not disappoint!  We shared the Salted Carmel with chocolate and cookie dough, it was super creamy and delicious!  No fault of the establishment, but there was an issue with a homeless lady in the entrance and dancing when people walked in. One of the workers asked her to leave about 6 times and said "Ma'am you've been here a long time and need to go" and the lady would just look at her and stare all creepy. Not the employees fault, but if they called the cops they probably wouldn't come or anytime soon and my husband and I both wondered why there was 3 young girls working night shift with no men on duty? Not to sound sexist, but this is clearly an issue in the area as we saw lots of homeless...not sure if there is better security for these workers because that lady was creepy AF! By the time we left, the lady was still there. Hopefully they got her to leave.  It would definitely make me uncomfortable to walk in alone if I wasn't with my husband. The staff was super nice!
author: Tia S.

description:
I have a thing for ice cream so obviously Smitten was on my bucket list of ice cream places to try. Came here on a Sunday afternoon during Memorial Day weekend. Lots of seating inside and in the surrounding area. They also make the ice cream using liquid nitrogen which is cool. You can see them making it in front of you.

The line was semi-long but moved pretty quickly. There's someone that walks around and takes your order on an iPad before you even get to the counter, which definitely speeds things up. But you sorta need to know what you're gonna get beforehand. The menu is inside so if you're standing outside in line, it's hard to see what flavors they have. One of the workers was starting to write the flavors on the side of the window though, but too slow to be useful since I was already halfway through the line. 

I ordered vanilla bean on a waffle cone and I wanted rainbow sprinkles but they were out T____T so I opted to try the Tcho crispies. They have two sizes -- small or regular. I don't remember exactly how much it was, but it was semi pricy. The norm for hipster ice cream in the city LOL. The ice cream was very creamy, but not overly rich. It was good, but the standout for me was the waffle cone. SO DELICIOUS. Not too crunchy, but not too soft. Perfect texture and taste. It made the ice cream that much more enjoyable. They didn't put the Tcho crispies on the ice cream for me, but rather handed me a cup with them. I wish they would have just poured it on the ice cream for me because I was holding a lot of stuff LOL so it made it difficult to put the toppings on myself. They were ok. I wish they had rainbow sprinkles. Ugh. It's my favorite thing ever. But I can't complain too much because the ice cream was still delicious.

Solid place to fill your ice cream needs. WAFFLE CONE ON POINT.
author: Amy T.

description:
All I'm going to say is nothing is better than SMITTENS. They make your ice cream when you order and you never know what they would have on their menu. It's kinda awesome, isn't it? They have seasonal flavors, changes every quarter/month. My favorite was their APPLE CRISP, not coming back this year. Apple crisp was super amazing and disappointed they're aren't bringing it back but now they have Maple Brown Sugar Pumpkin, PUMPKIN!! Just AMAZING!

Also, I love their brown sugar and blue bottle coffee!! 

I love all Smitten location but I love the hayes valley location the most.
author: Sandy B.

description: They have a very unique Vanilla ice cream that will surprise you and will blow any other ice cream away. they have a small selection but it's very unique creations. price is a bit on the high side for a scoop but is certainly worth it.
author: Austin K.

description:
Long line but it moves relatively fast. 
interesting method for making ice cream it's a very fast proses as apposed to a slow churning proses like other fresh made ice creams cute shop. Worth checking out if your in the area.
author: James T.

description: Small but great place to get ice cream. Very friendly staff and just watching how they make the ice cream was fun. I bet in summer there is s long line. The menu is not big but has a nice selection to choose from.
author: Akiko I.

description:
What a darling little place! Standing on the corner right next to a park renovation is a cute little stand that makes on-the-spot, liquid nitrogen ice cream with fresh and innovative flavors! It's certainly worth your time to check out what they have to offer and enjoy a cool treat!

When we went on a Friday evening, there was only one person in front of us, but I think we were just lucky because a steady stream of people showed up later. We ended up ordering a flight of 3 flavors for $9. I love that you can choose whichever three flavors you want, and they hand them to you as they're made. Out of the four offered flavors, we got:

Nectarines and Cream
Salted Caramel
Cookie Dough with Pretzels and Chocolate Chips

The only one we didn't try was the Dark Chocolate. I loved how the Nectarines and Cream flavor had little bits of fruit in it. It was more savory than sweet, as was the Salted Caramel. It's hard to explain, but the Cookie Dough definitely had more sweetness to it. The chunks of pretzel and bits of cookie dough were delicious too. Seriously, the flavors are complex and unique. They served the flight in three little bowls with mini spoons, and I think those tiny spoons are what saved us from inhaling the dessert before we could truly savor it!

The only downside is that as far as seating they only have a little bench in their establishment. There is a cool wooden structure just across the street that has some neat places to sit. 

All in all, there is something fresh and pure about a just-made cup of ice cream, and I'd definitely come back for more!
author: Carlye M.

description:
I usually love smitten but was disappointed when I visited last night. While the process and service itself was excellent the actual ice cream sundae I ordered was not up to the usual smitten standard, I ordered a small dough my goodness sundae and there was very little ice cream and a lot of the cookie dough topping and chocolate sauce which made the sundae cloyingly sweet. 

I absolutely love smitten so will definitely be back but will probably go for my regular TCHO scoop instead.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Super-premium ice cream meets nerdy/cool tech as they mix and stir the ingredients with liquid nitrogen. 

It's fun to watch, a process that looks like a stand mixer doing its thing with cool fog swirling around it.

My little boy (I call him my Smitten kitten now) and I have been there twice and he's opted for the cookie dough and I, the magical mint chocolate chip made with fresh mint. It was so unusual and very delicious, not at all like any mint chocolate chip I've ever tasted in the very best way.

We took a pint ($11) of rhubarb crisp home and it lasted a whole week (what discipline, right?) It was scrumptious, like a rhubarb pie transformed into ice cream.

Do yourself a favor and go on a weekday so you won't have to stand in line for 30 minutes in the sun. Weekends are very busy and while worth waiting for, I'm impatient. Each batch is made individually, per customer, so it takes 2-3 minutes once you've placed your order.

They have a locals' discount (10%) so remember that before you leave the register - nice!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I came here with friends because they'd heard about it on Yelp. 
Be aware: they only have four flavors. That's correct, four!
None of the four sounded appealing to me, so I shared a scoop with one of my friends. 
It wasn't the best, & it wasn't the worst. 
The scoops are TINY for the price they're asking!!
This is not a place I'd return to.
author: Reed S.

description:
Alright. I give in. This stuff is GOOOOOD. Especially their MINT FLAVOR ... get me a full jar of that.

I still find it ridiculous to charge +$5 for ice cream hence I refuse to hand out more than 3 stars. 

But the long lines at the Octavia location don't lie.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
It's alright.  Organic ingredients and nitrogen was fun to watch them make the ice cream but it didn't taste extra ordinary food or anything.  

Service was good but I think sometimes the flavors of sauces aren't Matched so good so it shouldn't be offered hahaha.  I should have had the ice cream just by itself!!  Think this place is kinda overrated hyped kinda thing.

I do prefer Bi-rite and Marco polo over this sorry fans. I thought the serving size is ok for cost though unlike many others complaint. if you get large $6 3scoops is ok.  Not liking the deal for the small tho.  Good thing someone finished mine haha so it's not that bad.

With all that said the service was decent tho.  We asked the server what to get and he did recommend is what he liked.
author: Juila L.

description:
I am addicted to Smitten! I love to go any around wherever I am in the East Bay, but this particular one in Hayes Valley always hits home for me.:)

Right next to Patricia's Green in what looks like a small converted shipping container, people will come and flock to see what 4 flavors have been rotated around and are being offered, so they can take it and enjoy it in the park. 

You order which flavor you want, add their preferred paired toppings with it if you want (I say go for it!), and then watch the magic happen of your ice cream being made in real time as you wait!

My only negatives are that the place is small and people tend to crowd inside, the price is $5 for a small, however do you get two scoops, and that they only offer 4 flavors at a time, enticing me to come back more often to see if they've changed ha!

The flavors I've tried in order of preference:

Fresh Mint Chip- My favorite because you taste STRONG fresh mint and balances well with the chocolate chips and sauce
Nectarines & Cream- Light and not sour. Subtly sweet and refreshing
TCHO 60.5 % Chocolate- Very rich, and even better with their (not so) spicy caramel!
Salted Caramel- I'm still partial to Bi rite's.. needs more flavor
Cookie Dough- Creamy and goes well with the salty pretzels
Balsamic Strawberry- a little too bitter for my taste

I'll be updating this as the other flavors come into season! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description: The ice cream is good but not worth waiting in line 20 minutes for. They only carry 2-3 flavors and happened to run out of cones when I was there. Also like any place in San Francisco it is small and has limited seating.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I think it's been about two years since I've been here. Yes, two years late on my Yelp review. I never would have thought there would be an ice cream place where Smitten is located. But there's a little sidewalk to stroll around nearby to eat your ice cream.

I don't remember what flavor I got, but I remember I liked it. It's overpriced and there tends to be such a long line, but that's usually what you get for hyped up ice cream in SF.
Looking at photos on Yelp, seems like the caramel or chocolate drizzle is the way to go, as well as other toppings. I wouldn't mind coming back to see what new flavors they've got. I never turn ice cream down. I guess when I went, I didn't want to be open to trying toppings? Who knows what was going on in my head two years ago.

I really like how cute this ice cream shop is. It's like the Tin Can created an ice cream shop haha.
author: Steffi G.

description:
Maybe I'm just too used to artificial ingredients to appreciate the greatness of Smitten's ice cream. While being able to watch the entire process of ice cream making with the addition of liquid nitrogen is incredibly cool, I cringed slightly when I took a bite of my fresh mint chip ice cream and found it very minty. I know, I know, I should love the fact that my fresh mint ice cream actually tasted like fresh mint, but my unsophisticated self could only think "damn, this tastes like an effing plant."

That said, the ice cream had a very unique consistency to it and was very refreshing. I definitely didn't -dislike- the taste and the plain vanilla was very good, so maybe I just need to try something that's less plant-y.
author: Shani T.

description:
If you're in one of those "love myself" moods, then please do yourself a favor and come here (or any location, really). Smitten is SO worth the indulgence. For some reason, when Smitten was brand new around Hayes Valley a couple years back, I wasn't too into it (I remember the texture being way creamier than I preferred), but recently it's done a heck of a job making me fall in love with their ice cream. 

They make your ice cream fresh using their liquid nitrogen method, which is also enjoyable to watch. They also do creative flavors every season, varying from early grey in the winter to strawberry balsamic in the spring. I've tried both of those (which are both delicious I might add), but my absolutely go-to is their Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough with Pretzels. It. Is. So. Good. The flavors all match together perfectly and the pretzels add that nice crunch and saltiness to balance out the sweet. 

At this point, the Smitten sign is my version of the Golden Arches---if I see the Smitten sign, we're getting some. 

With that said, scratch what I said earlier. Any type of mood is reason enough to go to Smitten.
author: Chantel T.

description:
Yesterday, SF got a brief taste of summer. And what better treat is there to enjoy on a hot evening than smooth, creamy ice cream?

Smitten is pretty pricey since the fancy flavors are made in small batches using liquid nitrogen. The best flavor I've ever had at Smitten was strawberry with balsamic glaze. Last night, we settled on a regular order ($6 for 3 small scoops) of Cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips to share. It was surprisingly good.

We took our expensive ice cream and enjoyed it on a bench at the park across the street. Warm nights like last night are elusive in SF but don't worry, Smitten has heaters for ice cream eaters on cold days as well.
author: Yi Z.

description: A really cool experience with the dry ice / molecular breakdown. Definitely worth taking tourists just to show them how intense the SF ice cream scene can be. Flavors are all good -- depends what you like. Expect a wait on weekends.
author: Steffan P.

description: I'm starting to get annoyed with all these liquid nitrogen ice cream places, as they are super expensive. A  regular here, which is two small scoops, cost around $6 w/tax, which is outrageous. What is even more startling is that the ice cream itself was not that great and left my mouth desert dry because it was so sweet. Next time, I'll go to Bi-rite or Mitchell's, where the ice cream is a little cheaper and tastes way better
author: Jade L.

description:
Okay, I'm a fan! There are a lot ice cream shops that are doing the whole liquid nitrogen concept so I wasn't really expecting too much because I felt like I've tried almost every liquid nitrogen ice cream trend but Smitten's is legit.

Although they only have a few flavors on their menu, they do it absolutely well. I'm not sure how often they change the flavors on their blackboard but I'm sure it depends on what's in season. I'm a believer of the phrase 'less is more' and this place does it right. I appreciate how they also write down which toppings and flavor combinations they recommend with which ice cream you chose as well. I ordered the TCHO 60.5% chocolate and chose the spicy caramel topping. My friend Jeff ordered the TCHO as well but with the oatmeal cookie crumble as recommended by the staff. They make all their ice cream fresh and there's a glass partition where you can watch them mix the batch for you. It's always fun to watch and you get to see what exactly goes into your order. The process is quick and seamless, we got our ice cream a little over 5 minutes.

Smitten is located in this cool area in Hayes Valley so once we got our ice cream we around the park for a little bit. There are a lot of seating areas so finding a place is not problem. When we sat down in front of the wooden Hayes Valley Temple by artist David Beck (which is impressive by the way. The wooden structure was intricate and beautiful). It's nice to take in the sights while eating delicious food. The ice cream itself was rich and smooth, it reminded me of a nice cup of hot cocoa during the winter time. The chocolate ice cream was topped with a spicy caramel sauce which complimented it well and it had just the right amount of kick to it. My friend ordered the same chocolate ice cream but with the oatmeal cookie crumble and it was delicious as well. The oatmeal cookie crumble added a nice texture to the smoothness of the chocolate.

I was a bit skeptical at first but like I said, Smitten is legit. They added dimension to simple flavors without it being too complicated. Overall, a great place. I wish it just wasn't so damn expensive for some ice cream but it is San Francisco after all.
author: Andrea S.

description:
I'm so pleased (or should I say Smitten) with this ice cream spot! I love how their flavors change & how all the ice creams are made to order with fresh ingredients using liquid nitrogen. You can watch the Brrista pull out the cream and ingredients & you can see your ice cream forming before your eyes! There are limited flavors but all of the options sound delicious. I tried the blood orange with pistachio cookie in a waffle cone. The cone was delightfully buttery & crispy. I've had thick tough waffle cones before and this cone couldn't be more opposite. It tasted fresh & very fragrant with vanilla. 

The location is in a hip spot in a crate container behind Rituals coffee by the park. There are benches inside the crate but no tables. 

I thought my blood orange ice cream was very creamy & tasty. It wasn't at all tart and sour nor sorbet-ish like I thought it'd be. There were harder mini orange candy chunks inside that added a nice crunch. I cannot wait to try their other flavors. The ice cream is definitely more expensive than your average ice cream but being that their ice cream is made to order & with fresh cream & ingredients it is completely understandable. I wish this place was closer to where I live so I could try their changing flavors.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Every flavor I've tried so far from Smitten has been fabulous. 

+ Salted Caramel: No one ever messes up this flavor but oh my they do it so well here. Creamy yumminess. This one's a must get.
+ Cookies and Cream with Pretzel/Cookie Bits: I just recently got this flavor and it blew my mind. Initially I wasn't feeling it since pretzels aren't my favorite thing.. but seriously the bits made the ice cream so good! The texture is perfect and so addicting. Definitely have to try this flavor as well.
author: Rita Y.

description: The chocolate ice cream is way too sweet. The waffle cone seems too soft and a bit old. I am surprised that this store is popular
author: Eva F.

description: Lemon gingersnap. So good! Thick and creamy liquid nitrogen ice cream. The lemon zest fruity flavoring and the crunch of the gingersnap paired so perfectly with the rich and creamy ice cream. Overpriced ice cream but worth it. Expect long lines even on weekdays but open late for late night cravings.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
When a sunny day like today comes along, one thing comes to mind.  ICE CREAM!!!

I'm smitten over Smitten!  I've been to every ice cream shop in town at least thrice but something about this place keeps me coming back for more.

There's something more cool here than their ice cream.  It's their whole idea behind the company.  An entrepreneur bringing her invention to life.  A job well done!

And wanna know what's sweet?  Their ice cream of course!  You can watch the magic of molecular gastronomy as the make it right before your very eyes.  I enjoy the strawberry ice cream with balsamic sauce.  They have a seasonal flavors so catch me there trying out something new.  

Nicely located on the corner of Hayes & Octavia.  You can catch a movie outdoors at PROXY or grab some coffee (ritual or blue bottle) nearby.
author: Janice C.

description: Creamy, delicious ice cream!  Loved the at Tcho chocolate flavor and the pretzel cookie flavor! I highly recommend trying all flavors. The wait in line is not too bad at all. It moves fairly fast. And it's nice to enjoy the ice cream in the park and benches.
author: Lucy L.

description: I love the ice cream here! All of their flavors are great. I love cookie dough or vanilla with brown sugar caramel, yum :D
author: Angel C.

description:
It's pretty hot here days, but honestly I would probably get ice cream during San Francisco fall and winters!

Smitten is really special to me because I love the smooth texture of liquid nitrogen ice cream! I haven't tried any other liquid nitrogen ice creams ever in the city so I was super excited to try this. 

Every ice cream is made to order in front of you, so you know it's definitely super fresh. It's definitely something I would try at home if I could get a hold of some liquid nitrogen. I ordered creme fraiche since it was an interesting flavor I don't usually see. As weird as it sounds, I think the flavor is pretty good, especially with the pear caramel! It's a sweet and slightly savory taste. 

I also thought the earl grey flavor was amazing! I chomped away on the regular size (3 scoops).
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Attempt number two! First time we came here, they just closed, so we decided to give this place a shot for dessert after our Valentine's Day dinner. 

It was pretty damn good! You will have to wait in line, as this place is as big of a secret as that of knowing the U.S. president is Obama. So yes, everyone knows. By the time we left the line was much longer than when we had entered. 

They have very select flavors so that's kind of a downer and the weird part is they won't put two different flavors in the same cup. You can't put two different flavors in one cup? What in the? Pretty weird in my book. However, what they do serve has an intense flavor that you can't deny that it's good. It's really really really good! The price will also reflect that as you're paying for liquid nitrogen ice cream! T-1000 would be proud! 

If you don't like lines, then avoid this place like the bubonic plague. However, if you enjoy great ice cream. Then you just found your best friend!
author: Benny H.

description:
This place is just so cool! I went on a cold night, but I still couldn't wait to try this icecream! The technique for making it is always super fun to watch, and it comes out so tasty! I tried the TCHO chocolate and it was just divine! I am so coming back next time I'm in the area!
The wait was pretty long (maybe 15 min), so just be prepared!
author: Larissa S.

description:
I didn't know ice cream could taste any better, but Smitten proved me wrong today! First off, I had very little knowledge of Smitten prior to my visit so I walked in with zero expectations. The first thing that made me smile was the extras that came with each of the ice cream flavors. The flavors of the day were mint chocolate chip, which came with  tcho chocolate (yay for supporting local businesses), lemon and ginger snap, and chocolate chip cookies dough which came pretzels and more tcho chocolate.

We got the mint chocolate chip and I swear I could taste strips of fresh mint! The flavor was so strong that my boyfriend thought it was the wrong flavor. Regular mint ice cream has made us forget what real mint tastes like. Ooh and they make the ice cream right there in front of you, which means you have to wait longer, but worth it.
author: Vivian W.

description: We tried the Earl grey and cookie dough flavors. In terms of taste, the ice cream was wonderful and probably some of the best I've had. However, they don't mix flavors (your cup no matter how many scoops, can have only one flavor) and the scoop sizes are small. Price then seems steep because of the amount you get.
author: Angela I.

description: Stopped by here after a big yummy meal at Souvla looking to satisfy my sweet tooth! I ordered the small salted caramel which was about $5, and I wasn't super impressed. It was decent, but at a $5 price tag and liquid nitrogen ice cream, I expected more. Hopefully this was just a one time fluke and I'll enjoy the next thing I get at Smitten!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Flavors change all the time and they use their own machinery to make their ice cream! Not my first time seeing liquid nitrogen used to make ice cream, but nonetheless it's always a cool experience to watch. 

It's quite pricey for ice cream but it works for them. They have recommended sauces with their ice cream flavors. I ordered the blood orange with brown sugar caramel sauce. It was fresh and the pistachios added some texture. Was the best flavor? No. Have I had better ice cream? Yes. Would I come back and try a different flavor? Of course. 

It's difficult to be critical of ice cream places who make their own flavors which change regularly. Sometimes it takes a couple times to come here and find your favorite flavor.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Ah it was so so ... everything from the customer service to the ice cream itself. In my opinion A La Minute in SoCal is much better - better flavors and bigger scoops. Seems like once you experience LN2 ice cream it all has the same texture wherever you go.

The texture was very smooth but dense. The sweet corn with berries was not strong at all and I was disappointed not to find bits of corn in the ice cream itself. Note that the berries is a drizzle. When I asked for it on the side the employee gave me a look as if I was crazy or weird, which I did not appreciate. As for the salted caramel, it didn't taste salted at all ... should be named toasted caramel. The flavor tasted and smelled great but again, it was advertised as "salted" not toasted or burnt.

Not subpar but nothing I would come back for.
author: Carlin T.
