description: They only have about 3-4 ice cream selection here and it's usually a new and unique mix. I finally decided on the passion fruit and lychee ice cream with chocolate covered plantains mixed into it. I love fruity ice cream and it did not disappoint. It was creamy sweet and tangy with a great amount of crunch from the plantains. Watching them make the ice cream right before your eyes is also a cool plus! Wish I could've tried the blood orange ice cream over pistachio cookies, too.
author: Jessica C.

description:
One of my favourite ice cream places in San Francisco. Always freshly made and always so good. They change their flavors every day, so you are always in for a treat. I saw cookie dough on the menu today, which was a new one. I would have tried it but I wasn't sure about the pretzel bits. I settled on my all time favourite choice, which is salted caramel. It's so smooth, has great texture and perfectly sweet.

They make it using liquid nitrogen and fresh ingredients. It's quintessentially San Francisco and organic as well. You can get single or double sizes. It's never enough, even on a cold night like tonight. The plain vanilla one is also good, as is the TCHO chocolate flavour, which is very rich.

They just opened a new location in Pacific Heights and must give it a try. Highly recommend this place!
author: Billy S.

description: Good ice cream, and you get a show to go along with it. Always packed if the weather is nice. Because we live so close to this, I've tried a number of the flavors, and honestly, you can't go wrong. I do wish they had more vegan or sorbet options though, just to mix it up.
author: Lydia L.

description:
I was really excited to come here because of the hype but tbh was a little let down. I got the strawberry balsamic with TCHO crunchies but the flavor was meh. It was also a little pricey for the amount of ice cream they give you ($5 for a small). 

It's pretty cool how they make the ice cream and would recommend for people to come to check out the area (lots of huge shipping containers around) but I've definitely had better ice cream elsewhere.
author: Jackie P.

description:
At first glance of this place, you may start to whip out your phone to take an ultimate Snap Chat worthy post. It's the old fashioned ice cream machine steaming away making one ice cream order at a time. 

The concept is great. The price, not so much. But hey, you get what you pay for right? I recall paying around $6 for a small.  The ice cream shop uses wholesome ingredients and a little help from liquid nitrogen to whip up a made to order scoop.

If you're feeling fancy, come right in and enjoy a satisfying old fashioned ice cream.
author: Briana H.

description: Wow this place is amazing! It opens late too for your late night sweets cravings! They have flavors of the day each day and it changes up daily. I ordered their cookies and cream ice cream with salted caramel on top. The small size looks small but it's enough because of his rich and creamy this ice cream is! The ice cream maker they use is pretty cool too!
author: Rissa K.

description:
Very few flavors to choose from. The give a fair sized stop for the price charged which is average nowadays for artisan ice cream. 

BFF got the Salted Caramel which she liked. I had the Cookie Dough which was silky and not overly sweet. Her Salted Caramel came 10 mins before my scoop of Cookie Dough which was in the same order. They were passing out many other scoops of CD waaay before mine was ready. 

Pac Heights location has a better selection of flavors (i.e. Earl Gray).
author: Julie L.

description: Love the ice-cream. Love the experience of watching it being made. The fresh mint flavor was exceptional. Since they only have ~4 flavors on any given day, can be an issue if you are really picky with your flavors. I am not, so I love it!
author: Ankit A.

description: Wow - talk about smooth ice cream! Delicious vanilla in a waffle cone. Yeah it was $6.25 but we shared it and it was on point. There so many great things to eat in SF that I don't even mind the price. I can't fit and finish my own cone, anyways. Cool concept and good flavor!
author: Aleks K.

description:
I love this place with all of my heart. I am so sad I came here on my last day in San Francisco because it was so good.

Beat all my expectations about it and their hype. The liquid nitrogen is cool but I care about taste.

They only offer four flavors but it didn't matter. They were all so good.

They don't let you taste them but they're good about explaining to you the flavors and how toppings will match with them.

I got their Earl Grey with Almonds. Mindblowingly delicious. Not too sweet, perfect creaminess, the almonds (a tip from the server) were perfect.

DEF WORTH THE HYPE.
author: Sarah S.

description:
OOOFFFF. No, just NO. This place is all hype, all show over substance. Because yeah, it's cool to watch your ice cream being made, and they've definitely got the performance aspect of it down... but oh my god, the ice cream here is actually kind of gross, almost NASTY. It's like it didn't mix properly -- with every bite, you can actually taste the fat. It's not creamy at all, and instead almost like eating a giant scoop of lard. 

I went with a group of people, and we got all the flavors they had up (they only have a small selection at a time) and every single one was disappointing -- we ended up throwing most of our ice cream away only after a few tries. One person described their ice cream as similar to "licking a stick of butter" (yep, that's as gross as it sounds) and another started choking after a couple of bites ("the fat is getting stuck to the roof of my mouth").  Maybe it's because we didn't get any toppings (.75 cents for a teaspoon's worth of sprinkles seems a little ridic), it wasn't able to hide the piss quality of the ice cream? Who knows. Blegh.

Also, really not worth the money folks (cuz seriously -- $5 for a scoop is a little bit like daylight robbery, eh?). Don't buy into the hype. Seriously, never again.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I am a smitten kitten for Smitten Ice Cream *cat heart eyes + ice cream emoji*   

Great quality ice cream, cool liquid nitrogen concept, nice service and great location.  I don't like overly sweet items and thought Smitten was just right.  A medium is 3 scoops and very sharable without going into sugar overload.  

Cookie Dough with Pretzel and Chocolate Chips-  Simple with slight crunches of flavor.  awesome.
Fresh Mint Chip-  SO GOOD, so fresh.  It's basically pho toppings for dessert, a dream come true!  

I like hanging out in Hayes Valley and the atmosphere at Smitten is cute.  It's the perfect place to grab ice cream and chill.  Everything here is great, no complaints!
author: Lyn C.

description: Best ice cream ever. Love how they make it to order and the unique flavors. Even though it's pricey, it's definitely worth it.
author: Lily D.

description: The vanilla ice cream had no flavor of vanilla and was very fatty. I took one bite and threw it away.tasted like eating whipped cream cheese spread.  Probably the worst ice cream I've had in a while. Oh well.
author: Mark I.

description:
Very neat concept! Smitten Ice Cream is a liquid nitrogen ice cream stand located in a lively area of Hayes - I highly recommend walking around the neighborhood after to check out the shops/restaurants! 

We waited about 30 minutes in line on a nice sunny afternoon. The line looks long at first but it moves fairly quickly. Keep in mind that part of the stand isn't covered so you could be standing in the sun for awhile (had to buy a bottled water for $1.75 by the time we got to the counter).

There were four flavors on the menu to choose from. We ordered a small earl grey with chocolate chips and a small salted caramel ice cream (each was $5). A waffle cone is $1.75 extra. The ice cream has a very CREAMY texture and both flavors were very RICH so I was glad that I only ordered a small.

Overall, really good ice cream but know that it is going to be a long wait time!
author: Linda X.

description:
I have never had a more memorable experience and unique icecream! 

They make the icecream in front of you and then you can enjoy sitting outside at the park - how much better can it get!

I got their Mojito with raspberry sauce icecream and I can say I have never had a more unique and tasty pairing.
author: Dana N.

description: Great ice cream and fantastic staff! Especially the incredibly handsome young man with best eye brows I've ever seen. Love this place!
author: Jason E.

description:
A certain type of fear washes over you when you can't identify what you are eating...which was the case for my sticky toffee pudding ice cream. I had to do a double take on the ingredients present and even now I can only say that I "might" have been chewing on pieces of molasses. But as for the ice cream itself, it was pretty good. Not too strong and overbearing, just enough to bring our meal to a sweet ending. 

The one thing I'll have a hard time justifying though is the $6.15 price tag for a small scoop of ice cream and 1 topping. That's absolutely ridiculous. Sure, you pay for the charm and the special presentation of liquid nitrogen ice cream but ice cream at this price point better blow my socks off - and it really didn't. Plus, that would easily be a double scoop at most other gourmet ice cream shops in San Francisco who also feature equally weird (read: unique) flavors.

While I can excitedly cross yet another ice cream place off my list, I can't be certain that I'll be back for a repeat experience.
author: Elaine Y.

description: $5 for a small ice cream?  And it was SMALL! A bit pricey but I had to try any ways.  Verdict? I got the chocolate chip cookie dough with pretzel bits.  It is good but I wouldn't say worth the money.  I can get a whole pint of ice cream at Safeway!
author: Nyla K.

description: New old-fashion ice cream made with liquid nitrogen. Cool design and really fresh flavors but definitely nothing mind blowing.
author: Bill Q.

description: Smitten Ice Cream was my very first experience with liquid nitrogen ice cream, and having had several other places with the same concept, I know this place does it right and they do it well. This magical encounter started with lining up to order flavors of the day. We ordered the yelper's rave of balsamic strawberry and mint chocolate ice creams that I still dream about till this very day. The next step I waited patiently, like a kid at an ice parlor, as they whip up my fresh concoctions before my eyes with huge kitchen aid mixers. It was like chemistry class where they had exact measurements of liquid nitrogen and cream to produce the best texture of ice cream. I watched as they blissfully throw in fresh mints, fresh strawberries, and fresh balsamic. The results were literally a taste of happiness that I wish I could move and live in San Francisco forever.
author: Judy L.

description: There are just four flavors offered here at a time, and the ice cream is churned fresh with liquid nitrogen in their patented machine. I really wondered what difference liquid nitrogen could  make when it comes to ice cream, but in the end, I was extremely impressed by what I tasted! On my visit one Sunday afternoon, my friends and I split the cookie dough with pretzel ice cream and the blood orange with pistachio cookie ice cream. Both of these flavors were very unique in taste and had the perfect amount of chunkies. But the ice cream base itself was what really impressed me. First, the texture was so smooth and creamy, because the ice crystals formed by the liquid nitrogen are smaller than those made with the conventional method, leading to a much smoother mouth feel. Second, the ice cream was so fresh that you could still taste the pasteural flavors of the milk and cream--there wasn't the slightest hint of freezer burn or even ice--all you get are the light, subtle aromas of the dairy. What a transcendental experience!
author: David K.

description:
Smitten serves made go order liquid nitrogen ice cream. You can't go wrong with any of the flavours, but after having been here 10+ times my favourite is the TCHO chocolate! I usually get it in a cup occasionally with a topping or two. 

Smitten is easily one of the top 3 ice cream spots in the city!
author: Tanay J.

description:
Super creamy nitrogen ice cream in creative flavors.

I got the Strawberry White Balsamic which was basically regular strawberry ice cream with balsamic topping. The flavors went together surprisingly well, but nothing super extraordinary. Good for ice cream, but wouldn't be my top pick for dessert.
author: Anna M.

description: No doubt my favorite ice cream in the city - smooth, creamy, fun area and staff, and changing. This review doesn't need to be long - just trust me and go! And definitely get a cone - they're homemade and you'll smell them a few blocks away :)
author: Brandon P.

description:
You walk up to this smoking tent thing and after waiting a bit anxiously while they make it in front of you, they hand you this tiny little scoop, no, spoonful of ice cream and you're all "say whaaa?! This is AMERICA! Where's my supersize?!!"

Then you take a bite and are immediately lost in the smooth, creamy richness of this delectable ice cream and suddenly wonder how you will be able to finish the whole thing. The small is more than enough. Bring friends so you can sample their flavors too. 

The flavors are always interesting and delicious and change frequently. My favorite seasonal has been the pumpkin with maple caramel drizzle and my regular order is the root beer float, which is definitely more bang for your buck and they use a real (ie not corn syrup filled) soda and TWO scoops. Don't do this one on a full stomach. Especially if you're like me and would never throw away the last little bit when you're about to explode because you could never lose to a dessert. Never. 

Also good for out-of-towners and quite dangerous when it's only a few steps from home. Walk it off in the park afterwards!
author: Carol M.

description: One of the best Nitro ice cream places I've visited. The cookie dough is bomb. Just a little pricey for how small the scoop it but hey its SF should expect it.
author: Thomas N.

description:
What a delightful surprise. 

Who said that nothing good ever came out of an old storage container? 

Great spot and the servers were kind and amicable. 

Kinda pricey but they use great ingredients. Can't beat the flavor either. 

Parking is notoriously bad in this area, so I suggest walking here from your dinner :)
author: Marwin L.

description:
I moved to San Francisco for Smitten Ice Cream. You may judge me. You may call me crazy. You may even consider moving to the most expensive city in the world pathologically reckless and financially irresponsible. But that's because you obviously have not experienced the delicious chilled dairy perfection known simply, as Smitten. 

To say that my relationship with Smitten is an addiction would be an understatement. Addicts can sometimes stop when they seek help. Those of us acquainted with Smitten know that their is no hope, nor desire, for anything other than a life devoted to securing and inhaling as much of their exquisite product as possible. 

As a true Smitten devotee, I spend at least 36.7% of my paycheck on their ice cream. I make sure I never fall below this number as that would be a deviation from anything other than absolute and complete serfdom to the cult of Smitten. 

As any good addict, I have forsworn relationships, hobbies, and basic personal hygiene to make more time for Smitten Ice Cream. I do not brush my teeth, shower, or clip my nails as this would detract from ice cream time. 

I also have my own Smitten Ice Cream Kit, which looks like a heroin kit. It includes a rusted metal spoon, only spoon I ever eat ice cream with, and never wash as this would deplete its vital ice cream essences. I also have a piece of rubber surgical tubing, in order to slurp the last bits of ice cream out of the bottom of the cup. I have a needle and syringe, to squish more ice cream into my mouth when I've already stuffed my cheeks to the point of bleeding. And a lighter, to melt the ice cream. Obviously, this seems disturbingly similar to a heroin kit, but please do not judge. Every item is painstakingly selected for maximum ice cream consuming ability. You would do well to imitate me in order to reach peak ice cream assimilation. 

Smitten should be considered an accredited college, and in light of this fact I decided to pull all four of my children out of private school, and have them spend eight hours a day in Smitten Ice Cream, eating and observing the Brrristas. My children have learned engineering and physics by observing the cooling and mixing machines operate. They have learned music by listening to the top 100 playlist that runs on repeat. They have learned complex mathematics by watching the Brrristas use measuring cups and teaspoons. They have learned advanced literature by studying ice cream labels and coming up with incorrectly spelled names for these flavors. 

I have developed close personal relationships with all of the employees by demanding their social security numbers and personal home addresses. If they refuse, I claim that there is rat feces in my ice cream and get them fired. This allows me to show up at their house and bang violently on their bedroom window if they're late for any reason. 

If you look closely, you'll see that all the problems in life can be solved by this careful method of study. As a bonus, a Smitten education pays for itself, and attendance is ensured through massive ice cream consumption. 

To be honest, Yelp isn't worthy of Smitten. The Discovery Channel isn't worthy of Smitten. The only way this store will get the recognition it deserves is if it is recognized as a historical treasure by Congress. It should be declared its own country with its own system of governance, its own military, and its own currency (which will obviously be used ice cream spoons).
author: Armi L.

description: Found this place by accident when I was craving for an ice cream cone after hitting some golf balls at the driving range. I'm a chocoholic so I ordered the TCHO chocolate ice cream with toasted almonds in a waffle bowl. The cost was about $8 for a regular size. I say, the best ice cream I've had by far. Very smooth and creamy. Will definitely stop by again and try other flavors.
author: Kath S.

description:
i love their ice cream!!!! 
i know they have 2 in  san Francisco and one in Berkeley, 1 in san Jose 
i don't know about so-cal.
small cup is 5$ and it's enough. 
i love their earl grey ice cream! 
taste like tea with chocolate chip on it. awesome! 
every time i pass their store i have to get an ice cream doesn't matter its cold or raining!
author: Dina S.

description:
The last time I had liquid nitrogen-made ice cream was in college and it was definitely more of a novelty than an endeavor in artisanal ice cream making. 

Not so here. When I went they ordered burnt caramel with tcho crispies and caramel syrup which was divine. They also had a peppermint bark option that felt like a candy cane in ice cream form- perfect for the winter holidays! The texture was perfect and the flavors wonderfully balanced. It's really hard to put together a good sundae concoction but these guys definitely succeeded. Love!
author: Sophie C.

description:
It's better than bi-rite! 
Everything about this little ice cream shop is very interesting. It is in a very hipster location. I decided to try this place after having it as a bookmark for months. Their ice creams are made by liquid nitrogen which makes their texture very creamy and rich. The only downfall about liquid nitrogen ice cream is that it melts a lot faster than regular ice cream. 

I am giving 4 stars not just based on the quality of the ice cream, but by the customer service. I walked in on a Sunday evening and was greeted immediately by the cashier. Since it was my first time there, I took my time staring at the menu and was browsing through yelp for recommendation. After I finished order, I was able to get my ice cream within 2 minutes. Usually liquid nitrogen ice cream can take a while to make, but this ice cream shop works fast! 

There are only a few flavors on their menu so I decided to choose something safe and highly recommended by other yelpers - the salted caramel ice cream. The salted caramel is very sweet but it is also very balanced by the sea salt. The only thing I don't like is the limitation to their flavors. I will come back to get my ice cream craving satisfied.
author: Shelly S.

description: Really tasty ice cream. It was fun to watch them make it too. Staff was kind of eh, but you don't have to interact with them much to get your order.
author: CJ F.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place in Hayes Valley. They have some pretty exotic seasonal flavors, but I generally stick to Tcho chocolate. It's creamy and rich. Although there's almost always a line, they get through everyone's orders rather quickly.
author: Cesar N.

description:
Drove from Penisula to try this place out cos I saw how they freshly make their ice cream online sounds so interesting. 
Not too many choices which is good for me. Tried the sea salt caramel it was fantastic!!! The cashier was friendly. Definitely worth the drive.
author: Vicky C.

description:
The ice cream texture is unbeatable: incredibly smooth, dense and rich! The chocolate is out of this world, but the other flavors are lacking. The two scoops small for $5 is pretty standard SF price, but you'll get nickel and dimed on the toppings and cones. Worth it as a rare treat though. 

The menu is limited but because the ice cream is made in small batches in front of you. There's long lines even at 10 PM during the winter, cause hey it's SF. Loved by adults and kids alike (not sure it's best idea to feed your kids ice cream that late either but y'all seemed chill). I like they're open fairly late for when you have a late night dessert craving or looking for an extension to the evening post-dinner. There's a patio area to hang out with heat lamps. Yass, cause I totally eat ice cream when it's cold in SF and wintery.

TCHO 60.5% Dark Chocolate - 5/5 Among the best ice cream I've ever had. Absolutely perfect creamy texture, intense, and satisfying dark chocolate flavor. It's almost ganache like but cold and less dense. I'm not one to actively crave ice cream but I would dream about this ice cream.
Mint Chip - 4/5 Fresh herby mint taste as if the leaves were crushed the day of. The chocolate chips are more like small chocolate flakes distributed into the ice cream rather than chip chunks, which made each spoonful a delightful blend of flavor and texture as they melted together in your mouth.
Salted Caramel 3/5 - Smooth, buttery, and intensely sweet. Kind of lacking in flavor though.
author: Truc N.

description:
COME for the finest ice cream texture ever.
LEAVE because those churning bowls are just too cool. You can't sit around and chill long enough until it's ready. You get cold feet thinking about liquid nitrogen.

Nitrogen machines churning delicious liquids into delicious ice cream. That's what's really going on here. It's like some witches got new technology for their cauldrons. Smoke and mist everywhere - but hey, ice cream!

There's print all over the place about the process of making the ice cream and how the texture is amazing from the churning and the quality of the milk, so on and so on. Guess what? They're absolutely, 100%... correct. I don't think a smoother ice cream exists.

Flavors. There are a few that stick around all the time. They're inoffensive, run of the mill, classics. TCHO chocolate, cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips, vanilla. But then there's a little extra. Mint chip, creme fraiche with pear caramel, corn and raspberry, mint mojito. These are where it's at.

I have gotten two flavors every time I walk in here. It's not cheap, but the greatest things usually aren't.
author: Ardie Y.

description:
Last week, San Francisco experienced a hot, hot heat wave for a few days. And what better way to cool down than to try ice cream, right? I've heard about the ridiculous lines that come through here, so when we got to this stand and were first in line, I almost cried from happiness. (This is a food stand, so no AC was provided! It was so hot inside the tent area that I wanted to crawl behind the counter and lay next to the ice cream making machines.)

The prices for ice cream is a little steep, but hey, you're in SF.. so you always assume you're going to pay $5 for a scoop of ice cream anywhere! But when you upgrade your size and start adding toppings, you might as well sell your kidneys to get some sweet treats.

I was pretty limited when it came to picking the ice cream flavor and toppings. Vanilla, chocolate (I don't touch that stuff.. gasp, I know), mint (which should only be in toothpaste/gum), and squash (the seasonal flavor of October, and another thing I do not eat). They have TCHO crispies for toppings, so all you chocolate lovers will be elated. I don't eat that stuff, but I hear/know that TCHO is some top shelf quality chocolate!

Since the ice cream is made to order, you'll have to wait around 5 minutes for it. But once they come out, the wait will be worth it! The ice cream is rich and creamy, and I was sad when I finished my cup. If you're looking for a no frills ice cream shop that's made to order, you've come to the right place!
author: Christine S.

description:
I came here with my sister yesterday and our experience was perfect. Yesterday was a beautiful sunny day with lots of people at the park and sipping coffee/juice and just relaxing outside with their Smitten ice creams. We had to try it!

First off I love how this ice cream shop/stand is a perfect sized portable. It's also easy to find; right behind Ritual coffee which is also a great coffee joint!

The lines were long but it kept moving which was nice. There were about two-three people working which doesn't look like much but they move quick and they're still able to give great customer service. The process of their ice cream is made by liquid nitrogen. The founder Robyn wanted to create a smoother texture by freezing ice cream at low temperatures while keeping a freshly packed product. The flavors come at 4-5 at a time/day which is great because they focus more on the flavors and taste without creating a disruption by making lots more different flavors.

I ordered their blood orange w/ pistachio cookie bites and their homemade brown sugar caramel drizzled over the top for the price of $6.25. The process is something I've already seen before but Smitten serves unique and creative flavors with interesting toppings. Their friendly and exciting staff are full of joy and have a blast making one of the city's best ice cream destinations.

The ice cream was creamy and kept it's freezing content the whole time we were eating it. The flavors were all there! Even the textures from the pistachio cookies were gave a soft crumbled feel to the tongue.

I will definitely come here again while sipping my blue bottle or ritual coffee!
author: Allister D.

description: Outstanding salted Carmel ice cream. Tasty and smooth, very cool process and great location!
author: Michael S.

description:
Ice cream lovers rejoice! His is a great place even for you plain old vanilla lovers  
They make their own ice cream RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU!!!! they also usually have a small selection of flavors, about 4-5, but with some innovative toppings.  

My fav is definitely the vanilla with strawberry topping. Ooh-la-la! 

Seating is limited (in fact none at all depending on the outlet you go to- there are a few at least in San Francisco) 

Small scoop usually is enough for a person. And secret- they also have a kiddie scoop (sshhh!)

They are also open late so it's a great place for dessert. 
They also offer pints of ice cream to take home for folks like me
author: Arjan N.

description:
Yes, bi-rite is really, really good.
Yes, bi-rite might be the best ice cream in the city.

But boy oh boy... Smitten is giving it a run for it's money! 
Shorter lines, comparable pricing, ultra delicious flavors that I die for.

Ice cream made on the spot in a super cool way.

The most adorable neighborhood, in Hayes Valley. 

Personally, it's my favorite ice cream in the city -10/10 would recommend. Actually, it is a MUST. 

Best flavors I've had here...
- cookie dough
- olive oil
- salted caramel
author: Ben T.

description: Smitten certainly has the most unique way in making ice cream that I have ever seen. Their staff is super friendly and knowing that they are really popular, there will be a small wait while you order and get your ice cream. The only reason I gave four stars is because their ice cream is a bit too sweet for me preference and I got the most basic ice cream flavor, vanilla. Yet I would never discourage someone to come here because it's an experience!
author: Eva O.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places ever! From 4 simple ingredients they mix and make your ice cream right in front of you. the converted boxcar space is adorable, and its often crowded. They typically only have about 3-4 flavors at a time, and usually rotate a new special flavor of the month. I've had chocolate, tangerine, blood orange, and salted caramel, and mint--all creamy and fantastic!
author: Ana G.

description: So sorry to complain about the plastic spoons.  Turns out they are bamboo, a good kind of recyling product.
author: Susan B.

description:
Love the novel concept of nitrogen ice cream! It's so fun to watch your ice cream being prepared in the huge mixers behind the counter. 

What I tried -- TCHO CHOCOLATE w/ SPICY CARAMEL SAUCE. This was the recommended combo on the board and it did not disappoint! I always love TCHO dark chocolate and I really tasted the rich flavor in the ice cream. The spicy caramel sauce paired well with the chocolate -- it had just a hint of heat from cinnamon. The texture of the ice cream is like a hybrid between traditional ice cream and soft serve.

The only downside is the price point here. Although I loved my ice cream, paying a little over $5 for a couple of small scoops is a bit extravagant for me. My favorite ice cream spot in SF is still Bi-Rite, but I will come back to Smitten if I'm in Hayes Valley again.

Other things to note:
- Lone lines, especially on weekend nights
- All ice cream is freshly made to order, so you can't sample different flavors
- Flavors of the day are usually 3-4 choices
author: Bonnie Z.

description: The ice cream is extra creamy and comes with great options (loved the pear syrup). However, it would be nice to have more than 3 choices. And, the line gets long and there's no where to sit. If you want to walk around with your ice cream, I'd recommend.
author: Leeyen R.

description: I love smitten. Their flavors are inventive (blood orange, strawberry and white balsamic, cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips) and fresh and the texture of the ice cream and waffle cones is (in my opinion) pretty close to perfect. Plus, they had my favorite rose lemonade. Ice cream aficionados you must make it to Smitten!
author: Heather L.

description:
Pretty pricey ice cream, but it's good!

I tried the SWEET CORN WITH BERRIES (August's seasonal flavor) and got it in a waffle cone. It didn't taste that much like sweet corn to me but it was a good flavor! IThe ice cream has a very creamy texture, unlike the icy texture of most ice cream. It's super rich though.. After a few bites, I could feel a layer of butter accumulating on the roof of my mouth. It was actually hard for me to finish the entire cone because it was so rich, so I would probably share with someone next time.

I really want to try some of their other seasonal flavors, like earl grey and olive oil.

The ice cream was about $5 for a small (2 scoops) and the waffle cone was $1.75 (toppings extra). If you download and pay using the PayPal app though, you can get a $5 discount!
author: Jessie L.

description: Nice ice cream place with super friendly employees and delicious flavors. Their Earl Grey is my personal favorite. And their ice cream making methods are super interesting and unique! We were lucky enough to get a small tour from an employee that we knew and had a great time! Only problem is that I wish they had a bigger variety of flavors, but I don't really mind because I can always find what I need.
author: Leah Z.

description: Cookie dough ice cream in a cone with whipped cream. Or get em all, you really can't go wrong.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Smitten is obviously a favorite - they have a new location in Palo Alto and imitations too (microscoop). 

CONSISTENCY: The ice cream as you know are made with liquid nitrogen but I never was a huge fan given the consistency - creamy but melts fast, soft but overly dense texture. I love cream but it was too much for me. 

FLAVORS: Limited. They offered vanilla, mint chocolate chip, TCHO chocolate (65%), tangerine (seasonal). Chocolate was rich but not dark enough for me, vanilla was surprisingly light, tangerine was interesting. Mint was the best, I've never had something that was made with fresh mint!

PRICE: Expensive! $4.95 for a small (2 scoops) and $6 for a medium (3 scoops) but you can't mix flavors. The best part of the ice cream are the toppings, I loved the thick peanut butter brittle. 

TLDR: creamy melty expensive. Skip but if you visit go for mint chocolate chip something different or peanut brittle vanilla for tried and true.
author: Jess C.

description: Terrible service. After 30 minutes of waiting, I checked with them about my order, and apparently, they had given my order to someone else. At least they re-made my ice cream, but I am never going back again. Not worth the time or money.
author: Andrew John D.

description: I feel like I cannot express how good the ice cream is in this review. When I got there, there was no line, and I got Tcho 65% Chocolate Ice Cream with the Tcho sauce, rainbow sprinkles, and a lemony homemade waffle cone. The ice cream was heavenly; chocolaty and creamy. The cone was sweet with the slightest hint of lemon. The sauce was just as great as the ice cream, and the sprinkles were crunchy and sweet. My mom got blood orange ice cream and it was great but surprisingly very sweet. This is my favorite ice cream place in the city.
author: Summer B.

description:
The creamiest of ice creams.  Consider me smitten!

Smitten is the smallest little ice cream parlor with a big difference from other places:  there own custom made ice cream maker that makes the ice cream as fresh as it can possibly be, produce a smooth and satisfying taste.  They don't offer a large variety of flavors, but they cycle flavors frequently and try to offer something for everyone, whether it's a fruity sorbet or a creamy chocolate type.  

Don't take my word for it:  Fall in love with Smitten Ice Cream for yourself.
author: Nadav P.

description: My friend, an ice cream lover, had Smitten Ice Cream made fresh at her wedding! She had 3 flavors - salted caramel, blood orange, and chocolate. Really liked it but definitely on the sweeter side for me.
author: Steph S.

description:
This ice cream stand is literally cool with the liquid nitrogen! However the ice cream is pretty expensive and the wait is about half an hour. People pretty much come here to see how its used and to try made to order ice cream.

I got the TCHO chocolate and it was very rich. I loved the taste, texture, and freshness of it, I wish they gave a little more. Unfortunately it melted pretty quickly, so you have to eat it pretty fast. 

I tried a little of the mint and it was very strong. It tasted like a mojito or a blast of toothpaste. I at least enjoyed the refreshing aftertaste. 

Although the ice cream is fresh, they have limited options and its quite expensive. I do recommend it as an experience though for anyone who has not seen the chemistry of liquid nitrogen!
author: Steven V.

description: Simply the best!!  Better than the other one, Salt and Straw(??) which was more hype than anything else.
author: Chitra J.

description: This ice cream is amazing! I take back what I said about Bi-Rite Creamery being the best ice cream I've ever had. Smitten ice cream is made right in front of you in an automated metal mixer that is pumped full of liquid nitrogen. The process is pretty complex, but the extremely cold temperatures that are created from the liquid nitrogen enable Smitten to deliver a product that's extremely creamy with no ice crystals. Favorite flavor has to be the creme fraiche with caramel and pear. I am definitely impressed, and dare I say, smitten even?
author: Josh S.

description:
First off really cool ice cream shop. Totally open and makeshift feel. As past reviewer stated, there are only 4 choices of ice cream per day which is totally fine cuz that helps narrow down the options. The employees were really cool.  

I got the tcho chocolate. Bf got the corn something with strawberry syrup. They look nice and the machines were definitely enchanting to watch (as if it was a fuming cauldron).  But I was totally disappointed. The first few bites were good/ interesting. The last few bites tasted like idk gelatinous. It left a weird taste in my mouth.  Probably shoulda stuck with a small cup but it was only another dollar to get the big one. 

Idk this place is great for presentation and that's probably it. Ice cream doesn't taste like ice cream. So be warned. Also, they said they would make another ice cream fully guaranteed if you didn't like your flavor but I didn't wanna be that ass hole. But it's always an option...
author: Katie T.

description: I thought their ice cream was pretty darn good!! Made from scratch on the spot and they make the long lines move fast. Their staff was very friendly as well. I had the cookies n cream and it was as good as I've ever had it. Not a lot to select from but they've got enough variety for my liking.
author: Mark S.

description: Got there just as they were opening up I ordered the mascarpone  with strawberry and it was delicious it was wonderful watching the cream turn into ice cream and then how the girls just put it together I would highly recommend after eating in the city take a nice walk over and grab a cone,!  Yum !
author: Lib B.

description:
Always a fan of Smitten. I actually tried the Mountain View one before this one so it wasn't much of a surprise. This one is so SF though--it's located in a quaint little shack in the middle of a sad looking cement park. But it's the same Smitten goodness.

For those unfamiliar--the Smitten model is liquid nitrogen ice cream that is made on the spot for you. Pros of this are because they aren't freezing their ice cream and because it's made with liquid nitrogen, the crystals are smaller and the flavor is richer and creamier than your typical ice cream. I will say that once you enter into the world of gourmet  (if you want to call this gourmet), Safeway ice cream will never taste the same again. 

The con though is the wait time. It's not obnoxiously long, but sometimes if they have a lot of people going and they're making flavors by the batches, you can get unlucky and end up in the last batch which will take some time... so not a huge deal but can be frustrating when you order before all your friends but end up being the last person to actually get the ice cream.

In terms of the ice cream itself at Smitten, I think it's pretty good. The creamy texture is very noticeable, and it's good. The only but is that the ice cream is really sweet. You won't notice it when you first start, but by the end of your ice cream, you'll want to get some water to wash out the sweetness. 

tldr. yay smitten. liquid nitrogen is all the craze these days. ice cream is on the sweeter size. small portion size is good though--actually two scoops!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
If you've never seen the makings of liquid nitrogen ice cream in person, don't fret, because Smitten is here!

The only ice cream parlor in San Francisco that produces ice cream through liquid nitrogen, it's definitely a must try. 

Pros:
-All orders are made to go. Meaning, ice cream is fresh and not frozen before hand.
-Everything is made from scratch that morning. Nothing is left out on the counter or saved from the previous day.
-Local/seasonal ingredients are used so the seasonal flavors change constantly.
-No preservatives or any kind are used. 
-It's cool to watch them make it!
-Super smooth and creamy. Even the syrup toppings is smooth and creamy (and looks frozen). (Nitrogen -- at 321 degrees Fahrenheit -- makes it very smooth).
-Intense flavor. If you are a fan of chocolate or vanilla, you will LOVE their classic vanilla and tcho 60.5% chocolate.
-Line moves faster than Mitchell's. Not as packed either.
-Doesn't melt as fast compared to Mitchell's.
-Small cute park next door. Great place to take your date after ice cream! :)

Cons:
-Only 4 flavor choices per day. (Wish there were more choices... Not much incentive to come here often if you tried all the flavors already!)
-Pricey. $4.75 for a small, $6.00 for a regular. Add an extra $1 for a waffle cone.
-No option for how many scoops you want (waffle cones automatically come in 2 scoops, can't pick 1 or 3).
-Only 2 sizes for cups (small or regular).
-You can't put more than one flavor in a cup/cone (sucks you can't try 2 flavors at once).
-I don't like the waffle cone (too crunchy and sugary).
author: Vicki L.

description:
On a rainy night after dinner we wanted ice cream, my cousins girlfriend recommended this place and said it was better then Mitchells. Had to try it at that point and see if it lived up the hype. 

I love the fat they make the ice cream in front of you, great presentation! There was only two flavors so I was a little shocked at that. I got the cookie dough ice cream sunday with pretzel. I have to say it was good, but i was not blown away. I like that the Ice Cream wasn't really sweet, and the pretzel gave it a different flavor. I was told other locations have more flavors, so maybe I was there at the end of the night when it was all gone. I would like to try it again to see if I can change my mind. Just wasn't blown away.
author: Sean M.

description: I've driven past the location in Mtv View a bunch of times so since I was in the area on a warm day we decided to stop by. The line is long ish we probably waited 15 minutes. The smell strawberry enticed us inside. It was balsamic strawberry and i love unique flavors. It was unqiue but too creamy for my palette. And was expensive.
author: Aria S.

description:
One of SF's local ice cream establishments, this is their first location located in Hayes Valley. There's another location in the Peninsula and two others that *just* opened in the East Bay as of this writing.

As I was going to be in the city for the weekend as the No1DP was in town, I took advantage of this and asked him to take me here to satisfy my dessert craving and I didn't want to limit myself to the touristy areas.

Hayes Valley is located in the non-touristy area of SF. When we went out close to 9pm, there weren't many taxis driving about. If you don't live near the area or unfamiliar with the pubic transportation, you're gonna have to use a Uber/Lyft to get here. At least it's located smack dab in Octavia St.

You know your establishment has made it when you see a line that fills up the store even in the late hours. At least the wait isn't too long; it took about 10 minutes for the No1DP to be able to place orders. He mentions having orders taken by iPad.

There's a chalkboard menu outside and inside that advertises the day's flavors. 4-5 flavors are available each day with one of the flavors being the monthly seasonal flavor. They are known for using local and seasonal ingredients (i.e. TCHO chocolate) and for using liquid nitrogen to make your ice cream to order. Though the cream is stored in jugs, the actual ice cream is made right in front of you in these machines called "Brr..." (which has 3 patents). Additional toppings, syrups and optional handmade cone are available for an additional cost.

Small is $4.75, regular is $6.00. Additional toppings/syrup/cone can easily make your ice cream cost $1-$2 more. The ice cream is at least of a good quality as the ice cream is quite solid and DOES NOT MELT. One of the few rare times I ate ice cream and *still* have clean hands after the fact! Sauces solidified upon pour and also did not drip.

Me: TCHO 60.5% chocolate with spicy caramel. Chocolate was good, but the spicy caramel just added to the ice cream - gives it a noticeable spicy kick. The cone was able to hold the ice cream.

No1DP: Fresh Mint Chip with TCHO Chocolate Sauce. The mint flavor is STRONG, reminiscent of fresh mint leaves in mojitos - good for people that like mint. 

Looking forward to coming back here to try their other regular and seasonal flavors.
author: Isabella B.

description:
I scream, you scream , we all scream for liquid nitrogen Ice creammm!!!!! 

Smitten by smitten. It's inevitable. Sweets and me are mutual. I will eat it when I feel like it,which is really rare. I don't much care for ice cream, cakes, cupcakes, candy, bright shiny candies, ice cream sundaes...The list goes on. I will eat very selective ones on occasions and a handful because I really love it. Like a very tiny artisanal piece of chocolate, that one tasty farm to table ice cream in Pacific North West. Emphasis on quality , hand made and small batch! 

Fast forward to Smitten. Came here on a very busy Saturday night with lines out the door. Of course! What do you expect? Where else can you find ice cream "Made to Order" ?? You just got to appreciate getting that rather fresh taste in less than 5 minutes! The concept is magic. Totally absolutely swoon worthy magic! 

The menu was simple. Few flavors with pairing.
*Classic Vanilla
*TCHO chocolate
*Mint chocolate chip
*Blood orange with pistachio shortbread. 

We ordered small Tcho Chocolate, Mint Chocolate Chip and Blood Orange with shortbread. Let the magic begin! They have two machine. One makes blood orange and the other one makes the rest of the flavor. And Zomg- I'm a kid again. Look at that thing churning out smoke!! Whaaaaa. It's like a fog show!! So funnn. And the people making it were all smiles even though their hands were freezing every time they stop to stir. They even posed for my pictures :) Thanks guys!! 

After a few thousand sheeps ( 5 minutes) later, I got my small Tcho chocolate with double scoops! Yey!! They have benches that you can sit and watch the whole process or take it to go and eat outside.  First bite- swooon!!!  Smitten! Oh so tasty!!! I loved it. Second bite was my friend's blood orange. It was divine!! Followed by mint chocolate chip. Just wow. It;s light and airy. It's fresh and absolutely right. Just wow!

Now the prices maybe a little high compared to your regular joe's ice cream shop where you get 100 scoops for $5 with all you can add craps on top. Or ice cream sundae the size of Texas !!! Those batches been mass produced and sitting in those batches for god knows how long. If you like those kinds of ice cream then, yes. This might be overrated for you. But if you appreciate the concept of "FRESH MADE" , yes no taste testing every flavor in the store for you!! But if you want to taste that made to order personal scoops and watch the coolest process of liquid nitrogen turning those flavors into ice cream right in your hand? Then, yes! This is the place for you.

 It's an old fashion treat with new fashion way of making it. You just got to try it once, twice or if not, every time. If I live in the Bay area, this would be my only choice of place for ice cream! I appreciate the concept, the technique and the flavors. It's all about that freshness. Mmmm definitely smitten I'd say! Definitely! :)
author: Latifa S.

description:
Cutest little ice cream stand I've ever seen! You order one of the flavors they have for the day and they make it fresh right in front if you! 

I tried salted caramel and ordered it with a oatmeal crumble topping. It was delicious! The ice cream is rich yet still light and creamy! 

The service was excellent! Very friendly staff that answered everyone's questions with patience and kindness. We went on a Sunday evening and it was definitely busy but everyone was very efficient. I'll definitely be back.
author: Anum A.

description:
I can't speak for all their flavors, and I believe they rotate their flavors, but the brown sugar was AMAZING! Just the other day I went to Bi-Rite and had their seasonal brown sugar and it was the best I've ever had. Then I came here and I had a new best I ever had lol. This flavor was so good I think it should be made everyday. 

They make it fresh for you with nitrogen, it's really cool and fun. Awesome customer service too. From my experience alone and only trying the brown sugar, I'd recommend this place to anybody as of right now 

My girlfriend got the mint chip, and we didn't like it all. The mint is very very strong, almost taste like MJ... haha. But their service was awesome and they let us swap it out for more brown sugar.
author: Brandon F.

description: WHY DID IT TAKE ME THIS LONG TO TASTE THE AWESOME ICE CREAM HERE?!  So damn good! I got the cookie dough, which i don't like in regular ice cream, but this one is so creamy just the right amount of sweetness! Not to mention, the prices are decent compare to Mr.&Mrs.Mis...
author: Rose P.

description: Didn't care for the pretzel and cookie dough ice cream. Expensive and small portions. The Shire has better desserts than this.. smh
author: Bilbo B.

description:
Was 100% prepared to be smitten by Smitten but unfortunately, was not.

We get there and wait in a short line. A staff member greets us with a coupon for $5 and asks us whether or not we use Paypal. They had some promotion going on where if you paid with Paypal, you'd get basically free ice cream and .25 cents credit since the small size with tax was priced at $4.75. Since we have the Paypal app, it was easy peasy but with the repeated questions and many frequent asks to download Paypal, I can see how one would be deterred from using it and decide to pay cash instead. The communication of this promotion probably could have happened better and more seamlessly IMO.

Anyways, we get to the front of the line and I order the salted caramel kids scoop (this size is not pictured on the menu) and decided to upgrade to a small at the last second in effort to share different flavors with friends. After placing the order and paying with Paypal (free ice cream) I move to the right of the register and watch my ice cream be made.

Friend asked for chocolate ice cream and they said they didn't have any. Womp. He didn't order anything. Two other friends decide to share the vanilla.

Watching my ice cream be made was pretty awesome. I love the concept and think it's pretty cool they make to order. 

Halfway through eating, we see they start making chocolate ice cream for someone else. Friend gets back in line and orders it. Maybe the chocolate fairy came to visit? The chocolate covered rice krispies bumped the flavor profile up this up in my book.

Here's the scoop (yes, I'm punny):
After receiving my ice cream, I was pretty pleased with the texture and how silky the ice cream is. It's firmer than gelato but not as soft as ice cream. The melting point wasn't as quick plus it was cold out.

Salted caramel is deliciously salty but not to the point where you need to gulp down 10 glasses of water from being thirsty.

Vanilla tastes like heavy whipping cream Ick. Friends sent it back.

Chocolate was superrrr chocolatey but not in a rich way, it was almost as if the 65% should be bumped up to 70 or 75% so it wasn't weirdly in between a dark and milk.

Earl Grey with chocolate chips was so good! The crunch from the chocolate chips really compliments the smoothness of the ice cream. Very subtly flavorful.

The waffle cone was freaking delicious! A cross between a shortbread cookie and crumbly sugar cookie. Seriously, I'd come back just for the cone. Part of the cone fell off and fell on the ground. Pigeons swooped in and ate it. Sad!

I'm not sure I'd say it's worth they hype but definitely worth going once and again if you're in the area.
author: Shereen A.

description:
You know that thing when you fall in love, and even though you know that falling in love with someone new doesn't mean you weren't in love the last time, you can't help feeling like you're being disloyal to the last person you loved?

That's how Smitten made me feel. Because in my exhaustive testing of West Coast artisanal ice cream, I've only ever given five stars to one place: Bi-Rite. In fact, every other ice cream has fallen so far short of the Bi-Rite that I suspected there might only be room in my heart (though clearly, not my stomach) for one ice cream store.

Smitten changed all that. Their salted caramel ice cream gives Bi-Rite's a run for its money -- though I think Smitten should really call their flavor Burnt Caramel, because the delicious burnt caramel flavor is stronger than the salt. But the texture! The creaminess!

Smitten made me a believer in the liquid nitrogen method. My one previous experience, in Portland, was underwhelming -- I thought it was a gimmick. But the Smitten texture is really unparalleled.

If I could deduct half a star for the cone, I would: their waffle cones just don't cut it. I'm a great believer in a sugar cone, and I don't like places that deny me that option -- Smitten is cup or waffle cone only and their waffle cones are not good. (I threw mine in the garbage.)  But even though I'm a little reluctant to award five-star status on the strength of one flavor, that one flavor was SO incredibly good that they are getting five-star status until proven otherwise. Seriously delicious.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
I dream of Smitten Ice Cream on a regular basis. I had my first taste  in 2013 and I completely wished that i had tried it years sooner... late into the game but better than never!

Environment - this wonderful place is made of what seems like an old storage crate. The long side opens as an entrance and the far elongated side is the counter. The shop is set up where there's glass that surrounds the counter and you are able to watch the workers make your delicious nitrogen ice cream.

Service - like every server in the Bay, nice people and good service. I think it's because they're always around sweet ice cream here... 

Ice Cream - I don't think you can go wrong with any flavors here; everything always taste super good. My ultimate favorite is the Fresh Mint. I came here with my boyfriend this previous time and I told him to get his own while I got a bigger size for myself.. hehe

I'M WRITING IN CAPS. COME EAT HERE ON A REGULAR BASIS.
IF YOU DONT REALLY LIKE ICE CREAM, JUST EAT IT FOR ME.

i wish i lived in the bay just for Smitten... sigh.
author: Connie V.

description: What a cute little place. If you want some simple, not too sweet, creamy, yummy ice cream -- go here! I love that this ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen! Plus, it's DELICIOUS! I miss the scoop of chocolate ice cream every day. Wish we had one in Chicago!
author: Nimrah T.

description:
Such a cool place! I'm used to just...normal ice cream...and this was so not normal in the best way! I got a small in the Fresh Mint Chip and whaaaaaat. It was so good. Talk about "FRESH MINT." That first bite is such a treat and a surprise. I wish this existed in Chicago!

Now, ice cream aside, the way they make it is something else. We waited about 10 minutes for our ice cream but I didn't mind at all because I got a show waiting for it. You'll have to go there to understand what I'm talking about.

The little courtyard on the side is cute, too.
author: Hayley S.

description:
Is it wrong to like novelty?

I sometimes do.

Came here with a friend who was still hungry after our medicare Japanese dinner.

I remember when this place was just a red wagon being pulled downy the streets of SF.

Long lines. High prices. Cool technique.

So why the 3 stars?

Well, first off....they took forever to get her blood orange ice cream.and kept trying to give her chocolate. The chocolate was meant for another customer who was waiting.

Why are you trying to pawn off the wrong ice cream bro?

Also, the 3 stars is because I'm not really a fan of their flavors. Their chocolate is too bitter for me...their vanilla is too plain for me. I don't like blood orange, and their other seasonal flavors such as mint chocolate chip. I don't like mint chocolate chip.

So yes, it's limiting to me. And since I'm the one who's writing this review, and since they can't get my friend's order right...and it took 15 minutes to get a scoop of ice cream AFTER it's been ordered...3 stars.
author: Jack R.

description: YEEEESSSSS! Anyone that knows me knows that I have an unhealthy obsession with ice cream. The day I came here, the salted caramel was one of the flavors of the day so I decided to try. Seriously the most amazing salted caramel I have ever tasted hands down. My cousin got the chocolate and it was equally as amazing. The ice cream here is so creamy and rich, which is what I look for in a good ice cream. The cool thing about this place is that they make their ice cream in front of you using liquid nitrogen. Pretty cool if you ask me.
author: Jennie T.

description:
Ordered today corn ice cream. It's good quality melty and fatty ice cream. It's remind me old standards of ice creams which were really from real products.
It's a bit pricy but it worth it. There is difference between others ice creams shops. But not 5 stars for Smitten's. The stuff could be more friendly and welcoming.
author: Yana C.

description:
I'm 'smitten' with Smitten. 

My friend and I decided to get some ice creme after a Thai super bowl party. She mentioned Smitten and for about 30min I swiped through Yelp photos with my mouth open. We each ordered the cookie dough with pretzel pieces, mines was accompanied by a waffle cone. Cookie dough is one of my least favorite flavors and so I wasn't expecting anything spectacular...It was more like incredible! It was the perfect combination of sweet and savory. The ice creme has a rich texture and didn't melt very fast at all. The waffle cone was also baked well. Unlike other cones it didn't shatter in my mouth or cut me while trying to eat it.  

I really like the space and could see myself grabbing a portion of ice creme on a warm afternoon. I also like that it's open late and across from the Streetscape Project piece commissioned by San Francisco Arts Commission.
author: Jodie G.

description: Probably one of the best ice cream I've ever had. Home made, very small selection making it easy to choose and that cone tho...perfection.
author: Nnedimma U.

description: Waited in a (shortish) line but they were so insultingly understaffed I walked away after five minutes when the line didn't move at all. Have some respect for your customers who Are willing to Give you their time and $$$ for your high priced goods--and have enough staff/registers to accommodate.
author: alex v.

description: Hands down, best ice cream in the city. If you're visiting SF just go here for ice cream.
author: Ryan G.

description: The first couple times I've had this was pretty underwhelming, but yesterday was something. It was the perfect consistency and the sweetness of the Blue Bottle Expresso was just right.  FYI--toppings aren't mixed in since this isn't Cold Stone.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Making ice cream has become somewhat of an art and science here in SF the last few years, and Smitten is just one of the few places where you can get your fix, freshly made from liquid nitrogen. 

Cool concept, so why only 3 stars?  Lack of variety, on a Saturday night no less.  On the menu was vanilla, chocolate, mint chip, and earl grey.  The line wasn't that long of a wait considering how popular this place usually is, and right before we were about to order, we heard that they ran out of the mint chip.  I was intent on going for the earl grey anyways so it didn't matter much.  

I was so ready for the earl grey, so we order...only to be told that the guy who makes it went on a break...and they only had vanilla or chocolate.  WAIT WHAT?!?  It was already 10 pm...and they closed at 10:30, so I didn't quite understand why not everyone knows how to make each flavor.  Maybe it's the business side of me that believes that certain departments should be cross trained...so in the end, I reluctantly had to settle for the chocolate.  Definitely on the creamy and rich side, but mix it up with vanilla and you have the perfect counterpart.  A small cup is more than enough even though it doesn't look like much, but I was sooo looking forward to the earl grey!  Blah...
author: Kevin C.

description: I just wanted to say that we came to get ice cream on the first really hot day in SF this spring. The sign and yelp both show the place to be open from noon to 10 pm, but they weren't open. When I mentioned that, the young lady behind the counter couldn't explain why they were still closed 5 1/2 hours after opening time. Guess we missed out on some really good ice cream.
author: Raymond W.

description:
The gimmick here is the fact that you can see it being made just for you using liquid nitrogen. Other than that, it's ice cream. It's fun and it's good quality, but my favorite will always be Humphry Slocombe! I'm only somewhat smitten with Smitten.

However, if you're in Hayes Valley and you've never been here, go. Definitely go.

They make their waffle cones fresh, so be sure to snag one of those! I tried the Cookie Dough, which had chocolate chips and pretzel bits in it! It was definitely a fun change-up. The service is super nice, as well! Just... After Smitten... Go to Humphry Slocome, too.
author: Gabriela K.

description:
Great flavors! A little expensive but then it's bang in the heart of Hayes Valley so that is acceptable, I guess.
I love watching them make the ice cream so don't miss the show while you ponder over some meaningless social media post. Or better yet, Snapchat it :P
Love the place around where one can simply wander, just you and your ice cream scoop. True love!
author: Shruti D.

description:
Talk about the future of ice cream...no, not Dip n Dots ;-p I'm talking about ice cream made with dry ice! My friend, introduced me to this small, hip, trendy ice cream shop and I'm glad she did.

A group of 4 of us went on a Friday night and sure enough there was a line out the door,  we waited about 15 minutes since the line moved fast, but actually getting our orders took awhile since it's made to order and there was a
big group of girls that were ahead of us...boo

We ordered Crème Fraîche with Pear Caramel (Seasonal)- Creamy, rich, sweet, and you definitely get the fresh pear flavor
Fresh Mint Chip - Warning if you're not too keen on mint get another flavor. However, I love mint and with the TCHO chocolate chips mixed in, it's the perfect combo.

I was skeptical thinking the ice cream would be more of an icy texture than smooth, but I was proven so wrong. It was one of the the smoothest and creamiest ice creams I've had! And why wouldn't it be since they use all organic ingredients including honey nectarine! 

As other reviewers have mentioned, because all ingredients are organic the ice cream does melt faster, but no worries you'll be done with it before that even happens  :-)

Must get it on their waffle cone...adds another level of texture.

My favorite part before devouring the ice cream is watching how they make it! The "Brrrr" machine is just genius!
author: D.J. K.

description: We wanted to try the place because of the liquid nitrogen that they use to make ice cream. Not only were we not disappointed, the creamy smooth texture of just-made ice cream is to die for. Oh, and the chocolate flavor was amazing. We will be back!
author: Allie S.

description:
Today's flavors of the day: TCHO 60% chocolate, Salted Caramel, Sweet Corn and berry, and Blue Bottle Espresso. 

I got to try all of them and the flavors were definitely delicious. Surprisingly, I liked the sweet corn and berry the most. It was subtle with the corn flavor. It reminded me slightly of buttered corn on the cob without the taste of butter, more like the creaminess of it. The berry sauce added tang to really contrast it. 

I actually didn't order this flavor, but I had a few bites from a friend. I purchased a small cup of the TCHO 60% chocolate. It was good, but it really tasted like chocolate milk. I personally don't like milk but I think that's Smitten's signature, the fact that you can taste all the ingredients. Of course milk is an ingredient, but I'm just not a fan. 

I also want to critique their way of serving the ice cream. Apparently I missed my name being called, which is weird to me because my entire group of friends didn't notice. Of course we were talking, but I'm sure that the workers can kind of tell where general orders are due to sequence of payment. 

I like the idea of LN^2 freezing my ice cream on the spot, it's very entertaining to watch. The concept is so that there are smaller ice particles in the ice cream. This is very true, but it was something that I personally did not like. It was very smooth, but also very melty. I'm the type of person to like my ice cream really hard. I think it's super fun and cute and I love to support local businesses and will bring my friends. But it's not a personal favorite. 

Oh it's also fairly pricey. $5 for a single scoop :(
author: Tina Y.

description:
First time here and happy that they also have Vegan Popsicles. The chocolate vegan Popsicle is necessary if you love rich dark chocolate, like me :)

My boos had the blood orange ice cream, which was delicious and creamy with nutty pistachio cookies that were little morsels of flavor explosions (Their words). They also had the earl grey ice cream which was true to the tea flavor but also rich, creamy, delicious and a nice crunch from the milk chocolate chips. 

Yum!
author: Isidro M.

description:
Dang, this ice cream is expensive...but it's also deliciously smooth with seasonal flavors. Don't miss the EARL GREY ice cream with tcho chocolate chips around March! 
Sweet corn ice cream is another highlight around August. The classics of tcho chocolate and sea salt caramel are always good picks.

If you'll be ordering three or more servings, of the same flavor, just order a pint for $11 and save yourself a bit of cash. It also makes more sense to buy a regular than a small, but if you're trying to be responsible, then all my respect to you for getting a small. 

Just went in June and got the seasonal olive oil + lavender and shortbread. They drizzle olive oil over the ice cream, so you'd definitely have to like the olive oil flavor to like this ice cream. The lavender was quite light, and the shortbread added a nice texture contrast to the otherwise silky smooth ice cream.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Came to Smitten Ice Cream (San Francisco) back in May 2015.  I was invited by a friend because I've never been here. 

The ice cream is absolutely amazing!  They make it right there and then and is the creamiest ice cream I have ever had.

I would give it 5 stars except that it doesn't have any seating, so it's grab and go.  However, there is a park just outside where you can hangout and relax.  Great atmosphere in the area.
author: Steve B.

description: One of the best I ever had. Great choice for the summer. I would for sure recommend. The cookie dough flavour is amazing. A bit expensive, but it worth the price (:
author: Rafael M.

description:
It's hard for me to describe the freshness of ingredients in ice cream. 

I ordered the creme fraiche with pear caramel sauce and it was one of the richest most magical ice creams I have ever had. The ice cream itself was of a perfect consistency, soft but not melty, firm enough to hold it's shape as I scooped pieces off. Perfection. The cone was probably the best ice cream cone I have had. Maybe a tie with Ici's cones in Berkeley. 

The flavor of the ice cream was so unique, so much depth of flavor that I would easily have gone back for seconds had there not been a tremendously long line (it was 85 degrees on a Sunday in San Francisco, AKA errbody wants that ice cream).

Smitten is a unique ice cream experience in that this location, the surrounding area, and the general set up are very San Francisco-esque. The overall flavors that are available are delicious and unique. Definitely worth repeat business to taste their selection.
author: Karma B.

description: I have had smitten a few times, and today was the first time that I had their earl gray ice cream with chocolate bits. I really think the ice cream would have tasted better without the chocolate bits. Smitten's ice cream is pretty creamy, but I prefer Humphrey's earl gray ice cream. Their small is actually two scoops, and it is good size portion for one person.
author: Shu T.

description:
I love the concept of Smitten Ice Cream. Ice cream made with liquid nitrogen and fresh ingredients to order. They usually only have 4 flavors, 2 are seasonal and the other 2 are the classic vanilla and tcho chocolate. I always go with the seasonal flavors. So far I've tried their white balsamic vinaigrette with strawberry (my fave so far, not too sweet with fresh strawberry flavor and the balsamic had a little tang to it and complimented well with the strawberry), mint chip (fresh spearmint used, definitely not your typical mint choc chip ice cream, it tasted almost like eating gum flavored ice cream. I don't think I would get this again but it was interesting to try), and nectarine (very flavorful and not too sweet). I've tried their tcho choc too, it's not too sweet, which I like. I usually stay away from choco due to the fact it's usually too sweet for me to handle.

They use fresh ingredients so they're ice cream has loads flavor to them. Sometimes it can be quite strong. It often surprises me because it's not what I'm expecting, in a good way.

Unfortunately, you can't sample (or not to my knowledge). It is a bit on the pricier end for ice cream too.

But I like that they keep their menu pretty simple, I mean there's only 4 flavors to choose from, but you can get more creative with their selection of toppings. I stay away from the toppings just cause they all sound so sweet. For an indecisive person like me, to only to have to choose between 4 flavors makes my life easier.

Their waffle cones are delicious too!

Smitten is located in Hayes Valley, so if you know Hayes Valley, parking can be quite the pain in the a**. But Hayes Valley is a very nice area with a lot of brunch places and boutiques. Great place to spend your Sundays especially with good weather.

Smitten is very popular so expect a line. They do their best to keep the line moving, which I think they do a great job with. The workers are friendly, but their busy so don't be surprised if you feel rushed to order or if you don't get much attention from them.

They take cash and card. I've tried to pay with paypal once because their was a discount of $5 off. But Paypal wasn't working for them that day :(. They said Paypal isn't one of their main methods of payment. Don't understand why they would sign up for it the.

Despite the Paypal mishap, I never mind the wait for my ice cream cause they've sure got me smitten!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Ice cream: 4, I got the creme friache with honey and chocolate, it was yummy. A little plain. 

Service: 5, people were super friendly
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Fan...tas....tic!!  Could have done without the political signage as you entered the store!!! We were there for ice cream, not politics. It basically was letting the public know they would take money from anyone.
author: ShuShu M.

description:
I came here on a Sunday afternoon with some of my friends after lunch. There was no line and we were able to order immediately. They have a limited number of flavours each day, and the day that I went they had vanilla, tcho chocolate, mint chocolate chip, and creme fraiche. 

I shared a small size creme fraiche ice cream drizzled with pear caramel on top with my friend, which cost $5. You can watch the ice cream being made in front of you with liquid nitrogen, which is pretty cool. The ice cream itself is very creamy and rich (I think that's just the texture that results when using this method to make ice cream). The ice cream is so rich that it's kind of hard to finish even a small size ice cream by yourself (I had trouble finishing it with my friend).

I have also previously tried the tcho chocolate ice cream, which was REALLY rich. My friend and I both tried our best to finish it...but we just couldn't...
author: Theresa L.

description: After hearing rave reviews about this place, I was slightly disappointed. I came here after work with a friend and found that half of the hype was the production of the ice cream (via liquid nitrogen). I got the corn with berries which was fine but I didn't find it particularly special. The berries didn't add any bite to the flavor. The texture was smooth but felt slightly on the runnier side. I think this place had a cute vibe overall but I think that it's a little overrated especially given the price.
author: Helen F.

description: Amazing ice cream made with liquid nitrogen! I always get the chocolate with the cookie dough pieces in a fresh waffle cone. Hands down my favorite ice cream in San Francisco.
author: Becky J.

description: If you read my review on another Liquid Nitrogen ice creamery, you would be afraid of the prospect of this mad science in any dessert. However, Smittens has the tools and the simplicity to make your mouth water.  Each order is hand crafted by their workers in a special blender. While most of these types of ice cream restaurants use a typical stand mixer, this ice creamery has a special attachment to ensure the ice crystals in the cream are as small as possible. This provides a clean smooth cream for which to consume. In addition all of their ingredients are organic and their favors are limited to four. While this is small, each flavor is thought out well to pair with their choices of topping.  The park nearby provides a perfect view and place for consuming the dessert. A must try for all ice cream lovers.
author: Joel Christian A.

description:
WOW! They even have their patented explanation of how they make the ice cream! 

I loved Smitten. Great flavors to choose from, made right in front of you, and it tastes delicious. It's the perfect amount of frozen and creamy, and I enjoyed my ice cream thoroughly!

Flavors change, so try to try them all!
author: Danae K.

description: I got the cookie dough ice cream here and it was fine, but it didn't have much flavor. It seemed like the cookie dough and the mix-ins just blended into a very bland ice cream. The brown butter caramel sauce on top was delicious though.
author: Ryan L.

description: I thought their ice cream was okay. They only offer four flavors for the day. When I came here with my boyfriend they had TCHO Chocolate, Salted Carmel, Cookie Dough, and Lemon Gingersnap. They have three sizes you can choose from small, regular, and pint. We got their salted caramel (regular size) and shared. I thought the concept was cool using liquid nitrogen to make the ice cream, only took them a few minutes to make. But I think the ice cream is too pricey for a small amount they give. For a regular, they only give you three tiny scoops. Good thing we didn't order their small, I would've eatten it in one bite, poof gone. The ice cream was not bad, it was creamy and had a strong caramel flavor, but not worth $6 plus tax, in my opinion. You can also add additional toppings for extra charge 75 cents. This is not a bad place to try out, and there are cute benches around the area where you can sit and enjoy your ice cream in the sun.
author: Noel K.

description:
This place is quite good .

-what's good here is that you can really order anything you want on top of your ice cream which is nice and their machines are patented so you're not going to get this flavor elsewhere. Also the chunks and pieces on the ice cream are measured just right 

- Only thing I don't like about this place is that there isn't more seating but that's okay !
author: Anonymous ?.

description: When we came in today, the ice cream wasn't even made fresh despite there being no line. All the ingredients had been sitting and it was just re-frozen to harden it up. Mine was ready in about 15 seconds, usually it takes at least 30 if they start fresh. There were ice crystals, so it wasn't smooth like usual. Not worth the $5.50 price tag any more. As they have expanded, the quality has gone downhill. The Hayes location used to be the last good one but even this is seeing a decline. SUCH a sad day :(
author: Cara R.

description:
I dunno.  I'm a Mitchell's girl I guess.  I just don't get the Co2 hype.  Like, it's still ice cream ya know?  It don't have to be that fancy... It's good, but for the price it just doesn't do it for me.  

Sorry.
author: Olivia D.

description:
It was worth it for us to come on a chilly night since we didn't wait very long to order or get our ice cream. Plus there was space to sit on the benches right in front of the machines so that we could watch the ice cream production in awe. I ordered the maple brown sugar squash ice cream with whipped cream which tasted just like pumpkin pie but very delicious pumpkin pie. And just do it, add the whipped cream! I also tried salted caramel ice cream with TCHO chocolate sauce. The TCHO chocolate sauce was chocolate heaven but the salted caramel wasn't salty enough and tasted like just caramel ice cream. 

I love that Smitten uses local ingredients and that they work with local SF businesses like TCHO. It's also pretty unique that the ice cream is made fresh in their machines with liquid nitro that is supposed to make the ice cream very smooth. However, while I think the ice cream is good, it wasn't as smooth as I expected.
author: Maya S.

description:
It would be impossible to narrow down awesome and often unique flavors of ice cream in SF, but Smitten got it right. 

The whole concept of nitrogen liquid is innovative but I wasn't intrigued due to working with it as an undergraduate research. Nonetheless, their ice cream is worth the wait. 

Crème fraîche with pear caramel on a waffle cone was divine. The nuttiness and subtle tang you get from the cream was out of this world. Let me tell you, what won me over was the waffle cone. The waffle cone take this to places that regular stuff just can't get. I hope you give this waffle cone a try soon.

The simple things in life.
author: Owie N.

description: Came here late at night to get dessert after dinner. I was impressed with the ice cream flavors that they offered. They make their ice cream on the spot and use liquid nitrogen to make it. I had the Earl Gray with chocolate chips and I loved it. One thing I really liked was that you could really taste the fragrant tea flavor and they had a good proportion of chocolate chips as well in the ice cream. I would come back here the next time I am in the area.
