Another thing that I liked was that since they were closing, the employees gave us a free cup of extra ice cream left over from another order, which was very nice.
author: Lynn T.

description: Ask yourself this: Is the price really worth it? This is not a rhetorical question. The method to produce this ice cream creates a unique texture that is thicker and the flavors are a good balance between sweetness and creaminess. One scoop certainly packs a punch. In my own mere opinion, however, it is not worth the price.
author: Shounak C.

description: Absolute favorite place for ice cream! Love the new flavors opt for those when you go instead of the standard chocolate and vanilla
author: Quynh-Chi T.

description:
This place is amazing!!!!

First off, let me just say that the employees are so great! They were all really nice and patient even though they were working super fast to get everyone what they wanted. On top of that, when I got my ice cream, I dropped half on the floor! :(( I admit I'm a huge clutz. They saw that and immediately remade my ice cream, what sweethearts! I didn't even ask or tell them!! For great customers service, I'll always be back. 

But that's not the only reason. 

Their ice cream is AMAZING! I think they make it a certain way... But it is soooo creamy and sweet and rich and just delectable! I couldn't get enough. It's great they not only have ice cream they have a lot of add ons and even TCHO chocolate! In ice cream sauce and nibs!

Even though it's a little pricey, good ice cream is worth it. Great service is worth it and Smitten is worth it!
author: Elysia M.

description:
Love this place and the originality! 

Basically, we're paying for the amazing flavor and entertainment as they make the ice cream right in front of your face! 

The only negative about this place is that it's located in a popular location. We couldn't find parking anywhere!!! Not to mention that the lots all around it have been empty for a year now! They should think about converting those into 15 min parking spots, or pick-up only.
author: Karen B.

description:
Fun little ice cream place/stand not far from Alamo Square! We went here somewhat late on a Friday night, and were not disappointed. 

Upon arrival, it was clear that there was a pretty long line. However, the line did move pretty fast surprisingly, so don't let that deter you when you see it.

Parking is a little sparse around the area, but not overly difficult. 

The menu had four main flavors (Salted Caramel, Tcho Chocolate, Sweet Corn with Berries, and Classic Vanilla). We chose Salted Caramel and Sweet Corn with Berries with the recommended pairings. Yes, it is a little pricey ($5 for a small cup), but the service was friendly and fast, and it was entertaining to watch them make the ice cream with the liquid nitrogen. The ice cream itself was pretty tasty. I found myself liking the Sweet Corn with Berries the most. Really reminded me of creamed corn. Such an interesting take on ice cream. 

Inside the stand it was pretty packed with everyone eating and waiting for their order. There is a bench to sit on inside, but no tables. If you feel too cramped inside, there's a small grass field across from the stand with a giant piece of artwork (can't remember what the piece or area was called) that has benches around it you can sit on. 

Overall, fun little ice cream stand to check out, especially if you are in the area. If you like corn, definitely give the Sweet Corn with Berries a shot!
author: Marc H.

description:
"We don't let you sample the ice cream
We don't let you split your portion between two flavors
We don't have cones 
We don't accept AMEX"

Overrated, way too sweet, and annoying attitude.
author: Eric K.

description: Cookie dough ice cream. You had me at "Hello"!  The creaminess and the flavor were both top-notched.  The service was fast.  Highly recommended.
author: Wing W.

description:
An ice cream shop that makes your ice cream right in front of your eyes? It was as cool to watch as it sounds. 

There's 4 flavors to choose from and the recommended topping if you wish to add those on. We decided to try the sweet corn with berries and the TCHO chocolate. Both were recommendations from the worker and they both tasted amazing. The sweet corn was a unique flavor that I've never anywhere else but it was delicious. The TCHO chocolate was rich but not too sweet or bitter like other chocolates I've tried. 

Once you pick your flavor, they pour the mixture into a mixer and use liquid nitrogen to change the liquid into an ice cream. If they still have the sweet corn, I would definitely recommend trying that flavor since it's limited edition and so unique.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Smittens is as good as it gets. This is the guiltiest, most sinful pleasure and is just completely irresistible. Literally anytime I am even remotely near Hayes Valley I start daydreaming about whether or not I can justify a quick stop over here.

I have never had ice cream better than this and I'm not sure that I ever will. They make the ice cream on the spot with liquid nitrogen. The normal flavors are all perfectly executed, especially the salted caramel. What really will have your mouth watering though is the special flavor which they change every month. It is always something unique and interesting with some added twist. For example, last month the nectarine flavor had perfectly crystallized pieces of nectarine mixed in, and this month the sweet corn flavor is topped with a complementing berry glaze on top and bottom. Add on to this the fantastic toppings, my favorite of which is the cinnamon shortbread, although the popular favorite are the delicious tcho crispies.

The setting is great as well as it is located in a converted shipping container in the heart of Hayes Valley on Octavia. This provides a great scenic spot to relax and enjoy the best ice cream that exists. Why are you still reading this? Stop looking at yelp and go get some Smittens right now.
author: Mark O.

description:
Okay, all I gotta say. Tcho chocolate ice cream is delicious. Still wish they did mixed flavors. I would totally mix chocolate and vanilla...or chocolate and salted caramel. 

YUM!
author: Nina Y.

description:
I have to say I was a little skeptical about how good some ice cream could be, but dang! I was SMITTEN. See what I did there? Yeah? No? Ok, I'll stop.

Anyway, first off I will say, it might be better to stick to just the ice cream instead of adding a bunch of stuff to it. I tried the basic Mint Chip Ice cream. It was really creamy, and actually tasted of real mint. Not the artificial mint you normally would get. That was a pleasant surprise to me. Now- I have a weird thing about chips in my ice cream. I don't like them super chunky because they get stuck in your teeth- this was nice. These chips kinda just melted in your mouth. My friend got a root beer which was also tasty! It came with a bottle of root beer on the side.  
With all that being said, the ice cream flavors change daily, and the ice cream is made fresh.  Every one was nice and we got our ice cream pretty fast! Impressed!
author: Tida C.

description:
I dropped by after I was (luckily!) able to score a parking spot directly adjacent to Linden on an unseasonably beautiful day in the city. I go, girl.

I was actually after Blue Bottle Coffee, and just happened to notice quite the crowd gathered in front of this ice cream stand. When I saw that it was Smitten, I got my ass in that line right quick. 

I made it to the front pretty quickly. I really wanted the mint chocolate chip, but I opted for the creme fraiche with pear caramel instead, because I knew I'd regret not ordering that. 

I tried to order a pint so I could hoard it for later, but they were too busy. I didn't know that they made the ice cream while you wait--major wow factor. 

A fairly small scoop costs $5.25, but I must say I was pleased with the size. An enormous serving of anything is kind of a turn off. The ice cream was delicious, creamy, and exactly what you would want this flavor to taste like. Nailed it.

Their staff is incredibly nice - always love that. Smitten lives up to its reputation. You have to try it!
author: Sunny S.

description:
Super tasty and unique flavor: sweet corn with berries (comes w berry drizzle syrup).  Very good and would def come back. Also if you pay with paypal you get $5 off your purchase!

Finished the 1st one and went back again to try the chocolate flavor. It is super chocolatey and a little too sweet.  The sweet corn and berries is def tastier.
author: Christine T.

description: Liquid nitrogen ice cream? Definitely something to try! I tried the flavor Fresh Mint in a waffle bowl and decided to get the topping recommendations with it, which were chocolate syrup and chocolate crisps. BOMB! It's not the typical mint chocolate chip that I'm used to from other creameries... It's straight up mint, like from your mint mojito! I'd definitely love to come back here and try the other flavors.
author: Kara M.

description:
I LOVE smitten! By far my favorite icecream place and go to. Their chocolate flavor is my ultimate favorite. It's so creamy!!! And it's fresh and organic. The customer service is really nice. I've been to the Oakland location as well and they give mini tours so that's cool. 

When smitten is near I always try and go. My favorite icecream place and I'd recommend going to all my friends and family.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Not sure if I went to this one or another one close by. Anyways, the ice cream was delicious and very creamy. I got a regular  strawberry white balsamic in a waffle cone. Service was decent given that there was a pretty long line. I appreciated the interesting array of flavors and I like that you can watch them as they make the ice cream in front of you. That being said, prices are pretty expensive. 11 dollars for a pint is crazy, but it is very fresh.
author: Jane H.

description: Omg this ice cream shop is the cutest!!!! I definitely had a good experience coming in here. i ordered cookie dough ice cream with pretzels and chocolate chip. I can honestly say it was one of the best ice cream I've had. it looks like a small portion but that portion is enough to make you feel satisfied. will be coming back to try more flavors!
author: Ana C.

description:
Just ok for a $5 small ice cream scoop. I got the cookie dough and pretzel. The texture was not as smooth and creamy as I would have expected. The process of making the ice cream is gimmicky but not worth it. Another example of SF hipster foodie-ism hype.

Not worth another visit.
author: Spoon G.

description:
I love what they're doing here. I'm all about the well-made, artisan ice cream. I like the kitsch of watching your ice cream emerge from behind the smoky, liquid nitrogen clouds. I feel like I'm supporting something real. I feel like I'm eating something real!

Unfortunately, this just isn't my favorite type of ice cream. I know they name the flavors with exciting names, but you're working with your straight-up basics: vanilla, Tcho chocolate (chocolate), white strawberry balsamic (strawberry) and blue bottle coffee (um, coffee). I haven't been able to catch the mint or the caramel, but neither of those sound earth shattering either. 

Ok fine, you stick to the basics. That can be a good thing if you knock them out of the park. (My favorite cupcake is chocolate with vanilla icing, after all.) However, I found the ice cream to be just... good?  I liked it. The texture was nice. But memorable, it was not. I guess I'm a little let down after all the hype and the higher-end price tag. If I was in the area, I might get it again. 

The most exciting thing Smitten had to offer me was the spicy caramel sauce. Now that, I can get down with!  It's made with a few kinds of chile peppers and it's actually spicy. Stand-out, memorable, and well-done. I was bummed they were out of fresh whipped cream, because I bet that would have been good too.
author: Catie F.

description:
Before you read my review for Smitten, you should know that I'm a Doubting Thomas when it comes to novelty ice cream shops. I was undaunted at Bi-Rite, unimpressed with MarcoPolo and disgusted by Ici's. But Smitten. I am head over heels for Smitten.

I walked into the trendy atmosphere of Smitten like an arrogant fellow, convinced that these 'novelty flavors' was just another hipster scam to charge a premium. So I played it safe and got a Munchkin (the smallest size available) Mint Choco Chip flavor with the chocolate sauce added. The ice cream was legitly made to order, which was pretty cool. And within minutes, I got my small scoop of mint chocolate chip drenched in chocolate sauce. I took a bite.

A Pidgeotto flew into my conscience and used Gust.....#MINDBLOWN

If you ever had Philz Coffee, I'm here to tell you now that Smitten's Mint Choco flavor is basically Philz Coffee Ice Cream. No lie. I felt like I was savoring ice cold bites of the Mint Mojito. Mmmmmm it was so good. Obviously, the Munchkin didn't last. I had to go right back in and order their Regular (it's 3 scoops! Not for the weak!)

Smitten is the real deal. I don't know if I can bring myself to try their other flavors, but the Mint Choco definitely converted me to a believer.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Date: Mon, Aug 19, 2013

Flavors:
Classic vanilla: organic milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, egg yolk
Salted caramel: organic milk, cream, sugar, butter, salt
Tcho 60.5% chocolate: organic milk, cream, sugar, tcho chocolate,  vanilla extract,  valrhona cocoa powder, salt, egg yolk
Brown sugar w/cinnamon shortbread: organic milk, cream, brown sugar, salt

Small (4oz): $4.75

I got the small Brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread. Yum! I wasn't sure if I would like it since they listed salt as an ingredient. I was afraid it would be like salted caramel, but the salt actually balanced the sweetness and richness of the ice cream. And the pieces of the shortbread gave it a nice texture. I will definitely be back to try some more flavors.
author: Elena N.

description:
I love smitten ice cream! so fresh and tastes great. This particular location is nice because there is plenty of places outside to eat.
The one flaw is that the heavy cream (or something) made me have a bad stomach ache. 
I will probably still try it again and risk the pain. Very worth it
author: Nikita D.

description: Love that this place makes your ice cream to order, and that you can watch it churning! It's so velvety smooth and creamy, like ice cream should be. I got the mint chip once and thought the mint was overbearing, but I love the TCHO chocolate and salted caramel. I also enjoy that the inside has heating lamps and a bench to let you enjoy it while you read the history of Smitten's ice cream machine. Unfortunately I think it's way too expensive for what it is, but maybe that's for the better because I would be too tempted to get a scoop. I usually save Smitten for a late night treat when a friend comes to town, since it's a great experience for first-timers.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Very Unique Ice Cream 

It's short and simple, well not the lines lol. 
Delicious ice cream guys! Must try! 
They use liquid nitrogen to make the ice cream on the spot and the flavors have an unique flavor. Something you def can't get at a store. They only have about 4 Flavors at a time. The classic chocolate or vanilla flavor and then 2 others. Ice cream is kinda pricey and you should def get 2 scoops since you're already there. The toppings are a must but pricey as well. 

Parking here sucks, it's near a beautiful park tho. If you're using google maps it may cross you up so just pay attention to your surroundings. Make sure to take your best homies with you or maybe a someone your on a date with. You'll look like a boss
author: Arron E.

description:
I love that they use liquid nitrogen to make their ice cream , it means everything is natural & made it to right then & it was fresh . The concept is cute & they uses organic milk . They were also in a little cart , quite a line . They opened it in a good location . As much as I love organic ingredients , the ice cream was a bit too sweet for my taste @ first I thought it was because I got chocolate but then I also tried my friends vanilla flavor. 

-besides the sweetness , thumbs up for the creative for fresh ice cream. 
-it is a bit pricey compare to other ice cream shop, but it's worth looking at them making the ice cream in front of you .
author: Sandy L.

description: Super delicious. Had the cookies and cream. Great portions. Great location. Definitely recommend this place
author: Louis M.

description: I think I had really high expectations from this place because of what I heard from people. I ended up trying this place because it was right next to Biergarten (which my friend and I were waiting for to open). I tried the blue bottle coffee ice cream. The coffee flavor was strong but not overpowering. I think my disappointment came from the texture of the ice cream. I literally got the ice cream and 30 seconds later it was already melting fast. It was really soft and a bit too creamy for my taste.
author: Erville V.

description:
Gwahhhhh magic ice cream.

Buttery smooth. It's like they've somehow taken chocolate (or whatever flavor) and made it a consistency something like a warm candy bar plus cold butter, solid but soft, and all perfectly frozen.
author: Ryan B.

description:
What's not to love? 

The flavors, service, presentation, experience and texture are PERFECT!
author: Charlie B.

description:
Uh oh. I'm going to get dirty looks because I didn't think this place was all that great. Sorry! 

I love the fact that they use fresh ingredients and that their menus change. We got toffee, mint, vanilla and chocolate (so all the flavors available that day) and nothing stood out to me. They were rich and creamy and it's cool that it's made on the spot. However, I've been to places that already do that (Ice Cream Lab in LA) and I liked theirs better.

Don't get me wrong, it was good! But it wasn't a place I HAD to go to if I'm visiting Norcal.
author: Kristine K.

description: Had the Cookie Dough ice cream and was not expecting it to be made on the spot. This is one of a kind ice cream and if you love sweets like me, Wouk will love this place. A great story behind their company and great tasting ice cream.
author: M H.

description:
Fun! 

Having Co2 ice cream made right in front of your eyes is such a unique experience. Add the chill park across the street and this is a perfect date night destination.  

Yeah, our 3 small ice creams were a little pricey @ $14 but the novelty was well worth it. 

We ordered all 3 of their daily flavors; classic vanilla, salted caramel, and the olive oil w/ lavendar shortbread. The creamy olive oil ice cream plays with your mind! They should serve it with some focaccia!  

If you like molecular gastronomy, this is your place.
author: Earl G.

description:
Yes, the lines are long. Yes, they run out of flavors right about the time you order. Yes, it's insane to have ice cream on a cool SF evening.

But I'm sure you are reading this while you are waiting in line, choosing an alternate flavor in case they run out of your original choice, on a cool rainy SF day.

This is our go-to place for dessert, as with 10 other people in front of me.  Smitten serves good ice cream, made fresh in front of you, with flavors changing depending on what's in season.

Always on the menu (for good reason!):
TCHO 60.5% chocolate  
Classic Vanilla  

Fave seasonal/occasional flavors:
Salted Caramel
Sticky Toffee Pudding
Blood Orange with Pistachio Shortbread
Earl Grey
Strawberry Balsamic

Docking a star off because it does get a little frantic here, with servers messing up orders. Although I probably would be after serving hundreds of people non-stop all day long!
author: Dawne L.

description:
ON TODAY'S SHOW, BILL NYE THE SCIENCE GUY MADE ICE CREAM! YES! 
Hahah It's how I imagined this place would be like upon hearing about liquid nitrogen made ice cream. A chemical lab in the back with crazy sparks flying everywhere! Unfortunately, it wasnt as extreme as I had imagined it to be, but it was still pretty neat.

Came here three weeks ago, and I ended up going here three times in one week! (people asked me to take them here so i just went too... i do not have a problem!)

Everyone always ask me, "Does it taste different than normal ice cream?" Well it's obviously more fresh than the packaged ice creams you find at stores. And... you get to see it made from scratch in front of you! I felt a bit cooler being able to say I came here before! 

Olive Oil with Lavender Shortbread: 1 star. ACK..... i HATED the flavor. It tasted like petals drowned in oil in my mouth. It was my first time and I decided to take a big leap and try their seasonal flavor. never again. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/smitten-san-francisco?select=CCb-RGvD39cMKd0bV97MPQ#lIonzTHJAdSYpU4vd9joQw
Salted Caramel: 4 stars. Luckily, I got to try my friend's ice cream and extremely liked it enough to come back 2 more times to try it myself. It is a very very rich flavor, but I liked it a lot, and I usually hate salted caramel. It was extremely creamy! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/smitten-san-francisco?select=CCb-RGvD39cMKd0bV97MPQ#CCb-RGvD39cMKd0bV97MPQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/smitten-san-francisco?select=CCb-RGvD39cMKd0bV97MPQ#h2u54LvknxDEuQQfkdQ9sg

 4 oz small $4.75 no toppings in a cup
6 oz medium $6 no toppings in a cup 
they also have a large which I paid no attention to, and cones cost a bit more
Toppings count a couple cents extra, depending on what you get

they usually have 3 flavors every day, two flavors are basics and one flavor is their seasonal Flavor of the Month

Lines look long, but it usually takes about 10 minutes!

It's a bit pricey and over hyped but an interesting thing to try once in a while.
author: Chena N.

description:
Amazing ice cream; made with liquid nitrogen :)
Pretty pricey but I guess it's worth it occasionally.
author: A V.

description:
I was a bit skeptical to try Smitten...it felt like I was walking into a glorified dippin' dot factory after I heard about their magical Kelvin machine + liquid nitrogen. 

Overpriced? Overhyped? Not really.

$4.75 for a small, which is actually 2 small scoops, is not bad at all considering what kind of made-to-order heaven you're in for. The ice cream is smooth and creamy, not icy and uneven in texture like I was expecting. It kind of looks like your ice cream is being mixed in a fancy kitchen aid. Takes maybe 5 minutes for them to make, but the anticipation just makes your first bite that much sweeter. 

Honey nectarine is amazing! It's seasonal, but if you come across it, get it! You taste the mild sweetness from the honey and the tang of the juicy nectarine. I think what got me hyped for this flavor initially was the spotting of 4 little red nectarines chilling on a cutting board that I saw  through the back door. Yup - the ingredients are that fresh!

Smitten looks like a permanent outdoor food stand. Breezy and super hipster. There are a few benches to sit on, but I usually opt to sit at the mini park across the street; bench-equipped and kid-friendly.

The only downsides to this place are the slightly higher prices, the limited flavors (4 per day), and the open nature of their storefront (not cold weather/rainy day friendly). Other than that, their ice cream is delicious and completely worth a try if you're not already a fan!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
5/28; first time trying Smitten 
I bought a regular ($5) "strawberry white balsamic" ice cream which means two scoops of this delicious (May) seasonal flavor!!!
In my first bite I was able to taste the freshly made nitrogen ice cream. It was creamy and yogurty ^^* 
Makes me wonder what the other flavors taste like and I'm definitely coming again!
author: Fish F.

description:
I can say this is the best ice cream in SF! 

First of all...I love the location in Hayes Valley. This shop is not in a typical building but they are operating out of a recycled shipping container. Super cool!

They make their ice cream in these mixing type machines and metal bowls right in front of you. The result....CREAMY SMOOTH FRESH DELICIOUSNESS!!! Can't get anything as fresh as that being made right in front of you! The only downside is that it is pretty expensive for a scoop. A scoop is $5.00 and is smaller than your average scoop.  Regular is $6.00 but is equivalent to 3 small scoops. You can't mix flavors though if buying the regular or pint size. Instead they give you an option to split your regular 3 scoop bowl into (2) 1 scoop separate cups. This does not seem like a deal but if you and your friend only want a scoop each it will come out to $3 a piece.  

The salted caramel and the strawberry white balsamic are awesome and you can't go wrong with vanilla. I do wish they had more flavors though.
author: Flora H.

description:
My co worker has never tried Smitten's before so I bought a small salted caramel for her.  After she tried it, she said, "I'm sure this will go straight to my booty but it was worth every pound".  

Their ice cream is just like their service, fresh.
author: Linda N.

description: The best ice cream i've had, and their new peanut butter banana vegan ice cream is a triumph of human engineering.  It's not an amazing vegan ice cream, it's just an amazing ice cream, period.  I would never know it's dairy free; it has the same unique, exceptional mouthfeel as all of their other ice creams.  I'm really happy this location is still going strong after ~7 in the "temporary" proxy space in Hayes Valley.
author: Ben H.

description: I really like smitten because they make it all right in front you and the process really neat! However maybe because I'm not a hipster and my taste buds aren't super fancy but the flavors are all too much for me. The mint is too minty-- like if I ate toothpaste. This is perfect after dinner at the stinking rose but not for a regular day. I've had a bunch of their seasonal flavors and everything had one really strong flavor to it. Like too much ginger or too much coconut and stuff. Their tcho chocolate is on point and just right.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
The ice cream here is SO creamy & heavy that it is best in small doses. Even the small size (~2 scoops) is a bit too much and very very satisfying (this means a lot -- i would never ever say there is such thing as too much ice cream). 

My fave was the EARL GREY, which has a semi-strong tea flavor sweetened by chocolate chips. So amazing, though the tea flavors sorta faded away after eating it for awhile. 

The Tcho Chocolate is great for those who prefer a super creamy and milky texture. Though it was a bit too heavy for me, it had strong chocolate flavoring. 

At $4 for a small, it is similarly priced to other ice cream places in the city. Unfortunately, you only get one flavor choice for the small. The "brristas" are super friendly and the entire store front is very hip (albeit small). Overall, a must-try for first-timers because of the unique way the ice cream is made-to-order with liquid nitrogen, but not my go-to ice cream place.
author: Samantha C.

description: It's been a long time since I have had such satisfying ice cream. I had the Tcho chocolate ice cream and it was incredibly creamy, not too sweet, just perfect. Will definitely be back.
author: Diana C.

description:
This is a great ice cream shop. I love the machines with the nitrogen, It's a cool effect too. The ice cream is great, the topping are really good too, I usually (yeah I go here a lot, so what) get TCHO crispies on what ever I get. 

The only issue is the limited amount of flavors they offer, don't go in expecting to get to choose from an array of flavor options because it's not that kind of place.
author: Thomas R.

description:
Milwaukeeans and other custard lovers take note: you can now get Kopp's quality frozen custard style "ice cream" on the West Coast. It only took me 13 years to find it.

Like the famous Kopp's in Milwaukee, Smitten uses egg yolks and special technology to keep the custard, ok, "ice cream," from developing ice crystals that make ice cream texture so mediocre.  In Kopp's case, it's big cement mixer style machines that keep the custard moving at all times and output product whether you're ready or not.  In Smitten's case, it's a much much slower, more expensive, individual-servings-only technology using liquid nitrogen.

Is all that newfangled  technology really necessary?  Of course not. But it's a lot cheaper than boarding a plane to Milwaukee.

Take note: the  flavor worth waiting for here is chocolate.  It has a smoother texture than the salted caramel which isn't made with egg yolks and has come out bitterly cold in two visits.  However, salty caramel is very trendy (probably due to the superior Bi-Rite salted caramel in the Mission) so you're going to order it anyway.  But don't.  Order the chocolate.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I'm smitten for Smitten's. Love the concept of this simple shop. Take a shipping metal container and turn it into a small store front. That's some Doomsday Preppers type shizzle right there. What's the hype with Smitten's ice cream? It's on the pricier side, there are really not that many flavors to choose from, and flavors may change daily. Read their story. The genius behind it, Robyn Sue Fisher started this whole gig on top of a Radio Flyer wagon. You remember that annoying hobbit, Frodo in that movie Radio Flyer when he was just a little boy? Yeah, she made ice cream on top of that thing. Liquid nitrogen, it's Terminator-1000 arch nemesis. When you finally try some of Smitten's goods, take notice of the texture. Super smooth with little to no air bubbles. That machine Robyn developed, now named "Brrr" would make Thomas Jefferson raise an eyebrow. 

It takes a little time for your ice cream to come out. The workers have to craft each order with Brrr. Just watch in amazement as they work their magic. I went the safe route with vanilla but topped it off with peanut brittle. Smooth like a baby's bottom. 

This kind of ingenuity reaffirms why we're such an advanced nation.
author: Smitcha B.

description:
Mildly disappointing and frustrating each time.  The ice cream is a 4 but the service has always been a 2.  I live in the neighborhood and every time my daughter has begged me for Smitten the cashier/service has been sadly disappointing. They are either having conversations with each other in the back an leave me standing at the counter until they feel like taking my order( like tonight) or like the previous time I waited in line for 20 minutes to find out there card reader was down and could only accept cash. (What the what?!-- have a 21st century plan b!)

The product is lovely, the menu is seasonal and changes, plus you get to watch its creation which is cool. But the service is frustrating and I dread giving my money to them each time I give into my daughter's whims. PLEASE improve your customer service!!
author: Lake R.

description: The liquid nitrogen presentation is cool but it's regular ice cream and overpriced just cause it's in this park. Line is long too sometimes with a lot of tourists
author: Han S.

description:
Okay, since my first review, I have actually returned here on a number of occasions because people visiting from other places have all bookmarked this place.

After coming for the 4th time or so, I honestly have grown to like it. It is still too sweet for me. The texture is smooth and creamy, softer than ice cream, but firmer than gelato.

The flavours are fairly limited, I've tried a few of them. 

Amazing Flavours:
+ Mint Chocolate Chip
+ Cinnamon Apple Crisp (Seasonal Fall / Nov 2013)

Decent Flavours:
- Tcho Chocolate 60%

Meh flavours:
- Salted Caramel
- Vanilla

It's fairly expensive at about 5 dollars per cup, which contains 2 small scoops. For me, one scoop (or half a cup) is more than enough. The Cinnamon Apple Crisp was provided to me for free to due the guy making it on accident. It honestly made me rethink this review. It was absolutely delicious and it even has a nice little crisp in each bite!

Recommended, but I'll only return when people visiting SF want to try it out.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I  ice cream. 

This place has delicious nitrogen made ice cream that is made once you order it. The classic vanilla is unique and like none other! Perfect sweetness and great cream flavor. Paired with a homemade waffle cones was such a delight. My friends tried the salted caramel and the special TCHO chocolate. Our tongues and bellies definitely loved this place.

It has us smitten!
author: Annie V.

description: Pretty awesome way to make ice-cream. The flavors are delicious. Customer service is fantastic.
author: Ulises R.

description:
Back for a scoop at this Hayes Valley location.  I got a scoop of Blood Orange w/ Pistachio Shortbread and it was extra .50c so small is $4.75 + .50 = $5.25!

Had to wait about 10 minutes for my scoop.  It was ok tasting, nothing really special and it melts really fast.

Charged it.

I should have gotten the Fresh Mint Chip!  Next time.
author: Ann L.

description: Overall, I didn't mind the $6 for a "regular" sized ice cream in a cup. They were making it made to order and the ice cream itself is pretty tasty. I ordered the pretzel, chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream, and sadly, the pretzels and chocolate chips were pulverized into crumbs. There was NO cookie dough to be found at all. Kind of a bummer. Next time, they might just throw in the toppings at the end so they stay whole or in larger chunks.
author: Niki S.

description:
The ice cream is super rich and super creamy. They have very few flavors and I saw the olive oil.... I'm adventurous and like trying new things so I gave it a shot. It wasn't bad but I don't think I'd have it again. It was very.. interesting. I can't get over that lingering after taste. The salted caramel though... that was good. I don't really like salted caramel ice cream but they had it on point. Another thing that was cool was that they made your ice cream to order. Probably why it was so expensive.... Also, if I wanted to add brown sugar caramel on my ice cream... please make it worth it.

It was an experience and definitely new but I don't think I'll be back again due to crazy high prices.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
I am most definitely smitten by Smitten! I came here the other day with friends and was so charmed by this cute little store. Luckily we got there before a really long line formed, so we didn't have to wait excessively for our delicious ice cream. 

Smitten changes there flavors regularly and it looks like they offer 4 at a time. Since the ice cream is made to order it doesn't seem like you get to taste test. Luckily it seems like most of their flavors are hits! I got the blood orange ice cream with pistachio shortbread and could not have been happier. I also took their suggestion and paired it with brown sugar caramel - the flavor combination was perfect! 

I think the consistency of the ice cream is great - light and airy. I'm not sure I'd have known it was made with liquid nitrogen if I didn't see it made in front of me, but it definitely makes my ice cream cooler (pardon my pun). Smitten Ice Cream has definitely joined ranks with some of my favorite ice cream places in the Bay!
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
All everyone talks about is the liquid nitrogen ice cream at Smitten, so I had to give it a try!

Their ice cream is a little pricey, but you get to watch the liquid nitrogen, so I guess it's worth the extra dollar or two. 

I've been here a handful of times, and it has never blown me away. I have never been able to finish my ice cream either. 

The TCHO chocolate has a super rich chocolate flavor. It's pretty good, but starts to get a little too sweet about halfway through. 

The classic vanilla has a nice milky flavor to it, but a little too milky for my personal preference. It also melted wayyyy too quickly for me. I was only able to eat about half of it, and the other half turned into milk. :(

Basically, cool concept, but their ice cream is not for my taste buds.
author: Vivian L.

description: Wow!! The best homemade ice cream ever! I ordered the strawberry white truffle ice cream. So good! I would pay an extra dollar for a regular which comes in two more scoop. Definitely my to go ice cream spot!
author: Jenn L.

description:
First and foremost, you are paying for the experience: watching your ice cream being made to order.

Customer service is abysmal.  It took several attempts for me to get the attention of the cashier, as she found that conversing with her coworkers was more important than greeting me and my fiancé.  What's more, when I did get her attention, she was super short with me.  The rudeness of the workers here is an immense turnoff.  Please train your people to value their customers. 

Flavor-wise, there is nothing to write home about.  Average is the word that comes to mind.

An Ohio native, I'll stick to Jeni's ice cream.  Jeni's offers a plethora of artisan flavors, is exceptionally consistent, and is run by friendly, helpful workers.
author: Kristen Y.

description:
I really like having a limited, rotating selection of choices when it comes to things like Pizza and Ice Cream. Especially when they're seasonal. So it's kind nice to have Smitten tell you that you'll be ordering one of four things on the menu - and that you can order one of four different things the next time you come in.

This is the pour-over of ice cream - each order of ice-cream is made individually in devices that look like Kitchen Aid mixers with the magic of liquid nitrogen. Due to this set-up, you can't mix flavors, but that's okay. 

They have recommended pairings for each ice cream flavor and my suggestion to you is that you add them both. My earl grey ice cream with salted caramel and shaved almonds was kind of delightful. 

This is a cute little shack in Hayes Valley that's definitely worth a visit after a dinner.
author: K M.

description: I was a smitten kitten who needed mittens to warm his hands from the FRESHLY minted ice cream. Forget milkshakes, ice cream is what brings all the boys (and girls) to the yard. At first I thought Smitten Ice Cream was more of a gimmick, but the salted caramel treat is one every place should try to mimic. As the milky sweet mix was being swirled by liquid nitrogen, my mind was leaping in twirls. When that first frozen scoop hit my mouth, my love for this ice cream shack unfurled.
author: Alexander W.

description:
Prepare to stand in line for at least 10 minutes in the SF cold for an overpriced ice cream shop. I guess you're also paying extra for the liquid nitrogen machine, which is supposed to make the ice cream a lot creamier.

The boy and I tried 3 different flavors for a discounted price. We had TCHO Chocolate, Strawberry White Balsamic, and Blue Bottle Expresso. All the flavors were indeed bold and very creamy. I was so glad that we ordered the Strawberry White Balsamic to balance off the other two strong flavors. I must say that one is my favorite! Very refreshing! TCHO was okay.. just tasted like a normal scope of chocolate ice cream to me. Blue Bottle Expresso was really good though! But I'm biased for loving Blue Bottle coffee.

So why 3 stars? $5 for a scope of ice cream is a bit pricey. Parking is terrible around here. The menu is too small for my liking... didn't have that many creative flavors. In all, I wasn't overly impressed.
author: Chariya S.

description:
Hooray for liquid nitrogen ice cream! 

We tried their seasonal flavor lemon gingersnap and TCHO chocolate ice cream. The lemon flavor was nice, however I was just not prepared for the ginger flavor to it. But overall, I enjoyed it. The TCHO chocolate was sweet and decadent.

I really enjoyed the texture of the ice cream. It's smooth and just perfect! 

TIP: You may need to find a parking lot a few blocks away for a cheaper rate. Arrive early before the lines can get pretty long!
author: Eva L.

description:
Good ice cream! I thought that my flavor - Earl Grey with Chocolate Chips was good, but not good enough for me to try this place again if I was in the area. They only offer 3-4 flavors at a time.

The ice cream is made to order, and the liquid nitrogen really does make the ice cream smoother. There are a few benches inside the stall for seating (or waiting in line).
author: Angie K.

description:
The flavors of the day when we went were chocolate chip Cookie Dough with pretzels, strawberry white balsamic, salted caramel and chocolate.

The line was long but it went pretty fast!

Of course I picked a small cup of my favorite flavor ever: Cookie Dough.
2 normal-sized scoops fit in the small cup. The regular has 3 scoops for only a dollar more.

It tasted very milky (duh it's ice-cream ;-). We could taste the pretzels a little as well, the pieces of cookie were tiny but it tasted super homemade and different than any other ice-cream. 

I think I would just rather have cookie dough with a bit of ice-cream rather than ice-cream with a bit of cookie dough - period :-D

It was really cool to see the Smitten people make the ice-cream - by flavor - in front of you.

We had our ice-cream in Patricia's Green right next to Smitten - perfect!
I liked it a lot but I still prefer my favorite, Loving Cup, a few blocks away!
author: Leslie S.

description: Wow- the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chips here is to die for, definitely one of the best ice cream flavors I have ever had.   If I was 16 years old I might want to eat this every day but alas I cannot eat like that anymore - so this will have to be a once in awhile treat.   I am glad to know they have Smitten in LA though as I never knew that -  so I can go anytime I crave this ice cream!
author: Sarina G.

description:
OH MY GOSH this place is incredible. I imagine the lines get long on weekends and particularly hot days, but it was a pretty short line on a Wednesday afternoon. I had the Blue Bottle Espresso ice cream with toasted almonds-- so so so delicious!! I usually can't eat too much ice cream (and often order kids' sizes) but their small was a perfect size for me. It isn't cheap-- over $5 for one scoop if you want toppings-- but not too outrageous.

Watching them make the ice cream is fascinating-- definitely something kids would love, especially if you have one of the people there explain the process. The ladies behind the counter today were so cheerful and kind as well. The couple in front of me had to wait a few extra mins for their ice cream because one of the machines was having some issues, and they were offered free extra toppings for having to wait. Great service, great neighborhood, AMAZING ice cream!
author: Hema K.

description: Must try ice cream place for SF! Using liquid nitrogen to make ice cream allows for the ice cream to be extra smooth. Four available flavors, come during the week for less traffic. Dont miss up the chance to try this place if you're in the area!
author: Dani D.

description: I was skeptical at first but I'm won over. This is the smoothest ice cream I've ever had. Earl grey flavor was fantastic. Just wish they did this in green tea matcha or black sesame flavor. Unfortunately the owner is against green tea flavor (not sure why though). $5 for a small cup. No combo flavors. Made to order.
author: Alias A.

description:
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE SMITTEN. 

All the rage about Smitten should be taken seriously. I'm a SoCal native and Smitten has been on the list of go-to ice cream spots from the mouths of my NorCal friends. I have failed in pushing from going to this place far too long. Smitten wasn't on the agenda as my boyfriend and I were waiting for a table at Straw. We decided to walk along the path around the park and found a little pop-up looking store. Fortunately, it was Smitten that we ran into. 

I love the surrounding area! So if you go on a nice sunny day like we did, you'll find yourself in a nice area to walk around. There's a cute bike rental on the side of Smitten (so cute). There was also  some food trucks so maybe try going on a warm weekend if you want plan on hanging out with a friend/going out for a date. 

So let's talk about ice cream. I got a regular early grey with chocolate pieces in a homemade cone and my boyfriend got the chocolate chip dough with rainbow sprinkles (all natural, btw) on a waffle bowl. They seem to take their ice cream pretty seriously (custom-made ice cream gadgets) and inventive, seasonal flavors. Taste was A. Using nitrogen in ice cream=smaller crystals=smoother ice cream= velvety and creamy texture. It was so good. But on the expensive side. I don't think we'd get this on a daily basis since 2 regulars with homemade waffle cone/bowl costed ~$15

Btw, we got ice cream before lunch. that's how it should be done (;
author: Jackie T.

description:
I'm always down to try out new, unique shops and support local businesses. I've seen Smitten on Yelp and a lot of my friends are fans of this place, so when it was right there, I decided to give it a try. To be honest, I wasn't necessarily hungry or even in an ice cream-craving mood, but I'm not out in Hayes Valley too much.

Today's flavors included Vanilla, TCHO chocolate, Fresh Mint Chip, and Strawberry White Balsamic. Since I wanted something refreshing and light, I opted for the Strawberry. For a little over $4, I got two small scoops in an eco-friedly cup and a tiny spoon. I have to admit, it was cool seeing my ice cream made in the liquid nitrogen contraption. Additionally, it's refreshing to see simple, fresh ingredients going into making my ice cream instead of a bunch of preservatives, stabilizers, and artificial flavorings. 

My friend ordered the Fresh Mint Chip, which was pretty good. You could tell the mint was from fresh mint leaves and not that mint extract stuff. My Strawberry White Balsalmic was also pretty good. It was exactly what you would expect from a strawberry ice cream.

Since I was already full from lunch earlier, I could have easily split a small ice cream with my friend. However, I didn't even see a kids size option (i.e. a one scoop cup). From pictures, it looks like they have one or used to have one? I think that would be my best bet when just enough of the good stuff hits the spot and does the job.

Awesome location by the little park. Friendly staff. Modern building. Great use of science. Tasty, sweet treats for those warm SF days and nights! Check it out if you're in the area!
author: Leana L.

description: Really good ice cream and great service!
author: Jake R.

description: While I waited for my vanilla ice cream with prosecco rhubarb sauce and TCHO crunchies, it was really cool to watch the staff make the ice cream with the liquid nitrogen. It is a bit pricy, but the flavor is outstanding.
author: Christina R.

description:
On a warm afternoon, nothing tastes better than an ice cream cone.  In fact, ice cream is probably one of the few foods that's maintained its high status in my life from the time I was a kid to now.  After gorging ourselves at Suppenkuche, Greg and I walked up and down Hayes Valley to explore.  We saw an overly long line for something at the park, and thought, "Well, there has to be a reason why this is going on."  Their chalkboard menu indicated that there were three types of ice cream available that day:
-Tcho 60.5% chocolate
-Salted caramel
-Classic vanilla
-Rhubarb Crisp

Yelp indicated that the chocolate was a consistent favorite, so we both decided to share a cone ($1 extra).  The line was, well, long.  It took about 20 minutes to finally get our hands on the liquid nitrogen treat.  But, you forgave Smitten for its long line when you tasted the creaminess and decadence of the ice cream.  Having only tried liquid nitrogen ice cream a handful of times, you can tell it's sort of different than the usual.  We both scarfed down the ice cream while sitting on a bench in the warm weather and determined that it just doesn't get any better than this.  Check out Smitten if you're in the area and in need of a delicious distraction!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Overall 3 stars. Pretty overpriced for the amount you get and the ice cream itself wasn't THAT amazing. 
I got a Tcho cocoa single scoop-it was very rich and thick to the point that it tasted like frozen fudge, did not enjoy it just left me feeling thirsty! The bf got cookie dough scoop-that was pretty tasty, way more light and creamy.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Solid ice cream.

I have heard the gossip--Smitten is the next best ice cream place in San Francisco. They have this Interesting ice cream making process, which includes chilling it with liquid nitrogen. Smooth texture--not my favorite, but good. Fresh ingredients. Great location. 

I recommend you buy a cup and eat while laying on the grass at Patricia's Green. Then rent a bike just around the corner, and take a scenic tour of the city. You will not regret it. For treat to take home, make sure to visit the French marcaron shops--there's practically one in every corner.

Ice cream: Good. I'd give every flavor at least one try. 

Price: A bit on the high end for ice cream, but I'd give it a chance. 

Location: Relaxed and casual. Street parking available.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Best mint chip ice cream. Really. 

At Smitten, they use liquid nitrogen to totally freeze your hand-made right-in-front-of-you ice cream selection. All the ingredients are really fresh and the result is creamy goodness. I tasted the fresh mint leaves in my ice cream. It was a little taste of heaven!!!!
author: Charissa N.

description: If you are an ice cream lover, you must try Smitten. Smitten has their own unique ice cream made with liquid nitrogen. Using their Brrrrr machine the ice cream is amazingly creamy and delicious.
author: Glenn B.

description:
Our family favorite ice cream
Spot when we we go back to visit! It's all so fresh and creamy and we really love their  story :)
author: Sana A.

description: The ice cream itself was good, super soft and smooth...we got the salted caramel and didn't like the flavor at all. Maybe if you get the right toppings it would have been good though..?
author: Susannah H.

description:
Smitten ice cream is very fresh...so fresh that I feel a cow was just milked to make the ice cream.  It is true that when ice cream is stored in a conventional freezer, ice crystals form and make the ice cream taste hard.  I brought a pint of Smitten salted caramel ice cream home, and the second day (after a day in a conventional freezer), the ice cream definitely tastes more icy.

1 star off: I do wish there are tables and chairs.  Smitten has a thin line of wooden bench around its perimeter, but not enough for a group to prop down and enjoy multiple rounds of ice cream.

Yes, I know it is winter.  I still want multiple rounds of ice cream in the winter.
author: Ally W.

description: Bomb.com. Yes I said it and it's not very often. I ordered the brown butter with spicy caramel sauce and my counterpart got the strawberry with strawberry prosecco sauce. Hers was incredibly delicious, mine was good too but not quite as delightful as hers. It's always fun to watch these guys in action making and preparing the concoctions. I highly recommend this place if you want to witness and taste something a little different.
author: Guisela L.

description: i guess the liquid nitro made in front of you added to the novelty factor.  If it wasnt for that i give this place a 3.  while the ice cream was tasty, i just felt like the flavors were overwhelming to the point i couldnt taste the creaminess of the dairy. in my book, things like taste, texture of both the dairy and the flavoring matters. texture was more icy. i tasted a of things, but only the flavoring and not the cream. i want to know im eating ice cream and not a tasty dessert treat.  i guess this wouldnt be as bad if i got the single scoop, but the double scoop but the overwhelming taste over the top. the pricing kinda encourages 2 scoops as its $6. single scoop is $5.
author: Jason C.

description: The place looked fully booked but the line moved by fast, grabbed a regular (which is double scoop) vanilla Ice cream and I have to admit the liquid nitrogen makes a huge difference! The ice cream was so rich and creamy! Didn't  feel at all too sweet! Wish I would of garbed an extra scoop!
author: Cesia R.

description: I've tried the cookie dough and lemon gingersnap, both of which were good. The waffle cone is the real reason to go here.
author: Huey N.

description: Came here with a few friends to try smitten and ordered the 4 flavor flight. They only had four flavors so we got one of each. The vanilla bean with brittle, the salted caramel, chocolate and brown sugar. My favorite was the brown sugar which had bits of cinnamon shortbread. The chocolate was my second favorite. It was the smoothest chocolate ice cream I've ever had! I loved the texture of the ice here, creamy and smooth. While the flavor isn't too overpowering. Definitely will be back!
author: Vy T.

description: Wonderful ice cream, great service, definitely recommended. The pumpkin flavor tastes just like pumpkin pie.
author: CJ T.

description: I usually never order cookie dough ice cream but the cookie dough ice cream here tastes soooooooooooooo awesomely good!
author: Alice X.

description:
This would've gotten a one star for the taste. You can taste the nitrogen on the ice cream, it's horrible. However, the customer service here is great. We told Adam our problem and he quickly fixed it by giving us new flavors. Fyi, don't get the mint chip. He even gave us a couple $2 off coupons for next time. But honestly, just go to Bi-rite or Mitchell's.

3 stars for Adam.
author: Sophie H.

description:
I went at night an hour or two before closing. First of all they were out of half of the flavors, then they wouldn't give me any samples claiming that that only full scoops are made on-demand. If everything is made on-demand then they should be able to make a sample for me!

What I ended up getting tasted fine but it was small and pricey. I haven't gone back since there are so many other ice cream places where I can get more flavors and be able to sample them first.
author: Michael G.

description: I've only been here once, but I think this might be my favorite ice cream stop. I recently tried their cookie dough with salted pretzel bits + chocolate chips and their strawberry with white balsamic. Both were really good, but the cookie dough flavor blew my mind. Everything from the textures to the taste was unbelievable. Usually I'm not really that into pretzels, but the small dashes of saltiness and crunchiness added to the super creamy ice cream made it all too perfect. Also, I'm pretty sensitive to sweets and can't handle things that are too sweet, so I'd say Smitten got their ice cream just the right level. Haven't experienced anything similar to this place before, so I def recommend!
author: Emily H.

description: I'm not a huge fan of ice cream, but having your own fresh come of ice cream made in front of you is something everyone has to try. It's delicious especially the mint chip ice cream, they put fresh mint leaves in it. Last time I went I got vanilla ice cream with chocolate rice nibs added. The area has a lot of seating and a small part around. If you like to walk around and enjoy your ice cream there is also a lot of cute shops around.
author: Nataliya M.

description: The concept of this place is awesome. They use liquid nitrogen (that dry ice you've seen as a kid that doesn't melt) to make ice cream right before you eyes! Perfect for first dates and children!
author: Jamila W.

description:
Hipster and gimmicky, but fun. The finished product is nice and creamy, but the flavor wasn't anything exceptional or memorable. I can't even remember if I had salted caramel or cinammon apple crisp.

I'll honestly admit that it was worth the visit just so I could post a video clip of the spinning ice cream with liquid nitrogen on IG.
author: Lynvi S.

description:
They recommend the cinnamon shortcake with the classic vanilla. I concur.

I love the idea of using dry ice to make the ice cream. It makes the ice cream texture incredibly creamy, and it's also fun to watch them prepare it. 

It's a great place to go to pick up a treat and chill nearby.
author: Connie L.

description: Cool little shop and great ice cream. I ordered salted Carmel with toasted almonds in a waffle bowl and it was just as awesome as it sounds. Service was great and the ice cream was a nice cool treat on a beautiful day.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Who doesn't love seeing their ice cream freshly churned with liquid nitrogen?!

Tasty but pricey. Not an everyday option but definitely worthwhile for a visit and repeat visits!  If you're in a hurry, best to skip until you have more time, fresh ice cream does require patience.

Whatever you get, add the Tcho crispies, yummy!
author: Alice T.

description:
It's a miss for me.

I don't think I'm really into nitrogen ice cream. It melts too quickly for me. Or maybe I'm just emitting so much heat that it's melting too quickly.

There's almost always a line after dinner time so come early.

Also, don't get attached to any flavors online. Their menu changes often and you might find that it's different when you get here.

That being said, I wish chocolate was a staple on the menu but vanilla is instead.
author: Sujin Y.

description:
Came here after seeing a comedy show at the Nourse Theatre and was delighted with the quality of the late night snack! Ordered the Blood Orange and Pistachio ice cream with the suggested pairings - and it was delicious! Extremely smooth and creamy! Highly recommend ordering with the pairings too!

Looks like the shop is in a portion of a shipping container so there isn't a whole lot of sitting or table area but that wasn't really an issue as people move through quickly!

Must try!
author: Alex P.

description:
Using liquid nitrogen to provide a smooth culinary experience, Smitten makes excellent ice cream that's hard to match. 

After a bike tour of SF, my great friend from undergrad and I walked a few feet to Smitten, right next door. I ordered the salted caramel in a cone. Looking back, I regret getting the regular size because the ice cream is so rich - my waistline begged me to get the small, but I refused to comply. The salted caramel at Smitten's took me back to one of my earliest ice cream memories - the salted pretzel and caramel concrete from Sheridan's in Shawnee, Kansas. 

Overall, the ice cream was a delicious experience, and we managed to avoid the line that inevitably forms when you sell a great product.
author: Chris O.

description:
This place has been bookmarked for me foreverrrr. I finally made it out here on a cold-ish Sunday night ..and got the creme fraiche flavor. O. M. G. It was so soooo good.

Not really a lot of seating and its on the pricey side for what it is, but definitely worth the experience. I completely missed the liquid nitrogen part because it came out so quickly.. we ordered..and then it was there.

I would recommend for visiting friends and special occasions..cuz otherwise I'd just rather bunker down at home with a pint of Three Twins and call it a day for the same cost.. but in the case you're a boss..and you don't mind spending the money..all day, every day!! meepsface.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Tried the blood orange with pistachio bits topped with the recommended caramel topping! I got a regular size which is three scoops, but those scoops are SMALL. Lovely little grassy area and obstacle structure right outside with plenty of benches to eat your ice cream on on a lovely sunny day. I thought it was good but not mind blowing. My first time having liquid nitrogen made ice cream!
author: Josephine L.

description:
Smitten provides fresh nitrogen ice cream with the option to add toppings and sauces in a cup, sugar cone, or waffle bowl. They keep their menu and available flavors simple but the creamy ice cream definitely delivers a strong savory taste.

Don't be afraid to come here when it's cold and rainy (yes, you should still be eating ice cream in those weather conditions). They have strong heat lamps and adequate benches for your Octavia dessert fix.

Recommend and will be back!
author: Riana C.

description: Not bad! I forgot the name of the ice cream I tried but it was some sort of toffee crunch something? Yes it was pretty good but the portions are very small and they give you the most ridiculous baby spoon to eat it with-- probably because using a regular spoon you'd be finished in two bites!
author: Andreea M.

description:
Family Vacation Part XIV 1/2 

Title: Last stop for Sunspot!

So my old Warcraft buddy made the mistake of telling one of my kids that he likes ice cream. He said there was a good place to get ice cream in walking distance. (we were at Lers Ros Thai on Hayes. So after our meal we headed to Smitten Ice Cream. While walking there he mentioned that the owner was on Shark Tank. Later I looked this up and I found out that it was a different Liquid Nitrogen ice cream. Before I came here though the only liquid nitrogen ice cream i knew was Dippin' Dots. It was cool back when I was younger, but I like regular ol ice cream. 

This place (founded by Robyn Sue Fisher.. Hi Robyn!) Is a super step up from the Dippin' Dots that you know. There really isn't a comparison. They use seasonal and local ingredients to come up with the flavors you know and love and some crazy & unusual ones. No preservatives, emulsifiers (don't know what this is), or stabilizers (i know what these are but not when talking about ice cream). 

The shop is build out of an Old Storage Container. (way to recycle!!!)

Ice Cream: 

(The usuals)

TCHO Chocolate (TCHO 60.5% 60% or no percentage, I am not sure but I think there is different types including Dark Chocolate).

In case you were wondering... and I was because I have never heard of TCHO - 
TCHO is a luxury chocolate maker based in San Francisco, California. Its factory and headquarters are located on Pier 17 along the Embarcadero, in the city's historic downtown waterfront district. (Your welcome)

Classic Vanilla, Strawberry, Fresh Mint Chip

(The others - Seasonal so it depends on when you go)

Honey Nectarine, Maple Brown Sugar Squash, Meyer Lemon Gingersnap, Cre'me Fra'che, White Balsamic Strawberry, Toho Chocolate, Salted Caramel, Olive Oil and Lavender Shortbread, Organic Mint, Plum, Sticky Toffee Pudding, Cinnamon Apple Crisp, Earl Grey, Blood Orange w/ Pistachio Shortbread, Sweet Corn w/ Berries, Sea Salt Caramel, Cinnamon Shortbread, Strawberry Pink Peppercorn, Brown Sugar w/ Cinnamon Crust, Rhubarb Crisp with or without Cake Batter, Rose... etc.

Toppings: (I am assuming alot of these are seasonal)
Chocolate Sauce, Pear Caramel, Candied Jalapeno, Almond Brittle, Brown Sugar Caramel, Toasted Walnuts, Dark Chocolate Chips, Spicy Caramel, Pitachio Brittle, Whipped Cream, Peanut Butter Brittle, Peppermint Bark, TCHO Bites, Cocoa Nib Praline Brittle, Candied Walnuts, Pistachio Brittle, Orange Clove Caramel.... etc.

Some of these Ice Cream and Toppings could be discontinued. I went through alot of pictures spanning 2 years to get them. Whew!!! 

Smittens usually have 4 choices during the day. Most of the time Classic Vanilla and Chocolate will be 2 of the 4.

They also carry Vegan options, and Ice Cream Pops...

During our trips we picked Salted Caramel, Chocolate and Vanilla. I am usually a Chocolate Ice Cream type of guy and this was good, but I really liked the flavor of their Classic Vanilla. All 3 were good. From looking at the flavor list there are some I would definitely try and some I wouldn't dare. 

We took pictures with my friend (known as Sunspot on World of Warcraft) and the family with our Ice Cream in hand. (Fyi I am known as Zhion on WoW). It was a really cool day. When I head back to San Francisco for the Bar hopping and Beer drinking, I will make sure to save some room for Ice Cream. I might get lucky and show up when they have Cre'me Fra'che!
author: Patrick M.

description:
A cool way of making ice cream! Come here for a show and a nice treat! While there aren't too many flavours (think there were about 3) they are each done superbly! 
I got the tcho chocolate and it was amazing. Nice and smooth, creamy and really chocolatey! Probably the most chocolate tasting ice cream I've ever had.

Staff is great, friendly and quick to serve. Prices are about right for the quality.
author: Derwei C.

description:
I really like this place. The only problem is that it's a pain for me to get to, parking is difficult, there is hardly any seating and the line is super long.

The ice cream is really good and they have monthly special flavors. My favorite type flavors are the ones made of fruits like peach and strawberry. Get the waffle cone if they are available. Totally worth it but they always seem to be out.

Also, service is usually pretty good. I just wish they would open up a second location that is a little more convenient. Either way, I'll be back.
author: Diane M.

description:
Best Ice Cream EVERRRRRRRRRRR! I would def. recommend to go here.

Thanks for making a happy Jew!!
author: David F.

description:
Liquid nitrogen ice cream!!! It doesn't get any cooler than that! It got a little nerdy scientist in me all excited and squealing on the inside. I got a small scoop of the creme fraiche. It was orgasmically out of this world good (creamy, great texture and not overly sweet). This is hands down my favorite ice cream spot. 
I waited 20 minutes in the scorching sun but the wait was sooo worth it. 

(long overdue review)
author: Tuyen T.

description:
Looks like Yelp deleted my review since Smitten must've flagged it since it's negative. So, let me rephrase this again in a manner that is not in violation of any of Yelp's rules...



Mr. Smitten ice cream maker guy, where's our ice cream that you promised us?

We ordered 4 ice creams, two of which were chocolate. The guy making the chocolate flavor calls out my gf's name and hands her one cup of chocolate ice cream.

She tells the guy, "We have one more chocolate, right?" He grumpily replies, "Yes, it'll be right out." Two or three more cups of chocolate get handed out after a few minutes to other patrons.. so I tell the same guy, "We're still waiting on one more."

This same guy, in an even more disgruntled-sounding and rude tone of voice, grumbled back at me, "Yes, it'll come right up." He never asked for our order's name, never checked his board, nothing.

30 minutes later, no f'ing second ice cream cup.

We just gave up and went home. The line's way too long to get back in to try to correct the mistake, and this employee clearly doesn't give a sh*t about our order or about customer service, just continues to lie out of his a*** and tells us that it'll be right out, no matter how many times we ask him.

I'm sticking with Bi-Rite. They're better, anyway. Also, I want that $5 back.
author: Kazu O.

description:
The softest ice cream I have ever had! I was really sad after my last bite because I just wanted to continuously eat it. I had the TCHO chocolate ice cream and it was delicious! I tried some of the salted caramel too and it tasted so perfectly. I also like that their small cup size is the perfect amount of ice cream for me.

I think it is really cool that you get to also watch them make it as you wait!

So worth it.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Yummy and fun. Creamy, gelato-like ice cream. Fun to watch and in a fun area, standing in line at the booth is part of the experience. Definitely touristy, but I am a tourist so whatever! 

I got the tcho chocolate ice cream with tcho chocolate sauce and cinnamon shortbread. Rich but the flavors went really well together. I got a small, which ends up being more ice cream than it looks and I think it's too rich to eat a huge bowl anyway. Good, popular places will always have haters but I say it's worth it!
author: Sara M.

description:
Dear Smitten, 

Can you make your August seasonal flavor, sweet corn with berries, part of your regular menu? Having to wait a year to only be able to order it for a month is very very cruel. 

Thank you, 

Your biggest August seasonal flavor lover 

If i remember correctly, I think there were actual corn pieces in the ice cream. It may sound weird to some people but it's such a wonderfully delicious addition to the already finger licking good ice cream. Must get! I'm eagerly waiting for August to come around!

-1 star only because I can't always get sweet corn.
author: Michelle T.

description: Super delicious ice cream and creative flavors. Probably the smoothest ice cream ever thanks to being made with liquid nitrogen. This is the original location and is outside in a covered stall in Hayes Valley. There's usually a line but it moved pretty fast when I was there. Very SF. Pricey but worth it, $5 for a small- 2 scoops or for $6 you can get a regular- 3 scoops. An extra scoop for $1 seems like a no brainer to me! All the flavors are delicious and bursting with flavor. You can add toppings too to customize your creation! I recommend the cookie dough topping which includes pretzel bits.
author: Alison B.

description: Yummmm. The first liquid nitrogen based ice cream shop I went to was Creamistry in Irvine. It was overpriced and tasted average so I never went back to one. But Smittens blew me away. The location was great and the design of the block and shop was so cute and modern! Taking stands to the next level. I ordered the vanilla ice cream with Tcho chocolate flakes. Such a simple flavor, but they did it so well! You need to come here to know what I'm talking about.
author: Carmelisa M.

description:
I came here a month ago with two of my friends after spending some time in Alamo Square. We walked here because we were craving ice cream and my friend had this bookmarked to try. 

Smitten definitely has a "hipster" vibe to it and is in a very cute neighborhood. The ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen and churned right then and there. I got the salted caramel ice cream (as did one of my other friends) and another friend got earl grey ice cream.
 
I did just try Bi-Rite a couple of days before this and you really can't compare the two. Bi-Rite is a classic creamery with ice-cream made in the traditional sense. This is definitely more new-age and trendy. The taste of the ice cream is definitely good, but because the process to make the ice cream is different, the texture is different. Smitten is an experience of itself.
author: Deepti N.

description:
Wonderful experience!

The ice cream was phenomenal. I had the vanilla classic with cookie dough and caramel. Delicious!

Michael was a dream! He has a wonderful mustache and an even better personality. He made my entire experience even more enjoyable.

The ice cream and the staff make this establishment, in my opinion, one of San Francesco's finest. I will be back! Thank you!
author: Cassie H.

description:
The ice cream is good. Ordered blood Orange flavor, strong flavor, you can taste the natural flavor with the slightly bitterness. It's is a bit pricey for ice cream. I think the quality is worth it 
It's in the middle of a hipster neighborhood, basically all ice cream is to go, since it's more permanent food truck.
author: Mona L.

description:
I think I was born again after eating this ice cream. 

This shouldn't even be called ice cream. It should be a whole new category. Ecstasy cream. Yea. That sounds good. Greatest thing to enter my face. Eat this ecstasy cream ASAP.
author: David T.

description: I had seen a lot of photos on social media about this place so went to check it out. It really didn't love up to the hype. I got the cookie dough pretzel with chocolate chips. You could barely taste the cookie dough, and didn't notice any chocolate chips inside. Also didn't like that they don't let you test out the flavours beforehand.
author: Ghazal S.

description:
I've had a couple of liquid nitrogen ice cream places in Los Angeles before, so watching the making of the ice cream process is not worth the wait for me. However, I was so impressed by the taste of the cookie dough with pretzels and chocolate chip flavor that I ordered another cup for our group right after we finished.

I came directly here after going to Bi-Rite creamery. Both had great ice cream, although the ice cream at Smitten is definitely smoother, denser, and more milky. I wish that Smitten has more flavor options, although I know it's hard given it is a liquid nitrogen ice cream shop. I was very disappointed that they did not offer the salted caramel the day that I visited.

Also, the is no sampling of flavors here since each batch is meant to fulfill one order. I can see some people were disappointed by this. Maybe Smitten can make extra batches just for sampling purposes and put them aside.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Watching the ice cream being made is just as entertaining, if not more so, as Cold Stone's. The variety of flavors, however, is not as striking. 

On the day I visited, I had the choice of Nectarine, chocolate, mint chip, and vanilla. I asked the guy at the counter for the best choice. He said "chocolate," so that's what I went with. 

The whole process seems like a lot of work for a small cup of dessert. Pulling the spiral blade out of the machine, the workers have to scrape off all the gooey bits, collect them together on the opposite counter, and then form it all into beautiful, creamy scoops. 

After my rather long wait, I was handed my cup. The ice cream was delicious. The flavor was wonderful, though I've probably had more complex mixtures, but the texture and consistency were divine. I wish all ice creams had this same feel on the tongue. :)
author: Lisa S.

description: Oh my gosh where do I start with this place! The ice cream is so amazing. It is creamy beyond belief and the flavors are to die for. The workers are nice and it is so cool watching them make your ice cream. If you're ever in the city it's a MUST to stop by!
author: Mikaela B.

description: Warning- do not go here if u can't handle nutting super duper hard... u will nut all over these guys windows & doors after trying the ice cream here... yeah, don't say I didn't warn u
author: Sasan S.

description:
Best ice cream you'll ever eat!!!!!!

Fresh ingredients (yes, you can taste the difference), and it's made with nitrogen.  It's cool to watch, but even better the nitrogen is so cool that it makes smaller crystals and the ice cream is the smoothest, silkiest, creamiest ice cream you've ever had.  

I don't eat ice cream too often, but when I do, I treat myself to this.  Forget the other hype spots in town.  This is the place.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
+++
Very pretty and innovative location
Fesh local ingredients
Ice cream made to order
Interesting to actually be able to watch what's going on
Local owner

---
$5 for two small scoops of ice cream are pushing it to the limit

-+-+-+
Only small selection of flavor available at a time
Veeeery rich, buttery, indulgent taste, might be too much for some, but def very creamy consistency

Definitely worth to try at least once but not the "that's where I ALWAYS go when I want ice cream" spot!
author: Eliane F.

description:
The ice cream here is pretty good, nothing too special. I wouldn't go out of my way to get it considering parking is hard to find and the line tends to be long which is daunting with SF's cold weather.

However, you should stop by if you happen to be in the area. The ice cream is made right in front of your eyes and tastes very fresh. I got a mint chocolate cop sundae (forgot the name as I went back in March '15). It came with chocolate covered Rice Krispies, chocolate drizzle, and the most delicious whipped cream I have ever tasted. If they allow you to, I would ask for some of their whip cream with your ice cream. The ice cream itself truly did taste like mint, which I did not expect but the herbal taste simmers down as you have more spoonfuls of the ice cream. The rice krispies nicely complimented the ice cream with a nice crunchy texture. 

Give it a try if you have the chance, but I don't think I would go to Smitten again unless I had something else planned in SF.
author: Tram N.

description: Very expensive hipster ice cream now elevated to global tourbook sensation, it's good but hippy. I'm not snobby about my ice cream though tons of other reviews are, I see it mostly as pricey sugar-cream water cooled quickly in a mixer. The ambiance & experience, however, do feel like classic SF so it's still a must-do to see how the locals live.
author: Richard C.

description: Outrageously rich and good. Made to order ice cream with the freshest flavor. Choices might be limited but the flavor can't be beat. I always get an upside down cone. Don't miss getting the cone!
author: Sue D.

description:
On the hunt for some ice cream, we tracked Smitten down to get on the nitrogen bandwagon. 

Location-wise: Great area in Hayes and even more awesome if you can walk. I made the mistake of trying to park in a dodgy side street; my bad for waking up some of the homeless sleeping on the sidewalk. Instead, I reversed and opted for parking in a gravel lot next to it. Not sure if I was supposed to park there but 1) this is SF 2) other cars joined in and parked next to me so it must be a parking lot. 

The options were pretty simple but who doesn't love a good old Chocolate or classic vanilla? The ice cream itself was made it front of my eyes like magic and was super dense. They used TCHO so it had a really rich and dark chocolatey taste but super good.
author: Leina K.

description:
Although pricey, this innovative ice cream stand really is something everyone's got to try, locals and tourists alike. The ice cream itself is so smooth, lending to the fact that the extreme temperatures of the liquid nitrogen with which it is churned doesn't allow crystals to form. This results in blissful big-impact, full-contact flavor directly to your taste buds. Top if off with their unique toppings (pistachio brittle, etc), and you've got magic again and again. 

Stars on stars on stars. stars for being unique, stars for being delicious, stars for excellent staff recommending excellent flavor combinations, stars for everyone being so smiley and friendly, and stars for such an apt name. how you can you go here and not be smitten with Smitten? I dare you!
author: Tuwie N.

description:
Love their tcho chocolate ice cream and the ambience . This place is also just a few blocks from my home and somewhat of a neighborhood pride for me. 

Having said that , their Earl grey and strawberry balsamic is just okay :(  

Verdict : tcho or don't go
author: Vasini G.

description: Cute lil spot. Reminds me of the container stores in vegas.... i love it... grouped up with a few other businesses. Music inside is nice and not loud. Cutw benches too..Customer service is excellent. Greeted us upon entry and we didn't feel rushed since this is our first time. Perfect place to get dessert after dinner in the area.
author: Gigi C.

description:
We were craving for dessert and decided to give smitten ice cream a try. What got our attention is their blue bottle coffee ice cream.
