Parking in this area is tough. It took us a while just to be able to find one. Once we got in, it looks like there's only 4 flavors to choose from. We decided to give the blow bottle coffee ice cream a try and the mint chip ice cream a shot. These 2 ice cream tasted very good and the mint chip tasted like you're chewing on mint leaves. They used the nitrogen process to make the ice cream which reminded me of this place in LA call ice cream lab. 

Overall great ice cream but the parking in this area is very difficult. Be prepared to take some time looking for parking.
author: Stephen W.

description:
This place is part of the latest trend that can be found in Nitrogen Ice Cream. I was a fan of both the location and storefront itself. We went there on a Sunday Night and it wasn't too crowded and service was quick and with enthusiasm. 


Even the taste was good and had different textures then traditional Ice Cream. If you are ever in the Hayes Valley and have a hankering for Ice Cream that appears like Hans Solo going into his deep freeze do come to this spot!
author: Matthew R.

description: Love the fresh ice cream and the variety of flavors. It's always exciting going to smitten because you never know what they're going to have to offer! But whenever earl grey is on the menu I have to order it. It is not too sweet and really has a tea-like flavor. The mint is great too because, again, not too sweet and the flavor is very subtle. Fun place to go for the experience of watching them make the ice cream!
author: Jen W.

description:
Came here after brunch with a couple of my friends. We stood in line for about 5 minutes. Apparently we were lucky to be in a short line on a sunday :) woop, score!!

The wait was well worth it. I was amazed at how the ice cream was chemically made. Hayes valley, thank you. 

The cashier was a bit bit**y but oh well. She's lucky the ice cream made up for your terrible service. 

The area was perfect!
author: Jay B.

description:
I'm definitely snobby about my ice cream. Vancouver has so many amazing spots (Bella gelateria, rain or shine, earnest) that I'm always hesitant when people talk up San Franciscos ice cream scene. (I have no love for bi-rites ice cream btw, tho the people working there were awesome)

But back to smitten. 

Smitten lives up to the hype. The tcho 60.5% chocolate scoop is so decadent that you really only need a tiny bit to feel satisfied. Get it with the spicy caramel. The creme fraiche pear caramel (with oatmeal) is a must try. 

Their salted caramel..... I've had better.

It's pricy but worth it.

I also had a great experience with the people working there.... Yes they're hip and young, but they seem like they're having fun and were so friendly. 

4.5*s, half star off for the price =P
author: Sam W.

description: If you want to consume a fresh batch of ice cream everytime, this is the spot. Staff is also really friendly about suggesting flavor combinations. I don't really recommend getting a cone, as the ice cream melts quickly, even on a cold night.
author: Emily L.

description:
I definitely came here thinking my first visit was just a bad experience and Smitten was due for me to try it again, I keep listening friends tell me Bout how great it is and I keep seeing the lines long enough to think it is delicious ice cream...but once again I was disappointed, so definitely it is not my palate. 

We had brunch today in Hayes Valley and I thought this would be a good place for dessert. The line was luckily short, and i decided to order the salted caramel since I was so disappointed In the past. Today. It tasted the same. Just like a big and salted stick of butter. My friend ordered the chocolate, and we came to the conclusion that if we went to a Supermarket we probably could buy some brand that tasted much better. Of the three of us, none of us finished our ice cream. It is disappointing because I have tried to honestly like this joint, but today, similar to my first experience, I walked feeling like I was eating something that i really didn't like, definitely not a place to kill my sweet tooth.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
While being an "Asian Tourist" in San Francisco, my boyfriend insisted we visit this place because supposedly this was the very first place that started using liquid nitrogen to make ice cream. So far, the only other place that I have had ice cream made like that is Ice Cream Lab here in L.A. and I love the mixture they use as their base. Like most trendy ice cream shops their menu does have a lot of variety and they do offer unique season flavors. 

The are where the Smitten Ice Cream is located is a totally a "hipster" location. Pastel colored buildings, sitting areas located around multiple different art pieces and some stores or shops are made from shipping containers. 

When we found the location of Smitten, I was excited at first to try their ice cream, but once we were in line, I slowly started to regret it. While the line is not long, the position of store doesn't benefit the customer. During the prime hours of the day the sun is beating on you while you wait in line, and while it was not hot that day, standing in the sun with minimal shade from the store itself made the wait kind of unbearable.

Their customer service lacks...well customer service. By that I mean, the girl that was working the register had a very dry personality. She didn't greet us, she just gave us a "are you ready or what" look, and when I asked her questions about the menu, she answered with a flat tone as if it was my fault for not knowing more about the menu. I decided to try their "TCHO chocolate" with their TCHO crispies after asking the cashier if it was "too chocolatey" (she said it wasn't), and my boyfriend decided to get their seasonal item which was their Earl Grey with milk chocolate chips and also added their cinnamon cookies. Then while waiting for our order the girls that were preparing the ice cream orders were  openly talking/complaining about their personal life. Some of it...not so good to say while people are in front of you waiting for their order.

After a 30 minute wait we finally received our order. Sadly, my ice cream order looked overly.."chocolatey", which was what I was trying to avoid. It taste like I was eating a whole chocolate bar. The TCHO crispies were really good though, I ended up just searching for pieces of the crispies in the ice cream and then I just tossed the ice cream because the TCHO chocolate ice cream itself was just too much...to the point where I had to get water from La Boulange to wash it down fully. I think I would have enjoyed it better if I had gotten it with their vanilla ice cream. My boyfriend's ice cream was really good. The Earl Grey wasn't too overpowering and the cinnamon cookies along with the chocolate chips gave it a good crunch.

This place was good to try but, since we have multiple locations in SoCal that do the same thing, i don't think I would go out of my way to have this place again.
author: Angelica E.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD.

move over humphry slocombe.
move over bi-rite.

smitten ice cream has now taken the crown.  think of it like this...smitten is the blue bottle of ice cream!

yeah yeah...the stuff is expensive...so are the other 2 places!  if you want cheap, go to baskin robbins.  if you want fresh, made in front of your face, with recognizable ingredients, then smitten, it is.  

this lady started off her business in a radio flyer...super admirable.  

my favorite?  vanilla with strawberry sauce, shortbread, and whipped cream.  all of these items are freshly made...very much appreciated. 

the line can get long..i think it's worth it.  the experience is worth the wait...magic is made right behind the plexi glass.  screw this, i'm going now.
author: Jen W.

description: Small place, but easy to spot when you're walking around Hayes. Rotates between five different ice cream flavors. Had the blue bottle coffee in a cup. Ice cream was okay, nothing spectacular. Knocking down stars because pricey for small portions and well, no reason. I just really wanted some ice cream and it was  right in front of me. Also, a slight drizzle was coming on and they shielded me from that.
author: Arezou A.

description:
THERE is a REASON this place has a line around the BLOCK! WOW!

Smitten Ice Cream sticks bases their menu and product on what is "simple is best!" The menu is quite small and does not offer dozens of options. There are typically three to four "special" ice creams of the day; depending on how many machines are operating.

They LITERALLY make the ice cream right before your eyes! And I'm not talking about scooping it into the cone. They MAKE it!

I had their classic vanilla and a waffle cone (which they ALSO make there) and their chocolate sauce.

Words. Cannot. Describe. How good. This freaking ice cream. Was. 

So please just GO there. Wait in line. AS LONG AS IT TAKES. And taste it yourself.
author: Kasie W.

description:
Walking in, I was largely unimpressed by the 4 solo options of pretty regular flavors: strawberry, chocolate, vanilla, and mint chocolate chip. And there's no sampling!! 

We got a scoop of TCHO chocolate with the recommended spicy caramel, and I was not a fan of the syrup. However, the mint chocolate was REALLY good. You can really taste the freshness of the mint as it is made right before your eyes.

I'd come back if/when they offer some seasonal flavors!
author: Jessalyn C.

description: Had the TCHO Chocolate sundae, which was delicious. Aside from the made-on-the-spot gimmick, one thing that set apart Smitten for me was the whipped cream - definitely the best I've had at any ice cream shop.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Wow. Nitrogen ice cream?! What more needs to be said?! Basically ice cream made by witchcraft.

They make their ice cream on the spot. However, there are not that many flavors to chose from (4 to be precise), but you can add on your own toppings such as caramel, chocolate, or crushed walnuts. Also, they can not serve you two flavors in one order since they make each flavor individually on the spot and different flavors won't be ready at the same time. 

The texture of the ice cream is very different from anything else I have ever had! It was creamy and delicious. I got plain vanilla and my boyfriend got mint chocolate chip. The mint flavor was very strong and I can taste that they made the ice cream using real mint leaves. 

They also offer homemade waffle cones for an extra fee... Unfortunately they ran out which means the cones must be super good and in demand! Hopefully they will have some next time I drop by.

Stumbled across this place one night when I was craving some ice cream and this was the closest to home. Little did I know I would have to wait in line at 9pm just for a couple scoops of ice cream! That being said, there's is barely any space for parking. There is also a cute little park right next to the shop where you can enjoy your nitrogen ice cream under the stars.
author: Jessica L.

description: My daughter ordered a root beer float and I ordered oatmeal berry crisp. The vanilla ice cream in the root beer float was average and the oatmeal berry crisp was pretty good. However, very pricey for a small scoop. Just fun and fascinating to watch them make it.
author: Anna M.

description:
Very interesting experience to see the ice cream mixture turn into ice cream almost instantly in the brrr machine. As the machine whirls into action, you can see "smoke" coming out from the ice cream mixture and in just a few minutes, the ice cream is formed. 

This ice cream is pricier than other ice cream of similar quality. I paid ~$6 for a cone of ice cream. I had the salted caramel - very buttery and the waffle cone is nicely toasted and crispy.

Parking is hard around this area. I had to circle around the neighborhood multiple times to find a lot.
author: Rongs L.

description:
the ice cream was good. really good. sweet corn? creative & delicious. 

everything else? horrible. 
the service was really mediocre, borderline rude. I ordered a small, with a brown sugar caramel sauce. 

I paid for my ice cream and ANDY handed me my order without the sauce. I thought it was just a minor mistake, so when I clarified my order he just laughed & said "we don't have any." and walked away, without asking if maybe I wanted something as a replacement. the lady (I didn't get the name of) ringing me up didn't bother to fix the order when I was clearly standing there confused because I didn't get what I paid for. 

so when I decided I didn't want a topping instead, I expected them to redo the transaction. but she didn't even offer me a refund for the sauce until I asked. the manager came over, and she explained the situation, he looked frustrated and I felt like I was asking for something ridiculous & out of the ordinary. 

overall, double check your order. make sure you aren't being charged for what you aren't getting. & it's okay to clarify for what you wanted.
author: Tina H.

description: My friend told me to check this place out while I was visiting SF and I decided to walk 25 min from hotel to justify the amount of calories I'd be consuming...seriously, it was worth every freakin' step and calorie. I'm not a big sweets person, but I didn't want it to end. I got "Cookie Dough" - cookie dough, pretzels, and chocolate chips. Best ice cream I've EVER had. The cone was just as amazing with its own unique flavor and was clearly just as freshly made as the ice cream itself. I absolutely recommend this place.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I wouldn't say Smitten is the best ice cream in San Francisco but I am a fan! They definitely draw in a crowd even at 9pm on a chilly Monday night. The store itself is very cute, a quaint "little shack" in Hayes Valley. There is very limited seating which might be a problem on more popular days. I've tried the Mint Chip and the TCHO chocolate. They are both really good and bursting with flavor! I really like mint and chocolate ice cream so I didn't mind. But the Mint Chip does have a very strong mint taste and smell, like you can smell/taste the mint leaves. I think it's really refreshing. The chocolate is very rich and had a velvety texture. I definitely needed some water afterwards. Overall I'm pleased with the taste and it's also fun to watch how they make the ice cream. Great place to take kids! Or kids at heart!

#icecreamadventures
author: Miko I.

description:
Is there such a think of ice cream that is too smooth and creamy?  After having Smitten, I think there is...

I like Smitten because of its idea.  Make fresh ice cream from a stand in an area that promotes people walking around to place.  Then you promise the smoothest ice cream ever because of you novel science based ice cream making.  Unfortunately the ice cream falls a bit flat.  The process used makes the ice cream to creamy, having this weird sticky airy texture.  It made me miss a nice solid scoop of Secret Breakfast or Salty Caramel.  On that note the flavors are somewhat basic.  Fancy chocolate/vanilla and another 1 or 2 special flavors.  Nothing to write home about.

Oh yea, and because the ice cream is made as they go, the wait can take forever on a busy day.
author: Veasna H.

description:
This is seriously the best ice cream in all of SF!!

They only have 4 flavors of ice cream, with classic vanilla and Tcho Chocolate being two constant flavors and the other two constantly changing. This includes one seasonal flavor that changes every month. 

This place make all of their ice cream right in front of you from scratch. They go from cream (and other ingredients) to ice cream in minutes. And each batch of ice cream serves 3-4 customers. This ensures that your ice cream is very fresh and never frozen or let to sit. The fresher the ice cream, the more light and airy the ice cream. 

The other great thing about this place is that they always use fresh, local ingredients. I love going into a place and buying a product where I can recognize the name of every ingredient! The ingredients are: milk, cream, honey, sugar, nectarines. 

My personal recommendation would be: classic vanilla ice cream with cinnamon short bread!  Yum!!
author: Rose Z.

description:
When I go to San Francisco, I always try to taste something new. smitten has been on my list for a while now. Really was excited to try this. We get there and there was about a 40 min wait. The place was cute. Its located on Octavia St. Its a little hard to find parking 
There are only four flavors at a time. On that particular day they had mint, blue bottle espresso, nectarine and cream and chocolate. What I really likes about this place is that o the board that they have, they write down each ingredients that goes in the ice cream. They also use liquid nitrogen and they make your ice cream when you order. I ordered the Blue Bottle Espresso and my children ordered the Nectarine and Cream. I thought it was tasty. It wasn't too sweet and the espresso wasn't over bearing. I however can't say that it was the best ice cream I've tasted. The nectarine and cream was also good but the more you eat it, it becomes sour. I guess due to the fresh nectarines. Price was a much. $6 for a regular plus $1.25 for freshly made cones. It cost me $30 for 4 regular size with cones!! However I do have to say that a regular had at least 3 scoops of ice cream which is a lot. All in all I had a great experience! I really love Tue concept and more power to them!
author: Marie P.

description:
Located in what I would call the "playground" of San Francisco (idk, it just has that kind of vibe), Smitten looks more like a little pop-up tent than an actual storefront, but by no means does that make their ice cream any less than delicious. Yes, the wait is a little longer, but that's only because they make it right in front of you!

I got the Cookie Dough with Pretzels and Chocolate Chips, which was right up my alley. It was a little too creamy in my opinion though; if I had gotten regular size, I definitely would not have been able to finish it. I also got to try my friend's Mint Chocolate Chip, which was not the kind of minty you'd expect from ice cream. It tasted like straight up mint leaves, but not in a bad way. My friend explained it as "weird, but you can't stop eating it".

My small scoop was $5, so yes this place is pricey. But then again, so is every other fancy ice cream joint in the city, so I'd say Smitten is definitely worth a try.
author: Sabrina C.

description: Smitten has been known for unique flavor of ice creams that change The store is located next to a park so it's convenient to walk over after your order. I tried their chocolate ice cream, which was pretty standard, I didn't feel like it was that unique. I also had their lemon ginger snap which was pretty good and flavorful. Two things that people may not like about Smitten are that they don't allow samplings prior to ordering (like Bi-Rite) and that the flavor choices aren't as numerous, though they do change flavors weekly. However, Smitten is certainly worth a stop if you're in the area and want to try something different!
author: Nick A.

description: What's not to love? Got a show and then some ice cream. I got a root beer float with tcho chocolate ice cream. It was good but I know I've had better ice cream for a cheaper price haha. It's all part of the experience though.
author: Lydia K.

description:
I heard about this from a friend before we visited SF and they said it was the best ice cream ever. That's a big expectation to live up too. Especially since I'm from Houston, land of Blue Bell lovers (don't hate!). 

But being the ice cream loving fans that we were, my husband and I went. And we were not disappointed! 

There are so many cool things about Smitten that I don't even know where to start. 

1. They make their own ice cream. Yes, I said that. They MAKE THEIR OWN ice cream. It is made to order just for you. 

2. Their secret weapon: Liquid Nitrogen. Robyn discovered that freezing ice cream at super low temperatures could create a smoother product and freeze ice cream in record time.  With a rapid freezing cycle, she could make ice cream to-order, without compromising taste for shelf-life. she set off to build a machine that perfected the ultra-cold churning process.

3. Since they make everything to order, you have maybe 5-6 fresh flavors to choose from. 

4. They have homemade toppings.

I tried their chocolate with homemade oatmeal crumbles. Holy moly! Was this quote possibly the best ice cream? Even better than Blue Bell? Yes, I think so. Again, don't hate! Just go try this place if you're ever in the San Francisco area. 

There was a little line when we went, even at 9pm. But it was totally worth it. You see them actually making your ice cream and get to see it through the beginning. And no they don't mind you taking photos or a video. I periscoped my time there :) 

Go try this place! I seriously crave this all the time! 

LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Worst and most expensive scoop of ice cream I've ever had. Paid over $8 for one scoop of mint ice cream.
Although it looked delicious the mint was to potent. I will never come back here again.
author: Linda N.

description:
Smitten is best for ice cream adventurers. I'm basic so I like my usual basic flavors. BUT I'll stay unbiased and note that they are creative with the flavors they create and you can really taste the homemade-ness of it (eg. Mint tastes like actual mint and strawberry tastes just like fresh strawberry). 

Flavors are pretty limited (around 4 available) so definitely go if you're down for any flavor. They probably keep the menu short because they only have four machines making the ice cream at a time and they make each one to order!
author: Lani C.

description: First ice cream place this kind that I've experience. Getting to see them make the ice cream right in front of you was awesome! I was hoping for more different flavors but I have to understand that this isn't Baskin Robbins.
author: Frank T.

description:
I suggested getting ice cream from here for some friends but it was closed for the day. This made them want it even more.

There were three of us so we ordered each flavor. I got a small TCHO chocolate with the recommended pistachio brittle ($4.75 + $0.50), my friend got a small salted caramel with the recommended TCHO chocolate sauce ($4.75 + $0.50), and my other friend got a small spring herb flavor (thyme, basil, rosemary flavors) without the topping ($4.75).

I always think Smitten is expensive, but they haven't disappointed me yet. The ice cream is very creamy and the flavors are usually spot on delicious. 

My ice cream had a good flavor and the pistachio brittle was really yummy. I love pistachios! I somehow like the salted caramel flavor now more than I did the first time. The chocolate sauce on it didn't make a big impact on me. Spring herb flavor was curious indeed but definitely fresh and herby. I didn't hate it but I didn't love it. Luckily, my friend loved it a lot. 

Staff remained very friendly despite the hoard of people trying to order ice cream. I appreciate this. 

Kind of a splurge, but whatever. I won't stop going to Smitten's.
author: Sofia R.

description:
7x7 100 Best Things to Eat Before You Die

#10 Kelvin-made ice cream at Smitten

If you want the freshest ice cream possible then Smitten is the place for you. When I mean they make it fresh, I literally mean they make it fresh. Its made per order, you really can't get any fresher than that people!

Just an fyi Kelvin is is the name of the machine used to make the ice cream. It is a "triple-patented liquid nitrogen-freezing magician that turns a milk-cream-flavor mixture from liquid to ice cream in one minute."

I won't lie, it's pretty cool to see your ice cream being made right in front of you and so fast too! There is something to be said about Smittens ability to blend a timeless novelty with modern day technology, genius! They certainly do set themselves apart from all other competitors by being able to give their patrons a show with their dessert.

Putting the innovation aside, the heart of the matter comes down to the flavor and texture of the ice cream. 

I had the creme fraiche with pear caramel  paired with their cinnamon shortbread while my family tried the tcho chocolate, one topped with burnt caramel and other with almond brittle. 

A sign that the ice cream is good is how fast it melts, the faster it melts the less perservatives it has! That's ok with me, all that means is that you have to eat it faster. I felt the ice cream was creamy and the flavor stood true to is name, The pear caramel was definitely a great addition and you really could taste the pear. Overall, for a dessert it wasn't overly sweet which I liked a lot. Tcho chocolate was also good!

Overall Thoughts

While there is a limited amount of flavors there is something there for everyone. The freshness and show is more than enough to bring me back to Smitten.
author: Eddie W.

description:
I expect overpriced everything in San Francisco. It's just the nature of the beast, really, and you either accept it or fight it tooth and nail. Or you're like me, and constantly have an internal struggle about costs and value and what-have-you.

This place was on the list of "must-try dessert" shops, and so, at 10 on a Friday night, the boy and I made our way down here.

The line may scare you, but as they use a liquid-nitrogen method of making the stuff, it goes surprisingly fast. Unfortunately, the place does stay extremely crowded, as crowds already served huddle around the pick-up counter snapping Instagram pics and ooh-ing over their orders. (I'd say I was guilty of that, but it was too crowded to join in, sadly).

All in all, I'm not impressed whatsoever. The menu is small (4 flavors), so we opted for 2 ends of the spectrum - basic and creative.

CLASSIC VANILLA. 
Figured, how could you go wrong with a classic? And they recommended it to be topped with malt syrup, so I did, of course. To their credit, it was solid ice cream - creamy, smooth, but 100% lacking in any flavor whatsoever. It was just a bland, cold thing to eat, very unmemorable.

RHUBARB CRISP.
The boy's choice, not mine. I liked the texture of it, but, again not a blow-you-away flavor, and nothing I'd get again.


For the price ($5+ for 2 small scoops) and the crowd, I can't say I'd come here again. It seems like just another trendy, overpriced SF place, and I'm keen to avoid that kind of scene.
author: Claire S.

description: Smoothest, creamiest ice cream I've ever had. I went with my parents after a sushi dinner and my dad and I shared a regular sized vanilla. They basically have a custom machine where they add a base to the mixer and inject liquid nitrogen to fresh churn you ice cream. I'm not sure if it's their recipe or the method but the product is top notch.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Quintessential San Francisco Urban Hipster Ice Cream (not in a bad way at all)
This part of Hayes Valley is very urban-posh w. a bunch of shipping containers being used to serve ice cream, coffee, beer, food......

Smitten is located in on of these.  Seem to have 4-5 flavors available at any given time with each being made to order.  They start with a liquid base of "ice cream syrup" which they pour into a stainless steel bowl attached to what looks like an industrial mixer on steroids.  As the mixing blades turn they pump in what appears to be liquid nitrogen - syrup is blended and frozen into ice cream as you watch.  The whole thing is pretty cool to watch - lots of steam billowing from the machine as they make order.  We took the 2 small scoops for  $6.00 - Rhubarb (which was WAY BETTER than i expected) and salted caramel - both were rich, delicious and amazing.

It is all outdoors so it can get chilly if you are there in the evening - bring a jacket.
limited seating available 

i will definitely go back
author: Ben C.

description: The ice cream here is very tasty. We had the Cookie Dough with Pretzels & Chocolate Chips, and the fresh mint. Fun to see their unique Liquid Nitrogen process for creating the Ice Cream. This place is not cheap. 5$ for a small cup of ice cream. + $1.25 for a cone & + $.75 per topping. Paying for quality though.
author: Kevin C.

description:
A small ice cream place which is next to a park. This place is like semi-outdoor. 
Got the small tcho 60.5% chocolate ice cream for 4.75. Its quite expensive since the cup is really small. they have this machine where they make the ice cream in front of you. Thats good that they have freshly made ice cream. 

The chocolate flavor is sooo good. Smooth and creamy and sweet

Parking around here is very difficult.

Line can be long. Friendly staffs but you may have a bit depending on what flavor you get and if its really busy that day especially hot day. When i order my ice cream, not much people didn't get the chocolate that i had to wait about 5 - 10 minutes to make a new batch of the chocolate flavor ice cream. 

They used ipad their way as a cashier
author: Julie N.

description: Too creamy and sweet for my taste actually. Also, my husband ordered his ice cream with a cone and they forgot about his order and by the time he got his they ran out. My husband said "well I paid for it so...?" Then the guy working made him feel like it was a nuisance and almost made him feel bad to get a refund, like, "do you really want me to refund you $1.25???" My husband was very adamant that yes he wanted a refund, money is money. Other than that it's cool that they make the ice cream in front of you with the machines but it's not my kind of ice cream personally.
author: Margalit K.

description:
An ice cream stand in a metal shipping container? That makes the ice cream right in front of you using liquid nitrogen? Gotta see it, gotta try it.

My friend and I got the Earl Grey. We wanted without chocolate chips but the cashier just automatically added it in. For 50 cents, we just didn't say anything but afterwards, I wish we had. The ice cream itself was actually pretty good, smooth and the liquid nitrogen definitely made a difference. Unfortunately after the first few bites, the chocolate bits just overpowered the tea flavor.

Again, liquid nitrogen ice cream: It's a cool idea and was fun to watch but I don't think I'd fork out the money for that kind every time.
author: Kat C.

description:
I've been to the Smitten in Berkeley before, and that time I seem to remember they had more creative flavor choices like Sweet Corn. The Smitten in Hayes Valley is a small almost booth-like shop, plenty charming and tucked away in the mini park. 

On the day I visited, all the flavors were fairly normal except Lemon Ginger, which basically tasted just like Key Lime Pie. I also got the Salted Caramel, which tasted just burnt enough to give it a more unique flavor. The portion sizes are pretty small but they give you tiny spoons too so it sort of evens out lol. The texture of this ice cream is a bit different from normal creameries, probably because they make it from liquid nitrogen fresh for you on the spot. I would come here again whenever I happen to see one as I'm passing by. It's good ice cream.
author: Hope X.

description:
Tucked inside a cute little cargo container on Ocatvia St,  Smitten touts itself as old-fashioned, natural ice cream with modern methods. They actually use liquid nitrogen for their delicious creations. It was right across from where we had dinner so my parents and I decided to stop in.

I had the Strawberry White Balsamic which was one of their flavors of the day. My dad got the Salted Caramel in a cone. Both were awesome with crisp, delicious flavors. The texture is just about perfect. I have to say I liked the Strawberry White Balsamic slightly more. My only complaint is the steep price. I get the unique methods for creating their ice cream is probably expensive, but there was a tad bit of sticker shock.

But overall, Smitten was one cool concept. It was a perfect after dinner treat and a good way to end a day of sightseeing in San Francisco.
author: Benjamin L.

description: good ice cream, albeit expensive. Usually only three or four ice cream choices.
author: Sesa M.

description: Yum, I love Smitten!  I came here for a tasting event through Gilt City, and we tried the vanilla, salted caramel, chocolate and nectarine (seasonal).  I loved the vanilla and nectarine the best as they were light and creamy and so refreshing, plus I added the spicy caramel sauce (a must on the vanilla!) and brittle, nutty crumbles - yum!  We had such a good time hearing about the history of the business, the machinery and what it takes to run a place like this.  I want to go back for more nectarine ASAP!  :)
author: Maile N.

description:
Ultra buttery and rich ice cream, made-to-order right in front of you, in a popular, trendy space. Love the flavors, and it's fun to watch them make it. Probably not for everyone, as it's pretty decadent, but if you love ice cream you should try it at least once. The price is a bit of a bummer -- blowing 6.50 on ice cream is just not something I'll do more than once. 

 Just to note this place gets super, super crowded on weekends. I would try to go on a weekday.
author: Nina D.

description:
I'm a little anti-hype, but I do love ice cream, and needed to see where Smitten sat on the Bi-Rite/Humphrey Slocombe hierarchy. I had a mint chocolate chip while my friend had a Blue Bottle coffee, and both were ridiculously rich/creamy. The mint also tasted like actual mint from the garden - not like the artificial stuff. Not sure if that made me like it more or less, TBH. :P The coffee ice cream was also super intense.

I echo the comment about the prices being a little meh, but other than that, I'd definitely come here again - maybe not all the time, but for sure during the occasional Hayes Valley jaunt.
author: Shendi X.

description: Such a great idea! Hand crafted ice cream frozen and made to order! So cool. It also was fantastic flavor! We got the cookie dough pretzel ice cream and it was perfect. I will definitely be back.
author: Jessica M.

description: Smitten's ice cream is always a spot I hit up in SF. I don't visit often, but when I do I always get a scoop. I love flavors like vanilla and chocolate, but Smitten's always has unique and fun flavors to try. I got the cookie dough with pretzals and it was amazing! Definitely reccommend!
author: Katie K.

description: Ive passed this booth a few times now and not gone in. Heck I've gone to the Los Altos one before I made it here. recently after finding our resy wait at a pop up was going to take a while we went and had dessert first. The place was basically empty when we got in but then suddenly it packed up behind us. Guess I bring the party. Brown sugar cinnamon shortbread hit the spot. One of my friends got the Tcho chocolate add on and kept calling "Tee Cho" sauce. I will never let them live that down considering the reside in SF!
author: Kim N.

description: the smoothest icecream I hv ever tried! I tried vanilla which tastes very nice. $6 for regular size. There's always a long line thou.
author: Foodie C.

description: It was a spring day on the weekend when I came. Oh my god the line was long. The ice cream, which I forget the flavors, were decent. It does take time for them to make it, since it's not the kind you'd usually get served from a pre-made carton. I don't think I'd wait in line for it again, but I'll definitely come here otherwise. The atmosphere was cool, since it's next to an open outside bar.
author: Alice S.

description:
I had the salted caramel ice cream. It was awesome! I like that it was made by liquid nitrogen. 

The only thing is that I wished they had a bit more flavors everyday. Other than that, ice cream was good on a sunny afternoon.
author: Irene L.

description:
This place is terrible, it will turn you into an ice cream addict, whenever you are anywhere near Hayes Valley you will be forced to stop in and get some of their awesome ice cream. I must admit I have only had the tcho chocolate flavor. I tried it once and have gone back for more each time. Why do you go to a specialty ice cream shop to get just a chocolate ice cream? you ask. Because it is the most creamy delicious ice cream you have ever tasted. They have signs explaining how they get their ice cream so creamy. Whatever the process is, it just melts in your mouth.

I saw this concept overseas and I thought it was a great idea, and was pleasantly surprised to see it in SF.
author: Elzabeth G.

description:
The texture of the ice cream was perfect and the flavors were delicious.

My husband and mother both had the TCHO chocolate with almonds mixed in and they were both raving about it. 

I really enjoyed my crème fraîche ice cream with pears and prosecco strawberry. The strawberry sauce was a tad sweet and I could probably go without next time. I did really enjoy the texture of my ice cream. It was very creamy and smooth. 

My brother had the salted caramel with almonds and chocolate sauce. He seemed to enjoy it.

It's definitely pricey but a sweet indulgence that I don't great.

The line moved fairly quickly.
author: Grace C.

description:
On Sunday, 8/31/14, my girlfriend and I decided to try Smitten Ice Cream for our first time. I saw Smitten Ice Cream featured on one of my favorite cooking channels last week. After reading the positive reviews on yelp I had to give Smitten a try. 

Atmosphere/Decor: 

Smitten's Ice Cream is setup like a metal shack like structure with open entry ways on each side. I like how you can watch the employees use the unique liquid nitrogen apparatus ice cream maker. There's a menu on the wall to the left that lists the different ice creams. There's a few wooden benches to sit down on while waiting for your ice cream. I also saw a good amount of chairs to sit on located outside towards the rear of Smitten's. I like the location of Smitten Ice Cream. Right next to Smitten's is a nice park. My girlfriend and I ate our Ice Cream at the park. There were plenty of places to sit at. 

Food:

I decided to go with a Truly Smitten Sundae. I ordered the Salty & Cinnacle (Salted Caramel ice cream, cinnamon shortbread, TCHO chocolate sauce, homemade whipped cream.) This sundae was absolutely sensational! The ice cream was so creamy and the texture was so smooth. The flavors were amazing! The cinnamon shortbread tasted really good and complimented the Salted Caramel ice cream. The TCHO chocolate sauce was pretty intense but not overpowering. The homemade whipped cream was the icing on the cake! 

My girlfriend ordered the Classic Vanilla Ice Cream (2 scoops) in a made from scratch ice cream cone. She loved her ice cream! She said it was the best ice cream she's ever had! 

Service: 

The girl that took our order was very nice. They make your ice cream fairly quickly. You don't have to wait that long. Service was good. 

Overall:

This place was packed! Smitten's Ice Cream is my new favorite ice cream spot. For the longest I was a coldstone fan but ever since trying Smitten's I now have to kick coldstone to the curb. Smitten's Ice Cream is the best ice cream I've ever tried. If you want some unbelievably creamy ice cream go visit one of the 4 Smitten's locations.
author: David R.

description: Super cool how you can see them make their ice cream...really small place and no real seating/tables, but take it to go, no problem. I wish they had more flavor/variety, but the ice cream was smooth with good texture (probably the CO2 that added to the smooth texture). Really wish they had more flavors though....also, there are no samplings so although I liked the ice cream I got, I wish I got to try ones before picking....
author: Hana C.

description:
Premium price for decent ice cream. $5.25 for a small after tax. Seriously? Not sure if this nitrogen method is worth those extra dollars! It's only fun to make ice cream w/ nitrogen on your own anyway (seriously, I did this in 8th grade haha). I've been here only a few times and nothing ever stood out to me.

I've had some fancy-smancy fruity thing that I can't even remember the name of... Obviously, not memorable.

EARL GREY + CHOCOLATE CHIP
Gave this a try and boooo, disappointed. The first bite, you can taste the earl grey and it was pleasant. As you take more bites, the chocolate chips kicks in and starts numbing your tongue with an overdose of milk chocolate sweetness. It's so overwhelming that you don't taste the earl grey anymore. I'm willing to give this another chance IF they can control the amount of chips to throw in the mix.

BLOOD ORANGE + PISTACHIO SHORTBREAD
Ah, finally. Finally found a flavor worth trekking out to Smitten for. This has the refreshing tastes of fruit with the smooth consistency of ice cream and there's pistachio shortbread chunks in there! I had this on a San Franciscan summer day and it was deliiiicious! And the best part? I only paid 25 cents, thanks to the PayPal app promo of $5 credit here. WINNING!

In the end, I'll come back solely for the blood orange/pistachio shortbread -- which I'll give a 5. But the price of $5.25 and the other disappointing flavors bring it down to a 3 in the end. Sorry Smitten, I'm just not ballin' enough to afford you!
author: Sandy T.

description: Easily the best ice cream in the city - I think it's MUCH better than bi-rite. They offer traditional flavors, as well as more outrageous flavors and they have all lived up to the hype.
author: Kayla S.

description:
This place is a must-try dessert place. Liquid nitrogen ice cream does have a different texture from normal ice cream. And the flavors they have here are amazingly delicious. I got one that was chocolatey, caramely, and had a slight salty taste of pretzels! It was perfect :)

The store is also super cute. It's just an open booth, and it's located near the playground strip in the middle of Octavia. Make a stop if you're taking a stroll in Hayes Valley!
author: Alice H.

description:
I love this place.  The ice-cream's texture is really smooth, ostensibly because they're frozen down lightning-fast in their liquid nitrogen bath so that the ice crystals are tinier.


Flavours I Remember Trying:

* Brown Sugar with Cinnamon Shortbread:
Delicious, evokes a warm spicy baked treat on a cold night.

* Fresh Mint Chip:
You can taste the freshly crushed mint herbs that were green leafy organisms only minutes before.  I'll take this over a mojito any day.


The only strange thing about this place is that the first half of the scoop tastes amazing, but then the second half of it grows cardboardy and bores my palate.  I suppose this just means I should never get more than one scoop here, so 4 stars.
author: Letitia L.

description:
The long wait perhaps makes the ice cream even better. On a rare scorching hot day in San Francisco, I had to make a visit to Smitten, which was highly recommended by my friends. 

I saw the long line up out the door, and joined in. The salted caramel flavour stood out, and of course I had to get 2 scoops of it. The next 20 minutes or so was spent waiting, watching the nonchalant employee make tubs after tubs of ice cream.

Then I waited and waited again, and finally, my name was called. Before me, was a cup of thick, smooth salted caramel ice cream.  I took one bite and knew it was worth the wait. The caramel flavour was prominent, and the hint of the salt was perfect. The freshness of the cream really made a difference.  I savoured every bite of this delicious treat.
author: Vincci L.

description:
Apparently, one of the staples of the San Francisco ice cream scene. And with good reason. The ice cream is so rich, and you can believe the quality, 'cause it's made right in front of you with their fancy schmancy liquid nitrogen machinery. And it comes out in decent time; they might as well have scooped it up, but NOOO, it's made from scratch. The dudes who work there are friendly, and it's in a heated little tent that makes you comfortable eating ice cream no matter what the weather's like outside.

The earl grey ice cream is so subtly good, but I recommend getting it without the chocolate chips, because the rich milk chocolate began to overpower the earl grey tea-ness after a few bites. Dark chocolate lovers will appreciate the 60.5% Tcho chocolate, which is anything but subtle and should probably saved for last, as you won't be able to taste anything elseafterwards. The salted caramel was kind of coconutty, and quite salty indeed--I actually thirsted.

In general, the ice cream is RICH RICH RICH, thick, and stands up as you spoon it. A small scoop is $4.75, but you get two rich scoops, which ended up being more than enough. Regular gets you three scoops in a big bowl. They accept cash or credit. And their location right next to Biergarten is wonderfully convenient. German sausages, beer, and ice cream? What a great combination. And not necessarily in that order.
author: Jade V.

description:
The fun part is look at your ice cream while it's made...
The ice cream is not that great. It's also too cold out there to wait 25/30 minutes for a cup of regular ice-cream...
author: Maggie J.

description:
This place is definitely a one-of-a-kind ice cream shop. The store itself is a remodeled shipping container. There was minimal seating and a long line that stretched out into the street (why people didn't just curve the line onto the side walk, I don't know.) I didn't realize why I was waiting in line for so long for a scoop of ice cream, but as you approach the counter, you can see why. The ice cream is made right in front of you and frozen with liquid nitrogen.  There was about a 10 minute wait in line to place the order, and another 10 minutes to wait for the ice cream. Loved the ice cream, but didn't like to wait for something that I am use to getting scooped and served then and there (just the spoiled little girl in me I guess).

They have 4-5 items on the menu since the flavors are based on the season and ingredients available. Ice cream is organic and made from scratch. I ordered the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was delicious (about $4-5 which was well worth it considering the quality). It tasted exactly as the description in the name. My husband ordered the Mint Chocolate (really loved this one!) and it was ridiculously minty and delicious. One scoop of ice cream looks small but is actually pretty satisfying since each bite was as amazing as ice cream can get!
author: Adilia S.

description:
This place is really fantastic.  It is the first place where I've been excited about vanilla ice cream. 

They usually have vanilla, chocolate, and a seasonal flavor which they rotate every so often.  I love trying their seasonal ones to see their take on them. 

There is usually always a line filled with European tourists.  It is a cool vibe.  That said, if your friends hate lines and do not appreciate quality food then this might not be a good place to bring them.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Bf picked up a pint of Brown Sugar with Cinnamon Shortbread. It was amazing! We often call back and ask if they have that on the menu for that day...they don't. =/

But the nice gentleman told us that it's a regular flavor in Los Altos. We haven't had time to head there yet, but soon! Maybe sooner than later cause I am craving it right now.
author: Audrey N.

description:
When I first tried Smitten, I didn't think much of the taste. The ice cream had an overall melty texture and and heaviness of the cream was a bit overwhelming. Not to mention the staggering prices for just two scoops of ice cream, not including the toppings! On our first visit we tried the Vanilla and the Salted Caramel. The vanilla was creamy, smooth, but again the creaminess was overpowering the dessert. The salted caramel packed a nice taste, not too sweet, but not too salty. However, it definitely didn't stand out to me as a a bowl worth its price.

Flash forward a couple years later; I just went to smitten's three times in a series of five days. Somethings definitely changed about the process, it's much more efficient with the workers are attending to their jobs in an orderly manner and the line moves much quicker. The prices are a bit higher, but the quality of the product is just the same if not better. Over the past few days, I have been salivating for this flavor, the apple crisp ice cream. An upgrade worth paying extra for, this flavor packs in the nostalgic essences of a warm apple pie, buttery, sugary, and most importantly delicious. The cinnamon cookies also add a nice textural balance. The cones at Smitten are also delectable, buttery and crisp they add a nice finish to a wonderful dessert. 

Tip* If you are not feeling too hungry for dessert but still crave ice cream, try asking for a single scoop. For just $3.00, its just as satisfying to the taste buds and better for your wallet.
author: Jessica E.

description:
The Rules:
$3 - single scoop munchkin (not on the menu)
$4.95 - two scoop small
$6 - three scoop regular
$0.75 on average for add-on toppings
No mixing scoop flavors (sadly)

The Lowdown:
Cold (duh), thick, smooth, and creamy ice cream made within 10 min of your order time.

The Tcho chocolate is rich. I recommend sharing ice creams with someone. Always a long line. ***3.5 star rating
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Hipster Ice Cream! Went to visit a friend in SF and she had a whole list of places she wanted to try. Smitten was one of the few ice cream places open on new years so it was where we ended up. The line was pretty long but we had finally found somewhere open that we decided to stay. 

We asked the cashier which flavor she recommended/was her favorite and she looked at the line and suggested mint because "the wait is long for the others" WTF kind of food service person suggests something because of how long you have to wait, especially when we've already been waiting in line????? She then proceeded to fuck up our order and we had to ask twice in order for my friend to get her ice cream. 

I saw a bunch of yuppies buying ice cream for their kids. I personally think it's crazy to get a kid $5 ice cream when they would be happy with some breyers but that's just me. 

Interesting experience, the ice cream was smoother and the mint was super fresh but I doubt i'll be back.
author: Ingrid L.

description: Corn and berries ice cream is so good!  Ice cream was incredibly smooth and creamy.  Recommended topping that we got (oatmeal cookie) was unneccessary and take away from subtle flavor.  Also got salted Carmel, also delish, but we all agreed the corn and berries was superior!
author: Camille C.

description:
**3.5** 

The first bite of Smitten on a hot sunny day will "hit the spot" no matter what kind of day you're having. There is a line, to be sure, as this is a city favorite. The only downside is that it melts REALLY quickly (if you add a syrup), so I'm glad I got a small sized cup. It turned into ice cream soup literally within just 2 minutes or so. Maybe the better route would have been to order the root beer float, like my friend did (also super refreshing and light). 

To sum it up, Smitten ice cream is creamy, yet light and refreshing. It's also an experience just watching them create your dessert. The downsides are that when added with syrup, it melts really quickly and there are no tastings allowed or mixing of flavors. 

Worth trying again? Yes, but only if someone insisted on it.
author: Diana K.

description:
Smittens has me bitter about all other Ice Cream places. Something about the selection and the staff is so helpful. 

Taste the blood-orange ice cream if they have it! I give it 10 thumbs up.

Excuse me while I drool thinking about how good it is.
author: Mark B.

description: You know you're ordering the right thing when the person ringing you up goes "yeeees, that ones soooo good" . I got the strawberry balsamic with an oatmeal crunch topping and it was EPIC.
author: Thielson D.

description: I have frequented a wide variety of novelty ice cream shops in Southern California and was pleasantly smitten by this ice cream.  I ordered the sweet corn with mixed berries and added pistachio brittle on top.  Like Creamistry, Smitten uses liquid nitrogen to create a wonderfully creamy texture, yet Smitten's ice cream is much less dense than Creamistry.  The blend of the corn flavor and sweet berries was a wonderful combination of salty and sweet, and I often prefer my salty and sweet separated.  The pistachio brittle was very fresh and not at all difficult to chew like many brittles.  Highly recommend!
author: Melissa T.

description: Great tasting ice team. Very fresh, with the promising ingredients they say on the board. The menu is confusing to read and doesn't clarify what's included in the price. I would have to give 3 stars for the location but mainly the workers were copacetic. Average. They looked unhappy to be there and were kind of rude. At least they had fast service.
author: Janine P.

description: Oh how I love Smitten. Whenever I'm in town, I always ask my aunt to take me since its one of my favorites. I love their different unique flavors but I always end up ordering the chocolate with cookie dough. The chocolate flavor is so decadent and rich which I love. I also really like the cookie dough flavor with pretzels.
author: Aspyn L.

description:
Smitten is a unique ice cream shop. It is at Patricia Green Park and is housed in something similar to a garage where the ground is concrete and there is no insulation. This unique design is match by it's unique way to offer ice cream. There are four flavours per day, and they are MADE TO ORDER! None of that ice cream that comes in  drums where it may have been sitting in the freezer case for who knows how long. 

The day I came, Smitten had Tcho chocolate, meyer lemon, malted vanilla, and salted caramel flavours. I chose the Tcho chocolate in a kid size for $3. After the order is placed, they make the ice cream in their churner filled with liquid nitrogen. Sixty seconds later, you are served your scoop! The texture was smooth and creamy, and it had a rich chocolate flavour! I also tried my friend's malted vanilla and it was really good as well!

For a high-tech ice cream shop, the prices are really cheap. There was no wait for us on a cloudy winter day, but I can see your order taking quite some time in the summer days.
author: Leslie P.

description:
Between Mitchell's, Bi-rite, Swensen's, and Humphry Slocombe.. SMITTEN's has the best Ice cream in town. I was blown away by their robust creative flavors such as: Spiced Pumpkin with Espresso Spiced Walnuts, Vanilla with homemade almond brittle, and TCHO Chocolate w/ cocoa nib praline. Talk about sex on a platter, all special flavors for the fall season.

All ice cream is made from scratch right in front of your eyes by their special mixer which uses liquid nitrogen to make your scoop of ice cream smooth. Smitten's ice cream is also renowned on the 7x7SF list and was featured on Food & Wine Magazine. 

Business hours: Everyday from 12p-9p (you won't regret it)
author: Kathy V.

description:
Ok. So my low rating and my dislike of Smitten is proof that I don't have refined taste and I like cheap things.  But so what!?! I miss Thrifty ice cream and I like Slow Churned Dryers 1/2 fat ice cream.
This ice cream was equivalent to eating a stick of butter. It was TOO creamy and I could not finish it. 
AND they won't let me mix two flavors. What's up with that?!  I am not used to having to decide between one. I WANT BOTH!  #sobackwards!  
Smitten, You can have your "nitrogen" ice cream and i will take my TWO FLAVORS!

It was not worth the wait, the cost, or the calories. Next time I am going to Safeway!
author: Julianna I.

description:
I can hardly formulate the words to describe the ice cream I indulged in at Smitten today...it was nothing short of amazing.

I've only had liquid nitrogen ice cream one other time in my life, and I was unimpressed. But Smitten Ice Cream is incredibly rich and creamy, much like the consistency of gelato. Their production process is so cool, for lack of a better word, you get to see everything!

This place will always be a destination if I'm ever in town again.
author: Christina N.

description: It is a great concept to use liquid nitrogen to make the perfect ice cream and seeing them make it fresh when you place your order is great. There is always a long line and most people are pretty happy when they get their order as long as they don't forget you. There are only about 6 employees here one cashier, one person taking your order at the door and either 3-4 people in charge of the individual machines that look like a mixer. I tried their salted caramel and strawberry white balsamic flavors during my two visits here where I got the regular cup with three scoops that costs $6.00 because it was hot both days. It was interesting flavors, but none of them really spoke to me in saying I must come back because it's the best I ever had feeling. I had good experiences both times. Service was good. Maybe I need to try a more normal flavors like vanilla and chocolate. Overall it is well made product that is freshly made for sure with very unique flavors that rotate. Take a chance and try it, you will probably enjoy it. I would try again if I was in neighborhood, but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I actually found this amazing place being lost in the middle of hayes valley looking for chantal giulon. It looked kind of weird, but to my curiosity, decided to enter this tiny store, which looked more like a tent to me. I decided to get the Vanilla and two of my friends got the salted caramel. Inwas surprised that they make your ice cream right in front of your eyes!! So like they poured this liquid into the machine (the owner calls it kelvin), which looked like a cake mixer and they had this tube that was giving of smoke which i guessed made liquid into ice cream.

1. Vanilla - it was REALLY REALLY GOOD!! Like you can taste the milk, and its actually not too sweet! The texture of the ice cream is really smooth ! This is a must try!
2. Salted Caramel - not a big fan. Way to sweet and very very buttery. You could really taste the butter in your mouth even after you swallow the ice cream. My friend couldnt even finish the small size.
author: Valerie H.

description:
I don't understand ice cream.  I'm more of the savory person rather than the sweet tooth person looking for sweet shops and ice cream shops to hit up.

I have passed by this place, having no intentions on going, but did so because my friend is a major ice cream fan at heart.  His belief is that the childhood ice cream kid in me has been long gone or is of no existence and I was quite Smitten with that.

I took a spoonful of his mint ice cream and it was surprisingly strong in minty taste.  What's special about their ice cream making process is that they shake it up with nitrogen molecules in a machine.  You can see the experimentation being completed with the clear display showcase.  An extreme fan for ice cream in the science field must have thought up the idea and may have wanted faster making ice cream with the use of technology.  What dedication.

The ice cream was great and the concept making is unique.  The ice cream kid in me, felt Smitten, indeed.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
The ice cream here is delicious! Tucked hidden away in the park in Hayes Valley - Smitten creates ice cream using liquid nitrogen. It's quite the experience

My friends and I went here for a pre-dinner appetizer (heh) as we were waiting for our seats at Suppenküche. I had myself the mint chocolate chip (as I am a sucker for mint desserts), and my friends had the vanilla; and maple brown sugar squash. The mint chocolate is not your average mint chocolate using mint extract -- they use real mint. So I wasn't a HUGE fan of that. However, the vanilla and maple brown sugar squash were definitely something that I would get next time.

Hurray for ice cream parlors close to where I live! w00t!
author: Joanne W.

description:
if you're tired of being given way too many options and seem to be an indecisive human being like i am; then smitten ice cream is your place.

only a hand full of options and it makes your life a lot easier! the ice cream process is pretty quick! You can watch the ice cream being made in front of you with liquid nitrogen. which is always pretty neat to watch.

what made this place truly 4 stars. i ordered the simplest and most old fashion ice cream ever. vanilla. and it was sooooooOOOOOoooo smooth! i don't think i've ever in my life time had ice cream this smooth and creamy! so 2 thumbs up for good quality ice cream! 

definitely worth a try so i would recommend it!

tips:
*credit and cash accepted
*located next to a park
*there's limited seating available 
*additional charges for toppings.
*you can customize your ice cream choice with toppings/sauces.
author: Lisa D.

description:
In September a group of us walked by this place while on a work trip. After dinner, we were ready for ice cream, but no one expected it to be of this caliber. The ice cream is phenomenally made with the best ingredients. The staff was friendly and very helpful in recommending what we might like to try especially as first timers. 

Over the month, the team I was with collectively were able to try the TCHO chocolate, mint, salted caramel, and the seasonal flavor which was pear something or other. All of them were fantastic! I've n ever been as excited about an ice creamery. 

When in SF, this place is a must. They also have a location in Whole Foods in San Jose (read winning).
author: Dolci K.

description:
This place is amazing!!!!!!!!!
The ice cream is so good!!
That ice cream touched my heart and married my tongue!!!!
I got the fresh chocolate mint and it was magical I would go there again.
author: Esme A.

description:
Wow... what can I say... this place is amazing. The Salted Carmel is worth the wait! 

If you are drunk shopping with your bestie, stopping here is essential. 

Cone or a cup? Doesn't matter. Can't go wrong.
author: Gina C.

description:
A bit expensive at $4.75 for a small but I have to say it was pretty darn good. 
The ice cream is made fresh right before you - mixed and made in small batches to order. The freshly made ice cream comes out creamy and perfectly smooth. The lines can be quite long on weekends but it wasn't too  bad of a wait ~30+ minutes or so. 

I tried the classic vanilla which was amazing. The mint chip definitely had a fresh mint flavor that really tasted more like a mojito than mint chip - not really my thing.
author: Brenda L.

description:
This is worth the wait. I don't want to be an asshole and give 4 stars because I do believe this place is a 4.5 stars rating due to a few things I will mention below. So I will do a 5 star rating bc that small niche isn't a bother for this gem. 

The ice cream is soooo smooth, but thick and not all that dense it's the perfect combo. I didn't even need water while enjoying which is a plus because usually I'm dying of thirst when having some ice cream. I got the Classic vanilla sundae which was about $8 that came with 3 scoops of ice cream with Tcho (chocolate covered rice crispies), homemade whipped cream and butter caramel sauce. By far the best deal because one scoop in a cup is already $4.95. And if you want a topping it's another 75 cents per sauce topping and the other topics such as Tcho bits are a high price. A waffle cone is another $1.75 if you're into that (or is it $1.25??). So I recommend that.

The line was long at around 9pm but with good company it goes pretty quick. Reason be, the ice cream is made to order and they only have three stations of flavors made when you order. The only downside besides the wait which isn't so bad is the variety of flavors available. Everyday is different and for me it was Earl Grey, Salted Caramel and Classic Vanilla day. So half a star there but I can't hold them against that because the ice cream is amazing, the staff is SO NICE, SO INFORMATIVE, OMG WE HAD TO TIP HER (Stevie, you're a doll) and the atmosphere is classic San Francisco nights.
author: Nina H.

description:
Not bad Ice Cream. 

All the flavors are good. Never had a bad flavor. 

I got the flight w/ four flavors. Seems to be the best deal and it's enough for 2 people to share. 

From best to 4th best

Chocolate 
Brown sugar
Lemon gingersnap (seasonal flavor extra +.50)
Salted caramel

The flight w/ four flavors is $10. Make sure to check the total before you pay. They need to press a special button for discount  otherwise it comes out to $12. 

Amex not accepted
author: Teresa S.

description:
My favorite ice cream in SF! 

On a nice day, there is a normally a small wait but the line moves quickly. The location Hayes Valley is fantastic so this is a great spot to bring people who are visiting from out of town. 

I'm a chocolate lover and their TCHO chocolate ice cream is among the best I've had,creamy with a deep chocolate flavor. I've had it with the spicy caramel sauce (which tasted like normal caramel to me) and that was good.. I've also had it with the cookie dough bits, which weren't my favorite. This is a great flavor to get plain and that's how I recommend it.

I've tried the strawberry white balsamic and it's fantastic! If you don't like chocolate or if you are looking for something unique, go with this one because it has such an interesting mix of flavors. 

Note that they don't accept American Express (though that may have changed). They also have vegan popsicles if you have dietary restrictions.
author: Ana D.

description: Think about it: They use liquid nitrogen to create a new batch of ice cream for each guest. It's such a spectacle to watch!!!!
author: Amelia C.

description:
Fresh mint.  Ah.maze.ing!  I will never be able to have mint chocolate chip ice cream anywhere again.  They really nailed the flavor in this one.  I still think about it when I'm in the mood for a cool creamy snack.  This is not a hard ice cream, much more creamier.  I usually prefer mine a bit more firm, but the flavor absolutely trumps the need for tightness.  Hmmm, that sounds a bit nasty...

Moon Pie was oh so dreamy as well.  I think I'm going to have to find excuses to head down here daily.
author: Maria S.

description:
The rotating flavors and the smooth consistency of the ice cream are what will keep me coming back every time I'm in the Bay Area. 

I had the espresso ice cream, the chocolate ice cream, and the peaches and cream. They were all good, but the chocolate eclipsed the flavor of the espresso--I would have liked to have them one at a time. (I ordered a "flight" and shared with friends.)

Seriously, though, awesome experience at this place.
author: R A.

description: I came here on a Friday night around 5-6PM. Parking was pretty hard to find. The ice cream is pretty pricey. I had the mint chocolate chip flavor. The mint ice cream was really light and smooth. The chocolate chips were more like slices of thin chocolate but it went well with the mint ice cream. My cousin had the creme fraiche with pear caramel with almonds. Every component of the flavor was identifiable and light enough, so that you're not left with a strong milky after taste you get from most generic ice creams. Their ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen right in front of you and they also play loud upbeat music that livin' up the place. After trying two of their locations in San Francisco I can safely say Smitten Ice Cream never disappoints. I can't wait to come back for more. The reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because this place only had a bench for indoor seating and some tables outside.
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
Good ice cream, though I like bi-rite better.

Love the earl grey!
author: Ellen C.

description: This was a great experience for me and my 9 year old daughter. She loved the setting of the shop and took photos of the employees hand blending our ice cream. We had the earl grey tea ice cream mixed with chocolate chips and topped with melted salted caramel. This is my favorite ice cream. I appreciate the simplicity of the ice cream and that it has about 7 ingredients. My daughter loved it too but she was hoping for more choices. They had 4 options for flavors today.
author: Cheryl C.

description: This place was ok..... Nothing really great about their ice cream except the set-up of the store, fancy, amazing, nice because not all ice cream parlor is set-up like that, something new to your eyes.
author: Marie R.

description: We had great service and great tasting ice cream. What more can you ask for in a frozen treat?
author: Dawn R.

description:
Liquid nitrogen based ice cream? That's quite novel, using molecular gastronomy cooking. I'm told that I'm supposed to get a better flavor profile since the ice cream comes out more dense & smooth, basically creamier.

Flavors change from time to time but the staples seem to be there such as Vanilla, Tcho Chocolate, Salted Caramel, etc. I've tried them all, they're pretty standard flavors and the ice cream is solid but I'd be more impressed if I haven't also tried other liquid nitrogen ice cream shops.

While Smitten is probably one of the earlier pioneers in making nitrogen based ice cream more accessible to ice cream lovers in SF, SoCal has been quick to adopt the same concept and one stand out place would be Beverley Hill's Ice Cream Lab, http://www.yelp.com/biz/ice-cream-lab-beverly-hills. Their flavors are more creative, for example the Blue Velvet uses an actual blue velvet mini cupcake that's tossed into the mixing process, giving the ice cream a nice texture to each bite.

With that said, Smitten is still solid for an ice cream spot for those hanging around Hayes Valley's Patricia Green on a perfect sunny day.
author: Steven C.

description:
Ice cream was way too sweet and watery.

Paid $6 for an ice cream that had the consistency of whip cream.  

Ask for extra frozen and it came out just as watery. 

Threw it out. Not worth it. Waste of money and calories. 


I'm from LA and we defitnetly have better food down here. Never had a good meal in SF
author: Jenny C.

description: I love this smitten and its location. You can grab a pizza in the adjacent food area or just chill with your ice cream in the park! Have tried their earl grey tea, lemon ginger, and mint flavored and all of them are to die for. I love the fact that they have a rotating lineup of ice creams and who doesn't like ice cream made with liquid nitrogen? I never add any additional toppings to my ice cream because I think it tastes perfect the way it is. They also got root beer floats which I am dying to try.
author: Song V.

description: Tried a flavor I hadn't seen before - sweet corn and berries.  Wow, what an amazing flavor - the best ice cream I've ever had (dethroning Humphry Slocomb's secret breakfast).  The rich corn taste was so surprising yet made so much sense as an ice cream flavor.  Just incredible.
author: Simon L.

description:
I never seen liquid nitrogen used to make ice cream before, so it was fun experience. I got the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread with TCHO chocolate sauce on top. YUM! The ice cream itself was smooth and creamy. You can't sample flavors ahead of time, so you need to go out of whim and hope you like it.

If I was going to choose between Smitten and Birite, I have to go to with Birite. Also I didn't realize Blue Bottle was around the corner. Eat ice cream and get a good cup of coffee afterwards!
author: Rhoda G.

description:
It's definitely not your usual ice cream from a grocery store. Sure, it's more expensive that with $5 you can get two containers at a grocery store if it goes on sale. BUT hey, it's all made from natural ingredients & Smitten's ice cream is 100X tastier & they make it right in front of you! What can beat that.

I got the "Fresh Mint Chip" with TCHO chocolate drizzle. I took the first bite and it was cold, creamy and minty-like the plant. With the chocolate chunks in it, it makes each bite even more enjoyable. 

S got the "Vanilla with salted caramel drizzle". It was the perfect lightness and doesn't leave that heavy sugar & cream after-taste like a container of vanilla from a store. It was delicious, but it gotten a little fluffy once it started melting.

There was also a "Blood Orange" option on the menu which is pretty interesting, but I didn't have the guts to try it. Hmm... if someone does try it, let me know how it tastes!

Hands down, this is one of the best ice cream place in the city!
author: Jane C.

description:
There is the novelty and gimmick factor of having the liquid nitrogen frozen ice cream which does wear off after a couple of visits.  The lines can be long because they make ice cream to order.  That said, as ice cream goes, this is my favorite ice cream in the city.  In the interest of disclosure, I dont need fancy and weird flavors.  I judge ice cream on mouth feel and temperature and flavor. The flavors are very true.  You really taste what the flavor is called.  That said, they usually only have ~4 flavors at a time.  My favorite is the vanilla.  If that is too boring, throw on some Tcho crisps and you will be happy.  The mint chip is good as well as the earl grey when they are available.  Also like the rhubarb.  Each of these flavors are just the right amount of sweet and true to flavor.  

Options that I didnt like as much were the Tcho Chocolate and the salted caramel.  They both had good mouth feel but too sweet for my personal taste.  

So the place is not perfect, so why 5 stars, well it is the creamiest cup of ice cream I have had while having the firmness to offer a unique mouth feel.  To that end, I think the gimmick of the liquid nitrogen is more than a gimmick.  Lastly, their house made cones are awesome.  Not offer not only a nice crunch, they also deliver great flavor to go with the ice cream.
author: Scott C.

description:
I think of smitten as one large, dippin dot! 

TCHO chocolate - 60%cocoa, It's such creamy texture that I felt the chocolate was a tad bit mild. Still delicious, don't get me wrong.

GET IT WITH THE CONE. Buttery, sweet, 
crispy goodness that marries so well with your icecream. Get textures together! 

Because they use liquid nitrogen, it's really cool to watch! However $5.75 for a small scoop of icecream with a cone is running a little steep. Especially when your semi-lactose intolerant and you know you'll have regrets when all that milk registers in your system.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
One of the first liquid nitrogen ice cream places I've been to but now it doesn't really stack up to most other ice cream places with the same concept.

They do have intriguing flavors and the ice cream does have a fresh taste, but honestly it's just okay.
author: Francis R.

description:
Smitten, where have you been all my life?

I've never been to an ice cream shop where I couldn't sample the flavors before making a decision. Since all the ice cream here is made to order, I took a leap of faith and chose what sounded the most interesting. Smitten offers four choices, with vanilla and Tcho chocolate being its staple flavors and the other two flavors benign switched out depending on what's in season.

I ended up settling for a small blood orange with pistachio shortbread, one of the seasonal flavors, and loved the creamy, slightly Orange Creamsicle taste. The shortbread and pistachio pieces gave it a great texture. 

The neighborhood that the shop is in, Hayes Valley, is ridiculously quaint and makes for a nice evening stroll and window shopping, ice cream in hand. I love that there's a location in Los Altos for those in the South Bay who don't want to drive up but still want access to excellent ice cream.
author: Rachel L.

description:
four stars for delicious, creamy, nitrogen-frozen ice cream.

I went for the plain ol' vanilla flavor and it was glorious.  they recommend adding the malted caramel syrup on top, but I recommend adding whipped cream. Line gets a little long at times, but you won't mind on a sunny day- it's gorgeous here.  Eat at the park across the way or while shopping the boutiques in Hayes Valley. Even with it's limited flavor selection, Smitten might just be my favorite place in the city. If you are in the area, you definitely should check this place out.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Amazing Ice cream! When it's made fresh in front of your eyes, the texture of the ice cream is smooth, silky, to another level.

Be prepared to wait, however, the wait is worth it if you are an ice cream lover. However, be prepared to spend, a small scoop is $4.75. It is worth is though, because the scoops are pretty rich and heavy. I had the chocolate with spicy caramel sauce, it was a delicious combination

However, I think most of the hype around this place is watching ice cream made in front of your eyes. Personally not sure if I want to come back to spend $5 on one scoop of ice cream, but it is definitely an experience worth trying!
author: Karina S.

description:
YOU MUST GET THE MINT CHIP. lol at $6 bucks for a little cup - it is definitely a pricey treat. However, I'm worth it =P The Mint chip is amazing, fresh mint flavor; none of that artificial flavoring with yummy chips! 

The texture of the ice cream is very creamy and smooth. It's a simple concept that I should have started a little stand to sell it, but didn't lol. I could be making millions right now!!

Anyways, I don't think i need to elaborate too much. Here are some tips...
- Get the Regular size, because if you get the small you will be sad when it's gone
- Mint chip and vanilla are the flavors to go
- homemade whipped cream
- almond brittle
- takes card 
- can be hard to find parking
- $4.50 for small and $6 for regular plus extra for toppings
- grab it and chill at the park

yay! =] I will surelllyyy be back!
author: Judy W.

description: Alright, I've been converted and am now a Smitten fan. I've had the mint chocolate chip a few times now and actually really enjoy it. I love the fresh mint taste and appreciate that it isn't too sweet. I've also had the earl grey flavor and that was super good! Unfortunately, I don't see that flavor as often. I do wish they rotated their flavors more often so I could try more things but mint chocolate chip never fails.
author: Krishna S.

description:
mmmmmmm mmmmm I happen to have gone to the newly opened Smitten in Los Altos and was not too impressed.

Thinking I would have the same encounter in San Francisco, I was very wary of the fact that it wouldn't be that great.

Turns out this location makes it good! I had the blood orange which was quite tasty.
author: Michelle T.

description:
It's good and kind of a novelty the way it's made with liquid nitrogen which makes for perfectly creamy ice cream but it's definitely trendily pricey. 

There's plenty of other good ice cream in San Francisco so if you want the novelty of this place then by all means go for it but for me it's the type of place I'll get ice cream if I'm in Hayes Valley and really want ice cream but I probably won't go out of my way to come here.
author: Julie N.

description:
Each bite is a taste of heaven.. The ice cream is freshly made using liquid nitrogen in small batches (I think its like 4-6 servings per container). The result is ultra fresh, cold but oh so soft and creamy ice cream.
