description: Freshly made ice cream? What is not to like! My favorite is the mint chip since they use fresh mint (all fresh ingredients). The line can be long on a warm day but worth the wait. I am thankful that I don't live near here or it would be the death of me...:-)
author: Tracy L.

description:
I really wanted to love this ice cream. I mean, REALLY. I patiently waited in line for 30 minutes and happily forked over $6 for a tiny cup of salted caramel ice cream with chocolate drizzle because I LIVE for salted caramel and it was the perfect day for ice cream. I figured with a line around the block, I would at least get my time and money's worth. 

Well... Um... No. 

Honestly, I have to go agree with the other reviewers who have said the ice cream is just too sweet. This wouldn't necessarily bother me with any other flavor, but when you have advertised your ice cream as SALTED caramel, I'd better be able to taste the salt. This tasted like regular old caramel with fudgy drizzle. At half the price, this would have been ok. But not for $6 + 30 minutes. It just was not what I wanted it to be... Not even close. 

I'd really like to come back and try the sweet corn ice cream - they weren't offering it today, and I wonder if the sweetness wouldn't be quite as overbearing with a different flavor. However, I don't know that I'm willing to invest another 30 minutes of my time just to gamble on overpriced ice cream.
author: Megan H.

description: I am lactose intolerant, but can handle anything with buttermilk! I am so glad I was introduced to this place as it was one of the best ice creams I've had - Creme Fraiche with Pear Caramel! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF!
author: A M.

description:
Super cute, located centrally in Hayes Valley. Take your scoop and walk around the adorable neighborhood, or just sit under the refurb shipping container and take in the novelty.

The flavors are definitely good. I had the rhubarb crisp, which was excellent, kinda different, liked the extra texture. Thenot  tcho was super chocolatey-heavenly, and my friend enjoyed the vanilla.

The liquid nitrogen makes the ice cream uber creamy, but also kinda too soft. Also means it takes a little while to make your ice cream, and you can't do multiple flavors in one cup, no matter what size. It's also the most expensive ice cream ever, damn.

Definitely more of a novelty, glad I tried it but not sure I'd be going back anytime soon.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: impossible to find street parking. 5 min wait to order. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: fast food to go style. Clean. Very clear and transparent ambiance. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: the ice cream was very smooth. This instant flash freeze way of making ice cream forms smaller ice crystals leading to smoother consistencies. I really enjoyed the texture, but I wish the flavors were better. 

_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

So smooth
author: Elliott N.

description:
Wow. Smitten, I am in love. 
Things to note:
1. No samples
2. No combining flavors
The reason for this is that they make your ice cream to order in the liquid nitrogen ice cream maker, they make precisely the size for one serving and they don't have extra laying around for samples.

Do not be deterred by the unconventional rules. This ice cream is the creamiest I've ever had. The texture is perfect- just the tiniest bit softer than normal, and so tasty. They use great local, organic ingredients.

You'll be in utter bliss here. Do it.

Random thinfs:
The shop is tiny, but super adorable. It's also partially open-air.
They have 4 flavors on the menu each day, and these rotate.
Servers were pleasant but not overly friendly.
author: Emma G.

description:
(See pics) Review #1312. I wanted to be smitten by it but I was not. Granted the process was mesmerizing to see how the ice cream was made with the nitrogen liquid, and it's in the middle of a tented outdoors place right in Hayes Valley.

The ice cream itself was creamy. However, the TCHO chocolate was a bit too sweet for my taste.  So next review / stop was Ritual next door.
author: T L.

description:
THE best ice cream.....period. The most amazing texture - what ice cream is supposed to be.
Really unique space.....Go.
author: Tara B.

description: Cool concept of making fresh ice cream for you in front of you... Salted caramel was delicious although I am biased towards bi-rite will have to come back for chocolate.
author: Vibhor C.

description:
What an amazing concept - liquid nitrogen forcing milk, sugar, and magical goodness to change milk's phase into frozen delight.

The apple pie flavor was like eating a real apple pie.

Excellent.
author: Julia P.

description:
Decadent, truly decadent and incredibly well flavored. Texture of dreams. 

There is no way I can eat an entire chocolate cone by myself. 

And pretty much every single day since I went 3-ish months ago and had their dark chocolate ice cream on a waffle cone, that is what I want to do anytime anyone says dessert.
author: Emily D.

description:
The fact that they don't make (as in, FREEZE) your ice cream til you order it made this place pretty awesome.  We ordered, then watched them pour ingredients into a freezing cold bowl and turn the mixing arms on.  Dry ice-type fog dramatically rose up from each mixing bowl - neato!

The finished products:

Sticky Toffee Pudding - OMG, date pieces made even chewier from the cold, creamy and perfectly sweetened brown sugary ice cream, and topped with whipped cream. One of the best ice creams I've ever had - taste, texture, balance of sweetness, it had it all!

TCHO 60.5% Dark Chocolate - super smooth, rich and creamy and chocolatey.  Very much like a gelato in mouth feel.  Unfortunately, just too sweet for my palate.

4oz (small) for $4.75 was well worth it.  I am indeed smitten : ).
author: Lucy Y.

description:
Cute ice cream spot, especially for a date (on a warm day). There's only a few flavors each day but plenty of toppings. Some seating inside but there's a park with benches right outside. 

Ice cream, great consistency. You can watch it get made too so that's pretty cool. I've had the salted caramel flavor twice, it's delicious. A friend had the cookie dough flavor and he was very happy with it. Stay away from the "spicy caramel sauce" as a topping though (unless you like very strong flavors)
author: Pallavi K.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with the family and I must say it was a unique place to grab some ice cream. With many great ice cream places in S.F. I had to explore more to suggest to my friends. 

I came when around 10pm and there were 2 flavors left instead of 3. The sea salt was sold out and I really wanted to try that one! Nevertheless, I got the fresh mint with chocolate sauce since i LOVE minty ice cream. 

Ice cream: WOW is this what really mint ice cream taste like? I been deceived from all the other generic mint ice cream I had in the past. This was really strong and it felt like I was eating those mint leaves that you eat in PHO haha. 

We also got the strawberry balsamic and it was really good Like a refreshing smoothie compress in a small cup!  

I definitely instagramed the way the workers were making the ice cream using liquid nitrogen and the machines called "Kelvin" was a really cool process to see. Definitely a place to try! 

One star taken away because it was hard to find parking!
author: Adam J.

description:
My kids were captivated by the liquid nitrogen. I will admit it's pretty cool to watch ... but at the end of the day it's still ice cream. Vanilla is vanilla, chocolate is chocolate. Compared to big players like BR31, I don't think the ice cream here was significantly different. Maybe we're just too simple of a people for a place like this. However, if you're on vacation and you're only going to stop in once then go for it.

We all had vanilla with cookie dough and the cookie dough chunks had pretzels in them. That's not bad but it was a little unexpected. All of us would have preferred that the pretzels weren't there.
author: Boris S.

description:
Across from Biergarten, it's perfect for when you're drunk and need a little something sweet. So we headed here to have some ice cream. It's the whole liquid nitrogen thing which is in everywhere it seems, but I was expecting a bit more interesting flavors like some of the other places have. The flavors were pretty standard though.

My friends kept saying that the owner of the place invented the process of using liquid nitrogen to make ice cream. I really didn't believe that at all, but it turns out they invented some sort of special attachment to a stand mixer to make the ice cream (although if you have liquid nitrogen and a stand mixer at home, one is perfectly capable of doing the exact same thing).

I don't even remember which I had, but I did add the spicy caramel which was actually quite spicy, and I highly recommend it. I also added some sort of nuts. So overall I paid about 9 bucks for ice cream that really wasn't amazingly memorable (except for the caramel).

So while it's good ice cream, the price tag just seems way to high to justify repeat visits. However, when you're drunk, maybe that idea will be different...
author: Grant T.

description: The. Best. Ice cream. Ever. SOOOO smooth. So creamy. Vanilla with brown sugar sauce and oatmeal cookie crumble is nuts.
author: Emily G.

description:
Showed up buzzed last night and got the sticky toffee pudding flavor with the hybrittle.

Rather than getting a huge boost in satisfaction from my inebriated state, the experience was a bit lackluster. The consistency of the ice cream was a bit offputting and the overall taste was mediocre.

After you get past the novelty of Smitten ice cream, you realize what it really is...underwhelming and overpriced.
author: Nick W.

description:
This is the perfect name for this cool spot in Hayes Valley. All of their ice cream is made to order, so plan on waiting about 15-20 minutes for your scoops. It is definitely worth it though! I had the pleasure of trying out their salted caramel flavor and it was so savory I didn't want it to end. 

Situated right across from the park, Smitten is in the perfect location to pick up a scoop and walk across the st. to enjoy your treat. The fact that it was a sunny day in SF made it even more enjoyable.

Note to those who are lactose intolerant: take a Lactaid before you eat this ice cream...it's rich and creamy, lol.
author: Richard K.

description:
I'm so in love with this place! It's such great ice cream and you can enjoy it at the cute little park right across from it. I've been to a similar place called creamistry down south and this place is so much better. It's creamier and less icier. The only thing that I'm not such a huge fan of is their few selections of Flavors. At least at creamistry you could customize your own ice cream. It's probably because this place is so small and is in a small area, but I think their business would go up more if they had more than 4 flavors a day. But all in all the quality of their ice cream is great. The small goes a long way! I got the regular last time and it was just way too much ice cream! 

Also, it's kinda hard to find parking. So try finding parking spots a block away from there!
author: Christine N.

description: I am so impressed with the "make it right in front of you" ice-cream! just like the pour over artisan coffee from Philz, each order was made fresh. The salted caramel was just amazing with the right balance or sweet and saltiness. The drawback? Long lines and wait times of course, but with the cool ice creamer making machine right in front of you spitting our liquid nitrogen, that's enough entertainment to keep you occupied.
author: Lily T.

description:
I am sensitive to dairy but that didn't stop me from trying their ice cream when they launched long back. The ice cream was good and it was impossible to not try it. I have tried their freshly prepared Vanilla, Chocolate and Caramel ice cream - not out of this world, but good. They make the ice creams right in front of you. 

I see now they have vegan ice cream which is good. I have yet to try their vegan offerings. 

I would love for them to make more freshly homemade vegan flavors with dairy-free ingredients!
author: Sun B.

description:
Okay, I'll admit it- having ice cream made from scratch in front of you IS actually cool. When that ice cream is plain and $6 bucks, though, the "special effects" don't quite do it for me.

Maybe I'm just cheap, or maybe I'd rather have a pint of Ben & Jerry's or Dreyer's instead- but I'm not entirely sold on this place. Major points for the unique idea, though.
author: Stephen D.

description:
What sets Smitten apart from other ice cream shops?

Liquid Nitrogen ice cream!

It was pretty cool to see them make the ice cream with all these liquid nitrogen retro machineries displayed as you order and wait for your thick and creamy goodiness.

Flavors rotate on a regular basis in case you become a regular and get scared that you will be bored of it. 

It's not quite the place to hangout in the winter since they have benches outside and inside.  So stay warm as you eat your ice cream!
author: Kathy D.

description: Really clean and well designed space with a really sweet backstory (pun intended). The maple brown sugar pumpkin was great. If you come in make sure to read the story for the places origin story too.
author: Mike Q.

description:
Yeah, science!! This place makes fresh liquid nitrogen ice cream. I had the sticky toffee ice cream which was pretty good! It was a smooth consistency with small chewy toffee bits. There was a little bit of a powdery aftertaste which didn't bother me too much but would've been better without it. The place is pretty pricey, parking is hard to find, and there is a long line but it's worth it for the experience.

$4.25- small (one scoop)
$6-regular (about 3 scoops)
$11- pint
author: Jenann P.

description:
I've previously spent three summers of my life working at Baskin Robbins, so I was a bit doubtful when a friend told me I could go to Smitten and taste ice cream like none I had ever had before. I mean, I've scooped through over 60 flavors of ice cream in those past three summers ranging from Vanilla to Rock n' Pop Swirl Sherbet. What could possibly surprise or impress me after that? 

Well, consider me impressed. I didn't find the flavor to be too special (lemon gingersnap), but the texture of the ice cream elicited a double take from me. So smooth!! They use some special patented technology to whip their liquid nitrogen into tiny crystals that result in smooth ice cream but this smoothness also affects the experience of biting through the ice cream. Instead of your teeth digging through rough layers of ice cream, they effortlessly glide through the ice cream which is an experience unlike any I've ever had with ice cream. The first time I ate it, I was honestly confused and not quite sure that I had eaten ice cream. Whatever technology they are using to make this ice cream smooth, it's working. 

Beyond that, the store gets points for atmosphere. It's located next to a park that just puts you in the mood for ice cream. And they state that they are committed to sustainability which is always a plus for me. They also use Square credit card readers, giving them a super contemporary feel to them. 

Definitely worth a try.
author: Philip W.

description:
Genuine kid opinions:

Sarah, age 8: "Yum! Delicious and home made in front of your eyes. The best ice cream place I've ever been. But I still like my kitties more."

Ethan, age 10: "It's good."
author: Al S.

description:
This place is a fun place to watch ice cream get made with nitrogen...

This place is not a place to go to when you are in a hurry it takes awhile from waiting in line to waiting to get your ice cream...

I got the mint chocolate chip... It was too minty for me ...had to throw some of it away..

This ice cream is not cheap... More for the experience of watching ice cream get made.
author: Omi Y.

description:
Very very good ice cream. Creamy and delicious.
Expensive ($4 a scoop) 
the flavors are limiting (salted caramel was delicious!)
The shop is inside an old shipping container which is very eco-friendly. I love the neighboring park and the hayes valley is a really cool and unique area.
author: Amanda C.

description: This is the best ice cream in the city! Better than Bi-rite and Mitchell's. It doesn't get fresher than this. Everything is made to order with liquid nitrogen. I got the cookie dough with pretzel pieces which was delicious. My friend got the strawberry white balsamic which to my surprise was even better than mine. It tasted like you were eating fresh strawberries. The waffle cones are made fresh daily and so good. Even the homeless guy in there spent his $5 on an ice cream instead of booze or drugs. That's how good it is.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
This location is the best because it is right on the park in Hayes Valley - surrounded by other great places like the Juice Shop and Ritual Coffee. Michael is the greatest - he is always patient with everyone answering questions and trying to pick flavors. He is especially kind to the kids (mine always want to know about the flavors) and he is so nice about it!! He even gave my daughter a cheeseburger sticker and remembered our names the next time we saw him. Now, for the ice cream - just know that it will be the BEST you've ever had - the creamiest most luxurious ice cream experience. I go every week now and every flavor is out of this world amazing. The cones are even something to be totally savored and enjoyed. Best time to go is between 4-6 on weekdays. I always find a parking spot and the line is only a few people deep.
LOVE!
author: Bea K.

description:
Smitten is one of those ice cream spots you HAVE to try on your own and disregard whatever mixed opinions you hear. If you're the least bit curious, like I was, taste for yourself. I definitely didn't regret it. 

Walking in, the Brittle Me This sundae special snatched my attention. Vanilla ice cream made w/ liquid nitrogen, brown sugar caramel, pistachio brittle, and whipped cream. Faithful to chocolate as I am, I was pleasantly surprised at how smooth, light, and creamy the vanilla was! Surely, one of the best vanilla ice creams I've had. Now the brown sugar caramel was sweet but complimented the light vanilla nicely. The pistachio brittle was my favorite part of the sundae. Just the right balance of nut and crunch. My soul was happy. 

So the gimmicks of Smitten definitely attract the crowd. Using liquid nitrogen, for one. Two, the place is an old ship container, cleaned out and simply decorated to make it into the green-friendly ice cream shack it is (all cups and spoons are compostable as well). San Francisco WOULD be the city to appreciate Smitten's character. Lastly, the liquid nitrogen ice cream machine is named Kelvin (get it?!) and that tickled the science nerd in me. Lol. 

The ice cream is a few more dollars than I'm used to, but I'll give the quality the credit. The shack doesn't have tables but is lined with benches. It's located next to a small park too so it's easy to find a spot and enjoy your scoops. 

Bottom line, Smitten delivered well last night!
author: Millie Mae H.

description:
Sweet corn & berries with a Strawberry Prosecco sauce?  Get. Out. Of. Town.

Seriously - get out so there's more ice cream for me!

Love Smitten.  The people and the Ice Cream are fantastic - and they work with community non profits (like giving stickers to volunteers at the Food Bank) every once in a while.
author: Katy M.

description:
Easily the best ice cream in the world. I dare you to find me a smoother ice cream! So smooth. So simple. So good! Liquid Nitrogen is magic, yo! You have to try this stuff. I can't eat any other ice cream after Smitten. The only downside about smitten is that it's flavors aren't as creative as places like Bi-Rite and Mitchell's. However, the smoothness and simplicity are so worth it!

Not super cheap ice cream though...
author: Andrew O.

description:
Fun neighborhood and hot weather makes for great ice cream. Though the long lines was a bit rough during the hot winter day (yes it was winter and yes it was hot cali weather), the ice cream made me melt. 
I ordered the meyers lemonnginger snap in a waffle cone and it was the perfect combo of sweet, tangy, and spice. Because all their ice creams are made from a milk base blended with liquid nitrogen, the ice cream was super smooth and creamy. 
Order the waffle cone ! You wont regret it. It was the perfect complement to the ice cream abd its freshly made so it tasted that much better. Worse comes to worse I'd just buy the waffle cone itself...it was that good! 

Cons: unfortunately it's a small shack and since its always made on the spot, the flavors are limited to 4 choices and prices are not cheap but think of it as the cost of labor for those nice men working the nitrogen machines :)
author: Mary M.

description:
MMMMMMMMM! One of the most delish ice creams I have had. It is so nice & creamy and seriously melts in your mouth. 
This is the first time I have had made to order ice cream. I got the "chocolate" ice cream with a spicy caramel sauce. Yummy! I forgot what my friend got, but it was yummy too.
There is a little park right outside & it's a decent place to sit and enjoy. Smitten itself has  2 long benches to sit. 
Each scoop was about $4-$5.
author: Sarika S.

description:
Pros: 
- no line when I got there
- ice cream is made on the spot

Cons:
- only had two flavors (salted caramel and an olive oil with lavender?) that day so not a lot of variety
- I ordered the salted caramel and it was probably the sweetest dessert I've ever had.

When I got my ice cream, it felt like I was eating purely the liquid used to make the ice cream. I had three other friends with me who all got salted caramel, so the girl just ended up making ours all at once. I'm hoping she made a mistake measuring because I really wanted to give this place a good rating. I probably wouldn't come back here again.
author: Julie P.

description:
It's novel to see ice cream made fresh on the spot, but it may not be worth the price of $6 for two small scoops in a regular cup.  The mint chocolate chip ice cream had a strong mint flavor, but melted quickly to milk before  I could finish such a small portion.  It would have been disastrous if I had ordered it in a cone.  Nonetheless, some locals will become smitten with this fad especially if the other flavors (e.g., butter pecan, vanilla, chocolate) are better.

Service is friendly, but a bit slow especially on a hot, summer day.  Parking is tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: We toured several ice cream places in our 3 day trip to SF. This placed had a lot of hype. It was good, but not as great as others in nearby neighborhoods. If you haven't tried made-to-order ice cream from liquid nitrogen, I still highly recommend going for the experience. For us, the review may be biased by the extremely long line, and the very slow wait-staff. We got the caramel which was smooth in texture and tasty, but just not worth that line and price.
author: Tom S.

description: Thinking about this place makes me want their ice cream again. I'm a super ice cream fan so even though it was like 60 degrees outside I still wanted to get ice cream. This place freshly makes their ice cream as we order them. It was entertaining to watch the process of using liquid nitrogen to make ice cream. I got the vanilla ice cream with TCHO chocolate topping, not sure what TCHO is but it's basically chocolate drizzled on top of the ice cream. I usually don't like toppings on my ice cream but this is so good. The vanilla ice cream itself is also very delicious, very different consistency and texture compared to normal ice creams, tasted super smooth. The only negative I would say about this is that they only do one flavor per cup, no matter how large the cup size is, and I'm a fan of trying multiple flavors.
author: Beth H.

description:
Cool setup for an ice cream shack - they repurposed a shipping container.

Line wasn't too crazy when we were there. It was kinda cool that they made the ice cream in front of you, but there wasn't a whole lot to see really. 

Slightly more creamy than normal ice cream; a little more like gelato. The chocolate is pretty sweet, but still good. Wasn't a big fan of the salted caramel. 

It's a novel place to bring guests if you happen to be in Hayes Valley or plan to wander around there. But if you're interested in 'especially good ice cream', there are other places for that. 

They take card with Square.
author: An Y.

description: The first time I tried Smitten's, I ordered a salted caramel which was just average. I thought it was pretty expensive even without extra toppings. Today, I decided to order mint chocolate chip. I added the tcho chocolate drizzle. I am not a fan of the ice cream at all. It tasted like dishwasher to me. The whole thing was just unpleasant to finish. I don't expect to pay $6 for bad ice cream. Will not be coming back, ever.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Very delicious ice cream, perfect for a fun date. This is an artisan ice cream shop that focuses on using the freshest and most flavorful ingredients. They make some "standard" combinations, but put a very unique spin to an old favorite. The fresh mint LITERALLY tastes like you're eating mint leaves (in the most delicious way!)

The blood orange with pistachio shortbread is, so far, my favorite! It's a "March only" flavor, which is DEPRESSING, but I'm looking forward to see what other flavors Smitten has to offer. 

Kinda pricey ($4.45 for a small - although it's plenty of ice cream) but WELL worth it considering the experience and quality ingredients.
author: Tosca B.

description:
I love the novelty and the idea of liquid nitrogen frozen ice cream. We had the Pumpkin and Salted caramel. Pricing is okay, but on the high side. I think over here is just eating novelty ice cream.

Pumpkin was slightly gritty from the pumpkin puree; salted caramel was really good.

Would I come back? Probably not.... Not when I can get Gelato or Bi-Rite. The texture was really smooth but Frozen Custard has nearly the identical texture at half the price!
author: Vicky L.

description:
What a gem! And it's tucked away in the cutest part of the city. Everything about this ice cream stand screams Hayes Valley - and I love it. 

You can't miss this one - on any given day, there's a line out their stand, ice cream swirling, and people sitting on the grass nearby with cupfuls of strawberry balsamic (only the best flavor ever). They use real ingredients - mint ice cream uses mint leaves, as an example. Although their mixtures of flavors aren't always crafted perfectly (some do taste a bit strange), I appreciate the concept, the ambiance, their mission to create unique ice cream, and the magic behind liquid nitrogen. I always find myself coming back for a small cup when I'm in the area!
author: Sally C.

description: I love this place because of the science behind how they make the ice cream. The salted caramel was AMAZING, and the lemon ginger snap with brown sugar. Must come!
author: Vinson H.

description: Absolutely loved the ice cream and overall experience, will be coming back regularly. SO and I split the sundae which was more than enough for two. Ice cream was rich, smooth and creamy with great mouth feel. The whip cream and toppings were just the right complement for a decadent dessert.
author: N A.

description: Smitten is definitely overhyped. I do not understand why I have to wait forever for ice cream that is just okay. Every time I have come here, the flavor selection is very small and my ice cream melts really fast. I understand that they are making it fresh right in front of you, but it's just like benihana for ice cream - expensive and alright. I'll stick with the other SF staples for ice cream: Mitchell's, Bi Rite, Humphrey's, Polly Ann's, etc.
author: Breniel L.

description: While I lived in Hayes for two years, this was my go to ice creams shop since it was so close. Since moving, I occasionally visit when I'm in the area it if the other shops are closed. They typically run out of flavors by the end if the day so try to get there before dinner time.   It's always fun to watch them make your order but other than that, it's not that interesting. Flavor options, they stick to their main offerings and occasionally offer one new one. I tend to order anything with TCHO chocolate in it.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Cool Sunshine + Warm Greeting + Liquid Nitrogen Fog +

6 oz. of Spice and Pumpkin Flavor Filled Ice Cream + ($6) + Salty 'n Cinnamon-y Batter Bakery Cookie Crumbles + ($.50) + 

6 oz. of Classic Vanilla Ice Cream + ($6) + Chocolate Covered TCHO Nibs + ($.75) + Brown Sugar Caramel Drizzles + ($.25) + Crumbly Soft Pizzelle "Cone" + ($.75) + 

1 Refusal to Say "Smitten with Smitten" + 4 Blue Angels Overhead = 

OCTOBER IN SF

-------------------
Update 10/2012:

Note to Self:  Salty Caramel was more sweet than salty.  Stay Pumpkin-y my friends!

-------------------
Update 4/2013

Note to Self:  Smitten's uniquely delicious Rhubarb is our new favorite flavor!  With the addition of cookie crumbles, it'll remind you of a great new take on rhubarb pie.
author: Amy C.

description:
I have no problem with the ice cream itself. The ice cream is good.

HOWEVER the service definitely made my sweet and delicious ice cream taste so bitter. Maybe we caught them on a bad night. Maybe we were assholes. No, I doubt that. They were also assholes to the customers in front of us too. 

There are so many other places with awesome ice cream that matches their awesome service. I'm reluctant to come back here.

Hilarious points for playing R&B love songs that night. They played such steamy music to go along with their cold service.
author: Hayne P.

description: Wow!!! I never knew they could make ice cream right in front of you and endless possibilities of flavors!!! So we had the blue bottle espresso with the Techo crunch pieces and chocolate Techo syrup.  So delicious and such a great treat for my birthday, and such a nice day in the city.
author: Shantiel P.

description:
Really really good ice cream. Vanilla tastes amazing like a rich froyo. Handmade right in front of you. Housemade Cone for an extra $1 is amazing!! Must have and I think they put a bit more ice cream in it :). Can't believe I lived so close for two years and never made it until now. 
 
Didnt have as many options today, but vanilla was the one we wanted. 

So good. Must go.
author: Candice H.

description: WOW. The best ice cream I've ever had. They only have a few options but that's because they make it right in front of your eyes. It's so smooth and creamy. Wish there was one in Elk Grove or sacramento.
author: Bilal R.

description: Great great place to get ice-cream. It never fails me. There earl grey ice-cream is bomb. I tried so many flavors it hard to keep up with it because they are all amazing.
author: Anriella D.

description:
Loved this place - loved the ice cream even more.  BUT the best part was - the staff told us we could bring our dog inside.  It was not warm outside and I wasn't too keen on waiting - or sitting - outside, with ice cream, no less. 
Really neat to see the machinery work and the flavors are unusual - and very high quality (serving are generous too). 
Staff couldn't have been more friendly and one of the members of our group received two $2.00 off coupons b/c (according to them) she had to wait so long for her order.
author: B B.

description: Honestly this place lives up to its name which is initially why I chose it. Interesting flavors, on par pricing, I went for the sundae and never regret it for a second. Very romantic "smitten alley" outdoor seating features an interesting mural and perfect lighting in the evening. Highly recommend.
author: Lauren K.

description:
QUALITY: 5 stars
-liquid nitrogen ice cream made to order
-innovative and delicious 
-true flavor of the ingredients really come out in the ice cream. Ex: mint ice cream tasted like a mojito. Actual mint!
-smaller ice crystals for smoother faster dissolving ice cream

PRICE: 3 stars 
-regular size (2 scoops) about $5
- a little pricey but it sure is fancy to watch make it

SERVICE: 4 stars
-no complaints, normal
-benches and wind blocking tent walls

OVERALL: def worth trying and watching them make the ice cream. And tastes great too.
author: Tony W.

description:
Oh-ho. Trying to hide from me and make it so difficult to park that I may not be able to partake of your goodness, eh?

Well, I lucked out when I went to lunch with my niece and she helped me discover you, little gem. I get a kick out of the experience of watching the ice cream being made, and I just love the plain chocolate flavor on a waffle cone. It's way better than gelato. It melts pretty quickly, though. I wouldn't suggest jumping back in your car and attempting to flee the scene, ice cream in hand - which is what I did and ended up with a lot of the ice cream on my shirt and all over my hand instead of in my stomach, where it should've landed. 

I've told my kids about it. And we're coming back. :)
author: Trish A.

description: Smitten is good but not my favorite. It's cool they make it with liquid nitrogen but the ice cream I get is never that good. The rest of my family seems to really like it so when we go I always get tcho chocolate because it is rich and creamy. But not all there flavors are good like that and there toppings aren't the best but I have to say they do have a good waffle cone.
author: Gigi G.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD! 
Now that I've got that out of the way, let me tell you why. The ice cream is fresh, melts-in-your-mouth smooth and made right in front of you, with a pretty awesome spectacle of liquid nitrogen being poured onto the ice cream machines. We were here on a Saturday night at around 10:30 pm for late-night dessert and there was a pretty long line outside the place! There's some seating area inside the place but there's enough open space outside to hang out and devour your ice cream. There was also some street art installations nearby that were pretty interesting.

Now to the fun part! Their flavors are seasonal and not too many, but do NOT let that bring you down. They are more than enough! We tried three of their flavors - TCHO 60.5% chocolate, fresh mint chip and blue bottle espresso - and boy oh boy were they mind-blowing!!! If the espresso was super coffee-y, the mint chip was unlike any mint ice cream I have ever had. It was like eating fresh mint leaves in ice cream form. No other way to describe it. And the TCHO chocolate, what can I say - it was like eating a chocolate bar that melted while in your mouth. We loved the chocolate and mint chip ice cream so much, we just HAD to get back in line to get some pint boxes of ice cream to take back home to the south bay!! I will be back as often as possible!
author: Spry I.

description: Best ice cream I've ever tasted! THCO Chocolate  is extra creamy and thick! My dad had the caramel. Cute story of how liquid nitrogen ice cream came to be! Quick service!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Short Story:
I'm smitten over Smitten Ice Cream!  :)

Long Story:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was a long line.  I got the salted caramel with chocolate.  It was a fantastic sunny day for this and I waited about 15 minutes in line and then 10 minutes after my order to get the ice cream.  It was really delicious and I am not an ice cream person!

So, I gotta say, I was impressed.  There are signs on the walls that show you how they got started and it's a real success story.  I'm impressed by tthem.

verdict:
I will definitely go back!  Woot!  :)
author: Michael W.

description:
Great, fantastic, super premium ice cream served here in a fun way.

Every time that I'm in San Francisco I make it a point to visit Smitten. Each of the ice cream flavors looks incredible but I always get the strawberry. I did notice this time that the ice cream looked a little bit too pink. However, whatever the color lacked the flavor made up for. 

Making the ice cream in such a fun, original, and colorful way makes this place a must visit for ice cream lovers of all ages.
author: Josh Q.

description:
When I reflect back on my wonderful week back in my home state, the first memory that pops up is eating from my Smitten tcho chocolate ice cream at the park on a lovely weekday afternoon in the city.

I usually don't like chocolate ice cream, but this one is so perfect! It's not too sweet. It's bold. It's dark chocolatey, creamy, smack-your-lips good. They do not carry many flavors, which allows them to focus on making their existing flavors damn good! Also, the workers look like mad scientists, whilst whipping up the ice cream in the liquid nitrogen machines.

I love it. And it tears my hearts up that I can only be in a long distance relationship with Smitten.
author: Emily T.

description:
Sweet corn heaven!  I've been here twice in the last month and have to say, I'm growing a tad of an addiction to that sweet corn ice cream here.  Think of your favorite bowl of cream of corn, think of the smoothest ice cream you've ever had (think more like gelato on smooth crack), and think of some sweet summer berries.. Put that all together and you'll have a little cup of heaven. 

If you really want to make a sick little remix, take a short stroll down to blue bottle, get yourself an espresso and come back here to make yourself the ultimate affogato!
author: Siao J.

description: Would've given this place a 5 star rating because it's cute, the ice cream there is amazing, but the little girl working the counter scored a zero on customer service. Very rude, either she was having a bad day or she doesn't like her job..
author: Shawna G.

description:
lovely! Do not be daunted by a long line, it goes by fairly quick. I got the nectarine honey ice cream and it was possibly the tastiest creamy delight i have ever tried. Not to mention that this season the nectarines have been ON POINT this year but the mix of flavors were great. They top it all off with nectarine honey as well so that gives an already flavorful icecream an extra punch. 

The people behind the counter are really friendly and it's really nice/fun to see the machines work!
author: Meena N.

description: Came here on a rainy Saturday night. It is located close to Japan town. Parking is easy to find after 8pm or later. My boyfriend and I got here and we found parking close by. The place was semi packed when we got there but the rush was gone soon after. There is a limited amount of flavors. I think about 4 different ones each day. I had the salted caramel and luckily it was buy 1 get 1 free! Awesome possum! This ice cream is made using nitrogen which is pretty cool. It's cool you can see them making your ice cream. One bite and it melts in your mouth right away. So yummy and sweet!  Super creamy too. The cashier guy was cool and he explained to us about the menu. We ordered, paid, and got our ice cream within minutes. Quality of ice cream was good, pricing is bit more than a normal scoop of ice cream, and customer service was good. The only thing that an ice cream lover can really complain is the amount of things on the menu. But I definitely will be back for some more!!
author: Monica W.

description: Checked this place out on a whim the other day out and about in the city. It's in a cool neighborhood. The line was LONG but it was worth it for the best experience. We had the salted caramel with spicy caramel sauce. So good!
author: Misty T.

description:
Interesting concept, definitely adds the WOW factor to ice cream. Reminds me of a couple high school science experiments I did.
I had vanilla, it was good. Bit spendy for ice cream, but I guess you pay for the experience. Only advice is to make sure the eco-friendly cups don't decompose before you finish your ice cream.
author: Amanda Y.

description: I used to love this place but tonight the ice cream was over churned, oily, and the texture of butter....super weird and gross....
author: Erica J.

description:
Random location, overpriced, and quite a long wait, but I guess it was a fun one-time experience I could've lived without. 

Pretty hipster truck located in an obscure part of SF with a small bench area under an overhang, lit with large lightbulbs. 

There are only 4 flavors/day (I think they alternate), which are written on a chalkboard  in addition to various toppings/drizzles and popular combos. Each flavor is made with liquid nitrogen in its respective machine so only one serving can be made at a time. (So if you order a popular flavor, be prepared to wait.) It's pretty cool to watch, but the ice cream itself isn't spectacular. I was surprised by the tiny portions. Not worth it in my opinion. Your money's probably going mostly to the liquid nitrogen.. 

I got the Creme Fraise with the Caramel Pear Drizzle, and my friends got the TCHO Chocolate and Vanilla so I got to try those too. They're all very creamy, super sweet, and melt quickly. I also kept getting small chunks of frozen cream/butter in every bite. They were all okay, but none were very memorable to make me want to come back again. 

Unless you really want to pay to see a little cloud of vaporizing nitrogen, I'd say take your $5-7 and buy 2 pints of ice cream at a grocery store instead.
author: Hye-Min O.

description: Cute concept using liquid nitrogen for ice cream making. BUT ON THE STREET? I understand that you have cover so that the customers don't have access to it but my mind can not let it pass that the store is pretty much on the street and wind blows here and there, and its not located in most luxurious (I mean clean) side of town either. however, the ice cream was tasty, I wouldn't say i'd buy it in buckets but it is a treat for now and then. the mint chocolate chip ice cream tasted like you're chewing on a piece of mint.... in general, overpriced per scoop, tastes great, your call:)
author: Anita L.

description:
Absolutely smitten with Smitten! One of my favorite ice cream places of all time.

Fresh ice cream made in front of your eyes with liquid nitrogen?? YES PLEASE. I have never been disappointed with any of Smitten's flavors. Their monthly flavors along with their regular flavors are so tasty. I can't choose a favorite because they're all just that good.

I prefer the Los Altos location to the SF one though. SF is always crowded and because of that, the texture of the ice cream isn't as consistent as the Los Altos location. The SF one also tends to give patrons their ice cream in a random order (people who ordered after me got their ice cream before me).
author: Ava S.

description: LOVED IT!!! The husband and I had just picked up a couple of salads for dinner, when we noticed the long line in front of Smitten. "Whatever that is, it must be good. Let's check it out." Ice cream that's made just for you,  with liquid nitrogen???  Why not?! We both got the TCHO 60.5% Chocolate; one with almonds, and one with oatmeal crunch. Good Lawd! That was some MIGHTY TASTY ice cream! Rich and creamy; smooth and chocolaty. . .It was LOVE on a spoon! Honey, my taste buds did a little DANCE, just to show their appreciation. The husband enjoyed it as much as I did; he's just a bit less vocal than I am.  We will definitely be back! Btw, it really IS pricey, but IMO, you get what you pay for.
author: Vertana G.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. The best ice cream in San Francisco, I have no words to even describe how crazy cool and yummy this place and ice cream is. it's a shoe box kinda place but it's so quaint.
author: Kyle D.

description: Super cool way to have ice cream! We got the TCHO chocolate with spicy caramel, and a vanilla with caramel. Friendly service. Didn't take very long to get our order. Rich, seems like a small portion but more than enough.
author: Barb C.

description:
"Liquid nitrogen? That belongs in the lab, not my ice cream" said all the skeptics.
Believe me, I was one. Then I came to see what the hype was about. And let me say this: my world has officially been rocked.

Yes, it is a bit more expensive, BUT you get to watch them mix the organic milk and cream into the "Brrr" machine with the cool smoky effects. Personally, I'd rather pay to watch my ice cream being freshly made than simply being scooped from a carton. The downside is that they have only 4 flavors available everyday. Also, try to avoid primetime dessert time (~9pm) if you hate lines. 

A small size of the TCHO chocolate was enough for me. It was extremely rich and creamy. Think of Lindor truffles melting right off your tongue.

If you're debating about what flavor to get, you can't go wrong with the vanilla. That's all my boyfriend gets at Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, etc and this is his new favorite. I don't know if that's a good or bad thing..
author: Ashley L.

description:
Vanilla with brown sugar caramel. tis good. 

I'm terrible at describing flavors but the vanilla is not too sweet, very creamy and... vanilla-y? -_- and the brown sugar caramel compliments it just SO well. Not sure about the other flavors and topping combos but this one is a thumbs up.
author: Chau T.

description: Cool concept, but the ice cream was a bit meh. I've tried vanilla (added some cookie dough with pretzels) and the salted caramel. The vanilla was almost like soft serve, not really the consistency I prefer. The cookie dough on top was dull. The salted caramel had a strange aftertaste. I'd rate it higher, but for the price, I left a bit underwhelmed.
author: Noah D.

description:
What other words describe "hype?" Definitely a fad.

Just because it's "cool" with the nitrogen-infused doesn't mean it tastes any better. The ice cream was way too sweet for me; the consistency was pretty drab. IDK, if I wanted soft serve, then I would have probably gotten soft serve.

Definitely prefer Bi-Rite over this trend.
author: Jamie Y.

description: So creamy and so smooth. It's like the ice cream version of a shaved snow to shaved ice. I can't believe how smooth it is. They make it in front of you. I mean, sure the ice cream tastes like ice cream, probably cause we just had the normal flavor of vanilla.  but I can't say enough how smooth the ice cream was. Pretty entertaining too. It's definitely worth checking out once.
author: Arnold W.

description:
Best ice cream I ever had.

I didn't had a long line, so I didn't see this problem.
I had some chocolate something and it was really great.

Also they had other flavors but they sounded a little weird.

If you don't like the ice cream than show me better ones.
author: Marc W.

description:
Ice cream made with liquid nitrogen in a shipping container that's been converted into a modern ice cream stand? YES!

This quite possibly could be the best ice cream I've ever had, which is saying something considering how many different brands, flavors, and places I've sampled over the years. My boyfriend took me here today and I ordered a scoop of the TCHO Chocolate; at $4.75 for a scoop I was a little surprised at the priciness, but the flavor and quality was outstanding.

Smitten's chocolate ice cream is some of the creamiest, richest, freshest, and most chocolatey that I've ever had, and I honestly never wanted it to end. As I'm writing this I'm feeling sad that I don't have another cup by my side to indulge in. Just wow. 

Aside from the priciness, it'd be nice if there were more flavors to try; aside from the chocolate there was honey nectarine (which sounded heavenly), mint chocolate, and vanilla, which are all great, but doesn't provide much variety. There are, however, various toppings and sides you can add to your ice cream to change things up, all at about fifty cents a topping.

The staff here was super friendly and the ice cream was made really fast. I would love to come back here for another scoop of chocolate and to give that honey nectarine a try. Even the business cards here were charming, made to look like old playing cards! Most definitely worth the trip.
author: Angela M.

description:
I believe that this is THE BEST ice cream that I have ever had.  My boyfriend and I shared a medium TCHO dark chocolate on a pizzelle cone ($6.75).  Sure it may seem a little pricier, but it is definitely worth the price.  The medium was actually plenty for my boyfriend and I, it was two scoops of very rich ice cream.  The cone was really tasty too.  It's thick and cookie-like.

So: the ice cream is great and the process is really cool too (I won't go into detail because you just have to see this yourself).  What are you waiting for? Go check it out!

Notes:
-They have heaters inside so don't even though it's not it's own building, it is warm enough in there.
author: Samantha L.

description: All that glitters is not necessarily gold. Not as good as it looks. Enjoy the liquid nitrogen smoke when making the ice cream but other than that, flavor and texture is below average, thus the 2 stars. Had the salted caramel, no saltiness or caramel flavor. Whoever thinks this rivals Bi-Rite's salted caramel, needs to get their taste buds checked. Even had it withe the pairing of cookie dough topping with chocolate sauce. Didn't help it. Other flavor I tried was the blood orange with pairing of Oatmeal crisp and caramel sauce. This was a bit better but nothing to rave about. Seems like a fun spot but I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Earvin T.

description: Long lines but the wait is worth it the ice cream is freshly made and you can watch it being made too! The ice cream was nicr and creamy I loved watching how the icecream was made!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
What happened to this place? My first visit here was about a year ago and the ice cream was super smooth and creamy in the good way and the experience made me want to recommend it to everyone.

I came here tonight and it was so different that I will not be back. I don't mind paying high prices for quality ice cream (which is my favorite food), but the quality here went into the ground... It was like frozen whipped cream. Are they just pumping air into it for higher profit margins? It melted very quickly after they got my order wrong with no apology. 

There are better ice cream places in the city...
author: Laura K.

description:
Some girl stole my ice cream!!!!!!!!!!!  :(

But luckily, I was paying attention, so I stole "Christina's" ice cream back. And the ice cream maker was kind enough to dump some pistachio brittles back in for me. Grrr!

It was fun watching them freeze their ice cream in small batches. And because they only have 4 Kelvins, they only make 4 flavors at a time. I tried the Fresh Mint with TCHO Chocolate bits adding Pistachio Brittles.  It actually tastes like fresh mint leaves! Definitely not your average mint ice cream from your average grocer.

Only thing I didn't appreciate was that they short changed me. Heck, they didn't give me my change at all! I was planning on giving the change as tip anyway but that wasn't the point! It was an expensive $5.25 for my single scoop and I handed them $6. While waiting I decided to look over to the ice cream making process and when I looked back, the cashier was already helping the next customer! I then learned that they ran out of quarters and the emotionless cashier never tried to explain what happened to my change!

Meh.
author: Athena L.

description:
Shivering and eating ice cream in 50 degree weather doesn't seem too appealing, but it is when you're eating Smitten ice cream. I've been a Bi-Rite fan for many years, but this may nudge it out since the lines are shorter, the salted caramel may be better, parking is marginally better than Dolores Park area, and the flavors rotate often.

The ice cream is fresh; they make it right in front of you. The salted caramel definitely gives Bi-Rite's a run for the money. My friend got the dark chocolate with chili sauce (it definitely has a kick at the end of each bite) and I got the meyer lemon gingersnap. I liked my lemon one, but next time I'll probably end up with salted caramel or chocolate.

They let you customize your flavors with add-in's, different cones, etc. It is not cheap, so expect to pay around what you pay for a pint of ice cream at the grocery store. But it's fresh delicious, indulgent and worth it for the occasional splurge (both $ and calories) I'm glad I don't live any closer since I'd probably be poor and a couple sizes bigger.
author: Christina L.

description: Great ice cream! And very unique idea (it's the only place I've seen that does flash freezing, anyway). I had the salted caramel with almond brittle. Was a bit sweet for my taste (I think that was my fault for adding brittle lol), but pairing it with Blue Bottle coffee was a perfect combination!
author: Bianca C.

description:
This is a fun place to go if you have friends in from outta town (in fact first take advantage of the tour at city hall (It is FREE and a great historical and informative tour of one of SF's most beautiful buildings)

anyway - back to the Ice Cream. This is like the DisneyLand of Ice Creams, sure, it was fun, but I've been there, done that (and seen the ice cream made) There are 3 featured flavors at a time (all with suggested toppings) and yeah, they are very good, but with all the hype I want more choices, so give me Bi-Rite or Humphrey Schombe in the Mission over this place. 

But again, go at least one to try it, it is fun to watch it being made, and yes it's pretty good.
author: Amy W.

description: Smitten is the best ice cream place around! I come here whenever I'm in San Francisco. My favorite ice cream is the TCHO chocolate with the spicy caramel sauce. So good!!
author: Trina R.

description:
Hayes Valley. Sunny Sunday. Outdoor event. Smitten Ice Cream. 

Now, I'm no expert at making ice cream, but I do adore the fact that these guys use only what's necessary to make what you order. 

I got the Creme Fraiche with Pear Caramel in a cup and it was most definitely the business. The smooth yet firm texture of the ice cream was what stood out to me. I'm not a huge fan of having chunks and bits incorporated into my ice cream so it was nice for me that  it was just that simple. Flavor was spot on. Not too rich with the right amount of sweetness that made me wished the bottom of my cup and I never came face to face. 

Their flavors change all the time so there's always a reason for me to come back. It just saddens me a bit to fall in love with a creation just to see it not be there the next time. Straight summertime sadness. 

WORD OF ADVICE: Just stick with the basics and get the recommendations that they include on the menu. They're usually a pretty good pairing.
author: Mike D.

description:
Smitten is a fun interactive ice cream shop.  Your ice cream is made as you order, so as you wait, you can watch the entire ice-cream-making process, which they do with liquid nitrogen. You can be sure your ice cream is made fresh. Their flavors change everyday, which is cool because every time will be a different experience. We got the strawberry balsamic (very fresh, although the balsamic was a bit too tart) and tcho chocolate with spicy caramel (chocolate was just perfect, but caramel wasn't spicy at and flavor was very faint).  

Would come again for new flavors.
author: Mark T.

description:
Even if you aren't interested in the unique preparation of their ice cream, you'd still be blown away by the amazing flavor and creaminess.  I had the salted caramel ice cream with caramel salt (I'm obsessed with caramel).  It had me torn between scarfing down and savoring each bite; it was that good.  

I have no idea who chose the playlist that day, but any place that plays SWV and Bell Biv Devoe automatically gets 5 stars.  Oh, and check out the backstory if you have time.  It's inspiring
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Yes, the ice cream is very smooth and creamy. Yes, the chocolate, ginger, and five spice banana flavors are delicious. Yes, I am happy to support a business which uses fresh, pure, and local ingredients. 

Still, I'd rather hit up some of the other local ice cream businesses... sorry.
author: Sharon L.

description: Unreal, the most amazing ice cream. My mom and I went here twice in one week. I first had the vanilla ice cream with strawberry sauce which was unbelievable cream and soft. Loved the strawberry sauce. My mom had chocolate with almonds which she said was the best chocolate ice cream she'd ever had. It also reminded her of the ice cream her mother used to make. Second time around I followed suit with chocolate and strawberry sauce, it was amazing. If you're in the bay area you must try it. No to mention that they make it right there for you, liquid nitrogen and all.
author: Natalia G.

description:
Let me just preface this review with the fact that I am a certified ice cream fiend and that I can talk about ice cream for hours and hence, I have a detailed opinion on them and thus a longgggggg review below :)

the good:
+ vanilla with almond brittle and brown sugar caramel tasted absolutely amazing. one of the best vanillas--super strong, creamy, rich flavor. brittle was not too sweet and added a great crunch. caramel added a great hint of sweetness!
+ their flavors are GOOD. I actually appreciate less flavors that are all done incredibly well
+ the place is really cute and hip with the yellow christmas-like lights, red awnings, and creative and cute business card! i love places that put attention to such details
+ though I came at night and couldn't appreciate the area around, it's a nice area to sit around or stroll during the day while enjoying ice cream

the okay:
+ my nerdy, scientific self really enjoyed the Kelvin machines that make each order of ice cream individually. however, I also found it pointless because while scientifically, it's supposed to make a smoother ice cream with smaller ice particles, I definitely did not notice a significant difference
+ the toppings are all tasty and carefully made but are each 25-75 cents apiece :(

the bad:
- yes i love that each order is individualized and makes me feel special BUT this means that you can't sample the flavors, you can't get more than one flavor in a cup and they use too many ice cream tins to make them
- it's ridiculously pricey, at $4.75 for a small without toppings and one flavor - ughhhh this is something I can't enjoy frequently. def not as affordable as bi-rite
- they don't have cones that are as great as Ici's chocolate filled bottoms that prevent ice cream spillage (yes my friend's cone was faillll and spilled dripping ice cream) 
- they don't have the variety of other great ice cream places 

BOTTOM LINE: decent, tasty, well-made but way too pricey and is just a fad that cannot outdo its competitors like bi-rite, mitchell's and mr.&mrs. but do give it a try!
author: Beatriz U.

description: This has to be the most expensive ice cream ever.  The concept of using nitrogen to fast-freeze milk into ice cream reminds me of Ice Cream Lab in Beverly Hills (which came later than Smitten), except Smitten's ice cream does taste better (it's super creamy) and costs more ($4.75 for two small scoops - a small size).  I got the White Balsamic Strawberry, which was very good.  I thought the Balsamic Vinegar would be blended into the ice cream, but it's really strawberry ice cream with some vinegar poured over it.  Mind you, it was still good, but at the end, I was tasting more vinegar than anything.   I ended up at Bi-Rite, which I also love and still do, and got a lot more ice cream for less.  The quality is really no different to me, so as much as I did like Smitten, I'd still probably recommend Bi-Rite out of the two.
author: Caroline K.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 3

Came here twice. 

1. Nectarine
~Pretty good. I loved the pieces of nectarine, although I wished the nectarine flavor were bolder.

2. Salted caramel with TCHO chocolate sauce
~Pretty good. Perfectly smooth salted caramel, and the chocolate sauce was a nice addition.

Service was okay. Line took about 10-15 min both times. Just really wish they did samples or let you order more than 1 flavor.
author: David L.

description:
We went on a Wednesday night so it seemed pretty crowded but the line moved along fast. It was cool that they had the machine right in front so you can see how it's being made. I also appreciated the signs showing the ingredients, history of Smitten etc.

However, I had higher hopes for the ice cream. I ordered the Cookie Dough. A small was $5!! This ice cream better be amazing for that small scoop. And alas, I was disappointed. I left the that it was not frozen enough. I wish the texture with thicker and creamier. The texture was smooth, not at all icy but I felt like it was too soft. The flavor was good but thing mind blowing. I'm glad I tried it but I do not see myself coming back.
author: Dianna N.

description:
Creamiest Ice-Cream in San Francisco.. Humphry and Bi-Rite may have more flavors, but Smitten's patented nitrogen freezing technique yields the smoothest yummiest ice cream out there. My friends love their mint ice cream, which they concoct out of real mint leaves right in front of you. I usually just get their vanilla ice cream with malt sauce on top... so very good!
Finding parking nearby can be very troublesome.
author: Aditya M.

description:
This place is right behind the Ritual Coffee stand if you're coming from Octavia. Easy too miss because it is back to back with Ritual, but just keep walking towards metal shack.

Had the strawberry white balsamic. It was VERY creamy (in both taste and texture), slightly sweetened, and with enough white balsamic flavor to enhance the strawberry. 

They use an Ipad POS and they were having problems with it when we got there. So slight wait for them to get it running again, and then about a 5 minute wait for the ice cream but I was so satisfied with their ice cream that I forgave them for making us wait a bit for 4 oz of ice cream.

But I'd go back for more.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
PROS
-Super cute little shop in a very hipster/rich area.
-Creamy ice cream, made fresh!
-Fun to watch that nitrogen machine be put to work.
-One of those "you must try it" places.
-New flavors daily, exciting isn't it?

CONS
-Ice cream melts VERY fast. So eat fast or avoid getting a cone cause it'll get drippy and messy in minutes!
-Super expensive. $4 for a small (aka two scoops). $6 for that waffle cone action (which I suggest to avoid)
-Long lines
-Slow service
-One of those "you must try it...oh but it's overhyped"

Sorry, but I was definitely not smitten by this ice cream place! Ordered the Salted Caramel and it was just too sweet for me. In five minutes my ice cream was dripping all over my cone and onto my hands. Maybe I need to order another flavor? Anyways, I'd go for the experience but certainly not for its ice cream.
author: Ting Jung L.

description:
Cute little shop that makes ice cream from scratch.. The story of how the ice cream parlor established is even cuter. 

A lady was selling ice cream from a red wagon and started a store front a few years later. 

The coolest part is that your ice cream is made as you order and in small batches to ensure quality ice cream. 

We ordered a few cups of the basic classic vanilla. I stuck with my go to flavor of salted caramel topped with toasted walnuts. 

Definitely will come back to taste all the other flavors and topping combinations!
author: Anne T.

description:
This is one of my favorite ice cream places for many reasons. Keep in mind, ice cream has to try really hard to impress me. I first had the lemon ginger snap and it was amazinggg. I feel you're getting your bang for your buck. It is pricey, but quality is also great, so don't expect baskin robbins type ice cream. I've had the blood orange with pistachio at this location as well and sure enough, amazing. 

It does take a while to get your ice cream but I found that if you come around late dinner on the weekends, the line isn't too bad as opposed to lunch/ early afternoon time. It's an outdoorsy pop-up type of place located next to the bier garten so it's definitely a cool place to hang out with friends or if you're on a date.
author: Josselin A.

description:
i'm not a big ice cream fan, but smitten is somethin' else. yes, it's hipster ice cream with all the liquid nitrogen fanciness - but it's super good and worth the wait. the ice cream is light, refreshing and can be topped with the most delectable things...like TCHO chocolate shavings. you won't be disappointed! 

-1 star because there's usually a pretty long line and it's not the cheapest place in the world.
author: Mandy A.

description:
So many good ice cream stops in the city, so I'm not really comparing Smitten to those, but just as a review by itself. The only reason I deducted 1 star is because for ice cream it can be considered a bit pricey. 

However, they do have back story to make it unique. They make it when you order it. Using some liquid nitrogen and other mumbo jumbo cool technology. The quality is definitely there and noticeable. It is very creamy and smooth. The flavors really pop and very evident. 

I always only order the flavor of the month at the time. They only have like 4-5 flavors with a few options to enhance it--such as syrups etc. The other flavors I never try because they just seem to be ordinary flavors, but the flavor of the month is something that is usually pretty unique. 

This place always seems to be crowded, but it gets moving at a steady pace. You can sit down on the bench if it already isn't occupied to wait or eat your ice cream. I prefer to just walk around the area to enjoy the sights and sounds of this part of the city. 

This might not be for everybody mostly due to the price, but it's worth a shot to say you've had it, and spoil yourself every once in a while if your palette can tell the difference in quality between ice creams.
author: Eugene N.

description: I couldn't appreciate this place that first time I went, but I went back today, and this is easily my favorite creamery in the city now. The ice cream is so fresh and creamy, and you get to watch the liquid nitrogen go when they make your ice cream on the spot. The only drawback is the price. For a regular cup of 3 scoops (which takes about 10 minutes to make), you're going to be paying $6 at least. But wow, the flavors just melt in your mouth. Definitely recommend brown sugar with cinnamon cookies. You'll thank me later. They only have 4 flavors at a time, but I really haven't had a bad one yet.
author: Danny C.

description:
Summer is around the corner, and so ice cream season! I was back at Smitten sampling more flavors. 

Unfortunately, on a given weekday evening I was presented with slim options - classic vanilla, fresh mint, and strawberry with white balsamic. 

I opted to try the classic vanilla and the strawberry! So creamy, so good. Liquid nitrogen most definitely makes a difference.
author: Mansi A.

description:
delish. You can definitely taste how the ice cream is smoother.

I got the fresh mint chocolate chip which had actual mint pieces in it.  I thought the mint overpowered the ice cream a bit, but was definitely interesting.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Really great ice cream in an ice cream city.  I don't care for the Salty Caramel, it's a little too much for me, I bet you'll love it though. 

The GF had the TCHO chocolate. I'll get that next time. 

Change I'll return: 74%
author: Justin S.

description: The staff here can't even handle an order. You ask for a cone they put in a cup. They have everybody just waiting for someone to do an order while the black guy with the tablet isn't expediting anything. While the line is still extremely long. Not worth the wait just go to Safeway or the other smitten locations that know what there doing.
author: Jeff  P.

description:
I didn't expect Smitten to be located in such a location! I thought it would be fully indoors, but regardless, I like its location! It's great for a sunny day.
It's really cool how they make the ice cream with liquid nitrogen, and it really does make the ice cream very creamy... however, the ice cream melts relatively fast and isn't as cold/hard... It's too smooth/notcoldenough/nothardenough/wordchoiceallovertheplace?? that at one point, I didn't think I was eating ice cream. The ice cream is also relatively expensive ($4.75) for a small...
I tried a nectarine flavor (I forgot the full name) which I really liked. I had some of my friend's chocolate mint flavor, which was way too mint-y for me.
author: Annie S.

description:
My boyfriend ended one of our SF outings with this place and boy am I glad he did!

The first time I came here I was charmed by the simplicity of this place. But when I saw how they made their ice cream, I was pretty much blown away. I mean, THEY MAKE IT RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU. How awesome is that? Yes, this place is a little pricey. I mean $4.75 for a small seems like a rip off, but it IS in San Francisco and it's homemade ice cream made RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU. It's a bit expensive, but the flavors are so freaking good. 

This month they have Vanilla, TCHO, Mint, and Creme Fraiche with Pear Caramel. I tried all 4 flavors and I would definitely recommend the creme fraiche one! The pear caramel on top is just sweet enough to send you a little over the edge of bliss! I wasn't too crazy about the mint one just because you actually really taste the mint.. It's like you're just straight up eating the plant.. I wanted a more chocolatey taste in it. You should definitely try one of their flavors with the pizzelle cone! It's an extra 75 cents, but it's so crunchy and it's just really good with the ice cream. :3 

The workers here are really nice! The cashier who's name I did not get, she was really friendly and patient with us. :) She even joked around saying she wasn't using her phone for texting and such and such, lol.

Overall, I love Smitten's. I do, I do, I do do doooo! And I try to come back whenever possible. :)
author: Venus L.

description:
Super cute place. I felt like my jeans were not tight enough and my bike had too many gears for me to "fit in" though ; ) 

I had the passion fruit something or other which was AMAZING! One of my favorite flavors of ice cream that I've had in a long time. Also tried some chocolate flavor that was slightly spicy. I forget what they call it. But that was just meh. I don't even think we finished that one. 

The process of making the ice cream is neat, and its like a little show, but for me if you see it once, thats enough. 
I'd come back, but I think there are other ice cream places in the city that I'd hit up first, unless I happened to be w/in 4 blocks of this place.
author: Benny N.

description:
All in all Smitten is a pretty amazing place. They have a very unique way of making ice cream in that its all made on the spot for each order.

Me and my kids (fine... "my kids and I") had vanilla and my wife had the mint. The vanilla was pretty good but the mint was absolutely amazing. It really did taste fresh. the waffle cones we're also pretty good but I felt like the toppings we're kind of chintzy and chucked too big. 
 
 The ice cream was definitely smooth although a bit dense for my tastes the only thing that I really didn't like was afterwards my stomach felt really heavy; my wife's as well,  but this is one reason why we prefer gelato because they use milk instead of cream.
author: Kane M.

description: I had the fresh mint chocolate chip and it was ok.  They used real mint so it had a herbal flavor.  BF had the vanilla and it was ok.  I like how they individually prepare the ice cream.  There was not a long line on Thursday night but parking is tricky in this area.  Service was great!
author: Chris L.

description: They refused to give us flights and made up some BS about the flight experience being terrible because the ice cream would melt. Won't be coming back to this location.
author: James L.

description:
I've been into trying different ice cream places lately, and I must say, Smitten is excellent. The only thing that stirs me away are the prices. A small is almost $5. 

I tried their TCHO chocolate with spicy sauce. The chocolate ice cream itself is delicious, but adding the spicy syrup adds a nice touch. The spicy sauce really has a strong kick, so be careful. 

I had a bit of my friend's brown sugar ice cream which I thought was also really good. They added some kind of shortbread which added a nice texture to the ice cream. 

I also tried my friend's mint ice cream. It is definitely different from your Dryers mint chip. This one has a really strong mint flavor. Like the actual mint leaves. If you're a fan of mint, this one is good.
author: Chris K.

description:
Super fun, the experience of watching the ice cream made is worth the price alone. 

Cons: 
- always a decent line

Pros: 
- interested flavors
- process is fun
author: Dimple B.

description:
I'm completely Smitten!

After one failed attempt to try this place out in February (they ran out ice cream during the President's Day heat wave!!!), we decided to give it one last try. If they ran out of ice cream, we'd refuse to come back here again.

Lo and behold, they DID have ice cream. It's such a cute little shop and decor is adorable. There was a line, but it was nothing like Bi-Rite. After long debate, I got the vanilla brittle sundae. It came with two scoops of liquid nitrogen vanilla ice cream, brown sugar caramel, pistachio brittle, and whipped cream. It was $6, but it was so worth it! I mean, I'm in tourist mode whenever I'm here, so might as well splurge! Plus, it's hard to get really good ice cream in LA. I absolutely loved it. I love vanilla ice cream to start with (and hate it when people use vanilla to describe plain LOL). The brown sugar caramel was a tad bit sweet, but it worked with the less sweet vanilla. The pistachio brittle was yummy! Perfectly sweet and crunchy. It was the perfect complement to the ice cream sundae.

My best friend got the TCHO chocolate. Even for a non-chocolate-lover, it was good. It was a bit too chocolate-y and sweet, but there's no denying it was still yummy. It actually worked perfectly when mixed with the vanilla. 

I still have yet to try all the ice cream shops in SF, but I will be back for you!!!
author: Patricia L.

description:
Dessert is always a must after eating.  I like watching the liquid nitrogen portion of ice cream making. It makes the experience fun and you can see your ice cream being made right in front of you. I know liquid nitrogen is not a new trend in ice cream, but it's still cool to me regardless! 

I really enjoyed a couple of flavors they had. the brown sugar was delicious. It wasn't too sweet, which is a plus for me. The cinnamon shortbread tasted what holidays are supposed to taste like. The olive oil is different but different isn't always  a bad thing. I enjoyed the flavors. I really don't understand why some people reviewed it so poorly... But I guess everyone has different preferences. The consistency is a that of ice cream, not gelato. It's very creamy, but it melts fairly quickly compared to ice cream. 

The only downside is the cost. You'll be spending over $5 for ice cream which only counts for 2 flavors! If you want more, obviously the price will reflect that.
author: Sarah L.

description:
My review might be biased because my heart is already set that Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous in the Dogpatch has the best ice cream ever. Anyways, I came to Smitten with my boyfriend on a Friday night after seeing strangers with ice cream cones and naturally, my nose led me to Smitten. I've been wanting to try Smitten for a long time now, so I was pretty excited! Smitten is pretty much your neighborhood ice cream shop with several customers sitting outside on the wooden benches while the employees whip up some ice cream using their liquid nitrogen machine. The wait for to order was about 5 minutes to order and it didn't seem that the customers could try samples, but I'm not completely sure so don't quote me on that! I got the salted caramel ice cream while my boyfriend got the vanilla ice cream with almond brittle.

Salted Caramel - Okay Smitten, you win for best salted caramel ice cream in SF and yes, I'll admit, not even Mr. & Mrs. can make a good salted caramel. Wow, seriously the flavor was so on point with just the right amount of sweet/salty goodness in every lick!

Vanilla - Like their salted caramel, the flavor was very strong. Classic flavor done right!

I also tried their cone, which I thought was okay, but as I was about to finish the cone, I found it to be way too sweet for my liking. Why 4 stars? I didn't really care for the consistency of their ice cream - it was more of like a soft serve. Their prices are pretty much up to par with all these specialty ice cream shops around. Back to Mr. & Mrs. I go!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Stopped off at Smitten last night after dinner in Hayes Valley. I've heard so much about how they make this ice cream, and as a sweet lover I wanted to try it. For me the uniqueness and fun is how they make the ice cream, it certainly isn't the actual tasting of the ice cream. While exceptionally creamy, I found the chocolate flavor to be extremely bland. My wife ordered the peanut butter and hers was even worse. I got a small and couldn't even finish it. After about 8 bites off that little spoon I felt like I was eating flavorless butter! The one great thing about the visit was the service. The two brrristas couldn't have been nicer!
Unfortunately, for great ice cream, this isn't the place.
author: Michael B.

description:
Oh my god. I should preface by saying that I have reached the point in my life where my college-age metabolism is slowing down, so I've been trying to better regulate my diet.

That said, I took a co-worker to get ice cream at this awesome outdoor spot near our work, and the nectarine ice cream was SO GOOD. If I'm going to join the ranks of America's obese, then smitten is definitely the railroad track grease to get that train rolling. 

The ice cream is a bit pricey ($7 for a small cup), but you get two scoops and it's made-to-order. So, this is perfect one-off treat for me to sub in for my previous weekly Haagen Dazs splurges.
author: Jay P.

description:
Was here on a Sunday afternoon and there happened to be no line!? 
Well, obviously we had no choice but to try some ice cream! It was my first time and I was drunk (ty Sunday brunch), so I can't exactly say what flavor I got? Maybe salted caramel. Do they have salted caramel here? Because that's proooobably what my drunk self would've demanded. 

Ice cream was super creamy and watching them mix it was fun for a minute.

11/10 would come back sober. 

TY to the German lover for taking care of me.
author: Momo M.

description:
My first visit to smitten was May 2014. Ice cream was delicious, customer service was outstanding and they paid great deal of attention to your order. However, like most businesses that quickly gain popularity, Smitten has gone from humble neighborhood business to snooty know it all business. 

Last night I went to get some ice cream.
