While I was glad to check it out, I'm still struggling to find out what the hype is over this place. The price for what we received was on the steep side. Taking all the above into consideration, I don't think we'd return here.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Went there for the first time. Line took about 10 mins. 
The girl at the register, short with shaved sides and long comb over to the back in the middle, couldn't figure out the order. 

We wanted two flavors each in the cone, she said you can only have one flavor whether its in the cone or in the cup, confused for a minute I said then I guess we want two flavors each one in the cup and one in the cone. Total came up to $22.
Minutes later we were handed two small cups with two small scoops of the same flavor. The woman serving the ice cream said we weren't charged for the cones and she doesn't see an order for the different flavors, but "there is another order for the same name". Totally confused at this point we paid $2 more for the cones. She swapped one of the small cups for the other flavor.
Ice cream was pretty mediocre, yes its creamier than usual, but still nothing compare to delicious bi-rite.

Walked away, started reading YELP reviews and realized that a small cup with two small scoops is one serving, not two... So basically they charged us for 4 servings, instead of two... WTF?!?!

1. Even at the correct price this ice-cream is not impressive
2. Not worth waiting in line
3. Get your service straight: my cat could've figured it out better than that girl!
author: Mila Y.

description:
It's a fun place for kids as well, since they can see with their own eyes how their cup of ice cream is made. I found it fascinating.

Small cup is 5$ but actually you get 2 scoops so it's honestly very well priced and it's even good to share!

I can't give 5 stars because I've Italian origins and I'm sorry folks but the most authentic Italian gelato is there...but I mean SMITTEN definetely delivered and I'll be back!

PS: They also serve vegan options, which is always appreciated!
author: MT M.

description: I had very high hopes for Smitten! The ice cream is very creamy and good, but I hate that they only have like... TWO flavors.  Basically your choices are either vanilla or salted caramel and a bunch of toppings.  I think some days they also offer a special third flavor, but unfortunately I went on an off day or something.  Anywho, I opted for just the vanilla with the brown maple syrup and the pistachio toffee topping.  It was good, but I just expected a lot more for the price and all the hype.
author: Lily T.

description:
I just love that this place is in what looks like a converted shipping container (with a roll-up door) and that they blend your ice cream to order. 

The salted caramel I had was a great balance (not too salty or caramely) and the price was reasonable. Nice that there's a park next door to sit down and enjoy. 

Great dessert option after you've eaten at one of the other yummy places in Hayes Valley.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Be warned, parking is hard to find. Went here with my girlfriend after a long day. Had the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread and chocolate sauce on top. It was pretty cool to watch them make it. The ice cream did have a hint of salt in the after taste. Wasn't too big of a fan of that but the ice cream came out pretty good. My girlfriend got the dark chocolate. That had more of a salty after taste to it. A little on the pricey side for ice cream. 

Must try? Maybe just for your amusement.
Try again? Not really.
author: Thomas N.

description: Yummy ice cream ! Best ice cream I've had in awhile!! Service is good as well and thank god it wasn't crowded when I went!
author: Karen J.

description:
I think this may be one of my new, favorite ice cream places! Although they don't have much selection, some flavors are seasonal. 

Delicious, creamy, smooth, ice cream that has just the right amount of flavor to it. I ordered the sweet corn and berries (seasonal flavor) and I would order it again in a flash! 

They make the ice cream through liquid nitrogen right in front of you. When I went, there wasn't a wait and we were able to find seating. However, that night I was in the area again and saw there was a long line. Go early to avoid lines!
author: Kris T.

description:
SELECTION - Green Tea Ice cream @ $5.50 (3 flavors per day...vanilla was the other one...sold out of the 3rd)

TASTE - strong green tea flavor and super smooth texture (uniquely liquid nitrogen). never experienced something like that before. unfortunately, after the first bit, all i could taste was sugar.

WHY COME? - san francisco's 1st liquid nitrogen ice cream shop (I think...), great outdoor seating at the park...perfect place to show off your foodie knowledge to ladies or out-of-town guests

WHY AVOID? - expensive, super sweet, amateurs making ice cream 

FOIBLE - sugar overload...super super sweet! sweetest ice cream ever! (and that's not a compliment) Every bite, including the first, was a chore to eat due to the sugar. (fyi...another stranger / patron i talked to also agreed.) No idea if it was a mistake on that one batch or the recipe guy has no taste buds....

SERVICE - they messed up my order! They started with a big batch of green tea base...then when it was done, they scooped out a small serving for the customer in front of me. Then they made a big one (for me) but realized she needed another small one, so she put it back in the bowl and halved it for the kid's scoop. Then realized she messed up and plopped it back in to make my regular scoop. I would expect much better service for the premium price and wait time. what a dunce! I never like to feel I was the recipient of a mistaken order. 

DON'T FORGET...to bring some money. at $5.50 a pop, u will need it. 

DESIGN...love the concept! really cool liquid nitrogen machines and an IPad for a cash register. industrial look of the shack was also nice. 

TO SAVE $$$...order just 1 and share...then go to a cafe or ordinary ice cream shop to finish off.

VERDICT...it was very cool trying this place once...but after the sugar overload and bad customer service, I would not return anytime soon. I much rather try out the dozens of other foodie oriented ice cream shops that have been springing up in sf.
author: Simon L.

description:
I have been smittened by liquid nitrogen ice cream!

How delicious and unique this place is. With only three choices of flavors per day, it saves you the stress of having to pick which one you want.  Why not try all three? Their ice cream is incredibly smooth, not too sweet, and doesn't melt as quick as some other ice creams I have had.  Their rose flavor with chocolate chips is so fresh, it almost tastes like you are eating the fragrance of an actual flower (but not to the extent that we can find you eating your mom's garden roses!) the portions are small but just right. 

The only downside is that the store can be cold so stay under the heater if possible or wear extra layers on a cold San Francisco day.
author: Lilian N.

description:
Come for: vanilla, chocolate, great service
Skip: nectarine

Their ice cream is so smoooooooth. Wish they had more flavors available since I wasnt a fan of nectarine but chocolate and vanilla are solid. One of our 4 cups took a while so my friend went in to inquire with one of the ice cream master chefs who got us on the next batch and added some goodies to make up for the wait. Thanks for turning this into a great experience!
author: Lise N.

description:
I've been here a couple times and the ice cream is great!

Just know if there's a lot of people, you might have to wait a bit, because they make the ice cream fresh.

Also, just be warned that it's a bit pricey for ice cream. $4.75 for a small.

TCHO Chocolate is great! I would definitely recommend.

Olive Oil and Lavender Shortbread is cool for about 2 bites and then it starts to taste rather awkward.
author: Emily D.

description:
Expensive okay tasting ice cream.

Smitten prides itself on making each serving of ice cream separately with liquid nitrogen. For this however, there's no option for tasting prior to purchasing. We had the olive oil ice cream with lemon shortbread which was just okay. Other experiences have been better but it's hard to justify the price.

2.5 stars.
author: Amy D.

description: The long awaited trip happened yesterday.  Tried the vanilla and caramel (dulce de leche). They were out of mint - so I will have to go again. Didn't think the ice cream was spectacular.  It was good- but not worth a specific trip. The waffle cone- was AMAZING and definitely worth coming back for.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
CREAMIEST ICE CREAM I've ever had and they make it right in front of you! They use a liquid nitrogen system and churn their mixture into pure ice cream gold! Pretty pricey for ice cream but that's the city for you. I recommend the waffle cone. 

Would've given another star but they had limited flavors. I got the chocolate and it was the best scoop of ice cream I've ever consumed!
author: Arnel S.

description:
Walking up to the counter of Smitten, I definitely scoffed at there only being a couple flavors. An ice cream menu for ants?! Nice try, Smitten. 

But my goodness was I miserably wrong. I ordered the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread while my friends order the TCHO dark chocolate. 

The novelty of seeing your ice cream notwithstanding, I impatiently waited for my flavors. The wait was worth it. The absolute creamiest and most delicious ice cream I have ever had. While the cinnamon shortbread was wonderful, the TCHO dark chocolate was exquisite and delectable.  Every spoonful of both flavors was luxuriously creamy, and the soft texture did not come at the expense of ice cream that was hardly cold or melting. 

No, this ice cream had the right texture, the right temperature, and enough taste to get me right back in line to try the other flavors. Forgive my ice cream ignorance Smitten, I will wait hours for just one of your ice cream flavors.
author: Amir H.

description: Quite the wait. And the price really adds up. The 5 dollar small is a bit small but the 6 dollar regular is a lot. dosent come with cone :( topping 75 cents. It is really smooth as promised but too sweet and melts heka fast. Cool liquid nitrogen action.
author: Jonathan C.

description: If you're looking for just ice cream, I think this place is just okay. I got the salted caramel, and it was way too salty. My boyfriend got salted caramel + vanilla with their homemade brittle (almond, pistachio, salted peanut) topping, and it was much better. As for plain ol' ice cream, it's not that great without adding stuff. Not that there's anything bad about adding toppings, but I think good ice cream should stand out by itself.
author: Karen L.

description:
The flavors were unique, watching them make it was neat, but overall the experience left me wanting more.

Strictly based off the taste I would give this place 4-stars however I felt the following were enough to warrant -1 star:

- Price (steep for what you get)
- Speed (time between ordering and receiving could be much faster)
- The wait (I got there before a line formed but why anyone would wait 30min in line for this is beyond me, gets busy after ~8PM)

If you've never been I definitely think you should give it a shot. It's a fun little spot and the always-changing flavors is a nice touch. Just don't go in expecting your world to be rocked and you should come away pleasantly surprised.
author: Tony S.

description: Go for the TCHO chocolate ice cream! The texture is amazing and the ice cream is worth the price and the wait.
author: Valerie K.

description:
The ice cream here is pricey for a small portion, and I'm still on the fence over whether or not it's worth the long lines since I've only tried it once.

I really liked the entire concept of the shop and how the ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen. It's fun to watch your ice cream being made right in front of you using the machines they have. The liquid nitrogen made a noticeable difference to me because the texture was really smooth and the ice cream stayed cold and consistent form start to finish.

The waiting area is small with little space to sit. If you're going during a busy hour, be ready to do a lot of standing. I must give Smitten a second try to decide for sure whether or not I love it. Until next time!
author: Sabrina P.

description:
Wow, my most recent visit really blew me away.  I had the Tcho Chocolate Ice Cream and it was incredible:  smooth, creamy and very rich.  The chocolate flavor was deep, dark and silky with the perfect amount of sweetness and just a slight hint of saltiness to really bring out the flavor.  It was REALLY good.  The process they use to make the ice cream really made for an interesting consistency and when it began to melt just a bit, it really made for a great texture and taste.

Can't wait to have it again!
author: Ken G.

description:
I love this place. I've cream texture is perfect and the flavors are perfectly balanced.  

Especially liked the spicy caramel.
author: christina a.

description:
I dunno if this is an insult or a compliment but... for my taste buds, this place is kinda like bi-rite creamery. 

The bonus here is, you get to watch them use liquid nitorgen to freeze/super cool the ice cream. Yaaaaaaay... 

Another bonus is, there's a little coffee shop behind them that offers Ritual's coffee. Hmmmm. Maybe it's a Ritual's coffee kiosk... not sure.  

Limited flavors, but I hear it's always sorta changing.
author: Garland W.

description:
Smitten? Totally.

The line was a little long for my liking, but hey--new city, new place, why not?

As a native Angeleno, SF's summer nights are colder than our winters. BUT IT'S NEVER TOO COLD FOR ICE CREAM! We got the sweet corn with berry sauce, vanilla with chocolate sauce, and vanilla with brown sugar sauce. The wait was less than 10 minutes for our extra smooth and creamy ice cream, so there are no complaints on this end!
author: Gabrielle P.

description:
I don't get the hype.

Yes, it's in a great location in Hayes Valley.  Yes, I was there on a beautiful sunny day.  Yes, I had just read about this place.  and...Yes, there was a long line.

But...they had two flavors to choose from.  Two.  Vanilla and Olive Oil.  I apprecaite the desire to be authentic and different.  I appreciate the organic ingredients and the 'made on the spot' gimmick.  

What I don't appreciate is the fact that when you wait in line, you get two flavors, and you have to settle for vanilla and some toppings.  And, if you're serving vanilla, you need to not big stingy with the toppings (hint hint Smitten - you should have drenched my vanilla in caramel sauce, not just drizzled).  Olive Oil ice cream is a ncie novelty, but it was 10:1 Vanilla to Olive oil orders on the day I was there. 

Do us all a flavor and always at least have chocolate and vanilla.  Hip for hips sake only works when you have more than two flavors.
author: Tobin S.

description:
This place is more about the story and the experience than anything else. Yes, it's expensive ($5 for a small), but the whole liquid nitrogen process is fun. If you're with a friend or you see a flavor you really like, it might be worth it every so often. 

I got the Earl Grey with chocolate chips. The flavor was creamy and rich, but the ice cream melted really quickly. I'm not sure it's any better than normal ice cream, but it was worth it for the experience.
author: Audrey M.

description:
I am updating this to 5 bc the salted caramel with tcho chocolate is awesome, the people here are awesome, and Buster likes going in here! 

Walk in with your doggy! The people here are very nice, they will yell for you when your ice cream is ready and you can hear them when you are walking around Patricia's Green. I usually finish mine before I get home. : )
author: Laura F.

description:
Smitten is a fun, making ice-cream a bit of an "event".  You choose your flavor (from the daily options) and they make your individual ice-cream on the spot.  The ingredients are put in a stainless steel bowl and they use liquid nitrogen to freeze it fast.  

So lots of fun, but I have to say I wasn't a huge fan of the ice-cream.  It's very creamy, but leaves a bit of a film in your mouth (I assume the fat content from the cream).   I had the mint chip (vanilla, with choc chip and fresh mint).  

For the area it's the best option, but I wouldn't' go out my way.
author: Jane B.

description:
Unless you want ice cream that literally tastes like a mint leaf, do NOT get the fresh mint chip ice cream.  Mint is usually one of my favorite ice cream flavors, but that's because most mint ice cream does not taste like a mint leaf in ice cream form.  That being said, the other two flavors I've tried (vanilla and maple brown sugar squash) were much better.  The maple brown sugar squash was Smitten's seasonal flavor for October, and is my favorite of the 3 flavors I've tried so far.  It basically tasted like pumpkin ice cream.  

Another tip:  Smitten does not have carry out containers for their single serving ice cream sizes and will just put another cup on the top of your ice cream scoop.  If you'll be traveling for more than 10 minutes, your ice cream will start to melt, overflowing the cup and dripping all over you.  Instead, ask them to throw that single serving into one of their larger cups.
author: Cici A.

description: I like that Smitten is a local ice cream shop and they use local ingredients.  The TCHO crispies, TCHO chocolate sauce, and pistachio brittle toppings were all excellent.  I like the ice cream, but I don't love it.  It's a nice place to check out if you're in Hayes Valley.
author: Wendy S.

description:
YES PLEASE!

But lick it up quick before it melts on the floor I GOT IT!

uno
dos
tres
quatro 

give me some more!

Ice Cream Truck - Cazwell http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2w02QxQZGQc

meet me there folks.
author: Susy C.

description:
This is such a fun place to go for unique ice cream!  

Shipping container converted into ice cream joint, with ice cream blended to order with LIQUID NITROGEN.  It looks like a delicious witch's brew.  And it is definitely a must do when visiting San Francisco - even if the weather isn't warm and sunny!

Three cheers for Smitten!
author: Laura M.

description:
Cute name. Cute spot. 

Smitten is a charming ice cream spot, with rich flavors and an interesting concept.  While I am a Bi-Rite devotee, a stroll through Hayes Valley was much more pleasant with this pop-up sorta shop.  They make their ice cream using liquid nitrogen, so kudos for being fancy.  I went with the simple caramel salt ice ceam, which was heavy on caramel and rich.  They have additional toppings you can add, which includes chocolate chips, crunchies, and fruit.  If in the area, its worth checking out.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Overall, I'm a big fan of this place and have been here a handful of times. 

The first time (and really every time after) watching them freeze the ice cream in to being with the liquid nitrogen is fascinating. 

The TCHO chocolate, salted caramel, and brown sugar flavors are all on point that are only made better with suggested toppings like the almond toffee bits. 

I'm knocking one star off because of the service. It was fine the first time I came but it seems to decline every subsequent time I come. I don't mind waiting in line for good things, but things behind the counter seem a bit disorganized with people getting served out of order or having their order forgotten.
author: Tasmin S.

description:
SUPER FRESH!
So far I've tried:
Strawberry
Coffee
Caramel

They actually post the ingredients outside the window so customers can see what's in their dessert.  Since they are VERY eco-friendly, receipts from debit card transactions will be sent to your email.  (Paying cash is so much faster!  Avoid using your cards!)
Their ice creams literally MELT IN YOUR MOUTH.  The coffee flavor I don't really recommend since it made my friend hyper and all jittery.  It's stronger than some store-sold coffees even!
author: Hyun S.

description:
I scream you scream, we all scream for.....Liquid Nitrogen????  That's right, at Smitten your made to order ice cream is super freezed by nitrogen.  It is like watching a science show live.  I was kind of saddened by the scoop size (super tiny) because the of the price.  But as my friend said, "Nitrogen ain't cheap!"  

To kind of cheat the system, you should pay the extra .75c for a cone and it seemed like our friend had more ice cream in her cone than we did in our eco cups.  But if you have the money, check this place out, the flavors are super delish.  I loved that their register, it was an iPad with a credit card attachment.  So yes you can charge your card.
author: Michelle M.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places in the city. Located at the heart of Hayes valley this place is very small but easy to spot, look for the red! The line tends to be long most of the time so be patient, the wait is worth it. The menu is usually pretty small but has a good variety of flavors like tcho chocolate and caramel. There are a couple toppings as well from spiced caramel and crushed nuts. I have nothing but positive things to say about smitten! Highly recommend this spot.
author: Josue V.

description:
I didn't really know what to expect but this place is worth a try! I felt that it was a bit on the expensive side (almost $5 for a small) but the ice cream was very smooth, creamy, and not too sweet! You can also see them making it right in front of you so it's a pretty cool experience. There's also a mini park across the street where you can sit!
The staff is also very friendly which is always a plus.
author: Joyce L.

description: the concept is kind of a gimmick, but the ice cream is really quite good.  Very creamy and delicious.  My favorite was the espresso
author: Adam G.

description:
Do you **LOVE** overpriced science? Do you get bogged down with too many options? If so, you will love the expensive ice cream here at Smitten, where they only give you 3 flavor options per day.

I came around 4pm on some random day during the week. I walked right up and asked for a sample of their rhubarb crisp, only to find out that they make all the ice cream to order (that's the nifty science part of it), so I would just have to blindly invest $3.50 for a kiddie scoop. 

Well, less than 10 minutes later, my ice cream was made. I looked at it sadly, since the cup was just so small and there was barely enough for 10 small bites. I was even more sad when I tasted it, and it WAS delicious...

So anyway...I would NOT come here when it's hot, b/c I think that's just insane to wait 40 minutes to order/eat just about anything (unless it was a chicken from Zuni's)....and next time I would pony up for the larger size since I definitely wanted more than 10 small spoonfuls...but I'll have to start saving my allowance.
author: Misha F.

description:
We enjoyed the ice cream...it was quite creamy. Unfortunately, the flavors are limited and it is a bit pricy. However, the service is great and I'm going back!!

I recommend Smitten for the quality, experience and service!
author: Mr. Bill S.

description:
Overrated. 

Limited flavors, pricey, and simply not that good. Cool gimmick using liquid nitrogen to make the ice cream, but that's about it. Would much rather go to Bi-Rite.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Science Fiction Ice Cream. 
I wish they still served the peanut butter. That texture and flavor was mind-blowing. They've improved the house-made waffle cones. 
Three cones will set you back $20. A worthy treat despite.
author: Rockie N.

description:
I want to be honest here.  This place looks like a destination, great location cool to watch the ice-cream being made, I get it.

Is it over the top ice cream I can't live without - NO.  It's good but no way would I be making a special trip.  There is value, I got a small and that is 2 scoops in a cup - it is a very generous portion, more then I could eat.

They had  4 flavors and we tired the vanilla and chocolate.  The chocolate was a little rich (but good) for my taste and I preferred the vanilla with the chocolate syrup.

Solid 3 stars and if I'm in the area I would go back but I would not be making any special trips.
author: Drew M.

description: Nitrogen ice cream....surely a really cool idea. And fun to watch the machine vapor up. The ice cream itself is pretty good, but rather simple. We had salted caramel and brown sugar, both good, but not as good as Bi-Rite.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Mreh. Smitten, I hope I just visited you on a bad day because I really want to like you.

When we showed up, there was no line and they said that two machines were broken so only two flavors were available: salted caramel and olive oil. I opted for the salted caramel with choco crisps as was recommended and holy crap. It was the sweetest ice cream I have ever had in my life. Good thing I got the small because I couldn't even finish half before throwing it out.

Maybe it was just an off day. I'll be back my next time here.
author: Jin Ju L.

description:
They make your ice cream right in front of you with fresh ingredients. The line was about 20 people long. We figured with that many people waiting, it had to be good. This place didn't disappoint. I think it's cash only.
We tried the strawberry (seasonal) salted caramel and chocolate. All delicious!
author: Margaret H.

description:
I came here in the evening after dinner. It's located in Hayes Valley by a street that has lots of nice restaurants. It's a perfect place to grab dessert after a meal! The store is literally made from a shipping container, so there is not indoor seating. It's more like a booth with an outdoor seating area. The environment was nice, hip, and clean.

There are usually a few flavors of ice cream a day with a selection of toppings and add-ons. The ice cream is made when you order and the brrristas churn out the ice cream on the spot using liquid nitrogen and an ice cream machine! Because the ice cream is made to order and not stored in a freezer, the ice cream is very creamy.

I tried a size small fresh mint ice cream and added cinnamon shortbread ($5.50). My boyfriend had the toffee pudding ice cream and added cinnamon shortbread ($5.50). The mint was delicious, the flavor was light and tasted like real mint leaves. The toffee pudding ice cream was also very good. It had a strong toffee flavor and much sweeter than the mint flavor. Both were really yummy and went well with the cinnamon shortbread. I was also told by the staff that Smitten uses organic and local ingredients, so that's another plus.

The service and environment was great. The staff was informative and super friendly. There's a good amount of seating and an outdoor heater for cold nights. While I was there in the evening, there was a good amount of people there and also good upbeat music from the 80s playing.
author: Monica T.

description:
At first I was a taken back a bit by their pricing. To add a topping and make it a cone (+ $0.50, +$1.00 each), my friend and I paid $12.xx total for our ice cream. We went there around 1:30pm and they only had vanilla and the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread left. We had one of each with their recommended topping (caramel and cinnamon, respectively). 

The line was quick but the order took about 10 minutes. That was because they have 3 patented churners in total and only 2 were operating, one for each flavor. I believe the machine for the vanilla was a newer model so they were still playing around with it. I saw that the worker (may have been new) attempted to make a batch of vanilla twice, but this older worker (may have been the manager) came by and looked at it and in the end, had to make it himself. 

I love the idea of using liquid nitrogen to make the ice cream! The consistency was somewhere between regular ice cream and gelato -- the creaminess wasn't overwhelming and it wasn't too sweet! 

The best part is that every scoop is made to order and the way the manager overlooked the quality of the ice cream made me feel rest assured :)

The one star deducted was for the homemade cone. Personally, it tasted more like a cookie/biscuit than a waffle cone. It was also a tad sweet and since the ice cream was already sweet, I thought the cone would have complimented better if it wasn't as sweet. If you're someone who loves sweets and has a sweet tooth, then I would say go for the cone! My friend liked it, I would have preferred a cup.
author: Loni K.

description:
I finally had the chance to try Smitten when their wasn't a line out the door and it would have been worth it even if the line was that long.  A truly unique way to make ice cream but worth it even just as a show.  I ordered the spicy bittersweet TCHO chocolate and I love TCHO chocolate in general and this did not disappoint.  It was very creamy and smooth and had hints of a bite which I really enjoyed.  

It was expensive for a small taste but let me wanting to try some of the other flavors.
author: Blake B.

description: New hidden freshly made, organic, local ingredients ice cream parlor gem! Liquid nitrogen so so smooth. Try the salty caramel with TCHO chocolate syrup topping. Their limited edition rhubarb crisp was also tasty with pie crust bites. One of my fav ice cream spots in the city. I'm smitten :)
author: Sheryl A.

description:
I am smitten by the ice cream they create at Smitten! We stopped by one Sunday night right before they were about to close. No lines to wait in is a bonus. I got the Strawberry Creme Fraiche and she got the Salted Caramel, both of course in one of their fresh made pizzelle cones. Single scoop ($4.75) + cone ($0.75) = a slightly costly indulgence but it became aware after tasting the ice cream that it was worth it.

Silky smooth in texture because freezing the ice cream base with liquid nitrogen makes it form less ice crystals. It was heavenly to try something so luscious. I enjoyed the burst of strawberry with the contrast of the tart creme fraiche. But I'd order that salted caramel next time for myself. That flavor is the gospel. The downside is you have to eat it quick and the cone is a bit too delicate for my liking.
author: Randy T.

description:
So far I've tried: 

TCHO dark chocolate (add jalapeno slices!) 
Brown sugar
Olive oil with lavendar 

My favorite so far has got to be the TCHO chocolate. It was rich with a chewy texture that tasted exactly like frozen hot cocoa. MUST TRY! 
$3.25 for a "kiddie" size one scoop. Pricey, but worth it. Additional charge for the jalapenos.

Love how the ice cream is made to order in about 60 seconds with liquid nitrogen. Awesomeee. It's also fun to play with the smoke the expensive-looking machines create heehee. 

The end result is a super creamy ice cream that melts fairly quickly, so there are no to-go options! Boo. Flavors also rotate often so they only offer about 4 each day.
author: Vivian D.

description:
This place feels like it became the darling of the Yelp scene overnight. With the line of hipsters wringing around the corner, I assumed Bon Iver was doing a free show or something, but after realizing THIS was the Smitten I'd heard so much about, I had to give it a shot.

I tried the blood orange, and DAMN! The tiny bits of fruit inside the cream really socked my taste buds. They have only three or four flavors going at one time, so have someone from your party check the menu before you all wait in line. Prices are on the high side, but it's pretty superior ice cream, so decide for yourself if $4.75 for a cup is too much. That said, I don't know any other place doing liquid nitrogen cooled ice cream right now, so if you're a curious eater (and you're reading Yelp reviews, so you are), give this a try.
author: Kevin B.

description:
ice cream x science! 

imagine a science lab, with these mixers (currently-but-soon-will-be-renamed named kelvin, which is a "special patented ice cream churner") lined up, cream solutions poured into the bowl, frozen with liquid nitrogen, and voila, you get ice cream!

i had the february flavor of the month:  earl grey with choco chips while my friend had the salted caramel.  i appreciated the earl grey but hated the chocolate chips.  i definitely liked the salted caramel better.

overall the ice cream was a bit too heavy.  it was definitely heavy in the cream and it almost felt like our lips were covered in butter after stuffing our face with ice cream!  not sure what it was, but i have a feeling the ice cream were made with whole milk and then some.

still worth a try :)  plus you get to pick up a cone/cup, soak up sf by sitting at the little park right across from smitten.
author: Alice C.

description:
The ice cream is soooo smooth. Melts in your mouth. Perfect for a sunny day. When can I come again!!

When we got there, the line to pay wasn't so bad and it moved fairly quickly.  There were however many people sitting down waiting for their ice cream since they make them for you right then and there...but it still didn't take that long. Can't say much about the decor of the place...small stand that would look oh so cute on a beach boardwalk :) Not so much where it is now in my opinion.
Anyways, I got hibiscus flavor and bf got tcho chocolate. Funny because when I looked at the menu I thought, how do you pronounce that? Cho? I ask the bf and he goes, t-cho! Ultimate fail. 
And then the best part: eating the cutie ice creams. I loooooved the hibiscus flavor and bf also looooved t-cho SO much that he was licking the entire cup dry when he was done. I've never seen him do that before...definitely a sight.
Overall I was very pleased with the ice cream sold here and will probably crave it soon.
author: Cathy C.

description:
This place deserves more than the three stars I'm rating right now. I went here for the first time today because my friend was raving about how yummy their ice cream were. There were four flavors available to choose from and I decided I wanted the mint chip whereas my friend ordered the creme fraiche. The lady at the register didn't tell us that we had to wait about 10-15 minutes but I overheard her telling other people so I knew. 

There are only a few flavors available everyday because there is only limited space for a couple of people to work at, each focusing on a specific flavor. So I waited in the station where the mint chip was made and my friend waited at where the creme fraiche was made. My friend got her order in less than 10 minutes. The guy working at her station was quick and knew what he was doing, he was calling out names practically every minute. 

As my friend was eating her delicious ice cream, I was waiting at my mint chip station. 10 minutes went by.. three people by now at the mint chip station have questioned the worker about whether or not their orders were coming. After waiting 15 minutes I realized that this lady at the mint chip station has not called out a single freaking name. I began watching her and saw that she was working a snail pace. She was taking her sweet time cleaning the stations around her and forgetting all about the ice cream she had to make. After a batch was finished freezing, it took her another couple of minutes to come back to the station and serve it. 

By now the guy at the creme fraiche station has called out 20 orders. My friend and I was standing there in disbelief.. At one point a guy at the chocolate station next to her tried to help serve the batch of mint chip that was frozen and ready to serve when the mint chip lady quickly stepped in front of him telling him that she has it under control. The chocolate guy stepped back with his hands in the air signaling that he will back off. She placed the batch behind her and then stepped off somewhere in the back! A minute later, the creme fraiche guy picked up a spoon and tried to serve the mint chip onto a cup because he noticed it was just sitting there and then the mint chip lady reappeared and snatched the spoon out of his hand and told him not to touch it. What.. the.. bleep.. 

I got my order after a 30 minute wait. I will never again order ice cream from the station where the girl with the short blonde hair is working at. Ever. The mint chocolate chip ice cream was good, the mint taste is pretty strong. But what I witnessed while waiting for my ice cream made my lose my appetite. I was standing there for 30 minutes wishing that I ordered another flavor. 

Minus one star for the mint chip lady who really needs to get it together. Minus another star for the system that they have, it is really easy to mess up an order. I saw several people complain about how their names were missed or that they ordered it on a cone rather than a cup.
author: Kawai N.

description:
My husband and I discovered Smitten last August when the flavor of the month was sweet corn and we totally fell in love. We loved it so much that we drove back the following weekend (we live in San Jose) to get more sweet corn before the month was over. 

Since last August we've returned various times and have tried a number of other flavors, which we've found to be really hit or miss. They seem to have a lot of fruity flavors, which aren't really my thing. The brown sugar and salted caramel are pretty tasty though -- and the waffle cones are out of this world!

I absolutely love the concept of this shop and the staff are pretty friendly. I wish they carried more flavors, though I totally understand why they can't. 

Anyway, fast forward to August again. My husband and I have been counting down to sweet corn ice cream for weeks. Two weeks ago we drove to San Francisco and were totally bummed to see they actually didn't have any sweet corn ice cream. Last weekend we wised up and called ahead before leaving San Jose and again were disappointed, but at least we hadn't driven all the way there. Yesterday we called ahead and alas -- they had it. We called right around 11 AM when they opened and headed to San Francisco shortly after that. My husband and I had planned to go for a run first. so we went for a quick one along the bay, looking forward to our ice cream reward. 

We arrived at Smitten at around 2 PM and guess what? No sweet corn ice cream! (I should have listened to my husband when he suggested we get ice cream BEFORE running, but I don't like running with a full stomach and thought it would be a nice reward). 

I know there are some things that are out of the shop's control when it comes to flavors, but I'm super disappointed. If you're going to have a flavor of the month -- offer it all month, not on sporadic days. I know we should have just gone right to Smitten yesterday, but really, it was Saturday. Did they not stock up enough to last all day? And if not, why didn't they tell me there were limited quantities when I called? Sigh. Looks like I'll just have to wait until next year.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Best ice cream ever.

Smitten is a little stand in Hayes Valley that serves individually made ice cream.  The have a patented ice cream chruner (the "Kelvin"), they use to make the ice cream right in front of you.  The end result is the smoothest ice cream you ever had.

Because it's individually made, there's only 4 flavors as there's only 4 Kelvins.   The flavors were subtle, not as strong as other ice creams, but I'll trade that for the lack of ice in the ice cream.  They have a variety of toppings as well.

We tried the passion fruit, vanilla and chocolate.  All were very flavorful.  The vanilla with the brown sugar topping was killer.  I had the passion fruit with the vanilla bread topping which wasn't such a great combo.  The ice cream just melts in your mouth.

Not cheap, but understandable when you consider each batch is individually made.  Should cost more than the mass-produced ice cream at most other places.

Smitten is certainly different and unique and I can understand the mixed reviews.  So unique you should try it for yourself.  For me, loved it, especially compared the frozen ice creams you get at most ice cream places.
author: Steve G.

description: One of the best ice cream in San Francisco, but a little bit pricy.
author: Wayne Z.

description:
So creamy! The list of a few flavors they offer made me a bit relieved. You know how too many options can be paralyzing? Not an issue here. 

I overheard someone who sounds much more knowledgable than me tell another that  the liquid nitrogen freezes the ice cream faster so there are less water molecules that freeze into ice, thus allowing the texture to be creamier. I'm no chemist but if that's true, it's a cool process. I found the brown sugar ice cream to be a good level of sweetness as it was so I skipped toppings.

Pricier than other raved-about ice cream places in the city but I wouldn't hesitate to get again as a treat.
author: Audrey N.

description: Luckily the day I went, the lines weren't that long. This is an interesting idea and catches most people's attention. C'mon, liquid nitrogen. It was good but I don't know if I'd wait super long lines. I'd rather go to Biergarden and have a beer. =P
author: Minh H.

description:
This place is amazing! Unlike any other ice cream parlor I've been to because they make your ice cream right in front of you. If curiosity gets to you, the staff is super nice and will explain the process as to how their machines churn your ice cream. 

Flavors are natural because that's all they use so everything is refreshing. Flavors are also changing so try something new because honestly, you can't go wrong with any of their options.
author: Lani H.

description:
I would say Smitten is a one time visit sort of ice cream shop.   The price is only worth the experience of having your ice cream done with liquid nitrogen.  But after the novelty wears off, it's hard to make yourself pay close to 5 dollars for two small scoops of ice cream

We had three flavors:
Rhubarb--really good, lots of rhubarb.
Brown Sugar--very good.  liked the little bits they had inside.
Dark chocolate--average
author: Alison L.

description:
Came here with my mom yesterday and got the 3 flavour option. There were only 3 flavours available so by default we chose mint chip, 60% chocolate, and maple brown sugar pumpkin. I think there are usually 4 flavours but maybe they were out of blue bottle espresso.
In order of best to least best: chocolate, mint chip, and pumpkin.
The chocolate is very creamy, like a hot chocolate but not hot. Theres no other way of putting it other than it tastes expensive. It's not your convenience store chocolate. More like the inside of a dark chocolate Lindor truffle. Yeah. That's it. Double thumbs up.
I'm not usually a fan of mint chip ice cream. I often find it too sweet but in a weird mint toothpaste plus sugar sort of way. The usual colour is also very off putting, does not help with the toothpaste imagery. Smitten's mint chip, however, was quite refreshing, You can taste the actual mint flavour and the sweetness does not overpower the mint. The chocolate pieces were also yum. Dark chocolate maybe? Pleasant surprise.
The pumpkin was the most anticipated but my least favourite. I'm usually a huge fan of pumpkin pie so I thought I would love it but it was way too sweet. Maybe it was the sugar syrup on top but it was way too much. I was unpleasantly reminded of a PSL, all sugary creamy sadness topped with cinnamon, the kind of overpowering sweet makes you want to stop drinking halfway. It wasn't that bad and I was able to finish it, but if the scoop had been any larger, I may have lost the battle.
I would come again if in the area and it was a special occasion but if I were a local, I'd rather get a large Costco tub than go out. I'm much too cheap to spend $5 on a small regularly.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Third time is a harm  ! 

 After the first two good experiences with Smitten, we shouldn't come back for the third time. Because it made us realized that the only reason that we love them so much at the first place, not because they have the greatest ice cream on earth but because it looked so "COOL" when you saw them made this ice cream for the first time. 

  Yesterday, our latest visit to Smitten, was an eye opener experience for us. Not only the wait was crazy long  (the line moved so slow as we discovered later on that their machines were broken )  but the variety of the ice cream has significant shrunken. A year before, they used to have at least 4 favors  for you to select now it downs to only TWO, Vanilla and Olive oil ! Neither were that good. 

My uncles who died to tried Smitten (it's their first time). They dragged us to stayed in the line with them for 45 mins, later on, commented to us that Smitten ice cream has a very smooth texture but they had a better (taste) ice cream somewhere else in the Bay Area. And I couldn't agree more. 

 If you have never tried them, go ahead and do it !
But you would probably agree with me, esp after trying them for a couple time, that Smitten is like a shinny object, it looks so cool at the first time but after playing with it for a couple of time, it gets dull.
author: Dom G.

description: Insanley awesome liquid nitrogen ice cream. It is sooooo creaaamy and delicious, i'm gonna die! Tried all of their flavors.. They are all good but Chocolate is my favorite. That's because i'm a chocolate dude, sweet and delicious. Fresh mint chip is awesome too!
author: Laurence S.

description:
OoOoOo liquid nitrogen ice cream ?? The AP chem student inside of me was super happy when I finally got to try this place out! 

I got the apple crisp flavor and my friend got the caramel flavor. Both had a really smooth texture. I liked the caramel flavor more - it was a bit bitter, and not too caramel-y. The apple crisp (seasonal) was good, but it was a tad bit more tangy than I would have liked. 

Somewhat pricey- there's only one size, so for about 4.50ish you will get two baby scoops, which I thought was just the right amount. Guess you're paying more for the experience of liquid nitrogen? You also have to pay an extra like fifty cents for the season flavor, which I didn't agree with, but oh well, still a really nice treat :D


Located in cute hayes valley area, surely a sweet place to end a date, heheh.
author: Ashley N.

description:
Individually handmade ice cream! Yes!

Awesome construction of the building, putting reuse to its best by making the place out of old shipping containers? Yes!

Very tiny portions, boo! but still worth it!

I'd heard a lot about Smitten and was really excited to try it after having an awesome dinner at Absinthe just down the street with my partner and his parents.

It was really cool to see them hand-make the ice cream with the machines and really gives Smitten a competitive advantage over other artisan ice cream makers.

The ice cream comes out super smooth and the flavors are extremely bright and vibrant as they hit your pallet.  The chocolate ice cream was smooth, creamy and just hit the spot with real cocoa flavor.

The one that really blew my mind was the mint.  It's flavor is on a completely different level compared to other conventional mint ice creams and now I can never go back!

They use REAL mint in their mint ice cream and you can really taste the mint leaf in the ice cream.

My partner got the carrot cake, which was the least of my favorite, but thats because I hate carrot cake, but he seemed to enjoy it.

I'd definitely suggest Smitten to anyone.  Great place for kids as well to show them the real science of making ice cream as the machines give a great "wow" factor to the ice cream (see image)
author: Kameron K.

description:
I had read so much about this place in a variety of publications, we had to try it. 

We attempted to come here once before, but the line was so long we decided to bail. 

Saturday night we had great parking due to having dinner nearby, and the line was fairly short. 

We just wanted to taste it, so we split a kiddie cup. Yes, it is small, and yes it is expensive, but you should expect that when coming here. It's a novelty kind of dessert, and much more labor intensive than your standard ice cream shop. 

We had the chocolate, and it was so smooth and creamy, it actually reminded me of chocolate mousse. If i had a larger size, it might have been too much, but splitting the kiddie size gave us each a few spoonfuls that were completely satisfying. 

If i was in the area, and the line wasn't crazy long, i would definitely return.
author: Amanda G.

description:
I really don't understand what the hype is all about with this place. 

The girl with the glasses behind the counter could really work on her customer service skills. She was condescending and pissed my friend and I off.  My friend convinced me not to say anything. Thankfully, the guys behind the counter were sweet and more than made up for her attitude. 

Back to the ice cream.....

Friend ordered chocolate, like my friend Alex P. mentioned, it tastes exactly like a chocolate frosty from Wendy's. 

I ordered the salted caramel in a cone. Initially tasted great but the flavor dissipated from your mouth so quickly it left me disappointed. The handmade cone was delicious but it didn't hold ice cream in very well. 

Afterwards, the tip of my tongue had a weird tingling feeling for a good hour afterward. Weird.

Plenty of other great ice cream places to visit in city.
author: Meaza S.

description: Overrated, guys. For 4.75 for 4 oz, I'm really disappointed in the taste of the ice cream. Granted I got the salted caramel which may not be the best flavor there, the flavor was just not up to expectations. Way saltier and not as caramel-y than most salted caramels. The liquid nitrogen was able to make the texture very light and fluffy (relative to other ice creams) but seriously, that taste. Not worth it, sadly.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Occasion: Dessert with Susan, Isaac, and Natasha 

What I Had: 
Salted Caramel
Brown Sugar with Cinnamon Shortbread 

Food Review: GREAT. FLAVORS. Sweet tooth stricken per usual, I ordered the two most decadent flavors on the menu, and Smitten never fails to deliver. Their ice cream is never too sweet, and in fact balances the sweet carefully with salty flavors (salt, pistachios, what have you). And of course, it's always fun to watch them make it "fresh" right before your eyes! 

Service Review: I've had mixed experiences with the service here. Some employees are super upbeat and friendly, others perhaps less so. 

Venue Review: Doesn't get more adorable than Hayes Valley. And I've never had trouble with street parking. 

Overall Impression: Hasn't gotten old yet. Their ice cream is delicious and experiential.
author: Rachael K.

description: Liquid nitrogen! Who would've thought! -321 degrees and poof amazing ice cream with of course the secret ingredients: tcho chocolate, fresh mint, blood orange ice cream, and classic vanilla with matching toppings. Lines get long so being a friend.
author: Kris O.

description: Customer service is so damn rude. The irony of serving grumpy ice cream. Go to bi-rite people.... at least they have patience. Bi-rite creamery. Dolores park.
author: Darren P.

description: What's not to like about fresh ice cream made right before your eyes and puffed with nitrogen?  Minus a star; I think they are trying to accommodate more customer turnover so the ice cream texture isn't as good anymore.
author: David C.

description:
This has to be one of my highlights of Summer of 2013.  We came for a day to the city on summer vacay.  Had to come check out Smitten, after seeing them on 'best thing I ever ate'

We ordered the Tcho Chocolate, a Salted Carmel, and a Lavender.  Everything was wonderful.  The texture was very interesting.  I can't say that I loved that it was that thick, but I certainly appreciated the creamy mouthfeel.  

Can't wait to come back and try more flavors.
author: Samanta V.

description:
I really do not see what the ice cream is all about. It's a fad. Paid around $6 for a single scoop of ice cream which tasted like regular ice cream but lighter aftertaste. 

Only good to say, one has tried it.
author: M C.

description:
Meh.  I'm not smitten. 

Albeit they made it one scoop at a time, I guess I just was not all that impressed.  There are many better choices around, and it just takes too long for you to get your cup.  

After finishing my vanilla, had a bite of my friend's chocolate.  Still the same sentiment. 

3.5 stars.
author: Mark M.

description: Only tried one ice cream- the TCHO chocolate but it was DIVINE! I am a chocoholic as is my husband and we said it was the best ice cream we've tasted in a long, long, time. Creamy, dreamy, and more dense than fluffy- this ice cream is heaven!
author: Piper W.

description:
OOOOOOooooo!!! So cold but so good. 


It was freezing and we stopped by this place after dinner. Open air so it was quite drafty. 

Nice little set up inside. We tried vanilla with brittle on top, and one other flavor. 

The little machines they use are totally cool. The ice cream is great. Super tasty, and sOOOOO creamy. I love good ice cream. I dont like my ice cream to be too creamy but it was still very good. Only problem was the price. 2 small ice creams were 10 bucks!!! cmon. really?
author: Benjamin B.

description: Smitten Ice Cream is good stuff. Its location is ideal. Hayes Valley is where you want to be, and if you're there, you want to be licking an ice cream cone.  Smitten has limited and seasonal flavors, it's no baskin-robins kinda variety. There were 4 different flavors. I enjoyed my classic vanilla and appreciate their different take on creating an always-good-thing.
author: Jade Y.

description:
I always thought liquid nitrogen ice cream was just a novelty, just a flashy way to make ice cream. Boy was I wrong. I wandered into Smittens during my hour long wait for German food. Their establishment fits nicely in a shipping contain retrofitted with a hip look. My initial thought was that I was going to get ripped off. 5 dollars for ice cream on a cone seemed much, but when I saw the rhubarb crunch flavor, my peaked my interest.

The rhubarb ice cream tasted just like pie and the texture was smooth and creamy. There were crispy chunks inside that tasted like delicious pie crust, what a treat! The 50 cents for a waffle cone was well worth it. It reminded me of a buttery shortbread cookie.

The ice cream was a bit pricey, but if I want to indulge myself with some dessert, I might have to revisit Smitten.
author: David C.

description: This is my new favorite spot for ice cream! I've been to popular ice cream shops up and down the west coast, and this one serious takes the cake. Or I guess the ice cream. I'm a big fan of anything with cookie dough, and the cookie dough ice cream here is enlightening. I felt like my eyes/tastebuds were open to what cookie dough should truly taste like. On another note, the cone is a MUST. I never thought I would pay $7.25 for a regular scoop on a cone, but I will gladly do so again.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Thank God I don't like near here because I would not be able to walk by without an ice cream cone in hand. 

I had the rhubarb crunch and it was superb! I usually only get my ice cream in a cup but a friend suggested I get one of their homemade cones and boy was she right. The cone was thick, crunchy, and kind of tasted like shortbread. 

Looking forward to trying some other flavors next time I'm in Hayes Valley.
author: Lexi M.

description:
We were very fortunate to be staying by this shop which was super adorable. We were even more lucky that they had vegan options!

The sign only had two - vegan pops, fudgesicle or salted caramel. Sadly, no more salted caramel. But the fudgesicle was excellent - made with coconut milk, it was very fudgey with a hint of cococnut. They were very adorable and a great treat, if a little heavy.

More creative vegan options would be great, especially with the coconut milk base!
author: Allyson D.

description:
Smitten is a definitely a novelty ice cream shoppe because of the 'made to order' nature of their ice cream mix being churned into frozen goodness w/liquid nitrogen right in front of your eyes. I would certainly place it on my "try-it-at-least-once" list, but as for a spot on my "to-be-revisited" list...it earns it by the merit of its mint reviews (I LOVE mint, I have GOT to try their Mint).

The place itself is nestled in Hayes Valley and looks like a fancy lemonade stand - super cute, and I can see the summer appeal already. 

As for the ice cream: I had the TCHO chocolate ice cream. I didn't add any toppings, 'cause I wanted to see how the ice cream stood on its own (the way I do with other ice creams).  Overall, it was very velvety, creamy and rich, while still retaining a lightness that I imagine is the characteristic of being freshly churned and consumed immediately. It is definitely a *textural experience. However, I haven't quite decided if I'd be able to really taste a difference between ice cream from Smitten and from another equally well rated shoppe. Perhaps by that merit also, I need to revisit.

Looks like I'll be back!
author: Emmeline A.

description:
This is some serious Mr. Wizard nonsense!  Watching the workers spray clouds of liquid nitrogen into the spinning vats of flavored cream makes the wait fly by.  Definitely more exciting than watching individual cups of coffee brew drip-by-drip at another vendor nearby.  The ingredients are organic and sparsely simple, displayed in picture form for all those illiterates.  The whole experience is a little gimmicky, but at least it's a novel gimmick (unlike cereal on frozen yogurt).

The end result is super creamy and on the verge of melting.  It's the texture of ice cream you make at home, except for frozen in a minute or two instead of 25-30 minutes.  Softer than soft serve; I'm definitely a fan.  I got the salted caramel which was amazing, though extremely buttery!  The waffle cone tastes more like thin almond cookie than a traditional cone.  My snacking partner liked it a lot more than I did.  But maybe I was just hung up on the fact that the cone was made with a huge gap in the bottom that required constant plugging with the wrapper and a thumb.  Definitely room for improvement since it should be more cone-like and less cylinder-like.
author: Adam B.

description:
What am I missing? It's ice cream, frozen on the spot for you, right? That's it, right?
I mean on a nice day it's cool because it's outdoors but what else?
I mean I like ice cream and I like neat things but I found myself underwhelmed.
I can't say this would be on a must list for ice cream fans.
author: Lizzy M.

description: Omg I thought I was in love with the brown sugar but the blood orange with pistachio cookies tho! I almost died.
author: Mary-Helen A.

description: A very cool store that is certainly an experience to go to. The salted caramel was a little bit too salty, but the vanilla was delicious. The machines they use to make the ice cream are awesome. It's pretty expensive as far as ice cream places go (think $6 for a double scoop plus another dollar for the cone). The waffle cone is probably not worth the extra money.
author: Alex V.

description:
Certainly the best ice-cream making spot I've ever seen. I love their creative use of liquid nitrogen to make the ice cream on the spot. 

Solidly good flavor. Not cloyingly sweet like so many tourist confections (cough, Ghiraradelli). I'd skip the sweet corn. It was like cold, smooth creamed corn. Interesting enough, but even a small cup was too much. A bite would have sufficed.
author: Rae B.

description: Funky little location near a tiny little park. Yummy, yet small selection of flavors. Fun to watch them make it. Customer service is hit and miss. The Cone was my favorite part, but the icecream and toppings were delish too!
author: Gogo M.

description:
Had to come here to see what all the hype is about. I haven't had LN2 (liquid nitrogen) ice cream since the 8th grade so I was definitely craving some. The day I went, there were 4 flavors: TCHO 60.5% dark chocolate, salted caramel, rhubarb crisp (strawberry tart), and vanilla. 

3 sizes for scoops:
-kiddie (1 scoop) for $3.75
-single (2 scoops) for $4.75
-double (3 scoops) for $6. 

Caveat, all scoops are for ONE FLAVOR ONLY! If you want to have multiple flavors, get several kiddie scoops. Cash or credit (they use square readers on an iPad). They also sell Hansen's sugar-cane soda, Jarritos, and bottled water.

I opted for a salted caramel single to stay safe since I don't like chocolate and vanilla on a regular basis anyway. The queue was long but quick. I waited for about 5 minutes. The taste was absolutely perfect, better than Bi-Rite dare I say. However, unlike regular ice cream, LN2 ice cream melts faster so I was looking to scooping more bites into my mouth faster than I wanted to. 

If you want to compost your cup and spoon, hand it back to the cashier. There is a sign that clearly says the trash bins right by the waiting area are strictly garbage, unfortunately.

It is nice that Patricia's Green park and playground is right across the street. There is ton of open space but be aware of people smoking, dogs running around, and the occasional car driving down Octavia.
author: Dominic T.

description: Best paired with bread pudding from Schulzies half a block away! Why are Schulzies, Biergarten & Smitten within such close proximity...
author: Linda X.

description:
I've been wanting to try Smitten even before they officially opened their doors. With the warmer than average temps that we had as recently as a week ago I've stayed away knowing the lines were going to be fairly long. So with today being a rainy day we decided to stop by Smitten when we were heading home driving through Hayes. 

I can already see the lines that will be building once the warm weather returns. They may need more than the 4 "Kelvin" ice cream making machines. It was an experience though, watching my made to order ice cream being blended with clouds of vapors emitting from their machine. They had a unique "register" of an iPad where your card is scanned through an attached card reader and you sign your name with your fingers directly onto the iPad screen. (Why can't the mobile food trucks do this too?!)

Three to four minutes later I had my strawberry ice cream in one hand and the shovel-like spoon in the other. Hubs had the salted caramel which I liked better than my strawberry. Texture was smooth, rich and creamy. I'm a fan of their salted caramel.  

Im not docking for prices but I'd have to agree with the others. Their ice cream is on the pricey side. Maybe a dollar too steep...?
author: Esther A.

description:
Something about the cold weather makes me crave ice cream. Maybe because it's something that's colder than me, thus making me think I'm actually warmer than I am. Enter Smitten. 

On the particular night we went, there were three flavors: Mint Chip with Tcho Chocolate, Vanilla and Sticky Toffee Pudding. I usually go for the most unique and sweet sounding choice so the last one was my pick. After our individual batch was made and all the smoke subsided, I took to the spoon and was delighted that this ice cream was the smoothest I've ever had and it wasn't super sweet. It was a perfect combo of dates and toffee swirled in some of the most delicious vanilla. 

After experiencing and being spoiled by so many wonderful ice cream shops around the bay area (and being Bi-Rite's neighbor!), it was refreshing to still be able to be surprised by this dessert.

Happy 2013 everyone!
author: Julia T.

description:
Lovely! Really cute place in a shipping container. The liquid nitrogen ice cream is gimmicky but really fun. Great customer service, great flavors. I had the creme fraiche seasonal flavor with pear caramel sauce & I added almond brittle. Amaaaaaazing. It's pricey but worth it for an occasional treat.
Also right in the little square/park area, which is nice.
author: Vicki G.

description:
I had my doubts.  I mean, $4.75 for one scoop of ice cream - albeit made-to-order liquid nitrogen ice cream - is a bit steep.  But, alas, I'll admit - Smitten Ice Cream has got some pretty damn good tasting ice cream. 

Smitten is to ice cream as Honolulu's Waiola is to shaved ice - texture so smooth you just have to try it, and abundant flavor to match.  I love how orders are placed on post-its and then stuck to the wall, so you get a true idea of just how long your order will take (60 seconds to make your ice cream!).  I also love getting to actually observe Kelvin (the ice cream making machine) doing his thang - and that Kelvin even has a name.

I'm only holding back a fifth star because the flavors during my visit (Tcho Chocolate, Vanillla, Double Ginger, Spiced Banana) weren't super appealing to me.  However, I will say that the Tcho Chocolate the bf and I settled on was the best chocolate ice cream I've ever had, and this is coming from someone who never orders chocolate ice cream.  If Smitten can convert me into a chocolate ice cream fan, just imagine what they can do with flavors I already enjoy!
author: Mel T.

description:
Ahhhhh Smitten's again. I got the small nectarine ice cream on a cone. Literally just found out a week ago that my favorite fruit is nectarines.... yummm. So juicy, so sweet, and the aroma and taste of nectarines mmmm mmmm mm. 

Anyways, the nectarine ice cream was delicious. They topped my ice cream with thick nectarine syrup which was more tart and nectarine-y than the ice cream. I found the tart contrast of the syrup to the ice cream greatly enhanced the flavors of both. The ice cream itself was deliciously smooth and creamy with small bits of nectarine spread throughout. The cone was perfect as usual. You can't come here without getting their amazing crunchy delicious tasty waffle cone. It's almost a requirement. So good. ughhhhhh
author: Ernest C.

description: My husband and I are regulars here and i was excited to bring my cousin here for his first time, but we got the worst attitude from the guy taking our order!! My cousin tried to order a brown sugar ice cream with chocolate syrup and whipped cream.. Michael the guy with the weird looking mustache gave him the nastiest look of confusion when he didn't understand the order.  He could of said sorry can you repeat your order but instead looked at us annoyed and irritated! .. We were very embarrassed to bring him here and have horrible service!! The ice cream was on point like always but the attitude from Mr. Captain Hook not so much!
author: Marisa T.

description: Great ice cream. They really make it when you order. Tried their nectarine & cream and cookie dough. I liked the cookie dough better. Also go with their pairings it's pretty good. Affordable price as well for $5 you get a small cup with generous 2 scoops. Will surely recommend
author: Milana R.

description: Fun to check out. I'm good with Baskin Robbins but this is definitely a fun thing to experience at least once. Don't expect the mint to taste like normal mint ice cream. It tastes just like a mojito minus the alcohol. Lol. Wait is long but I guess makes it worth while. I'd recommend the chocolate. We ordered all the flavors and that was by far the best. This place would benefit by having more machines with a little more quality control. Cool concept... But the orchestration needs some fine tuning.
author: Bri K.

description:
My sister took me here and we are both huge ice cream fanatics. It was not good, in my opinion.

I got the mint chocolate chip with the additional chocolate drizzle of $0.50. It was so bad! I read this in a couple of previous reviews and I have to chime in as well. Way too overly minty, they overdid the mint leaves like crazy. I felt like I was just chewing on a mint leaf. And the chocolate drizzle was nothing impressive for the additional money. Blech. I kinda though it was one of those acquired flavors where if you keep eating it it would get better......yeah it didn't. 

My sister got the TCHO chocolate flavor and I was also not impressed. Overall I think this place is cute and has good presentation, I enjoyed watching my ice cream being made. The end result was disappointing though. Head on over to Bi-Rite instead for the heavenly salted caramel.


P.S. They should find a way to get pigeons out of the place! A FAT PIGEON ALMOST ATTACKED ME TO GET TO MY ICE CREAM. Rude.
author: Emily C.

description: Decent ice cream over hyped with the nitrogen..butter ice cream left a film on tongue was not impressed with the flavor. Topping of berries was spot on.  Mint flavor was ok tasted like a strong green tea taste.  Had  high hopes will not right off just yet will try some more flavors before summer ends. humphrys is better especially that morning breakfast...
author: EL D.

description:
Smitten was the first time I've experienced liquid nitrogen-made ice cream. Unfortunately, the use of liquid nitrogen didn't have a lasting impression on me as its use in the scene of Terminator 2 where the T-1000 shatters into a billion pieces.

On the warm weekday afternoon I checked out Smitten, they offered three flavors: classic vanilla, TCHO chocolate, and rhubarb crisp. The latter was the obvious choice to me since it stood out amongst the other plain Jane-ish flavors. The rhubarb crisp is a seasonal flavor that is tart with a bit of crunch. The ice cream is pretty good, but honestly, I think it would've left a better taste in my mouth had the price of a small scoop was not a whopping $4.75.

I might give Smitten another try if I'm in the neighborhood, but its price point isn't something I'd go out of my way to come back.
author: Sylvia D.

description:
Pretty freaking rad to have ice cream made to order.
The ice-cream itself is pretty good but nothing to rave about--for the price you get a good amount of ice cream and Hayes Valley is a great place to enjoy an ice cream!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Expensive and little taste. My first time here and I was not WOWed. I may not be a professional ice cream taster, but I know what I like! 
I tried the Nectarine ice cream. Sure you get about two scoops for $5 dollars, but I don't think the price matches the quality. I've had some really really good liquid nitrogen ice cream in Redlands and I guess I'm spoiled from that. My expectations were too high!
author: Leilani Q.

description:
I always bring all of my out of towners to this little spot. "Have you ever had ice cream that's made right in front of you right after you order it?" That always peaks their interest. While they're looking over the menu, I order and just sit back as they ooo and ahh over their ice cream being made behind the glass.

The chocolate is great but I'm a huge fan of their regular vanilla, and don't forget the brittle. Their pistachio brittle is a definite must!!!
author: Mindy T.

description: Smitten is such a cute ice cream spot in Hayes Valley and definitely one of my favorites in SF. Hands down, BEST (Tcho) chocolate ice cream EVER. I'm usually not a chocolate ice cream person, but Smitten's is so rich, creamy and delicious! I've also tried their strawberry something (I forget what else is in it), earl grey with chocolate chips, and salted caramel (Bi-Rite still wins this one). Those were good, but not amazing like the chocolate. Their handmade cones are also so good! But if you really want a cone, come early enough because they run out near closing time. Also all their ice cream is made to order with liquid nitrogen machines! So cool (literally and figuratively), but the only downside to that is you can't taste the 3 different flavors of the day. It's a little pricey for ice cream, but the Tcho chocolate is so worth it!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Got the classic vanilla with brown sugar caramel and cinnamon short bread crumbles. Fresh ice cream made on the spot. Pretty good stuff!!! 

Nice place to try out
author: Oliver S.

description: Ice cream is YUMMY and perfect during this heat wave!! But, unfortunately the staff are rude and are obviously letting the heat affect their customer service. No tip for you.
author: Isabella M.

description: great ice cream and its fun to watch them make it.  Be ready for the lines as everybody obviously agrees.
author: Stacey G.

description:
Try the fresh mint!! Its fresh and its flavorful! Not to mention its a nice little show. 
This would be a great little date spot, there is a park right across the street where you and your boo can enjoy your ice cream. Then go for a walk through the hyde area, maybe some drinks. 

Great place! Entertain or just be a fatass by yourself (like me lol) cant go wrong.

Also they are constantly changing their menu and trying new things, so you can expect to try something new every time you go. wont get boring any time soon.
author: Preet S.

description: Uhmm, I tried to go on a Sunday after brunch around 2pm and the line was crazy long. So, I went back on a Wednesday night and it was perfect, only 2 people in line :). The ice cream is made in front of your face, they have a couple of different flavor. I got the chocolate-choco, if you like chocolate you will love the taste. It is very creamy, just perfect! The best ice cream I have ever taste!!!
author: Kim K.

description:
Yeah yeah, blah blah, ice cream is great, yadda yadda, liquid nitrogen, schmitrogen.
Yes the ice cream is good but that pistachio brittle is like CRACK ROCKS!

I would easily buy a dime bag of that stuff.
author: Augusto M.

description: We stopped in to try their ice cream. The flavors were limited, but it's really good. It's very creamy. I bought the chocolate and my buddy got the vanilla. I prefer the vanilla over the chocolate because the chocolate was a bit too rich for my personal taste. Overall this place is worth a try. I'll buy vanilla next time.
author: Harvey D.

description:
This place is awesome!

Each order of ice cream is made to order so this probably as fresh as ice cream can get.  I had the salted caramel and it was probably the best salted caramel ice cream I have ever had!  

They have some non-traditional flavors and toppings and I think it might be on a daily rotation. 

The ice cream was nice and creamy, not too sweet, and the consistency was on point.  I like that they listed out all the ingredients (or at least I think so?) on the menu board so I know exactly what's going in my body. 

I'll definitely be back to try other flavors next time!  I would give them 5 stars but $4.75+ for a small seems a bit steep for ice cream.
author: Maggi K.

description:
Smitten ice cream is a cool & fun concept. It looks like a pop up ice cream shop. The shop is set up in a shipping container.

Each scoop is made to order due to the liquid nitrogen process. 

Smitten offers 3 different flavors daily -- the selections were Salted caramel, Strawberry Rhubarb and vanilla on the day i visited. I ordered a kiddie size Salted caramel (@3.75) and it was really good. However, the salted caramel was extremely rich, a little too rich. I couldn't finish my kiddie scoop. But the ice cream was so creamy - i loved the texture. 

I'm definitely going to go back to try other flavors.
author: Terry C.

description: Very smooth ice cream.  Had the salted carmel.  Made to serve with liquid nitrogen.  This is a unique building made out of shipping containers. Very cool!  I was not a fan of the flavor of ice cream I had but I will come back to see if I can find something I do like better as the texture was very nice to the ice cream!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I tried the Cinnamon Toast Crunch flavor and had a sensory double take. Likeness to cereal uncanny. Sans fake sugary taste. Tastes so new and fresh it was foreign. Wasn't sure I liked it. Ingredients are so natural. 

Cone tastes like a high quality fortune cookie. 

I can taste the undercurrent of egg after a while which is strange. Cinnamon is strong as hell. Punchy. Floury. Like a creamy baked good. 

Eating and writing like its a science experiment. 

The regular w three scoops of this flavor might be too much. 

Fun watching the churning process.
author: Quentin J.

description:
I was really excited upon hearing about trying liquid nitrogen ice-cream. Smitten is located in the trendy/ hipster district of Hayes Valley. 

Perusing the menue, I was disappointed that there was only 4 flavors to chose from, and they all sounded pretty basic. I figured what's limited in quantity should be made up in quality. I chose the Honey Nectarine w/ cinnamon sugar shortbread. My first bite did not blow me away. It was really creamy but almost to the point of being a bit too runny. I didn't like the artificial taste of the nectarine sauce being drizzled over, it was too sweet for my liking and trust me I'm a big fan of sweets. 

My friends weren't really amazed with the Honey Nectarine either. My other friend got vanilla ice-cream with pistachio brittle and dark chocolate shavings, although it may sound so simple, the pistachio brittle really gave it that WOW-factor.  

I guess for those wanting to experience the novelty of this nitrogen-based ice-cream should go and try it at least once, but it's not something that I would go out of the way again for.
author: Marie N.

description: Yes ! Go get some NOW.
author: Manny G.

description:
So today my boyfriend and I went to Smitten because we are absolute ice cream lovers! We love to try new flavors, make our own ice cream at home, and have had gelato and sorbetto from Italy. And to be honest, smitten was nice to see but everything but good and here are the reasons why:

Hygiene (!!!!)
It was fairly chaotic due to the many customers but what I really can't ignore is the fact that they keep using the same pots over and over and that the (cumbling..?) earl gray ice cream kept flying around the pot and machine every time they took the pot away. It was just such a mess and everything was full of sticky white semi-freddo... Oh, and employees used their hands to just wipe some of it off the workspace but then didn't bother to clean them.........????????

Order: 
We ordered Vanilla and paid for that. Once we were called they told us that their vanilla machine broke down so we should please choose something different. Okay. Sh*t happens, we chose chocolate. Another 5-8min later we were called again, they handed us a cup with a scoop of white ice cream...? Salted caramel.... 

Taste: 
the ice cream was very dense and creamy but the taste was so intense that we both didn't enjoy it very much. It tasted more like a cream or paste than icecream. It was just way too much and too strong for us. Granted we are both not American so we don't enjoy overly sweet food very much but oh well, we definitely won't come back...
author: Virginia F.

description: Some really incredible ice cream! They make it on the spot and chill it with liquid nitrogen. There's some science about how rapid cooling with nitrogen makes it freeze differently so it tastes better. I'm a believer. Definitely worth doing if you're nearby.
author: Stef G.

description:
They make the ice cream right in front of you after you order it!

I'm a big ice cream fan and it was a pretty unique experience. It was hard for me to decide what flavor to get since you can only pick one flavor no matter what, so I got the 60% TCHO chocolate and seasonal sweet corn with berries (two small orders and two scoops for each). I have to say the sweet corn was just amazing, so get it before it's gone!
