But you will be paying a very high premium price for ice cream that is "just good," and the portions you get are VERY small.  That's okay, because we don't need a lot of ice cream, but if you go, you should understand that you are paying for the experience of watching the gimmicky ice cream machines, because the product is merely good, but the prices suggest so much more.

Would I go back here?  Not really, unless it was to take my kids for the fun of the experience.  Was it worth the stop?  Definitely, it was fun.  But now I've been there, done that.  The experience was fun, but in all honesty, and at my age, I'm in it for the food.
author: Steven K.

description: My daughter saw Smitten's on Unique Sweets so we figured, when in Rome.... Well it gave my GPS a nice workout but we found it.  In short, it was worth the search since the ice cream was great. A limited selection but was it good.  Vanilla and chocolate is what our group had. Simple and amazing. The service is good and they process the line fast.
author: J P.

description: Get the strawberry! So creamy so perfect so good I can't believe I've never noticed this place before! Even the regular vanilla was good. I also like their salted caramel (although it's not the best *ahem Birite/Humphrey Slo"* Their brittle is also delicious. It's tough because sometimes they don't have my flavors, so it can be a hit or miss. It's just sad that the portions are so tiny.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Smitten on a Sunday! Beautiful weather and lively neighborhood! Their semi-outdoor seating was a relaxing and welcomed sit out of the sun.

Yes, it is pricey - $6 for a regular (similar sized offering at Humphry Slocombe for $4something and you can choose more than one flavor) when you can buy like a lot more ice cream for $6 at the market. But you are also paying for the experience. Being our first time, we were sad that we couldn't mix flavors but also intrigued by the whole process. Watching the mixers go is very exciting!

And yes, the ice cream IS amazingly smooth and creamy. We got the vanilla, and it's like eating butter, which is a wonderful thing. Since their process is so unique, it's understandable that they don't offer as many flavors as some other ice cream shops. But I personally like to have options, so I may prefer to go somewhere else if their daily flavors are not to my liking.

At the end of the day, it was good enough that I would tell my friends about this place and would go back and bring out of town visitors. The End!
author: Jen L.

description:
I Not At All Smitten! 
My son and daughter in law took me to this place today and after standing in a LONG line...when we approaches the counter I noticed there was a small sign that read something like "Sorry We Are Out of Cones Today"... so I decided to pass to make a statement. 
How can an Ice Cream shop run out of cones in the middle of a Saturday? 
And I bet that sign wasn't made up today.
author: Jon B.

description:
It is impossible not to fall in love with this place. The immediate feeling that you're in a kid's (or an evil scientist's) private chemistry lab is the thing you notice first, around the same time as you notice the hilarious liquid nitrogen contraptions and kind staff and cute company story and logo. I love this place.

It's a little pricier than your Humphrey slowcombes and Bi-Rites, but not by much, definitely comparable. And the taste is amazing. It's way different than any ice cream you've had before, as the process makes it very creamy and without the ice crystals you're used to from any ice cream you've ever had before this. The fresh ingredients are fantastic, the fresh mint was an unexpected and amazing kick of freshness!

There is no way you'll leave this place unsatisfied.
author: Mike J.

description: The ice cream is good, but for the price plus the wait for them to make your order, I would only come here for special treats only.
author: MT Y.

description: What a fun experience and delicious ice cream. The ice cream was creamy and packed with fresh flavors.  The balsamic drizzle on the strawberry ice cream was unique and well executed. The chocolate was my favorite! Tasted like a truffle center. The waffle cone smelled better than it tasted so I'd save your money and just go for the cup!
author: Sonya L.

description: I am not exaggerating when I say this is the best ice cream I've ever had. There are really no words to explain it. Just go. NOW.
author: Nicky K.

description:
Oh smitten, you silly Billy Nye meets Ice Cream Parlor, you. 

The ice cream here is admittedly delicious, though a bit on the pricey side (as are most things in Hayes Valley). Definitely worth checking out at least once a summer, before or after hitting up the beer garden or off the grid.
author: Eliza D.

description:
5 STARS~~

This place looks like it's in the middle of a park area and doesn't really have any walls but don't let the exterior fool you.  The ice cream is so good!

They make each ice cream to order.  They only have 3 or 4 flavors but they make it so well.  So even if there isn't much variety, each ice cream is just that good.  Each ice cream is about $4.50 but there are many homemade topping you can include (make sure you get the brittle!)

The reason the ice cream is so good is because ice crystals form in the ice cream the longer it's been made so naturally if they make it to order, there are fewer ice crystals.

Try it out, much worth it!
author: Herman C.

description: I think a stingy me gave this 4 stars.  I'm offended at myself.  Let me correct the rating and give Smitten the 5 stars they deserve.  Best ice cream in the city hands down no contest.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars if there were more than 4 flavors on the menu at any given time.  I understand why that's the case, but I mean, how cool would it be to truly have the ice cream made the way you want it?! Ok, enough criticism...

I've been dreaming of Smitten for the last 3 weeks. The first time I had it, I swear there were some sort of drugs in it, because I had never laughed as much as I did when eating Smitten ice cream. It was a very surreal experience, I was really happy and giddy when eating this ice cream and so were my friends. So, ok, maybe there weren't any drugs, but the ice cream was so deliciously creamy that it could have been the same.

The taste of the salty caramel was a perfect blend of savory and sweet. The TCHO Chocolate was mouth watering. The Lemon Meyer Ginger was good (except for the ginger, I would have liked it better without the ginger). 

The $6 is definitely pricey, but for an every now and then thing... definitely worth it. Ugh, I need to have some ice cream now...
author: Jamie P.

description:
So freaking tasty. I like Mitchell's ice cream better, but the novelty of this ice cream shop is so much fun. They make each cup of ice cream individually with liquid nitrogen. Also completely over priced.

But how could you have a better afternoon? Go to the Octavia & Hayes park area, grab some ice cream, go to a food truck, grab a beer at the little beer garden thingie... It's just great, and this ice cream shop really contributes to it.
author: Jeff M.

description: Best ice cream ever. Love it!  Love the location. Love the concept.  Get the pistachio brittle or the "hybrittle" on chocolate or caramel ice cream with TCHO chocolate sauce!  Another favorite is the earl grey ice cream with rose syrup. Yum!
author: Lesa L.

description: The mint chip tastes strongly like spearmint FYI so after eating the ice cream, my mouth tasted like toothpaste or like Thai basil. I'm not really into that. I was also hoping for a more creamy base. The overall experience was fun to watch and the line was not too long considering how much of a hype it was. Nice vibe in the nearby park on a Sunday morning though!
author: Julian O.

description:
I have to say most of the people here are just in awe by the way their Ice cream is being made, people like to see the process of things and all the cool smoke coming out from the ice cream maker just makes it that much more fun.

The ice cream does melt quite fast so if you are a slow ice cream eater you might want to go with a cup. Flavors change and a good way to see whats good or "popular" is to look on the wall on the back to see whats been ordered the most. That and how clean one station is compared to the others.

Chai was nicely done, this one wasn't too sweet. But the Chocolate...geez too much sweetness..for me at least, when it melted you probably could of just used that as fudge haha.

Smitten is a nice place to check out and try but I wouldn't be a devoted follower. Its a bit pricy for ice cream but for what they are doing and showing I am not surprised. Give it a go, it could be your favorite go to stop for ice cream.
author: phillip w.

description:
2 stars doesn't mean I hated this place, but in the realm of ice cream, I have experienced so so much better.

A few general comments...
1) Liquid nitrogen doesn't mean it tastes better. If you've never seen this before, then, sure, come take a look. But since ice cream is frozen, regardless of the process, a creamery can use as fresh ingredients as they'd like to. 
2) This also means you can't taste flavors beforehand... which for me is half the fun of going out for ice cream as opposed to just buying a pint at the grocery store.
3) I personally like to choose from more than 3 flavors.

As for my ice cream, I got the tcho chocolate with meyer lemon caramel and pistachio brittle. I wasn't too impressed with the brittle and I guess I didn't know what to expect from the meyer lemon caramel, but I had wished it was more caramel-y. The tcho chocolate was pretty standard, I guess... but for standard chocolate ice cream, I don't need to pay $3 for a junior size.
author: Richa A.

description: Sweet, creamy to the point of being buttery. Delicious.  My date had the green tea ice cream, which was not as sweet as the coffee ice cream.
author: The P.

description:
This place is so fun! It's worth checking out for the experience. I had the salted caramel and it was good stuff, though a bit heavy to finish (although that tends to be ice cream in general for me). 

I had a chance to tour the back and see just how it is all done. The cones are hand rolled in the morning and you can see all the simple ingredients that they highlight on the board. The staff is friendly and wonderful. Can't wait to come back.
author: Raina B.

description:
the ice cream was good, but not great.  not creamy, but that's just what i prefer.

still, i think the novelty of this place makes up for it.

it's absolutely over priced, but it's just a fun place to take your friends to if they're visiting from out of town because you don't get to see this too often!

there's a reason why the line to this place  was long as shit despite it being cold and windy out.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Being an ice cream fanatic, and a fan of Creamistry (another liquid nitrogen ice cream store in Orange County) I had to try Smitten's while I was in town. 

The flavors are very unique and seem to encompass more unique flavors than other stores. Although the customization availabilities are limited to toppings. We ordered the fresh mint chip and the blood orange with pistachio short bread. 

The fresh mint chip was honestly too light for me, and I wished the mint was a little more potent. The blood orange with pistachio short bread was my favorite! The flavor was bold, not too sweet and the short bread was amazing. 

However, I wish the texture was a little more firm. I feel like if ice cream is too that it melts faster and it also seemed as though they may have used heavy cream in their base (hence the lighter consistency) which for me means even more fat than regular milk. 

Another thing that I was not too fond of was seeing that they did not even rinse out the bowls after each use. Instead you could see the ice cream stuck around the edges of the bowl, on the base of the mixer and on the whisks used to make each individual batch. This explains why they only have 4 flavors each day but hopefully they will find a way to keep their work space more tidy. 

Overall, it's worth trying so that you get to watch the process behind LN2 ice cream, but I think there is still room for improvement.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Ok, I am not a huge ice cream fan, which probably puts me in some type of 1% but every once in a while I'll have a small treat if it looks fresh. Smitten is a small joint in Hayes Valley and I just happen to see the sign. I decided to check it out and I was not disappointed! They only have about 5 flavors (or 26 fewer than Baskin Robbins) to choose from so you won't find Tutti-Fruit Bubble Gum Purple Crunch or what ever they have. Smitten just has really, really good ice cream. 

They make it in a special patented doo-hickey that use liquid nitrogen. Every order is made-to-order right before your bulging eyes. It takes a few more minutes but you can pass the time watching hipsters in the park across the street. I saw a guy practicing his mime moves which made me really want my ice cream to be done. Anyway, it was delicious. One warning though, this stuff isn't cheap, it's about $5 for a single scoop of heaven. So, if you are one of those types that likes to lay in bed with a quart of freezer-burned, Breyers on your belly, you will be disappointed by the portion size. However, your tongue will make you forget it.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
There's something magical about seeing your food prepared right in front of you.  I mean, that's the reason why people go to Benihana (Did I just refer to Benihana as magical? LOL OK).  The point is, seeing your food go from ingredients to the end product is fascinating.  While I wouldn't want to watch my bowl of chili slow cook for 10 hours, seeing ice cream being made in minutes makes the experience immensely more enjoyable to me.

The ice cream is different from the ice cream you'll find at other shops.  It's...creamier?  They have a handy sign that says that because they freeze the ice cream really fast, there are fewer ice crystals blah blah blah.  Whatever, it's delicious.

On the blackboard you'll find the flavors they have that day.  Annnnd for each flavor, they tell you exactly what goes into it by using these cute illustrated magnet things. Amazing.  Grab a scoop and go sit in the park area (which sometimes smells like pee, because it's a dog park, but eh), and go day drink in the beer garden after.  Best.

Oh also their cones are made of pizzelle.  BOOM!  Sold.
author: jon y.

description:
Smitten Ice Cream didn't leave me to be so smitten.

Came here with my sister and brother-in-law (third wheeling, yup at it's greatest) after visiting the NomNom Truck. Sister had heard of Smitten before, and said she had wanted to try it. So we did. We all got singles of various flavors, ritual coffee, vanilla with cocoa nib pralines and coconut with sesame brittle. Prices were a bit steep, at $4.75 each + tax (=total was over $15), for one little ball of ice cream. 

We originally asked if we could just have different scoops of different flavors in one, but the guy refused because he said each scoop is made on its own. We saw the girls pouring the cream into mixers and used liquid nitrogen to make our ice cream. It was pretty cool, but it wasn't amazing or anything. Each one came out one by one, and as we were waiting for the others, it started melting really quickly! No wonder why it was impossible to get a triple scoop in one container! 

Ritual coffee tasted like really strong coffee. Coconut with sesame brittle, tasted like straight coconut milk, not sweet enough with little crunch from the sesame brittle and vanilla w/ cocoa nib pralines was probably my favorite because it was most sweet, and I usually like it when there's some sort of texture in my ice cream. All were really creamy, but melted too quickly.

All in all, you're paying for magical ice cream made in front of your face and you will watch it magically melt the quickest you probably have seen ice cream melt, EVER. I personally didn't think it tasted all that great, I'd rather go to Bi-Rite.
author: Ada T.

description: BRRR. Very creamy texture, similar texture to butter. My favorite was the rose syrup mixed into the vanilla. TCHO chocolate is super, super rich so be careful. Very creative idea and I like how the store is in a packaging container/cart. No wait for me, came on a Monday night. Wish there were more flavor choices.
author: Ann P.

description: Not a fan. ..I was excited about trying this place but thought the flavors were just too rich.
author: Arinum R.

description:
After all the rave reviews, I expected much more from Smitten.

Sure, the idea of freshly made to order ice cream using liquid nitrogen is cool, but the product is disappointing.

My ice cream came out melted, and continued to melt at a very rapid pace. Yes, the ice cream has a more silky consistency than non-liquid-nitrogen ice creams but the fact that it melts so fast kills it for me. I ended up drinking half my ice cream.
author: Ashley V.

description:
As if this place needs another glowing review... but here goes:

You know a place has some damn good ice cream when people are willing to stand around eating it outside (more or less) on a chilly San Francisco night! But let me tell you, it's sooo worth it!

How it works:
I couldn't begin to tell you how the actual machines work... but Smitten has three "mainstay" kind of flavors (salted carmel, vanilla, and dark chocolate) and one monthly special flavor. Plus there are a ton of delicious- sounding toppings. You order, and then get to watch the magic liquid nitrogen machines billow out foggy vapor as they churn your ice cream from scratch!

The taste:
The whole smooth, no ice-crystals schtick Smitten has got going on is no joke! It is literally the smoothest, creamiest ice cream I've ever had. Even my boyfriend who hates sweets (really?!) loves this ice cream!

I really tried to resist, but I can't not say it... I'm smitten with this ice cream!!
author: Erin H.

description: Smitten is one of the best ice cream places I have ever been to! When my boyfriend and I started going up to San Francisco a lot, we'd usually stop in Hayes Valley and when we came across this little shop we decided to give it a try. The lines can get pretty long but it goes by pretty fast. Smitten is a very cute and the space is kind of small, but the way they make the ice cream is so unique compared to other places. I got the classic vanilla with brown sugar caramel, and when I took my first bite, it was so creamy and smooth and just so delicious! Smitten is literally the only place I would ever want to get ice cream! The neighborhood where Smitten is located is also really cute and there are so many different shops that you can pop in and take a look at! If it's your first time going to Smitten, I definitely recommend going and trying it out for yourself!
author: Michelle N.

description:
The addition of Smitten and Ritual are slowly transforming sleepy family-friendly Hayes Valley into a thriving playground for the young and ultra hip.

Made to order ice cream via liquid nitrogen?

How much more hip can you get?

Although the fresh made to order ice cream and fancy contraption may succeed in luring the hipsters out by the droves, they don't fool me. Recyclable containers and miniature spoons, long, never-ending lines, skinny denim as far as the eye can see, this is just a novelty item that will soon fade.

This tailor-made concoction may appear inviting, with its fancy well-worded flavors but it's missing the one simple element that makes it what it is. 

Ice.  

Simply put, your ice cream is too creamy, too sweet and not cold enough.  One should be able to enjoy a tiny kiddie cup without slurping the sugary sweet remains after 1 minute.

If there's one thing Smitten did right, it stirred up many long forgotten childhood memories of going out on warm summer nights for a crunchy vanilla wafer cone and real cold, i-won't-melt-in-30-seconds ice cream.
author: Lisa W.

description: It was tasty, but I prefer more in my ice cream other than just intensely rich sweetness. 3 licks will leave you thirsting for water. Maybe I just didn't pick the right combo, but we tried both the tcho and the salted caramel. Both had extras added in. Nothing to cartwheel over. I get it, a smaller offering of flavors allows for mastery. But for ice cream, I'd still prefer a larger variety of more exotic flavors. Overall, it's still worth a try for its creaminess. Can't really go wrong with any ice cream!
author: Jasmine D.

description:
Overhyped, easily illustrated by the long line out the shack. Cool concept: ice cream made to order using liquid nitrogen. But you're more sold on the concept than the taste and it was ridiculously overpriced. 

My friend and I got the Five Banana Spice and the TCHO Chocolate. The Five Banana Spice was odd and hard to finish, which says a lot given how little they give you. Spices and banana do not belong together. The TCHO Chocolate melted really fast, which is sad given how cool that day was. I could've bought a pint of chocolate ice cream for half the price, melt it a little, and I would have the same thing. Both of our selections were disappointing. 

The Salted Caramel was a flavor I wanted to try but unfortunately it wasn't offered that day. I may be willing to revisit JUST to try this particular flavor. Otherwise, I'm saving my money for some macaroons at Chantal right around the corner! ;)
author: Kathleen N.

description:
I stumbled upon this little ice cream shack last night as I was traversing through the fog and traffic looking for the elusive Hayes Valley parking spot. 

With my curiousity piqued, I backtracked a bit from my dinner destination to do a little snooping. As I got nearer, the gentle whirring of ice cream machines and puffs of condensation from the liquid nitrogen pipes only added to the novelty.

Despite the frigid night air and my better senses not to spoil dinner, the battle with my inner child was soon lost and I soon found myself clutching a Scoop of Bay Leaf ice cream with Meyer Lemon Caramel.

Even with all the quirky aspects of Smitten, they manage to churn out some delicious treats. The ice cream is SMOOOOTH. So much so, that I could have easily mistaken it for Frozen Custard or Gelato. It's rare to find ice cream of this consistency (even at the other famous ice creameries of the city) that isn't home made. 

Sometimes it totally pays to let that inner child of yours out every now and again.
author: Kevin T.

description: The brown sugar is the best! So far I've only tried the brown sugar and salted caramel which was good. The quality here is definitely evident. I encourage everyone to check this place out. Service was okay.
author: Maggy G.

description:
I'm gonna go ahead and say it: I don't care for this ice cream. Yes, I get why it's supposed to be good, but when all other ice cream has a certain texture, you expect that texture. Smitten doesn't feel like ice cream. 
The house made cones, though. Amazing.
author: Katherine B.

description: Vegan FUDGE pop is definitely... Life changing!!! It tastes so rich and so chocolaty!!! We stopped by Monday afternoon. There was just a couple of people in line. High five to baristas for putting Tina Turner on Pandora. It was a really nice compliment to a delicious ice cream. Also I tried their hot apple cider. I'm not sure about the ingredients, but it was the best apple cider I had!!!
author: Katie K.

description:
A few of my favorite things: 
Friday
Almost 70 degrees (in February!!)
Sunny 
Creamy vanilla ice cream 
Rose sauce 
Meyer lemon sauce
author: Lynn M.

description: It's good, not great. More of a novelty spot, with the liquid nitrogen. Longish wait, sort of pricey for what you get. When in the neighborhood I'll definitely support.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Came across this place after having brunch in the area, I had heard about this type of ice cream shop popping up and was interested in trying it. 

They make the ice cream for you on the spot in these machines that use liquid nitrogen. The liquid nitrogen gets the ice cream a whole lot colder then normal methods and as a result you get really smooth ice cream. 

I had the pumpkin flavor, and if you like pumpkin this is for you, very strong flavor to it, it was fantastic. My wife had the salted caramel and that was great too hard to decide which one I liked better since they were both so great. 

The shop is even neat in itself, it is made out of a storage container and they have added sitting areas inside as well. The only down side is the price, its pretty expensive but the quality is very good and wealth worth the occasional treat.
author: Chris S.

description: The taste was just right, creamy and not overly sweet.  I had the nectarine and it had little bits of dried nectarine and a drizzle of very good honey.  Yes, it was pricey for such a small cup.  From 7/29/12 to 8/4/12, show your library card and you get a free topping!  50 cents for the handmade cone.  On a sunny day, there are plenty of park seats to enjoy your ice cream.
author: Helen L.

description:
My favorite ice cream shop in SF.  2. Mr and Mrs. 3. BiRite.

I think it's the fact that they make it right in front of you, or maybe it's the fact that they only have limited flavors per day and makes you want to go back to try more.  Whatever it is, my son and I love this place.
author: Aban E.

description:
vanilla
brown sugar caramel
fresh churned
made to order
organic dairy
+ local/seasonal ingredients
--------------------------------------
THE BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD.




please bring smitten to new york, for the love of God.
author: Amie R.

description:
I like the concept.  Made to order ice cream.  Premium ingredients.  Hip urban setting.  But, I do not like the execution.

There are a few things that I can't get over.  First, they give you a pathetically small amount of ice cream.  Second, they charge you more than 4 dollars for that small amount of ice cream.  Third, they make you wait in line because they seem to be only capable of running one machine at a time.  Fourth, they only offer 4 flavors.  So, they do not really take advantage of made to order ice cream.

The ice cream itself is really creamy.  But, it is not that cold and it is a little on the mushy side.  Basically it is like soft-serve, but a little firmer.  There seem to be some interesting flavors, but the time I went, there was vanilla, chocolate, lavender (blech), and something else.  I went for the chocolate with almond brittle bits mixed in.  It was too sweet for me.  Not enough bitter flavors to make it that exciting.  I was expecting more.  Very average flavor.  Unique texture.  Not coming back.
author: Andrew W.

description:
This is my absolute favorite ice cream place in SF.  I like this way better than Bi-Rite!  They make the ice cream fresh to order in these special liquid nitrogen machines and they churn it in front of your eyes.  

My favorite was the fresh mint with tcho chips!  It's so deliciously smooth, creamy and yummy!  

I love that they change up their flavors every day.  They only serve at most four flavors a day but I love it!  It's not as flavor creative as Bi-Rite but who cares?  I want good ice cream and this place is it! 

I'm a total fan and it's a must stop for me whenever I'm in SF!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
BEST ice cream I've ever had. So creamy and fluffy! Pretty dangerous since I moved down the street from it.

Favorite is the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread. Hooked after just one bite. Brought some family to try it when they were in town and they had the same response I did. Even a flavor as boring as vanilla was amazing! The TCHO chocolate is a little rich for me, but I can see why people love it too.

Pretty expensive for ice cream, and the wait can be pretty long at times. The staff there have always been nice and helpful though.
author: Sophie S.

description:
So, here's the story.


a) It's not cheap.
b) It's a cute tech idea that actually translates well into a cute culinary idea.
c) It's incredibly smooth, and creamy ice cream.
d) There's going to be a line. Cope.
e) Chocolate, is consistently great.
f) They're not nearly as flavor creative as Humphrey, or Birite, or Mitchell's.
g) They're super consistent at making excellent, on the spot, icecream.
h) Which may have boring flavors.

Win some, lose some, but I am a fan.



P.S. Blue bottle coffee + Ice Cream + Nice afternoon = Happiness.
author: Max R.

description: The ice cream is smooth, delicious and the unique flavors are wonderful.  The only not so great thing about this is that the production line is off--there's been a handful of times where some people in the party are nearly done with their ice cream before the final person gets theirs.
author: Lisa V.

description:
Your favorite ice cream sucks!

It's made using rock salt and freezers, and deep down inside it wants to be a folk musician and head out on the road singing banjo covers of show tunes.

This ice cream is way better. It's made using liquid nitrogen and unicorn farts. It tastes like glitter and sunshine. It will bring your ancestors back from the grave. And it will almost certainly get you laid.

Rock on, Smitten.
author: TJ P.

description:
Another amazing ice cream place in San Francisco, what is new? This place is surprisingly different from the rest because to start they sell ice cream from a shipping container and use liquid nitrogen to make fresh ice cream from scratch right in front of you. The mist of smoke makes the science more exciting with an ending result of your delicious ice cream. They have some classic flavors and some interesting twist to ice cream flavors that change monthly. This place is pretty awesome for all ages when you are able to use science in a fun way to create an amazing treat. Turns out there are more uses for liquid nitrogen then to freeze T1000 in Termintator 2. 

Food:
Mint Chip- I am not too crazy about mint chip ice cream but the mint chip ice cream they had was the BOMB! The fresh mint comes out immediately and the after taste is a creamy milkshake that leaves a perfect note.
Blood orange with shortbread crumbs- Another flavor I would normally not be too crazy about but the fruit flavor is so fresh and tasty is too good not to enjoy with a delicious complement of shortbread crumbs for a nice crunch texture. 


I love ICE CREAM and I will be back for sure!
author: Elliot T.

description:
Party in your mouth!  
Tcho chocolate with spicy sauce: Those two need to marry eachother and never be apart! 
Salted Caramel with Tcho sauce: Just like the name BUT ten times better!

AND what everyone else says:-))
author: Gina H.

description:
This is some of the best ice cream I've ever had.  It's made to order, which seems like a gimmick but it's sooo worth it.  I did have to wait 15 minutes for my ice cream so it's not for those in a hurry.  I sampled my friend's corn ice cream with berry syrup. At first I was skeptical, I thought corn ice cream sounded disgusting but I was wrong.  It tasted like lightly sweet cornbread and the berry syrup complimented it perfectly.  I had the salted caramel and it was perfectly salty with great caramel flavor.  It's pricey at about $5 for a small in a cone, but it was actually very filling. 

Note to Little Baby's Ice Cream in Philly: this is what you should aspire to be.
author: Bri H.

description:
Yes, expensive, but you're paying for more than just ice cream, goodness gracious, they're making it with liquid nitrogen right in front of you! Is it worth it for just the ice cream? No. For the experience as a whole? Definitely yes! There's something about liquid nitrogen that brings out the fun kid in me. 

Also, their menu is both creative and also appetizing, which is more than what I can say for some of the other popular S.F. ice cream joints.
author: Victor H.

description:
GREAT ice cream!!! I always take my friends and family who are visiting from out of town to Smitten. It's a very unique and fun experience to watch them make your ice cream. 

It's a bit pricey but if you don't like the flavor then they will gladly change it out for free, no problem. SO delicious!!!!
author: Logan S.

description:
This is some expensive ice cream.

For those who don't know, the idea is to instantly freeze your ice cream, on the spot, when you order it, using special machines and some very cold liquid nitrogen.  It takes a while to do this.  It understandably costs a lot.

What I am less clear on is *why*.  Why would you go to the trouble to do this?

There's another shop, in Chicago, called iCream, which does something similar.  Rather than four all-natural flavors and custom mixers, they use retrofitted kitchen-aid appliances and offer a dazzling variety of ingredient options.  They have a reason to mix on the spot: they are willing to create almost any combination you ask for - hundreds or maybe thousands of possible flavors.  Smitten, not so much.  They generally offer four flavors with some small number of possible added ingredients.

Having said that, the ice cream is generally good.  We've tried salted caramel and a plum flavor.  The texture is excellent: smooth and creamy; much better than iCream, and a vindication of the custom mixer technology.  The flavors are okay - the salted caramel flavors came through strong and clear.  The flavors of the plum were muted, though we could detect some plum in there.

The place is definitely interesting for the novelty, but I can't see that it offers much more than the many other more conventional boutique shops in SF in terms of flavor, texture or variety.

It's fun.  But in the end, this is some very expensive ice cream.
author: Albert H.

description: This was my first visit here. I had the chocolate ice cream. I must say, the texture was the smoothest I have ever had. I highly recommend it.
author: Kalob R.

description:
Totally worth the wait!  I love this ice cream.  I like everything about it.  The cute chalkboard sign with the ingredients as pictures - there are only a few ingredients per flavor!  I like the design of the stand - modern/wood/cozy.  I like the flavor of the ice cream - I tried both the salted caramel and the sweet corn.  Both exceeded my expectations.  Who knew that sweet corn could be so delicious in ice cream form?  It's like when you're watching the Japanese edition of Iron Chef and they have to make ice cream out of everything (fish, seaweed, soy sauce), but this is the nonexistent episode where it actually came out delicious.  If my sentiment were translated from Japanese (like the judges) this ice cream would be like lotus flowers in the spring, blooming on my tongue.

The people are nice too.  A man who had just bought an ice cream cone for himself dropped it while tending to his young daughter.  They immediately made him a replacement cone with a smile.
author: Natalee F.

description:
The price is a little on the high end, but so is the ice cream. After discovering (and loving) it on a chilly January evening, I've made sure that if I'm in the neighborhood I swing past.

Everything is good. Everything. It's all made to order using liquid nitrogen, creating the smoothest ice cream I've ever tasted (apparently the ice crystals are smaller). You'd be silly not to try their suggested paired toppings.

My only complaint? I need them to set up a store in the East Bay, stat.
author: Ben W.

description: cool concept, friendly employees, but the icecream is a little on the sweet side and is a little overpriced for how good it is supposed to be. I tried both vanilla and salted caramel and they were both super sweet with the latter being the sweetest of the two.
author: Zo M.

description:
Can't believe I forgot to post my review. I have no issues with the line, the service, the price, how they present the flavors--whatever, we have a choice whether or not to patronize a business. I and my BF shared a salted caramel ice cream and it was just awful. There was too much liquid nitrogen and it burned both of our mouths--I couldn't eat more than a spoonful. The flavor wasn't rich or intense, and the texture was nothing to write home about. A bunch of reviews say the ice cream was "like butter"--that means it's been overchurned. 

I make my own ice cream so I have a high bar for flavor and creaminess. This isn't even in the ballpark. I've had friends tell me they like Smitten, so maybe the mix itself and the skill of the mixers is better on some days than others, and they also probably have lower standards. But I have zero desire to try Smitten again after hurting my tongue on it. No one wants ice cream to be fizzy.
author: Yelp Y.

description:
I heard stories of Smitten Ice Cream and their humble beginnings. The story is the business that started out of a red wagon and grew into a shipment container turned into a store front. Very cool and interesting concept.

Cool to see how quick they can make ice cream. There's a bunch of smoke flowing out of the machines. Quick freezing the milk or was it cream? Well, it turned out to be a delicious tasting ice cream, but the price was really expensive to justify it. This is definitely worth a try, but a bit hard to return to.

Overall, I would say 3.5 stars. Tasty, but expensive. Oh, don't get the vanilla. This isn't a good place for it.
author: Steven B.

description:
First a slew of local coffee joints, now Smitten Ice Cream is doling out their product one cup at a time. That would be a fine concept, except waiting 10-15 minutes for ice cream (in addition to waiting in a monster-sized line) makes me a little pissy. 

My expectations were only heightened by the line/wait time; when my ice cream tasted no better than [name any ice creamery in the city], I felt duped. Literally duped by the smoke (& mirrors!) their ice cream machine oozes while it churns. Apparently, their way of making ice cream is very high tech, but I care very little about the gimmicky & the new if the finished product doesn't blow me away. 

I ordered a small Brown Sugar with cinnamon shortbread bits. I enjoyed the shortbread & its chewy texture, but the ice cream tasted more like maple. The bf ordered a TCHO Chocolate w/ candied jalapeños in a cone. Chocolate was thick & dark. Jalapeños were not candied. Cone was soft, crumbly & unsweetened. The other two flavors today were Vanilla & Lemon Verbena, which leads me to my two final gripes: samples are not given & flavors are usually limited to 3-5 a day. 

Total: $10.25 (I wish I'd saved my money for Humphrey Slocombe.)

The only thing I was Smitten with this afternoon was my bf.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
It's cool how they make the ice cream in front of you. I also took a peek through their secured storage area's gate, and saw the HUUUUGE tank of liquid nitrogen. That's awesome! 

I didn't really enjoy the ice cream...I'm just not a big ice cream fan, unfortunately, so probably don't listen to me!
author: Celeste T.

description:
I'm not so good about distinguishing the difference between ice cream with like 100 ice crystals and ice cream with like 20... but apparently the liquid nitrogen can make ice cream a lot smoother and better! 

I just know I paid 6.00$ for 6oz of ice cream, but I enjoyed it! So that's all that matters i guess haha.

My sister and I shared the mint one. IT REALLY tastes like mint leaves... not your artificial kind.

Props to them for making FRESH ice cream. You don't have to eat ice cream thats been sitting there for a week! lols

My sister was happy, so I was happy too :)
author: Lisa L.

description: The vanilla was delicious and the strawberry was good but vanilla is still my favorite. You can't really taste the balsamic vinegar in the strawberry but you can definitely smell it. Street parking can be hard to find near by but we got lucky today and got a spot like right across.
author: Irene L.

description: Dude.  I love this place so much.  I got the chocolate with the caramel drizzle and it was bombdizzle.  Haha.  The only thing I hated about this place is the freaking line.  I think I waited about 45MIN.  I guess it was worth it.  I wish there was one in SD... someday.
author: Criselle O.

description:
I was not quite smitten with my first experience. After walking by almost everyday since its pod opening, I brought some friends and said "ehhh, go check it out since it's something different". I wasn't very excited about their flavors - chocolate, brown sugar, and nectarine. I know people say you can judge good ice cream by the basic flavors but if I'm eating the calories, I want to throw in the toffee, cake pieces, cookie dough, potato chips, brownies, granola, etc. 

We went with 2 $3 itty bitty kiddie sizes of chocolate and brown sugar. We passed on a 50 cent topping after the register gal scoffed at us for trying to add the praline that went on the nectarine ice cream. Brown sugar came up first which tasted almost buttery, good texture overall but the flavor didn't excite me. I could see the machine making chocolate was being fussy so it took longer to come out. The texture was gummy so we had trouble getting it down our throats. The TCHO chocolate was definitely bittersweet, also not my fave. 

Gals working inside didn't seem very happy. I'm sure I'll walk by and check out the flavors every so often, but for now if I had a choice between a Miette ice cream sandwich and Smitten, I'm going to Miette Confiserie across the park.
author: Mimi L.

description:
excellent fresh ice cream! we ordered

mint chip
nectarine
chocolate

everything creamy fresh and yummy. delicious.
author: Char Y.

description:
I'm not sure I get the hype. It looks really cool when they're making it and the staff is awesome & friendly, but what's the hype about the product? 

I ordered TCHO chocolate with almond brittle & pistachio. It was just okay. I guess it tastes creamier but it also tastes really.... light. The flavor just sort of.... evaporates on your tongue. I feel like I'm eating air. Or I'm being swindled.

I'm not smitten.
author: Mel L.

description: fresh ice cream made right before your eyes. the cream doesn't hit the kelvin mixer until you order. i had the tcho chocolate plain and simple. it was thick, creamy, smooth, and tasty. undeniably some of the best ice cream i've ever had. others had the vanilla with pistachios and five spice banana with caramel. all the ice creams had the same rich quality. the cashier was very social with every customer, rendering a lengthy line to get the goods. but the ice cream is definitely worth the wait. and yes, i was smittened.
author: Charmaine L.

description: Really cool concept but way too sweet. Had the salted caramel =) cool little shop and it's heated!
author: Tiff W.

description:
This place is blocks away from me, and it's a nice treat whenever I'm craving ice cream. I remember the first time I stopped by here I was just blown away. I got the Mint Chocolate Chip, and the freshness of the mint and the creaminess of the ice cream is what makes this place sooo good. You can tell they use good ingredients by the taste. They have vanilla and chocolate pretty much always, but I like to try the no-so-ordinary flavors. For instance, the flavor that triggered this review: Maple & Brown Sugar Pumpkin. DELICIOUS!

The only downside is this place is expensive. I usually just get the small bowl because it's so rich and filling. It's around the size of a scoop it costs about $6. This is San Francisco though, so I guess you can't expect to go anywhere without taking a beating in your wallet.

Bottom line though, if you're in the hood, check out Smitten!
author: Mike C.

description:
Delicious ice cream, so very smooth and creamy! A beautiful location, but parking is a huge problem. Go with a friend who can stay in the car and circle around :-) This is definitely a place everyone should try, for a unique and delicious experience.

I'd give Smitten 5 stars, but having gone 3 times in 2 weeks - there was always the same 3 flavors :-P Even yummy, that's too much - if they can't change flavors daily, then at least weekly.  The toppings were great, but the sauces were very skimpy.

The technique is amazing, but the overall flavor experience could be improved. For instance, the salted caramel is delicious, but the saltiness gets tiresome and could really use a bit of vanilla with it. The chocolate ice cream with the chocolate sauce was very good, but there was only enough sauce for the first few bites. I think the pistachio brittle was the best, but ours sadly was a bit sticky-soft (and it was in a separate dish, not with the ice cream)

The personnel get 5 stars, they were professionally friendly and quick, and everything looked clean.
author: Julie D.

description:
I know I'm late on this Smitten hype, but I made it! 

The flavors that's been covered thus far: 
-Vanilla w/ cocoa nib 
-Spring herb 
-Olive oil w/ lavender 
-Brown sugar 
-TCHO dark chocolate w/ candied jalapeno 

Though there will be many more flavors to come, so far my most memorable flavor is their Spring Herb flavored ice cream. It's different, it's creamy and refreshing. 

Order, pay and be entertained by watching them make the ice cream with the liquid nitrogen machines. Nothing too fancy, just cups of deliciousness.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I love this spot. They don't call it Smitten for nothin'!

Creamiest ice cream around. Offering only 3-4 flavors and a small variety makes it easy for me to decide on what to have. Then again, you just can't go wrong. 

I like to grab a scoop and eat it whilst laying around in the adjacent parklet.
author: Laney L.

description:
This place will Literally give you the freshest ice cream in the world. It is made right in front of you! They only have 4 flavors a day and its constantly rotating. 
I had the mint ice cream and it was nothing at all like the one dryers makes. This was made with FRESH mint leaves. It was a shock to me since the flavoring is much stronger than normal mint ice cream but it was't overwhelming.
author: Steven N.

description: I don't even know where to start. Watching your own ice cream frozen just for you is awesome. The huge tanks of liquid nitrogen give the shop an industrial/ sciencey feel.  The result is an extremely creamy and velvety smooth scoop that is hard to beat. The mint chip ice cream was extremely minty...not in a fake mint way... like actual mint leaves. It was refreshing and not too sweet, just right.
author: Amanda M.

description:
The guy working the register was really nice and really helpful. The made to order aspect was cool, but it also nixed sampling and mixing of flavors. Even if you get the largest size, you have to buy a single flavor. I really did not like the salted caramel, which was too rich, too salty, and too sweet for me. No subtlety at all to it. The sweet corn with berry drizzle was much better, however it still didn't  amaze me and I found it a little light in texture.

3.5 stars sounds about right.
author: David C.

description:
Smitten's ice-cream flavors are a hit or miss for me. Some tend to be way too rich and creamy for my taste.

Smitten is on the pricier side, but watching the icecream-making live in action is a cool experience in itself. It is also on 7x7's Top 100 Things to Try in SF Before You Die List this year.

There are a lot of trendy restaurants, cafes and bakeries not to mention a cute park area nearby which is another plus, especially on a warmer day. So definitely stop by for their ice-cream!
author: Joyce C.

description: Don't let the long line deter you from eating here, the home made ice cream is well worth the wait. They usually have 3 or 4 flavors. The ice cream is made right in front of you and is by far the creamiest ice cream I've ever tasted.
author: Amanda C.

description: The ice cream maybe good, but the price for it sure isn't.  $6 for a small cup of Tcho chocolate.  At least the line wasn't too long when we got there.
author: Jules S.

description: Excellent ice cream, interesting process.  The machines and descriptions of what are going on (shown on the wall inside) and how it is made sailed over my head- but it was a very positive experience nonetheless.  The ordering is all processed on iPads- what was life like before these miraculous devices?  Don't go here for a wide variety- there are limited flavors on hand at any given time- maybe 4 or 5 at a time, but they are VERY flavorful and worth the premium prices.  I enjoyed a vanilla and my wife had the best mint ice cream I have ever tasted!  Trust me and get the pine-nut brittle topping added to whatever flavor you choose- amazing!  I will be back for sure.
author: Andy S.

description:
I love that the ice cream is so "fresh," if ice cream can even do that. They make it all in front of you. Usually there're only 3 or 4 flavor at any given time they're doing and the line can be long, but that's part of the deal with super fresh ice cream.

The chocolate variation I had was soft but very rich. It was a little warm (the less to dull your ice cream, I suppose) but certainly nowhere near melty. The portion size looks small but like I said, it was super rich and came out to just what I was good for.

Seating is around the parklet area in a nice yuppie neighborhood.
author: John N.

description:
We had the rose flavor with chunks of milk dark and white chocolate chips.

It's so fluffy and smooth. 
They don't do tastes. 

Got a small then went back to get a large(5 scoops) and try the chocolate flavor. Too much chocolate for me. Next time I'll get a topping with it.

The only bad thing is the store is outside. It's always cold in sf.
author: farah b.

description:
Pros:

Obviously, the ice cream was delicious:

- Mint + Chocolate chips (7/10) - they use REAL MINT leaves here. friggin bomb.
- Vanilla with Strawberry sauce (10+++/10) - SO FRIGGIN GOOD.  try this one for sure. the consistency of it is soo good.

CONS:

- OVERPRICED. it's like $4.50 for a small serving equivalent to about one scoop of ice cream.
- the line is typically about a 15 minute wait.
- parking is a biatch. 

Conclusion: the ice cream is delicious, but overpriced. HOWEVER, you probably won't eat here everyday. so regardless of it being expensive.... "treat yourself, don't cheat yourself." and just have a scoop or two. :)
author: Niño M.

description:
Smitten provides a hip and novel approach to ice cream through use of its special Kelvin machines to make each scoop as you order - however, the hefty pricing due to the innovative method make ballin' on a budget difficult.

Smitten's flavor rotation encourages future visits to try limited-opportunity offerings - we were informed that the five-spiced banana comes along only during Chinese New Years.  The process was fun to watch, as billows of visible frost from the machines filled the counter.  The super creamy scoops were totally smooth and highly enjoyable, and the cone tasted like a crisp, buttery wafer.  My favorite flavor thus far is the TCHO chocolate.

The insulated tent interior provides a great escape for those with ice cream cravings on chilly, San Francisco nights.  I would revisit Smitten to taste new flavors, but it will never become my go-to ice cream shop because I might have to start pawning my belongings.
author: Andrew M.

description:
WOW. 
Was the only word I could think of after my first bite of their incredibly marvelous Brown Sugar ice cream kissed my palate. 
WOW. 
Was the second and third word I used (after OMG) to describe the texture, taste, and sugar rush I felt while consuming my next few bites.
THIS IS THE BEST ICE CREAM IN THE CITY.
Were my closing words after finishing the last bite and sipping the climatic drop from the bottom of my cup. 
BUT BUT BUT, I WANT MORE....
Alas, my story continues untill another day.
author: Sonya D.

description:
It's science + food! How can you not love it?

I went with a friend for a pre-dinner treat, happy to find that Smitten offers not just the full array of normal small to large sizes, but also a kiddie size! Perfect size for a treat that didn't ruin my appetite for dinner. 

I had Brown Sugar and added butternut toffee on top. The ice cream is velvety smooth, and the flavor was just-the-right-amount-of-sweet and the salty crunch of the toffee rounded out the experience nicely. My friend enjoyed a cup of Fresh Mint, and you could tell they had made it with actual mint, not the fake mint you normally get in ice cream. 

Watching the ice cream coalesce from the cream and sugar mixture and the ultra cold -- I don't know what it is, nitrogen? dry ice? -- was a fun, novel experience. 

Bonus: they accept credit cards via Square and make use of the cardless payment system. 

Totally recommend this place for yummy ice cream, a different take on dessert, and the unique flavors. 

High fives.
author: Allison S.

description:
First off,  the staff is super friendly and it's fun to watch them make your ice cream. Secondly, you don't need a large portion because whatever you get will be really rich and amazing. 

You get an experience with the creamiest ice cream of all the ever time. Worth it.
author: Janina K.

description:
i just paid $6 for an ice cream cone with two scoops of handmade liquid nitrogen cooled ice cream. the vanilla with cocoa nibs tasted incredible. the handmade ice cream cone was not worth the extra money. 
here is your tip: skip the cone and just get a cup. the cocoa nibs cost a little extra but at least it was crunchy and very flavorful.
not sure if I would wait in line on a weekend day, but during the week it was very worth it.
author: Jeff W.

description: I was really excited to try smitten ice cream. i have seen it on Tv and for one love ice cream. I hate ice cream that is too strong in flavor that once you take a bite you want to drink water to remove the overly concentrated flavor. that is how i found smitten ice cream. It wasnt refreshing at all which i think ice cream should be. i couldnt finish it so i gave it to my kids and husband. none of them liked it. so we had no choice but to throw it. really disappointing!!
author: Caina S.

description:
OMG, that was pure ridiculousness~~ 
TOO GOOD!!! AMAZING!!! Like I wanted to melt into my ice cream GOOD!
author: JD J.

description:
We live in Minnesota but travel to San Francisco several times a year. Smitten is always a required stop, usually more than once. Their chocolate is simply the best. We tried the salted caramel but it was a bit sweet for us.

We also spend a lot of time in Italy, and have been to countless gelato shops. Smitten may be better than all of them.
author: Rick S.

description: I had the sweet corn berries sooo goood! The process is pretty cool, they make it just for u using nitrogen :)
author: Armina S.

description:
My dad and I noticed a really long line and we decided to check it out. Turns out that it was the line for ice cream made-to-order with liquid nitrogen. We were waiting for my sister and mom who were shopping so we decided to kill time and join the long line of patient customers. 

The line moved really slowly and after we placed our order, we had to wait even longer for the ice cream to be made. I am a patient person but it was frustrating to see how inefficient this place was. There was one person making all the ice cream and he made it in super small batches so that only 2 orders could be fulfilled at a time. We waited a long time before getting our ice cream and I was disappointed by the flavor and texture of our peach ice cream. 

It's really expensive ice cream and you don't get very much of it. I suppose watching ice cream being made right in front of you is part of  the experience and what you pay for but it's totally not worth it.
author: Wanda K.

description:
Not bad, creamy but very expensive for the amount you get. 

The liquid nitrogen thing is actually pretty cool but here's a pro tip. It's not that expensive and you can basically make it yourself. It costs $25 for about a tank and as long as you wear gloves it's perfectly safe to manage. I've done it before, just remember to bring ingredients... all we had were condiments. (Mustard ice cream is not bad, ketchup ice cream is disgusting).
author: Rohan D.

description:
Awesome...

AWESOME...!!!

A friend took me here recently and while I'm not a HUGE ice cream fan (Asian, lots of milk, you do the math), I was still somewhat skeptical of her claim that this was the best place ever.

I might actually have to concede. In fact this place actually is making me contemplate moving up for work (or at least not being totally opposed to NoCal).

Smitten just wins on all fronts: location, taste, variety, and nerd factor.

Hayes Valley area is just awesome... it's just the cutest place. There's tons of great shops/places to grab a bite nearby and the reclamation project of that development lot is SO SF, lol. Smitten is smack dab right in the middle of all of that, and across from the itty-bitty (to my LA tastes) street with the open green space. You don't even really feel the press of people or traffic. It's just a great place to stop and take a break.

God the taste of the ice cream really was just amazing... very smooth, creamy without being really heavy, and packed with flavor. I had both the THCO (I think) chocolate, and the honey nectarine. I actually enjoyed the honey nectarine better but both were really good. I mean REALLY good, the honey came out wonderfully and the fruit was JUST tart enough to provide a great balance. I paired the honey nectarine with the pistachio brittle and the chocolate with the coconut brittle. I have to admit their brittles accompany the ice cream so well that I'm seriously thinking of not pairing anything else with my ice cream ever again. Be warned tho the brittle is seasonal and changes with their "ice cream" menu, so if you like what you're tasting grab a bag (if they still have any left for sale) because I'm really ruing not buying some of that pistachio brittle when I had the chance.

Variety as mentioned... the menu changes often, especially as their fresh fruits or other ingredients go in and out of season or availability. Don't worry, there are a few staples like chocolate and vanilla.. but be wild! Try some of the other mixes, I can almost guarantee that you won't be sorry!

Nerd factor, really I have two things:

Stampt (frequent buyer app.)

and liquid nitrogen.

'Nuff said.
author: Wonder W.

description: My FAVOURITE ice cream place in San Francisco (so far). They have very basic flavours but they make it right on the spot which makes it extra special. Definitely recommended.
author: Katarina D.

description:
San Francisco needed another ice cream joint like it needed another fixed gear bike; between Humphrey Slocombe, Bi-Rite, Three Twins, and Mitchell's, my opinion was that we were covered on frozen flavored cream.

Smitten proved me so deliciously wrong! Yes, it's expensive; yes, it's slightly pretentious that they have their own proprietary ice cream maker called the Kelvin that crafts made-to-order scoops for every patron (wait, that's actually kind of cool and maybe why it's so expensive). But--BUT--Smitten offers perhaps the most undiluted ice cream flavor I've ever experienced. We had the vanilla (which tastes like a perfectly fresh version of McDonald's soft serve, which, I mean, wow...) and Tcho Chocolate (my new favorite plain chocolate ice cream).

So creamy, so good, and so unlike its competitors, I hereby heartily support Smitten's wheel reinvention.
author: Alee K.

description: I'm redefining ice cream in my books based on the scoop I had at Smittens. TCHO chocolate was unbelievable.
author: Winston Z.

description:
I think I'm in love. This has become one of my new favorite places to get ice cream and is closer to where I live. Parking is a bit of a pain but where else in SF isn't. I heard about this place from my boss and the idea of watching your order freeze on the spot intrigued me. 

I've gotta say, this has definitely been the smoothest ice cream I've had in my life. I've have yet to try their other flavors but in the last two visits I've tried the Cinnamon Toast with Almond Brittle. The flavor was delicious; the cinnamon stood out but not too much to overpower the single kiddie scoop I had. Having it with the almond brittle really made it taste like cinnamon toast crunch. I wonder if they'll sell their almond brittle separately 'cause I'll definitely buy some of it during my next visit.
author: Samantha K.

description: I like the idea of using liquid nitrogen for the reason of a lower freezing temperature to form smaller ice crystals to allow for a creamier texture, but what exists in theory is not always executed that well in reality. I have seen many a cup of ice cream pass through the mesh veil here looking melty. While the ice cream here is certainly creamy, it is not always that frozen. I like the seasonal flavors a whole lot, seeing a crate of fresh rubarb being delivered to the storefront the week they were serving rubarb crisp. I am a fan of the space too of course, but not so much of the prices. Two people I know each ordered the same sized scoop, but one turned out half the size of the other, and they had ordered right after one another too.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I tried their Apple Cinnamon Crisp and TCHO Chocolate ice cream. Heavenly!! Its freshly made right in front of you.
author: Pooh S.

description: does not get any better
author: Ariele L.

description:
The ice cream here is very good, but not good enough to challenge my Bi-Rite loyalty. 

I do love the theatricality of the made-to-order scoops and the billowing liquid nitrogen clouds, and the stand itself is really just too cute for words. I also liked that the flavor selection was nicely balanced between traditional and adventurous.

As for the ice cream itself, the Tcho Chocolate was delicious, but the Bay Leaf Meyer Lemon mostly tasted creamy, when I was hoping for something a bit more assertive. I also found texture almost too smooth - and with that same mouth-coating effect of a McDonalds milkshake.

In any other city, this would be memorable ice cream. Here, it's just kinda whatever.
author: Amy L.

description: To DIE FOR! what a fun place in Hayes Valley! Ice cream was very YUMMY and what cool little set up they have getting to watch your ice cream getting made. Highly recommend if you're in the mood for a cold treat, cool neighborhood and great establishment.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Finally off my bookmark :D

Small establishment with a good following.  I had the salted caramel and DL had the vanilla.  Both were creamy and yummy.  

I was slightly disappointed that we didn't get to try the chocolate with candied jalapenos because there was a backorder for it.

I really enjoyed watching them make my ice cream and was just mesmerized by the fog coming out as my ice cream was churning.

It's great for a sunny day because you can sit at the park and enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Michelle S.

description:
What a cool idea and location!   Suddenly nitrogen is on the menus everywhere!

Very cool to watch your old fashioned ice cream being made in a fun and innovative way.  Also fun to stand right by them and catch all of the super cold air coming off the machine!

The ice cream is rich and really creamy too.  Get there, grab some and take it to the park right next door and enjoy.  Just don't run over to Miette's right after to get MORE goodies like we did.  TROUBLE!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I'm glad that I tried it but I didn't leave as Smitten as I had hoped I would.  I went with the salted caramel and had a few bites of the TCHO chocolate.  Watching the process is very cool and does result in an extremely flavorful ice cream - but the salted caramel was a bit too strong for me.  The good news is, next time, since I know how potent this stuff is I can go with a kids size instead of a small.  I'll probably take my chances on the seasonal flavors as well, their standby crowd favorites didn't do it for me.  

I can't wait for the rest of Proxy to fill in!
author: Krystle S.

description: It's gimmicky but I like it. On the surface I don't really buy that their cooling method is so great & prevents ice crystals from forming - I mean, preventing freeze/thaw cycles is important, but my friend who's made lab ice cream with liquid nitrogen said there can still be ice crystals if you don't do it right. Plus their "explanation" on the walle didn't really make any sense. But who cares as long as the ice cream's good, which I thought it was. I actually don't like TCHO chocolate (sorry!), but in ice cream form, I thought it was pretty good, and I did like the smooth texture, however it was obtained. The price doesn't really warrant it, but as an occasional treat, it's fine. The toppings also seemed a little goofy to me but also oddly moderately priced, so that was all right. I wouldn't wait in a big line for it, but it was nice to try and it's still kind of a fun gimmick.
author: Lisa K.

description: The ice cream is nice. Dry ice looks cool when making it, peach is the bomb.  Can taste the crystals ice but are good
author: M C.

description:
The best ice cream I've ever had.  The salted caramel was wonderful - got it with chocolate sauce.  It's so rich and creamy and flavorful - just the right texture.  Lots of fun to watch it being made too.
Really, you're still reading this?  If you looked up this place, you want some ice cream.  So JUST HEAD OVER THERE NOW - WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR??!!!
author: Bob P.

description:
Interesting...  liquid nitrogen... sure, let's give it a try... smaller ice crystals for creamier texture...ok... result...so so .

blood orange is good, though the color looked a lot like strawberry, and I was already set on getting strawberry cause I was staring at another customer's ice cream before deciding to get my own. But when I got to the counter, no strawberry? Ok, the picture on the right showing us how the strawberry ice cream is made kind of threw me off, but fine, blood orange with shortbread will do. My boyfriend got butter pecan and did not like it. He kept eating mine! I didn't like it either, too buttery and not the good kind. 

I think they have like 3 or 4 flavors at a time, and you kind of like have to wait for the ice cream to be made. To top it off, a little pricey... It was a nice experience, but don't think I'll be back. Though you never know... since it's in a great location and I just might settle since there are no other ice cream shops in that area.
author: Lotus L.

description: The sadness I feel for this stand only being in San Francisco is vast. This ice cream is beyond scrumptious, and is made right in front of you. It's a little pricey but I believe it's worth it considering the flavor of your choice is made right in front of your eyes and is made with fresh, local ingredients. I had Olive Oil Ice cream with Lavender Shortbread chunks with meyer lemon syrup....can I tell you this is the most odd, delicious, savory goodness to ever touch my lips? It was. The story of Smitten is delightful and I would give anything to have this shipped to the Midwest. If you're going to San Fran, stop by this glorious stand!
author: Briana S.

description:
Seriously the creamiest, tastiest, and freshest ice cream made in the city! 

I have been all around the city from Humphrey's to Bi-rite and they are all fantastic but hands down Smitten's is one of the best. I love how you get to watch them make your ice cream. 

The service is really great too. The cashier was very patient with me not knowing what I wanted (but be careful because of the line!!!) I got the Vanilla with Caramel and damn it was delicious. So sweet but good!!

Ryan was the maker of my ice cream and he's quite the looker ; ) I'll definitely be back for more ice cream (and possibly stalking a little bit) soon! : P
author: Ezequiel R.

description: We love taking people visiting the area here cuz it's a unique location and it's a cool different type of process for making the ice cream so it's cool to watch. Also their ice cream is very creamy and they have very unique flavors. Many are delicious! Sometimes there is a long line and they are pricey for their portion sizes.
author: Kristy R.

description:
I've been to Smitten quite a few times and I tried them for the first time over 4 years ago when they upgraded from their little red wagon to their container store. I love their unique flavors, which changes based on the availability of the ingredients. And, of course, who doesn't find watching ice cream being made-to-order in front of your eyes amazing?! I sure do. 

With the popularity of stores making instant ice cream with liquid nitrogen, I began asking myself, is Smitten's ice cream really that good or was I simply "smitten" by the way they make it. As I tried other gourmet ice cream parlor's in The City, I discovered a huge difference between ice cream made using the traditional method vs. the ice cream made at Smitten with liquid nitrogen. It's the texture.  When you think of the texture of ice cream, the first thing that comes to mind is the creaminess, hence the name. I hate to say it, but Smitten's ice cream is more chewy than creamy. Sometimes I also find their ice cream icy or chalky. This is because of the flash frozen method they use. The creaminess of ice cream comes from the churning. The slower the churn, the creamier the ice cream. Smitten does churn their ice cream, but they do it quick. One huge benefit of less churning is less air in the ice cream, meaning the ingredients they put in is what you get out. This result in stronger flavors.

Now, to answer my question, I learned that I am more smitten by how Smitten makes their ice cream than the ice cream itself. That's not to say Smitten ice cream is bad; I just find other gourmet ice cream around town better.  I will still hit up Smitten whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Albert L.

description:
I'm smitten!

The story of the wagon is impressive and what's not to like about made-to-order ice cream with the help of liquid nitrogen?! And fresh ingredients from local farmers. I'm in love. 

I love chocolate and the TCHO chocolate with almond brittle was amazing! It was so chocolatey and satisfying! The strawberry topped with shortbread was light and fruity. The fresh mint was really minty and very refreshing. They offer four flavors a day and you get to pick from different toppings and they are fresh! We recently visited a strawberry farm in Davenport and I was pleasantly surprised to see that they got their strawberries from this exact farm! 

Go try smitten and you'll be smitten, too!
author: Cindy T.

description:
I've always loved Bi-rite, so I was a little offended when someone told me Smitten was better than Bi-rite. So, I went to Smitten; I was apprehensive and determined to leave with the satisfaction of being able to say that it was NOT better than Bi-rite. I was wrong, it was just as good, but in a different way.

At first taste the mint chip was refreshing, smooth and tasted of fresh mint leaves (which they use).  The apple cinnamon crisp was equally delicious. It was as if I was eating an apple pie. I also enjoyed watching my ice cream get made with the liquid nitrogen contraption. I left Smitten knowing that I would frequent this place often.  

They have less flavors than Bi-rite, the ice cream is much smoother and they do conventional flavors so well! They only have about five flavors on the menu that rotate seasonally, I believe.
author: Erica R.

description: love the mint flavored ice cream..  tasted like fresh mint.  Extra cold and made fresh to order. I think the price is very reasonable for a couple of scoop compared to what you would pay at a place like Haagen Dass (gone down hill).
author: James W.

description:
Good flavor, but it's not worth the trouble. Experienced it once, and that's enough because:

1. Small selection  - choc, vanilla and one other flavor.
2. Extremely slow, which in chilly town and an outside venue does not bode well for ice cream.
3. Expensive.

The liquid nitrogen technique is being done with ice cream in other places with more variety, but it's always slow. (See iCream). Don't see how they will effectively manage a line.  When we were there only a handful of folks shared the line and we still waited 10 minutes for our three item order.

In SF there are SO many other great ice cream choices with terrific flavor, textures and variety.  Try: Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Mr. & Mrs. Misc. for starters.
author: S G.

description:
I wasn't sure to expect with Kelvin-made ice-cream. After reading their signage and seeing the process, I am still a bit confused with the logistics. There are four different machines (apparently the only ones in the world), hence four different flavours to choose from. Naturally, I went with chocolate.

The ice-cream was so creamy smooth that it was almost custard like. It was packed with tons of chocolate flavour but oddly not as cold as ice-cream normally is. I'll admit I was skeptical paying $4.75 for one scoop of ice-cream, but it was worth every penny!
author: Seema M.

description: How good can an ice cream be for a wait of 30 minutes! I am still impatiently waiting!!!! Now that I got the ice cream, I can tell you that it is really good but for me it is not worth waiting more than five minutes. These guys are S-U-P-E-R slow!!!!!
author: bora o.

description:
I'm smitten with Smitten Ice Cream. (Sorry, couldn't resist) 
I like to refer to it as 'nerdy ice cream' since it's a little Alton Brown meets Bill Nye, plus it's in a shipping container. Salted carmel was my favorite! Also tried the sweet corn with blackberry sauce & the chocolate & both were mighty tasty! The absolutely best part? The cones are so amazing! Made right there pizelle style. Crunchy, sweet, & still a little warm. 
On a warm day be prepared to wait in line. It is pricey for ice cream, but it's a great learning opportunity for kids & adults alike!
author: Kym T.

description:
Smitten has a cute little stand right in Hayes Valley and it's hard not to gravitate to the bright red walls. 

As a lover and adorer of ice cream, it was a must that I try some to make my taste buds smile. But was I smitten with Smitten? Eh, not quite smitten- but happy enough with my Fresh Mint Tcho Chip child's scoop. 

But be warned fellow Yelpers...when they say Fresh Mint, they mean FRESH mint. As I later hiccuped or burped post-ice cream, the minty taste came running back up awakening my senses and awakening my memory that I just ate Smitten Ice Cream as the mint came rushing back into my mouth. The mint is insanely fresh (a good thing!). I really appreciate that they use fresh ingredients instead of extracts or artificial flavorings.   

I'm glad I tried it, but I wasn't quite as smitten as I thought they would have promised. 




(Sidenote: I like that they take orders on an iPad...it's just cool)
author: Christine A.

description: The line was pretty long but service was excellent. I got the root beer float and it was very good! The ice cream was special and it was a legit root beer float. Definitely will come back! They also have a paypal promotion!
author: Andrew Y.

description: Smitten ice cream is so fresh and so clean! The only ice cream you need and must try is the FRESH MINT CHIP! They make the ice cream to order right in front of you. Brilliant. The ice cream is creamy and the fresh mint is like mint straight from a garden. Very crisp and refreshing. Unlike the "candy mint" flavor other ice cream places use. Honestly, calling it "amazing" is an understatement. You just have to try it for yourself. Regardless of the San Francisco weather. ;)
author: Raja R.

description:
My friend came here too.

This place is used the freshest and least amount of ingredients and using liquid nitrogen....While I liked the fact they use fresh and the least number of ingredients, I find that they are overpriced and give very little...
The place was busy when we arrived. Loved the fact that they were playing 90s jams -- BSB, Monica, and Jodeci (I think).

We ordered:
- Brown sugar -- which you can taste if you let the ice cream sit on the mid-tongue or as the aftertaste.
- Banana with 5 Chinese Spices -- the taste of banana hit as soon as I put the spoon in my mouth. It tasted like the banana in banana bread without the bread. That gooey and spiced up flavor. I would order this again!
-TCHO Chocolate -- this was good too. Like a smooth and subtle hazelnut flavor.

We had a nice chat with a couple before we parted ways. I also liked the seat-up of this place. They have enough space that is comfortable and not overdone.

I will come back here in warmer weather.
author: Anisha G.

description: I don't usually eat sweets but this was totally worth it. Made with Liquid Nitrogen. It's fresh ice cream made right in front of your eyes.
author: Charlie N.

description: A cool novelty place. Waited in line for 25 min. The thrill of it all is watching each ice cream scoop being made in front of you and cool liquid nitrogen fog spilling out. I had the Strawberry Ice Cream- tasted wayyy too milky/creamy/heavy cream and very little strawberry taste. Have had better.
author: Annie K.

description:
This liquid nitrogen process they use for the ice cream definitely made the ice cream creamier but not to the point where it's worth the extra money you pay for it!  I tried the TCHO Chocolate with Almond Brittle mix-in.  I wished the chocolate was a little more chocolatey and the almond brittle less brittley (could have used more almond in the brittle) - but I'm definitely glad I added the almond brittle as I like having a little crunch in my ice cream.  

It's a fun place and a neat idea but I think I'll stick to my other favorite ice cream shops.
author: Amy W.

description:
Let it be known, there is no chocolate ice cream in this world that can hold a candle to Smitten's TCHO Chocolate.  This should be the gold standard for all ice creams.

I am pretty sure this is also the coolest ice cream experience b/c you get to watch your ice cream form in front of you through the use of Liquid Nitrogen and their fancy machines.

also... I think their salted caramel ice cream is a few notches better than Bi-Rite's salted caramel!  Oh man I can't believe I'm publishing this... but it's true.
author: Kyra W.

description:
On a joyride with friends, we decided to go to Hayes Valley. The little ice cream stop has a very nice interior. Whoever decorated the menu design and the interior as well as their labels is very talented. It all is very well put together.

THIS IS THE BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. 

I tried two flavors. The TCHO Chocolate ice cream really tasted like chocolate. The honey nectarine must have been my favorite. I want another one just writing this review. So amazing, so fresh.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
Smitten? Seriously? 

Guess who else makes simple, elegant, fresh ice cream? Haagen Daaz.  

If you want to waste 30 minutes of your life watching this concept eatery slowly churn out your... 

---- Wait whaaa ----

$11 for two samples?!

Smitten, you've gotta be shittin me.
author: E W.

description: I've been there once. The prices are awful, even for SF. Pricier than Bi-Rite with less selection. They only have three ice cream options.
