description: MINT CHOCOLATE CHIP. Best mint chip ice cream I've ever had. Definitely makes me want to visit Hayes Valley more often. Nom.
author: M E.

description:
Just A-OK in my book. 

$5.50 for a small cup seemed like a lot to me, especially considering they were only making two flavors - vanilla and green tea- at the time. Not much choice there. And why aren't the prices posted? Maybe they know folks would turn around if they knew how much it was prior to ordering...?

Anyhow, tried the green tea. It was okay. Not mind blowing. Definitely creamy. 

Might come back if they're doing chocolate salted caramel. But I feel this place is pretty overrated, so I might want to spend my hard earned $5.50 elsewhere in cute Hayes Valley - like for a box of tasty macarons at Paulette around the corner.
author: Liz K.

description: Liquid nitrogen makes the ice cream so smooth, and I love the tastes - salty caramel (though it may be too sweet when you eat the second scoop) and rhubarb. They also have vegan options, which is a plus.
author: Anna G.

description: I'm sure most people go to Smitten more for the concept rather the actual ice cream. The ice cream is good but nothing special. However, I think their Apple Cider a la Mode is GENIUS. Why hasn't anyone thought of this before? Deliciously spiced hot cider topped with your choice of ice cream. I went with good ol' vanilla and the combo blew my mind. I only wish the cup wasn't so small cuz I definitely could've had a few more to myself.
author: Helen L.

description: i saw them make the ice cream right in front of me.. i was excited to try their Salted Carmel Ice Cream. I've had the ice cream before at Bi-Rite. so i wanted to compare.. and by far Smitten is the winner in my books! It was fresh and it had the perfect hint of salt. And i totally loved how the added Almond Brittle onto my  ice cream! it gave it a special taste!
author: Belinda C.

description: We had  to wait awhile for our ice creams, but what a unique experience ! Delicious ice cream made by " mad scientists'
author: Katherine M.

description:
Smoothest, best ice cream i've ever had! My favorite flavor is the salted caramel & the vanilla with lavender biscuits!

not too long ago a couple girlfriends and I just sat there and kept ordering and reordering rounds of ice cream on a Sunday afternoon haha
author: Shivani S.

description:
first impression: wow... the ice cream is expensive! I got a small scoop (4oz) for $4.75 plus tax bringing the scoop to $5.13. That is $20.50 a pound! (even todays gas prices are around .49 cents a pound). okay, so i'm probably comparing apples to oranges--

then... i read a little further- all ice cream is made fresh to order. okay, so this 'slow food movement' is really getting S-L-O-W. then i think: can this business deliver by going this extreme on this food trend. 

the result: watching the ice cream maker ladies scramble to meet consumer demand seemed a little depressing- I figured I would wait a good 20 minutes for my 4oz of ice cream, and we really threw them for a loop when we requested a receipt. surprisingly, they delivered rather quickly- i waited maybe 10 minutes (which is probably twice as fast as birite). they had two flavors (would have loved more variety, but i guess you loose something when you go 'back to the old fashioned way'. pure ingredients, okay. the vanilla was okay. my boyfriend got the tcho chocolate which was excellent (and i don't really like chocolate). i got a waffle cone (which i wonder if they make those to order too?) that was so good. GET THE WAFFLE CONE! 

I'll flip a coin to decide if i'll go back.
author: Grant D.

description:
I love that this is a woman owned and heart-driven biz, started from the ground up.  I love that everything is so fresh, and the toppings are amazing. 

But today I had the mint chip, and had the oddest ice-cream experience, ever.  I guess it was the nitrogen mixing with the chocolate chip, but it was like my lips and then my throat were being coated with wax, with every single bite.  I ended up tossing mine.  

But even with a solid hitter, like vanilla, the wait, texture, and price are not worth it.   Why not at least make up a fresh batch every half hour are so, rather than have everyone wait and wait and wait for their own serving to be fixed?   I won't be back, either way.
author: Ann G.

description:
Unfortunately Vogue's proclamation that this is the best ice cream in the history of civilization has set the bar super high and I'm afraid that it's going to have a negative impact on the business in the long run.

Yes, it's a nifty operation and it's cool to see the ice cream being churned in front of you.

Yes, the flavors are fresh and you can be assured that it doesn't contain preservatives.

However, with all of that being said, I'm not sure the overall experience is indeed "the very best" or worthy of a 5 minute wait, let alone the hour long wait that I see often times when passing through Hayes Valley.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Creamy dreamy ice cream!

Finally made it to Smitten - I bought a $25 all you can eat ice cream, tasting the new flavors of the season, hang out with Robyn and learn about her ice cream coupon from Guilt and redeemed it at an event last week. The event was intimate and super fun, there were about 12 of us tasters, 4 kelvins, 4 kelvinistas, 4 flavors of ice cream, a pile of fresh pezzel cones, and our empty bellies. The staff and Robyn were super friendly and accommodating even welcoming us with hot cider! 

We got to try 3 new flavors/combos:
- Bay Leaf with Meyer Lemon Caramel - the lightest ice cream of the bunch, the herb flavor is strong but I think that's what makes it special
- Maple Walnut - toasted nut crumbles in ice cream... mmm.
- Apple a la mode sundae: vanilla ice cream over warm baked apples with peanut butter caramel and crumbled graham crackers - probably my favorite it tasted just like the holidays and peanut butter caramel?!?! what's not to love 
- Classic Tcho chocolate - wow! the smoothest ice cream I have ever tasted, you have to try it yourself to really understand 

Note: Sitting outside at night in front of the shop was chilly especially when eating ice cream but we found out that soon Smitten's going to be putting up a tent and heat lamps so that we can still enjoy ice cream on the coldest winter day.
author: Nicole L.

description: LOVE the way they run this place. They are so creative and fresh. It is the way it should be. The texture of their ice cream is unique and the flavors are true the name, I had the mint when I went for the first time. I was taken aback by the strong fresh taste of actual mint leaves rather than the artificial green mint chip one finds in the store. Worth hitting up if you are ever in the city. With their changing flavors and toppings it's a fun surprise.
author: Shannon G.

description:
Very unique ice cream production using all high quality local ingredients. What makes it special are the cool machines they have where they make it in front of you- I have never seen ice cream made this way before.

I think it's a great spot for part of a date or to take friends from our of town.  I had the chai flavor and it was very flavorful.  I will be back to try more.  

Tip: It is an open structure so wear a jacket if you plan to sit and hang out for a bit.
author: Elana R.

description: People are not lying, this is wonderful delicious ice cream. The owner went to b-school at Stanford and invented this special liquid nitrogen machine blahblahblah...IT MAKES AMAZINGLY DENSE AND PERFECT ICE CREAM. That's all you need to know. Well, that and a little goes a long way - I get the small chocolate with chocolate sauce (no, it isn't redundant), and it is as satisfying as an enormous scoop would be elsewhere. Van Leeuwen chocolate was my previous standard for chocolate ice cream, but they've been replaced and forgotten. Love.
author: Ruchi M.

description:
Over.....rated. Ove....rated.
Come on folks. The idea of nitrogen ice cream is genius IF you are at a farmer's market or somewhere remote. 
The taste ranks w Breyers you buy at Safeway.  

$5.50 for a small scoop?   20min wait? 

Miyakos is still my favorite as the owner is genuine and it's old skool customer service, with old skool Mitchell's, with old skool flavors.

Smitten is Hipster ice cream and I won't be going back anytime soon.
But their cargo container building is cool visually.  Not sure if it actually costs less to build than wood frame but it fits the vibe.  "41 pieces of Flair" over substance.
author: Mitch M.

description: The new flavour: "Earl Grey w Milk Chocolate chips" is soooo good. It's very light and fresh. Just what you expect from Smitten. I'm still waiting for the Blood Orange by March. My favourite ice cream in town (: Great neighborhood too!
author: May N.

description: It is really good, creamy and thick. Good flavors, of course would love to see a few more flavors, a bit expensive, but hey in new order SF what isn't expensive? Even a tent in GGP aitn free, is it? Anyway, finally some nitrogen cream in sfland.
author: SForiginal T.

description:
I've been itching to get in and try Smitten's ice cream for at least six months. Problem is, so is everyone else. On a good day, there's 20 people lined up waiting for a chance at some tasty sweet goodness. Not sure what was going on today, but my friend and I stopped in and were able to walk straight up to the cash to order. Sure, we had to wait about two minutes to actually place it, but whatever. It's better than standing in a line and waiting half an hour just to get up there. 

We ordered the Passion Fruit ice cream and the Chocolate. Based on the way they make it, there's no ice crystals like in conventional ice cream. Freshly made on the spot, this is like cold solid cream in a cup. Smooth, silky, tasty, and nearly orgasmic on the tongue, this will put almost any ice cream you can think of to shame.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Dear Smitten,
Everything about you is adorable, and your ice cream......, I died and went to heaven. 
I love you.
Michael
author: michael C.

description: Best ice cream ever. Enthusiastic Brrrista.  Mint chocolate chip was like a party in my mouth!
author: Willow M.

description: My boyfriend took me here as a surprise date the very first time we hung out and it was a hit from the start. We go here and buy the pint size to share for the next 3 days. The seasonal flavors are always really delicious.
author: Andy M.

description: Some of the best Ice Cream I have ever had. The ice cream had such a great texture. We also tried the ice pops and they were great as well.
author: Tyler C.

description: One of the best ice creams I've ever had in the bay area. I felt it is overpriced before trying but think it is worth the price! I especially recommend the Vanilla flavor - pure, fresh and creamy (without being too creamy), exactly as it is advertised. I cannot be more satisfied :)
author: Almond W.

description: I may have ordered the wrong thing; the ice cream was creamy but otherwise forgettable.  I must have ordered one of the weirder flavors because I remember wishing I had gone with plain vanilla instead.
author: H C.

description: I just love this place. The mint is my favorite, it is simply pure. And now that they have tasting flights you can't go wrong.
author: sonja h.

description: Amazing ice cream and a super rad experience.  Pretty sure I still dream of the TCHO Chocolate.  Mmmm....
author: Amber H.

description: Checked it out on a warm Sunday and the line was so long. Decided to come back on Monday instead and no wait at all!! LOVE this place - very happy that I got to try the June flavor, Olive Oil with Lavender shortbread! YUMMMM! It won't be a bad idea just to get some ice cream and chill in the park.
author: Goby Y.

description:
Went here again to give it another shot after a three star experience.

This time I ordered the Tcho Chocolate Mint Chip. When I went for the first bite with my spoon to scoop it, it literally crumbled in my bowl. I know, crumbling is  not exactly the first descriptive word when you think of ice cream. For $5 for two tiny scoops, it should at least be slightly above average. As for the taste, it tasted like real mint leaves as oppose to the artificially green crap you get at the market. However, the flavor was very light, like a hint of mint. In this case, I prefer the green crap from the frozen aisle.  

I actually had great ice cream before where it was not creamy, I had this milk Ice flavor at ICI in berkeley, but it was suppose to not be as creamy as other flavors.

I tried my friend's Thco chocolate (which he did enjoyed), and it wasn't bad, but nothing to go crazy over. The flavor was chocolaty (as expected), and texture was dense.
author: Jessica T.

description: Ice cream made to order. No, you read that right. No preservatives or other chemical crap -- this is as pure as it gets. Delicious flavors and unique toppings, they even make the waffle cones on the spot. I had salted caramel with TCHO chocolate syrup in a waffle cone WITH peanut brittle crumbles on the side -- GENIUS! With a concept like this you can expect to wait a little longer for your order but rest assured it is worth the wait.
author: Jonny A.

description:
Yummy and fun experience. The ice cream is so creamy! It's like a cross between soft serve and traditional. Very rich and delicous! 

May be a bit of a wait, but definitely worth it. The salted caramel rocked!
author: Wendy S.

description: This place is cool and unique. Nitrogen ice cream so awesome! The ice cream however was too smooth for me I got the strawberry and felt as if I was eating strawberry cream cheese. But for the unique experience I'm a fan!
author: Diane S.

description: Yeah, this ice cream is heavenly. Smitten is this cute little box shop in a bitty park with a few other box eateries. I ordered the salted caramel and they handmade it on the spot. I really wish I had taken a video of the ice cream machines with the whooshing and the anticipation. I got a small cup, which was just under $5, and worth every tiny spoonful. This ice cream is decadent. It's the perfect re"treat" on a sunny day. Can't wait to be in Hayes Valley again. Thank goodness I don't live in that neighborhood or I would be there every day, getting happy and fat.
author: Kat R.

description:
Good, but little more than the gimmick.  

The flavors are original, and the ice cream is pretty good.  And I admit it, I took a picture of the liquid nitro machine and posted it on facebook as yet another example of how much cooler San Francisco is than any other place... 

BUT, it was a little pricey, AND though the freezing to order process did make the ice cream smooth, the 3 scoops my friends and I got were inconsistent in texture, and I can't really say that it's the smoothest or creamiest ice cream I've ever eaten, or even that I've eaten in San Francisco.  Just aiight for me.
author: Linda L.

description: Tried Smitten for the first time since I love ice cream.  As everyone has mentioned the ice cream you order and is freshly made before your eyes with liquid nitrogen.  Their flavors change every day.  We decided to go with the TCHO chocolate ice cream and the cookie dough.  Personally, I am not too fond of TCHO chocolate so i wasn't too impressed with how the ice cream tasted.  I did find the cookie dough to be delicious. Perfectly creamy and not too sweet.  Since I visited on a weekday I took off, it wasn't too crowded but I have passed by when the line to order is ridiculous.  Their flavors change every day and it was about $9 for two single scoops of ice cream without toppings.  Their location has limited seating.  There are only a few benches inside, but you can definitely go to the park right across the street to sit at the benches/tables to enjoy your ice cream. Smitten is a good place in the middle of Hayes Valley to grab a quick treat to satisfy your sweet tooth craving.
author: Christine D.

description: The texture of ice cream is unbeatable. It's also a great show. However, for me, the ice cream is too sweet and ridiculously expensive. There's better ice cream in sf.
author: Michael S.

description: I got vanilla ice cream with pistachio brittle and dark chocolate shavings.  It was so good and they churned it right there in front of my face!
author: Elise G.

description: A little on the pricey end which is why I won't give the 5th star, and it's really good to try but probably wouldn't go out of my way to go there every weekend. I've always been interested in molecular cuisine, your ice cream is made to order using nitrogen and dry ice. The crystals are so tiny, the consistency is just so silky and smooth. Tried the choc mint one. Pretty good!
author: Alexandra V.

description:
I really don't know what's up with the taste buds with people in the Bay Area. I got this ice cream when this place first opened and it was by far the WORST ice cream I've ever tasted. Mitchell's & Bi-Rite are far better. 

I'll probably try it again, to either confirm or alter my thoughts.
author: Adriana B.

description:
We love ice cream....they have really a delicious product...I can taste the heavy cream :) yes, it's a bit pricey....

Our daughter loves watching them make the ice cream....taking deep breaths while she's waiting....
author: Barb L.

description: The ice cream is made to order with liquid nitrogen, just like in science class. Its a different texture from other types of ice cream around town because its creamy and the flavor is rich. I'd go with a small chocolate to start. The other flavors can be really strong.
author: Theresa D.

description: I wanted ice cream after lunch and a friend of mine brought me here. It's located in the Hayes Valley and all the ice cream is home made. The best flavor is the mint flavor since they use fresh real mints. I also ordered it with a home made waffle cone.
author: Benny Y.

description:
Get the mint or salted caramel ice cream.  The smooth texture of the ice cream makes this place worth the longer wait.

However I don't recommend the TCHO chocolate.  It's less ice cream and more coco powder which made it too dense and less refreshing.
author: Jen G.

description:
Try this for novelty, not for taste. 
Didn't even finish my ice-cream here.

The concept is great: Liquid nitrogen ice-cream, made to order.
I like the menu options - interesting flavors and toppings (I had quince topped with candied coco nibs).

Ice-cream texture is OK - it's very smooth, though a little too dense and cold.

But...
The actual flavor of the ice-cream just isn't that great.  Tastes kind of bland, honestly.  Quince is quite an intense fruit, but it is totally lost in here.  This is not the kind of ice-cream like at Bi-Rite or Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous that you have to keep going back to.  
The candied coco nibs topping were like sugar shards... the texture is too hard but not crunchy.  Too much sugar and not enough nibs - they need to find a better way to candy them so they get a thinner sugar coating and actually let the coco nib flavor come through.

Well hyped place, want to like it, but sorry I don't.
author: Thomas L.

description: Love their fresh made ice cream. Their mint and chip is super delicious! Can't see any of the mint, but definitely can taste it!!
author: Natalie S.

description: The salted caramel is absolutely amazing. This place is great because of the way they make their ice cream. The liquid nitrogen makes all the difference. So smooth and creamy. A little bit on the pricey side for a small ice cream. I spent $6 on a small size with a sauce topping, so I wouldn't come here often. But on occasion it's awesome.
author: Melissa L.

description: I'm not a big ice cream person but OMG Smitten is so yummy!! So smooth and creamy but also light and refreshing at the same time!
author: Christine C.

description:
Today I was able to try Smitten Ice Cream for the first time and it was delicious.
The salted caramel ice cream with almond brittle melted in my mouth. I love the kick that the sea salt gives it; I devoured it. 
This is real ice cream. They make it right there in front of you so it's fresh and you are able to taste how pure and rich the ingredients are. I also learned about some of the other flavors they are mixing up and saw a menu on their website and let me tell you, I have a lot of ice cream to eat in the near future. Such unique and interesting flavors!

This is probably some of the best ice cream I've tasted and I can't wait for them to open in Hayes Valley because I will be stopping by frequently.
author: Denise S.

description: The best ice cream! Completely worth the wait even on a rainy day! I truly enjoyed the tcho chocolate in a cone! The only thing I wish they'd have is for the cone to be dipped in chocolate at the bottom!
author: Kiran J.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM
This place is all about texture.  The first time I went I ordered whipped cream on the ice cream.  The ice cream is so smooth, the whipped cream seemed coarse.  To get the texture, they make the ice cream per order with liquid nitrogen which allows for tiny ice crystals = smooth.

Downsides: few flavors (4 at a time), no sampling, no flavor mixing, above average wait time (they have to make it), pricey, and their house-made cones are a let-down.

Upside: Best ice cream

Also good: the toppings are all house-made and delightful
author: Ahab R.

description:
I actually had this foodie dream two nights ago (not making it up):
I heard about this new ice cream place in a fancy mall where you have to make a reservation to get ice cream there.  So we go and there is a long line and a velvet rope and I didn't have to have a reservation because my friend knew the owners and got us in.  Everything was wood: the counter and all the scoopers, everything.  You had to sign a release form to eat the ice cream because the wood the scoopers were made out of had some sort of oil in it that could cause allergic reactions in some people.  I had Sauerkraut flavored ice cream and it was amazing.  

Going to Smitten is kind of like this.
author: Bucky M.

description:
Gimicky or not, you gotta love Smitten's made-to-order flavor-of-the-day ice creams. I mean, it's ICE CREAM for crying out loud! Can you really go wrong with ice cream?

Sure, you may spend minutes deciding if Malted Vanilla or TCHO Chocolate is a commitment you're willing to make (to both your tastebuds and your hips), but once chosen there really isn't room for regrets. So just pick one at random, find something to entertain yourself with for 5-10 minutes, and be ready for some the freshest, richest ice cream you've ever had!
author: Valerie C.

description: The lady got my $6 ice cream cone wrong 3 times, and charged me 3 times. I paid nearly $20 for a cone of ice cream, I found out upon checking my e-receipts in my email later that evening. They did not respond to my email or phone call. Pretty disappointed...
author: Layla S.

description: Made on-the-spot Ice cream was great and location in an converted shipping container was very cool but the service was not great. The brrrista" (their term, not mine) that took my order was seemingly on drugs which could explain why it was placed incorrectly and then took forever to be corrected. Definitely a shame to have service problems come in the way of an excellent, innovative, product.
author: Stephen S.

description: Thick and delicious. A fun process. You need to be willing to use your patience. The line goes slow and you don't get your scoop immediately after placing an order.
author: Deanne R.

description:
Yummmm!!
I had the Bayleaf ice cream with orange clove Carmel and pine nut brittle.  To die for.  A tad overpriced, but overall I am impressed.
author: Sherri B.

description: Pricey, but a very cool concept. They make the ice cream right in front of you and per request. I loved the pizelle cone.
author: Rex X.

description:
Smittens' was just alright to me. My boyfriend and I went here the same night Biergarten, right next to Smitten, had opened up. 
The ice cream was made to order by liquid nitrogen, which made for a really cool show as you waited for your ice cream. 
While they have very unique flavors I was still expecting that sweetness that I usually want in ice cream. My boyfriend had the chocolate chip mint and the mint was very overpowering. I had the butter pecan and it was rather good. 

For me I still remain loyal to Bi-rite, but we'll see.
author: Brie S.

description:
Came upon this place while hanging out at the Hayes Valley designer fair. I've read on yelp about this place so i was excited to try it. The line was long but not too crazy. 
It was kind of expensive for a one size cup. There are only 2 flavors and I suppose they change them weekly. 2 cups of ice cream came out to be $11.00 
We had vanilla and salted caramel. I must say bi-rite is so much better for salted caramel. 
Overall I'm glad I tired it. Not sure if I'd get it again.
author: Smiley H.

description:
cool process, great staff, great environment, but expensive pricing, and disappointing flavors. 
interesting flavor offers, and because of the absence of free samples, they allow you to switch flavors at no cost if you are unsatisfied, however the flavor profile was not enough to justify the pricing. $5.50 per small scoop.
author: K D.

description: I was just a little bit beside myself when I tried this ice cream. I mean, ice cream is ice cream. You don't expect a whole lot out of the experience other than that it be more or less cold and sweet. Smitten hit both of those notes and then went above and beyond. The taste and--because of the dry ice freezing process--the texture are unreal. Plus the space is neatly nestled in the adorable Hayes Valley district, so it's great for families and hipsters alike. Who can't get behind some seriously tasty ice cream?
author: Risa P.

description: Very rich and smooth ice cream! Got the spicy drizzle. Forgot what it was called, but it was great with the chocolate ice cream!
author: Jasmine O.

description:
The ice cream is uh-may-zing! The flavors are fantastic. My favorite was the salty caramel by far. I love the shipping container converted into ice cream stand! Biodegradable packaging. Real ingredients. Delicious. Grab some, sit on the bench at Patricia's Green, and enjoy the moment. 
My only complaint: it melts too fast.
author: T B.

description: Ice cream is jaw dropping leaving you absolutely begging for more. Satisfies that essential craving in all the best ways possible. Life makes sense when you're holding a cone. I keep licking my lips for more.
author: Servando B.

description:
One of my favorite things in this city. I was dragged here by my girlfriend after a large meal, and really didn't want to eat anything else. I obliged her by ordering a small cup of ice cream - I think one or two scoops, and it blew me away.

The venue itself is very unassuming. It's been a little while, but I remember it resembling a tent with clear plastic walls on one side, and heat lamps running as it was a cold evening.

They make the ice cream in front of you with liquid nitrogen, and... that's all I can say about it. It's not a fancy place, it's a bit indie and a bit hipster, but the flavor of the mint ice cream I had is probably my best ice cream ever. It's definitely a place to go for a high quality, delicately flavored ice cream, rather than a huge fudge sundae, but if you're looking for quality of flavor, this is it.
author: Rob C.

description:
It's science and food combined together to make ice cream! I wanted to visit here for awhile now, and since today's a rare sunny moment, my friends and I drove down to try out some much needed sweet hits.

I got the salted caramel and in the kiddie size (definitely european sized). First these are made to order, so there's no pre-made anything to it. Plus they use cool liquid nitrogen to freeze my yumminess, so I knew there would be a wait. That's okay, I waited 20 minutes for crepes at Sophie's crepes, so this didn't push my patience button like some yelpers who need their creamy drug fix fast.  My flavor was super awesome...like buttery sugar clouds that went all too fast. I also tried the TCHO chocolate (that was like pure gelato flavors!) and the Spring Herb (which made me think of strong herbal tea). 

It's right next to a funky park that has a giant steel woman figure, plus a spiderweb crawling gym for the kids. Very nice place to vegetate on a Sunday.
author: Pauline L.

description:
I mean... it was cool.  

I tried vanilla, which was really good.  It was sweet and creamy, and very "real milk" tasting.  Not amazing, but really good.  But part of Smitten is about the experience - I get that.  They're making ice cream in your face, that's boss.

Here's the thing: it took a REALLY long time.  So you may need to be in a wait-a-really-long-time-for-ice-cream-but-it's-really-good mood.  Also, they were experiencing some sort of equipment malfunction on their snazzy iPads, which made them seem less impressive.  It was like... womp womp. We had to wait to be charged (even after getting our ice cream!) but we continued to wait patiently instead of stealing off like thieves in the night.  Or, afternoon.  Whatever.

My friend got the salted caramel, which I also liked.  It was like those Werther's butterscotch candies, but with a touch of salt.  Cool, but I liked my vanilla better.
author: Paz R.

description:
I read about Smitten online and thought the concept was interesting enough to try it.
Went over the weekend and had to stand in line for about 35 min to finally order, they offered only 2 flavors Green tea and Salted caramel. If you wanted salted caramel you would have to wait 25 more minutes......
So the option was Green Tea with a 15 min wait.

Dont get me wrong but if you are going to wait over 45 min for ice cream, it better be damn good.

It was't, the Green tea was so overly sweet it was impossible to even finish the single scoop, left haft of it, something that I would never do with ice cream but it was so unpleasantly sweet.

I dont think I wouldn't ,return not even for the "experience" of made to order ice cream. Not worth the wait, the price or the taste.
author: Salvador O.

description: BEST ICE CREAM EVER. Get the fresh herb if it's available - made with basil, mint, thyme and rosemary. I was so skeptical but it's SO GOOD! A little pricey, so make an experience out of it and eat it slowly!
author: Megan O.

description:
I love science. I love food. And when the blatant connection is made between both, it's harmonious. Definitely read about Kelvin while you're waiting for your ice cream to be made. There's pictures and everything. 

Onto the ice cream. As I mention in many reviews - a few basic principles when it comes to food/sweets. I love local business. I am willing to pay more for it. And when you're ingesting all those calories, it better be the best thing you've ever tasted. 

Smitten was delicious and worth the price tag as a special treat. Definitely not something I would have every day - then again, should I be eating ice cream every day? Probably not. For me, the best part was the homemade toppings - especially the cocoa nib praline. Shell out the extra 50 cents for toppings. It's worth it.
author: Julie L.

description: Love this place. It's pretty cool experience to have an ice-cream made from scratch using liquid-nitrogen. I got the most basic ice cream flavor, vanilla. Yet I would never discourage someone to come here because it's an experience!
author: KC C.

description:
It was the best of times.... and some of the best ICE CREAM EVER! Ohhh Lordy if thou art in heaven punish us sinners  for worshiping the cream and fat gods. We are not worthy of enjoying the delectable creations that have smitten us. As an unbeliever, I came to this place with the significant other, not expecting to have ice cream made-to-order, and not expecting flavors like salted caramel and a mint-basil-thyme-rosemary concoction. 

NO REGRETS! you must try this place! The salted caramel tasted slightly burnt (gave it character) and the MBTR one was a delicious and refreshing palate cleanser. Neither of them could've been consumed by themselves without the other (well, I would've eaten all of mine, but was glad to share it since it was DENSE).  Considering it expensive is only for the cheapos. It is WORTH IT. Every small, delicious ounce!

We will be back. We're smitten!
author: Ben G.

description:
I am smitten with Smitten. Their quality of ingredients is appreciated. All the flavors I have tried so far are beyond say. (Earl Grey - my fav so far - YUM!) The pizzelle cones surprisingly remind me of my grandma's baking. Sometimes my famiglia and I swear she's back there making some batter. 

We can't feel our fingers but it's damn good. My cousin and I trek all the way from San Jose for Smitten. Need I say more?
author: Ashly d.

description:
Although I like the location and the cute store front, 2 stars says it with: Meh, I've experience better. 

Maybe I'm not a real connoisseur of ice cream, but my salted Carmel lack flavor and was kind of like eating a big soft ball of cream. I would prefer to spend $4.75 (a single scoop: actually made up of two little scoops) on bi-rite salted Carmel. 

The staff is definitely friendly and nice, since it is in my hood I will likely try them one more time before I give up on them.
author: ellen m.

description: I've been walking past this place for weeks and they were finally open today! I wasn't sure what the deal was, but the fact that I could walk up and get ice cream grabbed my attention. Turns out, like Blue Bottle Coffee down the alley, they make each order on the spot. It's crazy and freaking awesome. I had the caramel ice cream and it was the most intense caramel flavor I've ever experienced. I'll be back.
author: Eric K.

description:
Overall: if you're hoping for a lot of flavor choices then this is not the place for you. It's great if you love simple flavors, or are adventurous enough to try some unique blends. I don't know how much the nitrogen really adds to the ice cream, but I will say that all of their flavors are very creamy and rich tasting, but don't leave you feeling sluggish / sweetened-out afterwards. 

Heads up: there is no sampling (unless there's no lines and they have some extra ice cream) and parking is a struggle here. The line is also super long, and while the ice cream is good, I wouldn't wait over 20 minutes for it so I would suggest going in the morning on a weekend or on a weekday.

Definitely try:
1. Fresh Mint Chip - I really dislike mint flavoring, but this was so refreshing and unique. It was a perfect amount of fresh mint and chocolate chip, and is the only place I would ever order a mint-flavored dish at.
2. Homemade Nut Brittle - super delicious!
3. Cinnamon Shortbread - perfect shortbread and an amazing addition to the vanilla ice cream
4. Blood Orange with Pistachio Shortbread (March flavor)- I'm not a citrus flavor person, but the combination with the pistachio was yummy!

Skip:
1. TCHO Crispies
2. TCHO Chocolate Ice Cream - it's your average chocolate ice cream
author: Gia K.

description:
Best ice cream, and great toppings too!!  The ice cream is made in nano batches to order, so it's all very fresh.  The toppings I tried were made there as well...  Interesting flavors.  I wish you could taste the different flavors first, but it's not possible because each serving is made to order.  Sometimes you just need to have a little faith!  ;-)  In this case I ended up with some delicious ice cream!

Overall good experience!
author: Danielle S.

description:
Worth the venture to try something new.  I ordered the Kiddie Spring Herb in a cone.  I advise the cone because I believe you get more bang for your buck.  The Spring Herb reminded me of drinking tea and lathering some herbal lotion after spending a day at the spa.  The cone was just one big delicious cookie that complemented the ice cream.  Wonderful.  

It's nestled in between a little park and some shops on both sides.  It's in the cuts but worth exploring.  

Because you get fresh ice cream, the amount you paid for it seemed right.  A kiddie size is a sampling and then some.  But I believe getting it in a cone makes it worth your while.  

I also tried the Caramel and the chocolate.  Both tasted authentically like what they said they were.  Caramel tasted you were eating caramel straight from the container and chocolate was smooth like gelto chocolate ice cream.  Both were very rich in flavor and were a delight.
author: Daphne A.

description:
Excellent fresh mint flavour !!
A must have every time I have guests visiting the city.
author: Jb Y.

description: Freshest ice cream ever! Watching them make the ice cream is such a fun experience too!
author: Stephanie C.

description: It's a sad day when an ice cream shop thinks that they are so all that that they don't give samples on their 3 flavors.
author: Elaine W.

description:
is it unique? yes
is it delicious? yes, except for that mint/basil crap they had, consistency was nasty, flavor was lacking
is it worth the wait and the 5 dollars you pay for a small ice cream? NO!

i've bee here a few times, the wait time varies, even if there isnt a line you'd still have to wait for them to make the ice cream. the cool factor is that they make it right then and there, if you dont care about the cool factor, and care more about options, price, go to bi rit, or mr. mrs. miscellaneous, way better pricing, shorter wait time, more flavors
author: Long C.

description:
Best. Ice Cream. EVER.

The freshness must be the secret.  I've had all sorts of ice cream and am always looking for something better.  Smitten has made that search very difficult.  How can anyone top their flavor/quality?  I'd like to see more flavors (they offer about 3), but that's a lot to ask when the product is being made on the spot.  I had their vanilla, olive oil and salted caramel.  Not only is the ice cream fabulous, but their cones are to die for, as well. The wait isn't very long considering how busy they are and service was very friendly.  I think the owner was working the counter when I went. 

I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Lester B.

description: I love this place.  So cute and nice to come to on a good weather day.  You can eat your ice cream at the street park and people watch.  Then you can walk around the neighborhood and find some shops.  I love watching them make the ice cream, it makes me feel like a kid.  The Caramel Salt Ice Cream was the best but then again, I love Caramel Salt anything.
author: Grace P.

description:
I love this place! It's in a perfect location .. right next to a dog park and a jungle gym. Get an ice cream, sit on a bench and watch the cute dogs run around in the grassy area. Accidentally drop some crumbs from your waffle cone and watch as the birds race to grab that piece off the ground!

Smitten come up with crazy flavours! They seem to have around 4 to 6 flavours every day, and the few times I've gone, they've always had Tcho Chocolate and Vanilla. My recommendation is to go for the crazy flavours! I've tried Sweet corn (Amazing flavour!! My favourite!) and olive oil (delicious!). The people who run the stand are also really sweet and friendly.

The shop seems to get busy at very random times ... afternoons are usually busiest because the dog park attracts a lot of people. We went once around 8:30PM, and there was no line-up and 15 minutes later, there was was a huge crowd in line. (They close at 9pm.)

The ice cream is a bit on the pricey side, but totally worth it to go once or twice a month, IMO :)
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Very lovely outdoor ice cream stand. They make each to order as a fresh batch. The flavor is very strong and rich because of the egg yolk. Go with vanilla, salted caramel flavor was a little too strong after a few tastes but the vanilla was to die for, yum! Expect to wait ten minutes especially if you get the most popular (caramel) flavor. There is a park right next to this place where you can enjoy and there's also a bike rental.
author: S B.

description:
Not to belabor the good reviews of Smitten, just want to point something out. 

I'm kind of lactose intolerant, or maybe milk protein irritable would be a more accurate statement. I do not jive with store bought ice cream. Mitchell's I can get down with since it's practically butter. Humphrey Slocombe/Bi-Rite are right in the middle. 

Had Smitten today as a treat after a work lunch (lactaid was certainly in my future as soon as we ran back to the office a few blocks away). Carrot Cake, great flavor loved the texture of the carrots. 

While delicious and wonderfully conceived in execution and idea- this ice cream is incredibly milky. I'm not saying that's a bad thing. But as someone who does not consume milks or creams- unless on a rare occasion or only when the milk is now broken down so much its a hard cheese or butter- this was a weird sensation. Lovely flavor- weird to be sipping up ginger/carrot flavored milk when it had melted in the cup. 

So not a full on review but rather a note to bare in mind, if like me, you haven't had a glass of milk in 10 years.
author: Niki M.

description:
Ordered the brown butter ice cream and added almond toffee. Delicious!!! Also quite fun to watch the churning process.

Disclaimer: I came on a fairly cold night when there wasn't a long wait. I've seen how bad the lines can get on warmer weekends and don't think I would have liked it quite as much if I had to wait awhile.
author: Amy F.

description: The whole idea of this place is really cool. It was awesome to see the ice cream being made in front of you. I ordered a small fresh mint ice cream. It was not quite my cup of tea. It tasted like I was eating actual mint leaf ice cream, which is cool, but not what I'm looking for when I get mint ice cream. (Guess I like artificial). The texture also leaves a film in your mouth like Starbucks whip cream. Still awesome though, even if it wasn't quite to my taste.
author: brittany s.

description: Ridiculously overrated. Ice cream is good, but not worth it. Why the hell you need to use nitrogen is beyond me. Any good ice cream store can do better.
author: Jason B.

description:
No Wonder they call it Smitten!
I was smitten all day after I ate one of their ice creams. 

SO GOOD!
SO CREAMY!
JUST MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH!

that salted caramel though.....god I want more!

I love the concept of on the spot ice cream. Freshest ice cream I have ever tasted. 
Cant wait to visit SF again just for this :)
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Cone was cakey and dry. Does that make sense? I wouldn't eat it again. It's very pretty to photograph and admire. 

Salted caramel was tasty but it melted super quick! I basically ate it by licking my hand like a cat.

+++ Adults are allowed to order kid-sized cones.
author: Jacquee P.

description: This is a very cool concept, and full of hipsters. I enjoyed watching them make the ice cream. The place was very busy and chaotic when I went, and the menu is a bit jumbled. I just had a vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce. It was good, this place is definitely worth a visit if you are in San Fran.
author: Jacob M.

description: When I lived in San Francisco over the summer, I would definitely call myself a regular at this place (fortunately for my taste buds, unfortunately for my waistline and wallet). Mint chip and Salted Caramel were my favorite flavors, always with the TCHO chocolate sauce. Winning combos!
author: Stefanie G.

description: I love Smitten.  The ice cream is so good and the flavors so inventive.  I follow Smitten on FB just to make sure I know what flavors are up.  Nice setting across from the park, on the corner of an alley.  Great place.
author: Deborah K.

description:
The concept- fresh made ice cream without preservatives or extra crap you can't pronouce- just cream + fresh ingredients to make a few flavors a day- usually starting out with 4 flavors but by the end of the day are out of at least one or two.  Usually vanilla and strawberry are easy to come by, but caramel, chai, and other seasonal flavors go fast, especially on warm sunny days.

The experience- you get to watch as the cream and other ingredients are put into a special apparatus that uses liquid nitrogen, at -322 degrees Fahrenheit, to make teeny tiny ice crystals that result in super creamy ice cream.  This takes about 5-8 min and is probably worth half the $5.50 you're paying for a small cup of ice cream.

If I would have thought of this for my 5th grade science fair project, I'm absolutely sure I would have won.  All those fatass grade school teachers would have been all over it.  

Anyhow, I digress.  The ice cream is super rich, creamy, and delicious (and probably 800 calories).  It's definitely worth a try but I don't know that I'd make a special trip to Hayes Valley just to have it again.
author: Maxine S.

description: Quite enjoy the ice cream base and flavors (liquid nitrogen or not) price for serving nog bad
author: Lisa C.

description: This is such a cute and charming place. Each order is made to order, but we did not mind the short wait, as we were mesmerized by the liquid nitrogen process that you witness right in front. My husband had the cookie dough flavor, which he loved, while I had the salted caramel. The salted caramel was too salty for my taste, and I knew after a few bites that I would be unable to finish it. When I asked if it was possible to switch to a new flavor, the employee was very friendly and accommodating, and asked me what other flavor I would like. I opted for the nectarines and cream. When I tried this flavor, I thought it was a bit too sweet for me, but finished my cup. Overall, the ice cream was very fresh, but I didn't love the salted caramel or nectarines and cream flavors. My husband and I agreed that the cookie dough flavor was really tasty though. There is only a small bench to sit on in the stand, but I think that adds to the ambience of the place, and there is plenty of seating near the stand where you can enjoy your ice cream and people-watch.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: ok, so I'm glad I got my serving in the cone because I think their cones are so good! i was skeptical about trying the flavor olive oil, but I'm glad I did! olive oil had lavender sea salt and shortbread. it's only drizzles with a little bit of olive oil, so it isn't that weird. I'd def come back to try new flavors.
author: Ann T.

description:
really fresh ice cream (that's what they're known for).  It's so creamy, it's ridiculous.  I got the toffee one the last time I went there and it was good, although a littlleee too sweet for my taste so I took off a star.  The vanilla though was really good. 

overall, I think their flavors are pretty good - I'm just an ice cream aficionado, and I think they could use a littllee work to get the flavors a bit more balanced, but if I passed by it like...right now, I'd probably get a cup.
author: Megha A.

description:
The whole process was fun and the ice cream was extremely creamy..
I had the chocolate and my partner had the olive oil with lavender and short bread..both were fantastic.
The staff was extremely friendly
Yes it is expensive but in my opinion it was worth it!
author: Robert O.

description:
Extremely rude. I order myself something simple like salted caramel ice cream. Eight other people order their ice cream after me. Those eight people got their ice cream before I did.

This place has been in business for a few months and they don't have a system down yet. Using Post-It notes is supposed to give you the impression they do it manually and that is somehow better. Because of this manual process, eight other customers after me were served their ice cream before me.

How about using a real ordering system instead of Post It notes.
author: D M.

description: V good ice cream! The small is larger than you realize, you don't need a regular unless you're trying to gain weight via creamy sugary substance in take. 75cents is too much $$ for 25 gourmet rainbow sprinkles though - pepper that shit on more!
author: Hailey H.

description:
Initially thought this was a bit gimmicky (which it is) but also found the experience quite fun.  Kids were on a tour of SF creameries and this was the last of the bunch which I thought would end in taste fatigue, but the flavors of the mint cookie was refreshingly of fresh mint.  The cacao nibs were smooth and pleasingly bitter.  Staff was delightful.  For a shack hooked up to liquid nitrogen, this creamery was true to flavors and ingredients.  Would have gotten 5 stars, but two things got me.  No restroom for the kids or seating.  Plus we just came from Bi-Rite.....

Sure to be back.
author: Dude D.

description: Best chocolate ice cream we've ever had! Tasted like cold belgian chocolate pudding. So much fun to watch them make it.
author: Lucy P.

description: OMG best ice cream I've ever had. Now that I've eaten here I will hold all my ice cream to this standard. Because of their super awesome Brrr machine that makes your ice cream right in front of your face using liquid nitrogen, their ice cream is super creamy & rich. It's nice & dense so you feel like you're getting your money worth. No way would I usually pay almost $5 for two scoops of ice cream but Smitten is different. It's THAT good. Would totally recommend for a date because the shop is super unique & cute. Love everything about it honestly. I got the salted caramel. It was heavenly. Tried my roommate's chocolate. Also amazing. Can't wait to go back. Definitely worth the walk & price, I promise. LOVE IT!!!
author: Jasmin K.

description: It was a hot day and I was craving ice cream again, so I tried their mint flavor. Surprisingly, it was delicious! The mint flavor was strong, but not overpowering. I would get this again! Quite refreshing on a nice summer day. =].
author: Desmond C.

description: I would be a great fan if I were a fan of ice cream, and enjoyed their somewhat pompous, high horse, attitude. The product is amazing, the location is fantastic, and the neighborhood is enjoyable. If you like ice cream, you would love this place.
author: Oliver B.

description: I wish I could take Smitten to Austin with me. Wow, this place is on point with serving creamy ice cream!
author: Miriam S.

description:
I don't get why this place only has 3.5 stars as an overall rating.  This is the best ice cream I have ever had.  I read a few reviews that complained that it was too creamy?  Idiots!  It's called ice CREAM!  Those same people probably love that sugar and ice blend they sell in 3 gallon tubs for $2 at the supermarket.  SMH

Onto the ice cream.  I wasn't going to order at first because of the pig fest my friends and I decided to have at Paxti's right before this place, but after seeing that nifty nitrogen machine, I was curious, then sold.  One small cup of the brown sugar with cookies.  I read a few complaints about the line and how long it took, but they have 3 machines everything is made to order, and it takes about 5 minutes from start to end.  Combine that with hot weather and the amount of people that will crave ice cream.  Do the math.  Since we were there right before closing, there were only about 4 or 5 orders before ours, so the wait was about 15 min, but I couldn't complain when I saw that all 3 employees were actually doing something.  It's not like when I'm at a place with slow ass service and the people working there are searching for that long lost booger in their nose.  

OK, slightly off track once again.  The ice cream I got was delicious, to say the least.  A few of my friends got the almond brittle topping for an additional 50 cents, and that was pretty good as well.  The ice cream is creamy, just the right amount of sweetness and has a generous amount of flavor added to it.  And since you are watching them make it through the window, you know that it is going to be the freshest ice cream you can have without actually making it yourself.  Oh, and the lady working behind the register/making the ice cream/owner (?) isn't too bad looking herself. ;D

The ice cream is a bit pricey for the amount you get ($4.75 is a small and you get 2 scoops about the size of those giant jaw breakers), but considering the amount of work going into each one, I guess it is somewhat justified.  I'm definitely coming back here again and hopefully I can try that mint chip flavor that I have read about.
author: JP T.

description:
my friends loved this place. after a nice german dinner at a nearby place. it was cold as heck but we were determined to eat ice cream.

i tasted each flavor, and the ice cream was cold and creamy. personally, my favorite things about this place was the fact that they ice cream was made in front of you, and that this place is housed in shipping containers.
author: Ameer N.

description: Awesome place to come during a hot summer day or a cool evening. They are conveniently located next to a park with plenty of spots to just sit and relax. The experience is great because you can see them making the daily flavors right in front of your face! A great place to take kids in my opinion. Their product is yummy too! overall a really cool place to stop by and take a look at. There's a nice small community feel about this place.
author: Thanh N.

description: First time at Smitten! 1pm on Monday and pretty quiet. Still takes about 5 mins to make the ice cream, so I'm glad I had some time to kill. Tried the Spring Herb mix. Delicious, but I can tell that not everyone would like herb flavored ice cream as much as me.
author: Julia H.

description: The most delicious and creamy ice cream I've ever had. Once you have it, everything else pales in comparison. The chocolate is my favorite, along with salted caramel. When I started coming here last year, they were constantly running out of flavors and closing early due to running out of ingredients, but that hasn't seemed to happen in a while. Still, don't get there too late or your favorite flavor might be gone!
author: Rachel D.

description: So this is really good ice cream. At the same time, not sure it's for me. I got the TCHO chocolate and it was nearly overpowering. If I go again, I'll probably try the vanilla. Then again, there's tons of ice cream all over this city. So why not pick something that works for you?
author: Heather R.

description: Everyone loves this place..I didn't. I give them three stars because the ice cream was good, but oh man, it's so freaking rich. Two bites would have been plenty. A whole cup was enough to knock me over. It's also way overpriced. Sure, the idea is cute, the toppings are different, and it's fun to watch (and wait..and wait..and wait) for your ice cream being made, but come on..the prices are insane when you look at them on a full stomach.
author: Sarah K.

description:
After my first and failed attempt at Smitten two weeks ago (they ran out of liquid nitrogen by 745pm), I finally experienced what the hype was all about. Friday night, 8:00pm, and a wait of 5 minutes. Win! The idea of fresh-made ice cream with liquid nitrogen sounds very intriguing and the ice cream does taste lighter and more fresh. 

The menu consists of 4 different flavor and rotates on a daily basis. I wanted their strawberry balsamic but tonight was just not the night. 

$3 for a tiny tiny 2 oz scoop, I didn't feel satisfied with my TCho mint chocolate chip. The next size up is $4.25 for a 4 oz scoop! 

The mint is delicious. It is nothing like the green mint ice cream you purchase from other shops. It has a taste of real mint leaves, vanilla, and chunks of dark chocolate chip.

The brown sugar tastes like molasses, with a hint of salt. Reminded me of Bi-rite's salted caramel, but I heard Smitten also had salted caramel on certain days. 

Overall, it was pricey but I'm interested in trying the other flavors they have.
author: Rosanne L.

description: I don't know about you, but I love ice cream! I especially love really good ice cream. Unfortunately, I did not get that experience with Smitten's. I do hear almost everyone rave about the place and I have never really heard a bad review about Smitten's, but I have to be honest, the ice cream is pretty basic. Yes, it's made right there in front of you, but I just cannot get excited about this place. I'll admit that it is a very nice spot to bring a date, especially at night. On the contrary, I did bring a date there and we both did not think too much about the ice cream. I'm not saying the ice cream is terrible, because it's not. It's just not super amazing as people make it out to be. Smitten's is definitely over-hyped as being the best ice cream. It's a bit too creamy for me. For me, I love hunting down great food. I like finding the best of something, whether its the best tacos, or best hamburgers, or even best ice cream. Smitten's just didn't do it for me, but definitely go there. There is a reason why it is popular, it's just not popular with me. That's just my opinion amongst others who absolutely love this place, but I am giving Smitten's 3 out of 5 stars for those reasons.
author: Eric M.

description:
Rating: 3.5

Visited today to check out the shipping containers that have been transformed into Ritual Coffee Roasters and Smitten Ice Cream. Flavors of the day included Coconut w/ Sesame Praline, Ritual Coffee, TCHO Chocolate, and one other I'm forgetting. Ordered a small coconut praline. I liked the sesame crispies in the ice cream. Having the ice cream made to order is great, but kind of makes it melt a little fast, especially on a warm day. Credit cards are accepted here. Friend signed her name like a credit card slip on their iPad and had the receipt texted to her moments later. Awesome tech!

Overall I liked the taste of the ice cream. You really taste the freshness. Seating is available in their little seating area by Ritual or grab a bench at Patricia's Green and enjoy the day. Open until 9pm during the weekdays and 10pm from Friday-the weekend. Looking forward to trying the other flavors soon.

Remember to use their compost bins! :D
author: Carolyn J.

description: Definitely haven't seen anything like this before, they make there ice cream with liquid Nitrogen. & let me just say I was blown away with the presentation. I tried the TCHO 60% Chocolate with the brown sugar caramel. Goodness.....My daughter and I were completely satisfied.
author: Rza Marie R.

description: I would say it's cool to watch them make the ice cream on spot (not always though), but in terms of taste, I thought it was too creamy and rich for me. I personally favor light and lower fat ice creams. If you are fan of pretty rich and thick ice cream, you will savor it!
author: Danny C.

description:
I'm smitten by the whole thing.

Love that the shop is made out of a shipping container. The owner is adorable! The ice cream is YUMMY and FRESH.  What could be better?

Yes, you may endure a long line but I can assure you that it is worth the wait.

BOOM!
author: Jillian G.

description: Im usually not into that yuppy organic stuff but this place was awesome. Ice cream was delicious and so creamy. A must.
author: Jamey P.

description: if you love ice cream you will love smitten!  the ice cream was rich and creamy.  came here on a sunday afternoon and the line wasn't too bad. parking might be a problem but we were luckily enough to find close parking.  i had the salted caramel with tcho chocolate sauce.  one word "yummmmm".  my friends got the classic vanilla with different toppings and they said it was really good.
author: Len L.

description: If you love ice cream, this place is legit. I came here thinking that this place was all hype and no substance but I was proven wrong. I got to try all three flavors of the day and all 3 were the bomb. Rhubarb was delicious. This fruit/vegetable ice cream was not too sweet but full of flavor. The salted caramel was probably more salty than sweet and man did I love it. You gotta wait for your ice cream but it is so worth it. Although its the same price as a tub of ice cream, it beats ben and jerrys or baskins any day of the year.
author: Steve N.

description:
"Meh. I've experienced better."

Exactly. The most remarkable thing about this ice cream is the cool spoons. I got vanilla and strawberry, after hearing about the super wait for caramel. Vanilla was just okay, but no better than a Haagen-Dazs pint. The strawberry was crap - honestly, a one note taste and unappealing mouthfeel. Adding fresh fruit is great, but ever heard of enhancing flavors? I've had better strawberry ice cream come out of a kid's toy machine.

Oh, and $5.50 for a 6 oz or so paper cup, compared to Bi-Rite's $3.50 and Humphrey-Slocombe's $2.75? Only in freakin' Hayes Valley, man. The molecular gastronomy thing is cute, I like it - but only if the product stands up to the process. Smitten is all sizzle - and no steak.
author: Neko M.

description:
I'm a little bit mixed about Smitten Ice Cream.... on one hand, the ice cream was pretty good. I got the sticky toffee pudding. There were little pieces of dates in it (yum) and the consistency of it was pretty smooth. Yes it was sweet, but I expected that when ordering a flavor called sticky toffee pudding. Fresh ingredients also made it a plus in my book. I also enjoyed reading the story of how the shop came to be while I was in line. So it's not NOT good per say... 

With that said, I don't know if I would shell out $4-5 a scoop to go there again. The cost isn't bad considering most local shops cost about the same nowadays.. but that's the thing: most local shops cost about the same nowadays. And most local shops don't have such a long wait, taste just as good (if not better), and have more than four flavors to choose from. Note that I waited about 15-20 min after ordering to get my ice cream. 

And besides, the guy making my ice cream wasn't wearing gloves, had ice cream mixture all over him, didn't seem to care much about how he was handling things, and the machine had ice cream mixture spilling everywhere on the sides. Maybe I'm just being nit-picky but I'd be lying if I didn't say that it decreased my appetite a little bit.  I used to work in an ice cream store so perhaps I notice these things more than most. 

If you're in the area, I'd say go for it if you want to try it at least once. The idea is there, just not the execution.
author: Precilla T.

description:
Love simple fresh made to order ice cream. My buddy, his daughter, and I had ice cream here after dinner. We were not disappointed with the service or taste. Little kids along with big kids have varying tastes and they were very accommodating to our taste. My buddy's girl wanted mint chip, and we were told since the mint is fresh the taste is pretty pronounced and could be too strong for kids. They even offer to let you select another flavor, how awesome is that? Very, if you ask me! I purposefully ordered vanilla knowing the little girl maybe not like the mint and swapped mine for hers.
Love simple fresh made to order ice cream. My buddy, his daughter, and I had ice cream here after dinner. We were not disappointed with the service or taste. Little kids along with big kids have varying tastes and they were very accommodating to our taste. My buddy's girl wanted mint chip, and we were told since the mint is fresh the taste is pretty pronounced and could be too strong for kids. They even offer to let you select another flavor, how awesome is that? Very, if you ask me! I purposefully ordered vanilla knowing the little girl maybe not like the mint and swapped mine for hers.
author: MoMo A.

description: Unique ice cream spot in the very cute Hayes Valley neighborhood. Had to try this shop that uses nitrogen to freeze its ice creams to order. Good flavor and very creamy texture. Sampled TCHO chocolate and rhubarb crisp. Both were good. But the texture is not quite the same as traditionally made ice cream. Prefer Bi-Rite, but this is a charming spot worth trying!
author: Linnet T.

description: This is the bougiest thing ever. You'll wait 20 minutes for a single scoop of ice cream that costs you an arm and a leg. And when you finally get it, you'll tell yourself that you liked it. I mean, there was that huge line, it's high quality ice cream, fresh ingredients, it's fresh and new and shiny. But you're lying to yourself because your love of ice cream comes from your childhood and no matter what you tell yourself, you don't actually like eating mint ice cream that tastes like you're literally eating mint leaves.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I'm not quite smitten, but I'm definitely a fan of a cute gimmick.  Maybe it is waiting 15-20 minutes in the sweltering sun that has addled my brains?  Yes, that is about how long I had to wait while I watched, order by order, the mechanical whirring of the "KELVIN" and billowing smoke from all of the liquid nitrogen, which gave me flashbacks of all of my undergraduate chemistry labs when I thought that I would blow up Dabney Hall on NCSU campus.  Those orders were all of the other ORDERS ahead of mine.

Is it worth the wait?  Well, for me, I must say yes.  I'm a fan of decadent and rich dessert.  I'm a bigger fan of CAKE, but ice cream on a nice summer-ish day in SF (or as close to summer-ish as it can get with a cool breeze in the shade), is an acceptable second runner up.  You can read other reviews that are more technical or focus on the concept, but I'm all about EMOTIONS and FEELINGS (I'm so emo), oh and gimmick.  I'm not an easy sell, but if you have something that is cute, I'll bite every time.

So, for me, this is what I loved:

-I loved the "new Old Fashion" idea.  
-I loved watching them make my ice cream to order.
-I loved seeing the liquid nitrogen and all of the smoke that reminded me of SF fog and chemistry experiments gone awry.
-I loved how people were just anxiously waiting (and there were a lot of people to people watch).
-I love that they were serving out of a trailer (Hey, I'm from the SOUTH, please...honey, trailer is right up my alley).
-I loved the creamy, uber richness of the TCHO CHOCOLATE.  
-I loved how this took me back, like a time-travel machine to my VERY FIRST TASTE of the flavor called "WORLD CLASS CHOCOLOATE" of Baskin ROBBINS in 1984 in Okinawa, Japan.  It tastes EXACTLY the same.
-I loved that I felt like a little kid again having her first scoop of ice cream.


What I didn't love so much:
-HOLY COW, it's one expensive scoop of ice cream.
-Where are the napkins, exactly?  I didn't see any  and I really needed them.
-There needs to be a bigger compost trash can for the bio-degradable ice-cream cups
-I understand that the cups are intended to be biodegradable, but my ice cream actually leaked through the cup...I guess it was BIODEGRADING as I was eating *hahaha*
- The ice cream melts as SOOOOOOON as they hand it to you, so take your photos quick kids or else it will end up being a lava flow of melted ice cream that, while edible, creates quite a mess.
-I had some type of coconut crunch praline mixed in...but it had no flavor of coconut...strange.

Good news is that even though I got LOTS and LOTS of melted ice cream on my brand new sundress yesterday, it came out easily with Shout handiwipes. *hahaha*...

I'll be back Smitten...maybe next time, I'll fall in love...
author: Hiromi N.

description: Fun place to get ice cream. I love how they would use the dry ice and make the ice Cream in front of you.  Ice cream price is most pricey compared to other supermarket ice cream. But love how it taste so good!!! Feels up my craving for something cold and sweet! Next time, if they still have the sweet corn with berries flavor available... i might go back for that!
author: Selina L.

description:
Creamy deliciousness! 

Doesn't get much better than watching your scoops of ice cream being made right in front of you. Due to the freshness, this ice cream has an amazing creamy texture that I love! 
They keep it simple with a few flavors to choose from. (make sure to add the cocoa nibs to your vanilla ice cream!) The couple of times I've been there, the customer service was great. I also really like the fact that there is a little park to enjoy your yummy ice cream and watch the dogs and kids run around :)
The reason for 4 stars and not 5; well, its just a touch to pricey I think (but worth going once in a while for sure), and also, one other ice cream place in the city is still number one in my heart :)
besides that, WELL DONE SMITTEN!
author: Sam C.

description:
LOVE LOVE the plum ice cream!  I also love the location as it's right by the park so I can eat ice cream with my dog!  

The ice cream here is made to order and it's really creamy.  They are anal about certain things (i.e., you can't combine two flavors in a cup or cone).  It is also pretty pricey, but I think it's worth it.
author: Melissa W.

description: Delicious ice cream made from scratch via a special liquid nitrogen process. I tried the vanilla and cinnamon apple crisp. I'm not exactly the biggest fan of ice cream or dessert in general, but I'll admit that this was quite good. They have a limited selection of flavors each day (around 4 I believe?) Not too much of a line when we went, but it was quite chilly that day so that could've played a part. The ice cream is  definitely a bit on the pricier side, but well worth a try.
author: Kevin N.

description: Liquid nitrogen ice-cream made fresh on the spot. Good service + awesome ice-cream and great if you have a dog. Can't beat that!
author: Christopher K.

description: Delicious ice cream. I love the chocolate ice cream with the spicy chocolate sauce topping :) Enjoy while walking down the park on Octavia.
author: Arezou K.

description: Good, but limited flavors. They do freeze the ice cream in front of you, which is pretty neat.
author: Rosie P.

description: Tasty but shit service. They fucked up my order, then wouldn't fix it with out requiring me to requeue and pay $1 to another guy working there.
author: Russell S.

description:
5 stars for the concept! who doesnt like to see their ice cream made on the spot!  

although the concept is awesome, they are very limited with what they can do because of how special the process is.  I must admit the ice cream itself was very creamy, but the taste however was too rice for my friends and i.  I got the mint chip... and im a HUGE mint chip fan but this was disgusting!... it tasted like mary jane... i swear to you.. but hey maybe my taste buds are off!

my gf got the chocolate with the brown sugar caramel, that itself was also rich

we also ordered the vanilla! THIS ladies and gentlemen was OFF THE HOOK! i must say id give 2 stars for the vanilla and 1 star for the concept! other than that ill save the drive to SF to see this happen for the 2nd or 3rd time!
author: Jorlyn W.

description: Very stingy. OMG! For .75 cents more per extra topping, they sure give very little of it. I don't get it!!! Inflation or plain stinginess! Seriously!
author: J C.

description: Creamiest and smoothest ice cream I have ever eaten! Having said that, my husband and I didn't care for the mint chocolate chip much - tasted like fresh mint leaves. It's much less sweet than mint chip we're used to having. I liked mine, the honey nectarine. Again, amazing texture, but I have to go for flavor so I'll still be at Bi-Rite! Also, it's much too pricey for me ($4.75 for 4oz & $6 for 6oz). Cute indoor/outdoor space (shop is housed in an old freight container) and there is a nice park adjacent to it where you can enjoy the ice cream!
author: Freckles H.

description:
Besides being expensive and sort of gimicky, the ice cream is quite good.

I've ordered several of the flavors and can't really pick a favorite. I tried the mint flavor one time, and it was super minty. In fact, it tastes almost like mint leaves, instead of the normal "mint" ice cream you might buy in a store. And it was bright green!

Because each order is done to order, there can be long lines and waits as they spend time to create each order.
author: C S.

description: Love their ice-cream! One of the smoothest ice-cream I've had, it was great! The first time I visited, their chocolate flavor machine broke down, so I went with the mint chocolate chip, wow! the mint really came through, it was a bit too minty for me but it was still very good! I came back the next day, the chocolate machine was working, it was amazing! I wish they have that in the DMV area!
author: T y.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place since I first read about it in SFgate.  Tried smitten this past Sunday.   Love the location, the vibe as well as the idea.  I had the chocolate and got to try the nectarine that my friends had.  

The verdict:  too much gimmick not enough focus on the flavors of the ice cream itself.  The consistency is definitely unique.  Something that can only be produced by the custom liquid nitrogen contraptions there.  The nectarine ice cream had a super smooth texture, but lacking in any full nectarine taste.  I was a little disappointed as I was told they had picked up the stone fruit from the farmers market that morning.  The nectarine was lost in the ice cream and the flavor a little bland.

The chocolate had a very creamy flavor and fudge like texture.  Took me for a bit of a surprised as I was expecting the ice cream to be super smooth or maybe light and airy.  The chocolate was definitely the better of the two.

I will give Smitten another try.  Texture is unique enough to come back, but the flavors don't wow me and were actually disappointing.  I'll come back and hope to try something that does wow me next time.
author: Steve O.

description: Every time I go here I am taken back at how amazing this place is!! I loved the chai flavor!  I love that they make the ice cream right in front of you!!
author: L D.

description: Really great ice cream! Chocolate was amazing. Very rich and creamy. Cute little post to stop in on a sunny day
author: Nicki M.

description: Don't mind waiting for ice cream this good. The mint is out of this world, and not laden with sugar. It's just right and the mint actually tastes like fresh mint, bless them! One of the gems of San Francisco.
author: Daniele E.

description:
Would I be the first to use their brand name as an adjective for my emotional reaction to their product?
Enjoyed the malted vanilla very much. Only knock is they wont let you combine two flavors, because the blueberry coconut is gonna force me to walk the block from my house to their pop up and that's not enough distance to help me meaningfully combat the side effects of frequent indulgences in their wonderous nitrogen enriched cream product.
yum. The lemon cookie waffle cone ain't such a bad deal for the extra 75 centavos neither.
author: c d.

description: Their ice cream was the consistency of soft serve except extremely fatty. It seems more an experience destination than a tasty one. Like Philz coffee, you're order is hand crafted just for you. But honestly, is the taste less important than the spectacle?
author: Josh O.

description: Salted caramel ice cream (made to order) is as legit as it comes!
author: Osito S.

description: Love their ice-cream! ..but only when I get it there; for some reason it doesn't taste as good when I've picked up various pints to go and then left them in the freezer at home.
author: Busy P.

description: Smitten offers an unusual approach to ice cream!  These liquid nitrogen frozen treats are smooth, delicious and the portion size is great!  Upon visiting this San Francisco hot spot, I tried both the sweet corn and vanilla flavors.  Both were delicious!
author: Megan B.

description: Best ice cream ever!! Love salted caramel :)
author: Erica R.

description: There was a point that I considered going vegan. Smitten makes me very happy I didn't follow through on that decision. It's a little unfair to review after only one taste (for me, moreso than for Smitten, because I really want to go back) but I don't live in SF. However, our trip to Smitten was a great part of a great visit. I had the mint chip, which was incredibly creamy, with real peppermint flavor, not an artificial one. The chocolate bits where a good, rich chocolate, frequent enough to enhance the flavor but not overpower it. The small was plenty for me to share with someone else. Very good service, and fun to watch your ice cream be made.
author: Amela R.

description:
Pros:
- ice cream texture is amazing. Almost silky, particularly since they upgraded their machines
- best cones I've ever had. Tastes like a shortbread cookie

Cons:
- the staff is a nightmare. Feels like they have a rotating cast of high school students. They take forever, do not exhibit any sort of professionalism, and are not very nice. 
- the flavor selection is not too creative, especially when compared with bi-rite et al
author: J H.

description: Happened to stumble on this place while exploring around SF. The ice cream is truly phenomenal! They make it then and there on the spot and it is really superb. Not icy at all, just the right amount of creaminess, and the flavors are really amazing too. Another plus is the unique building: it's essentially in an old storage container. I'll definitely be coming back here in the future!
author: Jane D.

description:
What a waste of time! 
Bad ice cream. Oh it's smooth for sure but tastes so bad. 
And I wish the operation ran as smooth as their ice cream is. Machines breaking down. No ice cream after a 45 min wait. 
What's the point. So not worth it. 
Go to BiRite creamery instead.
author: Shanaya M.

description: Definately a place to try out new ice cream flavor.  Very very creamy, interesting mix...the mint chip is pretty good.  We definately need more places like these to drown out the clones of corporate creamery...
author: Huy N.

description:
Finally got to try this place, and I thought it was delicious. I actually went here two days in a row! Took different people with me. My first visit I was able to have the TCHO dark chocolate with the candied jalapenos. I don't know exactly why they call it candied, because I expected it to be something covered in sugar and then baked. But it was just red and green jalapenos on top of the rich chocolate ice cream. It was still delicious, though. The ice cream definitely did my tongue right in this awesome spicy/cold combo. The second day I had the salted caramel, and that cocoa nib topping for it. It was delicious, too. 

I'll be trying more flavors soon that's for sure. It takes maybe about five minutes for them to make the ice cream courtesy of some fancy molecular gastronomy, and while it does come out pretty, it can melt pretty quick. I'd say the price isn't something to whine about, as they use some really good product and do all that fancy stuff with it.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Remember when you were 9 years old and your mom would take you to Baskin-Robbins for a good report card. You'd walk in and want to jump up and down with excitement over how many flavors there were...31.

Well, Smitten feels like that... but for grown-ups... though I do feel like jumping up and down with excitement when I go to Smitten. 

The ice-cream is made right there in front of you, one order at a time. The ingredients are fresh and tasty. The flavors have unusual combinations like spring herb or olive oil and lavender, which  actually has olive oil drizzled on top.
