I like that not all of their flavors are sweet. It definitely gives a different sensation to taste savory ice cream.
author: Russell Allen E.

description: I am not a sweet tooth person but certainly enjoy sweets occasionally! I had heard about this place before but never tried until now! It lives up to its expectations! Great location too! Using liquid nitrogen to prepare your ice cream is really cool to watch! The lines go fairy quick and its a pretty good serving!
author: Praful G.

description: It's definitely more for the experience to get in line and wait for an ice-cream wasting 30 mins of your life but it worths for this yummy, creamy, tcho chocolate sauce topped brown-sugar ice cream.
author: Beril Y.

description:
Pros:
They use liquid nitrogen to freeze your selected flavor of ice cream on the spot; Get an instant eReciept on your phone via text message; Good use of unimproved land in a very hip area.
author: Gabriel A.

description: More than 2 years later. They still haven't smoothed out the kinks. Gave my ice cream away to someone else as I waited and waited. When I asked, they did finally work on my order and gave me an extra scoop but I didn't even finish it and I NEVER throw away ice cream. Texture was awesome but flavor was awful. All I tasted was sugar. No flavor. No chocolate. Just sweet.
author: M C.

description:
Love the food stand idea!  My girlfriend & I tried all the flavors that day - Vanilla
Summer Herb (rosemary, thyme, basil, mint)
Salted Caramel

It was pretty pricey for what it is but the ice cream was uber creamy but melted way too quickly.  The Summer Herb was very refreshing, and unique but the other 2 were adequate.  Nothing special.  But who doesn't love ice cream!
author: Meredith K.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco. Well, it's up there of course. Never had this experience of fresh made ice cream made right in front of me. Yes, I said made. You have to come here to experience it to know what treat you are in for. They mix the cream in front of you, then freeze it in a cryogenic cauldron spewing out a cold San Francisco fog.  It's quite poetic... and reeeeaaaallly good!
author: Patrick W.

description:
Ah.maz.IN!!!!  I had the tcho chocolate  which was rich chocolate creamy flavored ice cream. Even though weather was chilly and drizzling the chocolate ice cream does an perfect job of lifting your moods to enjoy the chills.  
The technique of have it made fresh and freezing it with liquid nitrogen is to eliminate the crystallization of the ice cream. This is absolutely the reason why its creamy and perfect. 
To those of you who have to try its worth it all!!
author: sheetal t.

description: This place is awesome! Hands down the best ice-cream I've ever had! The frequently change the flavors, they all taste very natural (the mint one especially has a really strong minty taste) and the whole liquid nitrogen thing is fun to watch.
author: Mircea P.

description:
Yay I'm a fan is correct! Rituals Coffee ice cream in a kiddie cup. 

Yummers. I just wanna say "Thank you! Come again!"
author: Kelly C.

description: I don't like ice cream (prefer gelato), but the salted caramel makes me overcome my bigotry towards the overrated dessert.
author: April M.

description: Holy organic cow!  Just had the salted caramel with cinnamon gingerbread, whipped cream and chocolate syrup. The crunch of the bread with the ice crystal-less ice cream topped with fresh whipped cream made for the perfect bite. Props Smitten. You made my TGIF!
author: yosup j.

description:
Fresh ice cream made on the spot in kelvin machines? AWESOME!!!!

Flavors change weekly but vanilla and chocolate is always available. Check on the website for their other flavors. Still have not tried them all.

Now if only the parking option is better and there was a warm spot for me to sit and actually enjoy the ice team.. Then it would be perfect and I'd be getting pig shaped eating there weekly.
author: A. Z.

description:
Evil little ice cream shop within walking distance from my apartment.  All of the flavors that I have had were amazing - especially the peanut butter.  SO GOOD.  I love that their flavors change each week, and also love that their portion sizes are not enormous.  Only 4 starts out of 5 as $6 is a little pricey for the small size ice cream (I'd rather it be cheaper than larger).  

This place is fantastic.
author: Allison M.

description: The 'ice cream' tastes like a fast food shake.  Paying with Paypal made the purchase $5 off, awesome.
author: Alf O.

description:
ice cream made fresh right in front you, yes please. limited choices so i dont spend forever deciding, yes please. and fresh waffle cones that smell heavenly coming out right as it's your turn, yes please. 

creamy, delicious ice cream made with premium ingredients. we really enjoyed the mint choc chip and the strawberry with white balsamic vinegar. 

only downsides i saw were some issues with one of the ice cream makers which made for increased wait times. and we got one flavor a good 10 minutes before the other which was a bit awkward. would be better if they could coordinate how orders come out so that groups can eat their ice cream together.
author: Christina H.

description: Bi-Rite who?  Smitten is the best ice cream in the city.  So creamy and made to order.  Doesn't get any better.
author: Caitlyn M.

description:
the day was perfect... just listened to some Mozart over at Davies, downed some burgers and had absolutely no room for any more yummy in the tummy... but wait that didn't stop me from standing in line for smitten. The day was perfect for ice-cream and had been wanting to trying this ice cream for a while now, and even more after I read that they converted their truck into a store.

Tried the tchao chocolate (i felt like i ate melted chocolate!) and the vanilla with cocoa praline nibbles (husband likes the crunch factor). It took a while to stand in line and get the icrecream, but its absolutely yummy.

They are still a small shop, so one has to forgive the time it takes and the lack of selection (just 4 flavors at a time) and the cost. But they are just starting guys, so give them a chance (also expensive at $4.75 for the second size (small))

Definitely try and bring your patience!
author: Sapna E.

description: Seriously overrated. Smitten is marketed as fresh and made to order. I ordered the seasonal strawberry, made with organic local berries. The flavor was disappointingly flat, like it was made with diluted strawberry juice rather than chunks of real berries. Liquid nitrogen allows the ice cream to be frozen when you order, but this feels like a total gimmick. There is no slow-churned, creamy mouth feel that you would expect from fresh ice cream. For $6/scoop and $11/pint, you're better off with the myriad amazing ice cream spots around town, like Bi-Rite Creamery, Humphrey Slocombe, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, Mitchell's, Three Twins ... hell, even a trip across the street to Mollie Stone's for a prepackaged pint would be better.
author: H N.

description:
I would have given it 4 stars, but too expensive for the little amount they give you.  If your in Hayes Valley, worth a stop, but if you have the time go to Bi-Rite Creamery in Mission Dolores.  More ice cream, cheaper and you can taste ALL you want!  And the employees are more friendly to talk and look at :]

Isn't tasting part of the experience?!

Okay so that's the lame part of Smitten.

The good, but annoying part:  lemon verbena (the guy corrected our pronounciation of "ver-beeeena"), vanilla malt, tcho chocolate, and spring herb.

The salted caramel was too rich for most of us.

And really.  No tastings?!
author: Nich B.

description:
I loved Smitten. The environment, the service, the neighborhood, and, yes, the ice cream was delish. I got mint chocolate chip with meyer lemon caramel on top. It's $4.75 for a small cup, but considering the novelty of the place (they freeze the ice cream right in front of you with liquid nitrogen) I didn't feel like I was wasting money. Which is good, because if I'm going to splurge it better be worth it. My review could also be influenced by the fact that this was my first visit to Hayes Valley (where have you been all my life, Hayes?) and I felt like I was walking on a cloud, but I usually hate ice cream so I think that balances out my Hayes Valley infatuation. There are only 4 flavors, and they rotate frequently, so you can't get bored! Ahh, when good food meets good business strategy, I fall in love. 

And I wanted to lose 5 lbs. Oh well.

PS- order to go, it'll save you money :)
author: Shireen S.

description: The best ice cream I have ever tasted.  The texture is so smooth.  Flavor i had was balsamic and strawberry.  So good.  I live in Vegas and was passing through San Fran and went here on a recommendation of a friend.  I will be back next time I am in SF.
author: Randy B.

description:
Updated review:

In response to my review I was contacted by Smitten's management, they apologized for my experience.  I thought this amount of care for a business warranted a second try (especially since my prior Smitten experiences were so good).   So tonight I tried Smitten's vanilla ice cream and it was magical once again - creamy with a wonderful soft texture.  They also had a really nice creme fraiche with pear carmel that my husband tried.  All in all it renewed my excitment for this cute little ice cream spot.
author: Danielle B.

description: Went after dinner on a Saturday night and waited in a pretty long line. The ice cream was really good, of course, but perhaps not quite worth the hype. For one thing, I wish there were more flavors. We had to choose between vanilla or salted caramel, as they ran out of the third option while we were standing in line. I got vanilla ice cream with caramel sauce and whipped cream. It was yummy, but like I said, nothing to go out of your way for. That being said, I am not a huge dessert person. I get much more excited about steak or sushi.
author: Shannon K.

description: Pretty much my favorite ice cream spot right now and there are so many creameries in SF too (Mitchells, Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe...)! I love that they make each cup fresh for you. The cream here is extra smooth and rich. My favorite is the unique and creative flavors and toppings. I loooved the rosemary/basil/mint flavor they had a few months ago!
author: Aleyna S.

description: Smitten is the World's Greatest Ice Cream. Period. To the point. It's the best. Homemade gelato in Italy (although not technically ice cream) is fantastic. Bi-Rite in nearby Mission is great, too. But Smitten is on a different level altogether. It's not just that it's cool (a converted container near a park in hip Hayes Valley) or that it's trendy (lines will be long), it's that it is THAT good. I get the Salted Caramel with Tcho chocolate sauce. I get the small. And when you first get it, you may think you got ripped off paying $5 for such a tiny little ice cream. But once you take your first taste... you'll know why Smitten is the World's Greatest Ice Cream. If you like various topics or multiple flavors... this ain't the place for you. It's kind of like the In N Out (although not fast) of ice cream. But what they lack for options, they make up for in FLAVOR. And isn't that what it's all about?
author: Phil N.

description: WOW so good!  Tried the mint ice cream and was very impressed!  Yeah, the liquid nitrogen part was cool, but the end product delivers!  It was especially delicious with an iced americano from Blue Bottle!
author: Christopher L.

description: Fantastic creamy ice cream made to order. And a really cute location too (made out of an old box car). If you're in the area I'd highly recommend stopping by for a bite. Only marked it as four stars because of the price, although I can't imagine liquid nitrogen (part of the super freezing process) is super cheap. Plus it's San Francisco. Best ice cream I had there
author: Ellen K.

description: It was my first time here. I got a regular chocolate ice cream with caramel + brown sugar. The ice cream is soooo smooth and creamy. It's PERFECT!! Although I don't really like food that is overly sweet, I was completely OK with how sweet this was. SUPER good. I will come back again!
author: Emily L.

description:
Ok, so I'm easily influenced. Brought here by brother and sister-in-law, who raved about their ice cream. It's made to order, limited flavors, nicest service, and an experience for the kids. We tried these flavors:

vanilla WITH the cocoa crispies-by far everyone's favorite

rhubarb crisp-tried to trick my son into thinking it was strawberry b/c they didn't have strawberry, it was too tart for him, he couldn't finish his little scoop and wanted our vanilla 

chocolate-very nice, very chocolate-y

there was one more that we tried but I can't remember--butter pecan? good, not as amazing as the vanilla

so, why one less star? it's very expensive for that little scoop and my son's distaste for the rhubarb

but..we'll definitely be back!
author: Christine S.

description: Cool concept and back story. I love soft serve ice cream and had my doubts about the liquid nitrogen. Lucky for me, I like to try new things so I gave it a shot and I loved it. This kitten is Smitten lol YUMMY!
author: Crystal G.

description: Smitten isn't the first instant ice cream parlor I've tried but it certainly is the best! The Salted Caramel ice cream with TCHO chocolate sauce lives up to all of the hype! The Earl Grey ice cream is delicious. It's like a tea slushie with chocolate chips...if that existed.  The location right in the heart of Hayes Valley shopping with a great patio and next to a playground makes Smitten an ideal place to go. We went on a chilly day and were relieved to be able to purchase hot cider while we waited. Each of the liquid nitrogen ice cream makers runs in full view of the customers so you get to watch your ice cream being made. All of this is set up in an old shipping container. The ice cream is delicious, made even better by the unique location.
author: Kari G.

description: Loved this for its ideal ice cream texture -- somewhere between soft serve and hand-packed ice cream. My apple crisp ice cream was tasty, though a tad sweet, and the waffle cone looked prettier than it tasted, but overall very satisfied. My only complaint is that I wasn't immediately drawn to the 3 other available flavors, and so fell to this one by default. Good thing I liked it.
author: J C.

description: This place is definitely consistent with their ice cream :) Smitten has become an essential pit stop every time I visit San Francisco. Tried the vanilla and rhubarb crisp this time around and I haven't been disappointed yet. The vanilla was rich and creamy and the rhubarb had a tart taste to it. The taste of rhubarb was very unique and I love the addition of graham crackers (hence the crisp). Although it's a little pricey for ice cream, the quality of it never disappoints!
author: Monica L.

description: My Favorite Ice Cream! So far nothing I've tried beats them. I love all their flavors. Vanilla...Blood Orange with Pistachio... my gosh, I wish I live next to it (actually no, then ill gain so much weight). They change their flavors all the time though.
author: Lucy L.

description:
Two of my friends and I came here on Friday.  It was windy and a little cold, but I was intrigued because they made ice cream with liquid nitrogen.  

If you don't know what liquid nitrogen is, it turns to gas instantly when it touches something warm.  

Back to the ice cream.  I got a lemon verbena which has some interesting flavors.  It tastes like chinese ginger egg custard.  Overall, it is a cool experience enjoying fresh ice cream on Hayes.
author: Ernesto F.

description: Gotta give this place more love!  I never get chocolate ice cream from anywhere but here.  Tcho chocolate is bomb.com and the consistency of the ice cream is SOOOO  creamy thanks to liquid nitrogen.  You really can't go wrong with the classic flavors here because they do 'em right.  When you're feeling daring, try some of their other specials!  Their fresh mint chocolate chip is really interesting and refreshing.  The honey nectarine has real chunks of nectarine and they aren't skimpy about it either!  DELICIOUS!
author: Anna T.

description: After eating a cupcake from Miette, we couldn't help but notice the cute little ice cream shop.  Even though we already had our dessert, we couldn't pass up on a unique and made-to-order ice cream place.  The flavors for the day was Vanilla, Fresh Mint Chip and Strawberry White Balsamic.  My friend ordered the Fresh Mint Chip which was very minty (so you have to love mint) and I ordered the Strawberry White Balsamic.  I absolutely loved mine.  It was a little weird on the first bite but as I continued to eat it, it got better and better.  Would I go back? Definitely!
author: Sonya C.

description:
Ice cream fun in Hayes Valley!  This new ice cream shop has four appealing flavors that are made to order and churned using liquid nitrogen.  It's cool to see it being made in front of you as you wait.  

Check it out!
author: R L.

description:
The ravishing Robyn Sue of Smitten Ice Cream graciously thanked me for my Yelp of her business & offered me a free scoop, which I took her up on at her Precita Park Mobile Food Roundup the other day. This gesture demonstrated to me her sincere appreciation of her customers & that she's forward-looking as a business person. Kudos again to you, Roby
n! 

Santa's Yelper sez, Nothing. He's busy devouring his yummy Malted Vanilla w/ Cocoa Nib Praline Smitten Ice Cream.
author: Tadashi Y.

description: I'm not a big fan of ice cream but I have to say this one is really tasty!! And the concept is great, changes from th usual :)
author: Charlotte D.

description:
It is my personal quest to try every awesome ice cream place in the city (and everything on the 7x7 list but that one is a little harder to come by). I thoroughly enjoyed my ice cream eating experience here, but with some definite qualms.

Good things:
- Creme fraiche with pear caramel and tcho nibs: Their seasonal flavor, this was SO great. I've had creme fraiche before that tastes overly sour, but the cashier described it perfectly when he said that this tasted like a light cheesecake. The pear caramel was a perfect pairing, though I can't really say the same about the tcho nibs (don't pay the extra 75 cents for it; they just end up falling off your cone...)
- Super helpful and friendly staff in a super cute place: My friend and I actually walked past this place without seeing it (well, also because we were on the other side of the street. Oops). It's like a tiny little DIY warehouse and the atmosphere inside feels super cozy. It'd be a perfect place to go with another person to catch up :)

Not so good things:
- Handmade cones: I love love love waffle cones, but theirs really doesn't do it for me. It's another 75 cents on top of an already pricey ice cream and the worst part is the texture. It's so soft that the ice cream melts through. Actually, the worst part is the hole at the bottom of the cone, which is really quite unpleasant when your $6 ice cream starts disappearing through it.
- Lack of options: A common theme in what I consider my fave ice cream places are variety. That doesn't exist here because the ice cream is made individually, which seems pretty neat but I honestly cannot taste that much of a difference. There are only 4 flavors at a time that you cannot taste before buying, so you kind of have to go blindly at this and trust that you're getting something good.
- $$: The smallest size starts at $4.75 and even though they say that it's two scoops, it's technically the size of one scoop. Pricey ice cream that should definitely be reserved for special occasions :(

Despite my drippy mess of a cone and the fact that I can get 6 ice creams at Rite Aid for the price of one at Smitten, I'd still return to try all their other flavors. They know how to make good ice cream here and that's the truth.
author: Shira C.

description:
there was a long line on a saturday,
but i think it was worth a visit as its my first time to smittens.

i had the salted caramel + the monthly flavor - brown sugar squash,
hmm both of them are not bad, but i actually expected something yummier than this!
author: Miffy L.

description:
I was excited to try Smitten ice cream after all the hype. Tried the mint flavour, which I was told would be "herbal" as opposed to "mint extract-y". Sadly the herbal-ness overpowered any flavour and it tasted like eating mint straight from the planter box. The aftertaste was disappointing, too - the texture is way too creamy and flat in flavour.

The liquid nitrogen ice cream maker gimmick was still cool, and so was paying with Square! Would come back and try another flavour.
author: Lan Y.

description: Pretty good. Closest nitro ice cream place to me so it's a good fix but if you ever get a chance to go to Chin Chin Labs in Camdentown London it's the best ice cream you will ever have in your life.
author: Tati F.

description: This ice cream is fresh, like freakishly fresh; the mint in my mint chocolate chip tasted like I had just picked it from my parents' backyard.  They make each serving after you order it and usually seem to have about 4 flavors at a time.  Cute, kitschy and very SF, which also means it's not that cheap. I think for most normal people the smallest scoop is best, I got the regular and it was a little too much but it is delicious.
author: Madeline W.

description:
Great concept! It is a real darling outdoor joint.
The service was fast and I didn't have to wait in line much at all. The ice cream flavors were a set of about four to choose from, all which were quite rich and creamy. I wouldn't say it's the best ice cream out there but if you're in the neighborhood and you want some no nonsense simple ice cream, this is the place to go.
author: Anna J.

description:
I heard a lot about this place and end up passing by it all the time, so I was excited when my bf ended up taking me here one day! However I guess the hype raised my expectations a bit because I thought the ice cream here was just ok. 

We got the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread and the TCHO chocolate. First of all, we got the kiddie sizes for both and its $3.25 for one small scoop... a very small scoop. However, that one small scoop does pack a punch in terms of flavor. The brown sugar was deeeeelicious, with the shortbread adding a wonderful crunch. I'm not really a fan of chocolate ice cream, but the TCHO they served here was super intensely flavorful and just really satisfying overall. 

I suppose the novelty of this place is that the ice cream is made to order using liquid nitrogen... but we ended up having to wait a pretty long time for our orders because of this. Not only that, you can't sample flavors. For me, I'd probably say the price isn't worth it because they give you so little and the whole liquid nitrogen process doesn't necessarily add to the ice cream in any way (IMHO). I'd probably come here again, but it's definitely not my regular ice cream spot.
author: Janey L.

description:
I really enjoyed the experience.  Loved the salted caramel flavor - perfect sweet/salt mix.  Consistency was super smooth, and it made my tongue tingle (in a good way).  The person taking orders was very chipper, and the line wasn't too long.  I enjoyed watching the process and just taking time out a busy day to relax.  

I've seen a lot of comments about the line and the price, but this is made to order stuff, perfect for a summer day when you want to hang out in a fun part of town and soak in the atmosphere.  I'm not glorifying waiting, but is 15 minutes of chilling out really that painful?  And if so, perhaps we all need to slow down a bit.
author: Jen C.

description: We saw this place featured on a TV show and we added it to our place to visit in Feb 2014 (from Montreal, Canada).  We ordered the chocolate.  Very cool that we got to see it made in front of us... but within minutes of eating it, my boyfriend and I became violently ill.  We immediately vomit. Apparently, this could be a reaction when liquid nitrogen is not handled properly during food preparation.  My boyfriend and I have emailed the company just to advise them that this happened.... but no acknowledgement reply since February.  My review is not that we received bad service at the store or that it wasn't tasty to begin with or that it wasn't a cool place to visit or that we don't recommend it.  I am just turned off that nobody acknowledged us... they don't have to go into explanations or be defensive.. Just a simple "oh, I'm sorry to hear that" would have been nice.
author: Kat Z.

description:
Just tried smitten ice cream last night. The rhubarb crisp was awesome, not too sweet and very balanced.

I live right by, so I can have some after dinner but the line would totally discourage me during weekends ..

It's great to have a ice cream shop like that in the neighborhood, keep it up smitten ice cream!
author: Matthieu T.

description:
Tasty tcho chocolate ice cream. The line was long, and honestly, the workers weren't overly friendly (especially consdering the whole process is confusing). One woman asked a question because she hadn't received her order yet, and the employee barked, "I'm ONLY manning the chocolate machine--you have to go over there to get yours." 

But the delicously smooth ice cream made up for it. I would just think if they're doing something very out of the ordinary, they should remember people are confused, and some really nice instructions might help.
author: K. D.

description: Incredibly smooth ice cream -- that's the point, since they make your scoop to order and no ice crystals form.  I enjoy that they list each ingredient in each flavor, and that list is short.  I was especially impressed by their mint chip.  I only enjoy mint chip when it tastes like actual mint, not the fake mint flavoring like in gallons you buy at the grocery store.  This mint chip is right on the nose.  I'd appreciate some more creative flavors, but the way they do the originals is so good.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Smitten has gotten me smitten for some more of their ice cream! I tried the bay leaf ice cream and I was not prepared to see that they poured the liquid into their machine and cool smoke came out and voila, ice cream! The texture of ice cream made this place different from the rest that I have tried. It was creamier and lighter.
author: Shirley W.

description: The ice cream is probably 4 stars, but the value is lower because of Smitten's gimmick -- preparing ice cream while you watch -- resulting in high prices, low flavor variety, long wait times, and lower quality (IMO slow churned ice cream has smoother texture than the flash-freeze process employed here).
author: Rick F.

description:
First time here on a Saturday night. Parking is difficult to find, even at night around 9pm. Come early if you can. The wait can be a bit long, roughly 10-15 minutes for all ice cream(5 cups) to be made.

Was a bit disappointed that there were only two flavors to choose from: vanilla and green tea. 

Chose green tea, and tried some vanilla.
-love how the green tea is so strong, it's literally drinking thick green tea; too salty that night as said by my friends, maybe thats why the green tea was SO strong?
-the vanilla was DELICIOUS! perfect sweetness, tasted very authentic!

love how the flavors are super organic! Ingredients are literally 6-7 things and mixed in the ice cream machine! No artificial flavors whatsoever!

Might come back when there are more flavors available, like the salted caramel, or chocolate!
author: Judy L.

description:
Although the flavor was very intense, I did not care for the consistency or the 25 minute wait for this very expensive treat. This is taking 'Slow" food to the extreme. (2 stars for this review)

OK, so I went back to try the ice cream on a much less crowded day (and hour).  The reason being that I had out of town guests and we happened to be in the area. The density was much smoother this time. The flavor (Brown Sugar) was a better choice (than Green Tea the 1st time). But, it's still slow and expensive.
author: Tracy F.

description: I wasn't all that smitten with Smitten.  I had heard so much hype about this place and when I got into the long queue one Sat afternoon I thought I'd really be wowed.  I waited 45minutes and they were out of cones and mint chocolate chip when I got to the counter.  I ended up with the creme fraiche with pear caramel which was good but not mind blowing.  It was overly sweet and I wished I just settled for the small vs. the large.  After a few bites I had a headache.  It is kinda cool that they make each batch with liquid nitrogen per order so if you're into all that molecular gastronamy hooplah...
author: Lilli C.

description:
ambiance//****
what a fun concept...reinvent an abandoned container to serve ice cream?!

service//****
the people are nice + what fun to watch them explain the kelvinista as they make your ice cream

ice cream//****
freshest ingredients mean limited flavor selection
upside: it changes daily~

what sets smitten apart is the silky smoothness of the ice cream
it's like gelato consistency!! 
do you KNOW how hard it is to get it like that?! i do because i make my own ice cream ;p

~*~
it's expensive...until you find out 2 scoops come in in a small!
*think* of it as a scientific investment...
+ your taste palate will thank you~
author: Donna S.

description: Ceylon chocolate is the bomb!  Try it with whipped cream- I was in heaven
author: Taska S.

description: Smitten is my new found love. The first time I went they had JUST closed which was a bummer but the worker was so sweet that he gave me an ice cream scoop from the freezer. He had saved it for himself but he gave it to me anyway because he didn't want me to leave empty handed. Such a sweet gesture! I've been there 2 times since and I'm a smitten fan for life. My fave is the chocolate and the cones are a MUST have!
author: Katrina D.

description:
I tried the mint Tcho chip and although it was very good, it's not the best ice cream I ever ate, and for the price, that's what I was expecting.  A tiny kiddie scoop for $3.  I think it's kind of a gimmick.

I might try it again if I was already in the neighborhood but if I'm going to drive somewhere for ice cream I prefer Bi-Rite.
author: Madeline M.

description: This ice cream was incredible. I had the chocolate with spicy syrup...I died. Only then came back for the sole purpose of eating more Smitten ice cream. You won't regret coming here.
author: Shane T.

description: What a cool concept, who would have ever though of making ice cream using liquid nitrogen! What started as a little cart is now a kiosk with a continuous line. Order up and they'll make it fresh right in front of you, eat fast though because it seems to melt fast! I got the salted caramel on a freshly made waffle cone...delish! I tried some of my friends' who got the Earl Grey and Vanilla, both unique in it's own way. A must stop on a beautiful day, or on a brave cold day to check out how it's made.
author: Karen L.

description:
This place has a cool gimmick going, but really their ice cream has the texture of cold pudding. I have a suspicion that you might get something similar if you stick a SnackPack in the freezer for a half hour...
They do use quality ingredients, so the flavors are great (I tried vanilla and TCHO chocolate), but this is not for serious ice cream lovers. Liquid nitrogen just doesn't deliver real ice cream texture.

By all means try this place once or twice (as I did), but for real San Francisco ice cream go to Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Three Twins, Mitchell's or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous. Clearly there are much better (and cheaper) options for ice cream.

ps. For all you chocolate ice cream lovers, just go get a pint of Haagen-Daz Five in the milk chocolate flavor. It is hands down the most perfect chocolate ice cream in flavor and texture.
author: amber c.

description: Innovative idea!  I enjoyed watching the process and appreciate their use of natural ingredients but that's about it.  I got the nectarine flavor on homemade waffle cone.  The flavor was good but ice cream was too soft for my liking.  The waffle cone was a disappointment.  It was too thick and lacked flavor.  My date had the vanilla flavor with caramel sauce.  It tasted like Dryers vanilla ice cream but at 3x the price tag.  They were also stingy with the caramel sauce.  Overall, not worth paying $4.75 + $1 (cone) for a single scoop and $5.75 + $1 (caramel sauce) for the regular size in a bowl.
author: Angie N.

description: Concept is great.  I like that they make all of the ice cream on site.  It seemed like the line stayed consistent but moved pretty fast.  Service and ice cream were pretty good.  I love the cinammon short bread. Kind of pricey but still delicious.
author: Randall T.

description: Heard about this place time and time again from my daughter but never had the chance to go try until today. After having fabulous brunch at Samovar just 2 blocks away, we walked over to get a scoop. The flavors of the day were Tcho Chocolate, Classic Vanilla, Earl Grey w/ chocolate chip and ... Forgot what the last one but I had trouble choosing between Tcho choco or Earl Grey... But I eventually chose Earl Grey w/ chocolate chips. It was heavenly. It's amazing to watch the process of making the ice cream with nitrogen right in front of me. Must return to try different flavors in the future.
author: Ada L.

description:
Tried their Salty Caramel as well as Rhubarb Crisp. I admit, their concept of making small batches is unique and  great. You get to eat freshly made ice cream thus there is a long wait. You can tell they use good quality ingredients. 

As for the flavors, I wanted to taste a bit more salt with salty caramel. The caramel flavor was too strong and bit too sweet. I don't know why they came up with Rhubarb idea because I thought it tasted like salad - just not working. It may sound like such a common idea, but it would probably have tasted better if they mixed it with strawberry. 

People who work there are polite and nice though. They definitely have a great concept. I just wish it was executed a bit better.
author: Cupie M.

description:
YUM YUM YUM.

I ordered the salted caramel single, in a cone.  You have have some skilz to eat this thing so that it doesn't melt out the bottom (I'd recommend a cup unless you really plan on using napkins in plenty or paying attention closely), but the ice cream flavor is absolute ambrosia.  Love to watch the process too--the beaters be frozen, yo.  Yes, it's not cheap, but I personally think it's worth it.
author: Jo S.

description:
The philosophy behind Smitten's is to create ice cream on the spot with the freshest ingredients possible. Their method is unique among other ice cream shops. However, in my opinion, it's just a clever gimmick. The super fresh ice cream is really not noticeably different from fresh ice cream that was made a day or two ago. 

The ice cream is certainly very creamy and smooth. It melts quickly because it's more of a consistency like gelato or thicker soft serve instead of hard-packed ice cream.

Smitten's offers several flavor bases and topping to add on. I personally prefer bolder, interesting flavors with chunks already mixed in. But the chocolate ice cream is excellent in taste because they use high quality chocolate / cocoa. 

If you like ice cream, it's definitely worth checking out once. I would go back if I wanted to try a seasonal flavor that peaked my curiosity (strawberry with white balsamic).
author: June K.

description:
Went tonight to show my friends from out of town how amazing Smitten was for ice cream! I was mortified at how rude the employees treated us. Maya was absolutely the most horrific employee I've ever come across. She literally gave not only us but the customers in front of us major attitude over things that were THEIR mistake. 
When we asked for an extra spoon she acted as if we had asked her to make some bizarre request. 
Really yummy ice cream however the employees were obnoxious hipsters with terrible hair.
author: Adriana S.

description: Mediocre ice cream at best. Way too hyped. Vanilla was alright. Salted Caramel was too damn sweet. Small portions. Save your cash. Go to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous get the Sweet Cream or Pink Squirrel.
author: Hyuk L.

description: If you order two cones at the same time, why should they arrive ten minutes apart?!? Riddle me that, SMITTEN! We waited 20 minutes just to order, waited another 20 minutes for cone #1, then another 10 minutes for cone #2. Paid $15. Was thoroughly unimpressed by the service and product. And it's not as if they didn't have any help, I counted 8 different employees working behind the counter on a Sunday afternoon, who knows how many others there are working to deliver a 30 minute ice cream cone. I will not be back. But if this is the experience you expect from a "humble independent ice cream vendor" then by all means get at them.
author: Brandon H.

description: This is probably one of the best ice cream scoops I have ever had. I tried the fresh mint chip, which tasted like an actual mint leaf and was very refreshing on a warm day. I ordered it in a cone, which I was expecting to be a standard sugar cone, but instead was the most delicious ice cream cone I have ever tasted. It was buttery and flaky and paired so well with the creamy scoops. I recommend this to anyone who enjoys ice cream!!!
author: Hillary W.

description:
On a rare day of sunshine in SF, how can any ice cream be bad?

When the mint chip ice cream tastes like cilantro and strawberry tastes just like strawberry yogurt, it's not bad, we just weren't smitten.  

Add 15 minute wait and only 1 flavor per cone/cup (which I'm sure they have a very good reason to enforce this rule, but nonetheless, super annoying to me as customer), we'd opt for Ben & Jerry at local Safeway.
author: daphne w.

description:
Even though it was really cold, there were lots of people.
They made a mistake for us when my bf's ice cream didn't come out until I had finished mine. ( they gave us credit for next time) 
I got the fresh mint chocolate chip which was really creamy and fresh. 
My bf got the vanilla flavor which was really soft and creamy. 
They do not put  any chemical, so I think this is good for your kids.
Even after the ice cream had melted in my cup I could tell its high quality was from its thickness.
author: SS K.

description: BEST SALTED CARAMEL ICE CREAM! I love love love this place. Its a tiny little booth tucked away in the Hayes Valley. The ice cream is made right in front of you and you can customize your toppings. If you haven't figured it out yet, my favorite flavor of theirs is salted caramel! Nothing comes close to this yumminess. Love this place. It's a definite plus that Blue Bottle Coffee is just a few steps away!
author: Karina A.

description:
I was so looking forward to try the made to order ice cream. I tried the green tea. it was way too sweet. it was i want to throw it away sweet. And i love sugar.  It has very  good  creaminess but there was lumps like they forget to strain the custard before pouring into the ice cream maker. Maybe I had a bad batch. I will go back to try again. Begs the question why have made to order ice cream but cant custom make the taste. 
Does freshness matter when it comes to icecream?
author: Cokeaholix X.

description: Nice little outdoor stand for ice cream right across the street from the Biergarten.  They offer just a few flavors each day and is made to order right in front of you.  They use liquid nitrogen to freeze it instantly.  They offer interesting seasonal flavors such as earl grey with milk chocolate chips or blood orange with pistachio shortbread.  The ice cream really is good and it's pretty cool to watch as they make it.
author: Charlene P.

description: Had the chance to drop by Smitten today. Great location by the park. Met some entertaining people and had the Salted Carmel Ice Cream. My wife stood in line while I played stroller duty with the kids so I missed seeing the ice cream being made. Overall the ice cream was super creamy and I had the small cup and it was more then enough. So good and I really enjoyed it.
author: Matt S.

description:
A science experiment with average results. Those machines that they use to freeze the ice cream is definitely cool to watch. They look like high tech Kitchen Aid mixers. The ice cream is definitely made to order. On the afternoon I went, they offered Salted Caramel, Vanilla and an odd flavor (tart tasting root with crisp). I got the salted caramel the adult size ($5) for 2 scoops. Expensive. The mix of the ice cream is way too sweet. It was sweet on its way down my throat to my stomach. I had to drink a pint of water to wash the sugar from my mouth. I like the texture of the ice cream ~ very creamy. Very good to try once but I wouldn't go back until I knew for sure the mix has changed. 

This place is definitely cool - it's housed in a booth. They are pretty organized. You order and they write it on a post-it and you can watch as they mix the ice cream. Then they call you to pick up and it's a quick process. The wait is the mixing of the ice cream. I got mine in a cup since it was a warm day and my ice cream was melting right when I got it.
author: Candace F.

description: Very unique flavors. I my favorite flavors are the Elvis and secret breakfast. The Thai coconut lime was delicious and the vietnamese coffee flavor was good, but nothing special. $4 for one scoop and $6 for two scoops.
author: Dorothy T.

description: First time here I got the salted caramel and it was amazing. Boyfriend got one of the vegan fudge bars they had. I had a bite of his and it tasted just like fudge. Sooooo good. We will be back
author: Rachel W.

description: Not my favorite, but pretty damn good. Some of the rotated flavors are better than others. It's great that you can grab your ice cream and then head over to the park and eat. I consistently come back here so that's a good sign.
author: Ken L.

description: BEST ICE CREAM SHOP EVER! First of all, Smitten is located in Hayes Valley, a cute little area a few blocks from Alamo Square. Secondly, the ice cream shop is not a full-on place--it almost looks like a tent with glass on the sides. Smitten makes the ice cream right in front of you, so you know it has to be good. The only downside to this place is there are only a few flavors, but that is because they make it on the spot. Smitten can get crowded, so be patient, but it is definitely worth the wait! The chocolate flavor is very rich and delicious, that is my favorite flavor from there. This place is a must-visit for out-of-towners of locals looking for authentic tasting ice cream!
author: Cristina N.

description:
Drove up to San Francisco yesterday (from Cupertino) just to try Smitten ice cream. I was not disappointed.

I got a regular chocolate cone, and this had to be some of the best chocolate ice cream I've ever had. I don't know, maybe you're not really into chocolate. I am. Even the really good ice cream you can buy at the grocery (and there's not much of it) makes chocolate that's so bland you have to wonder if the manufacturers even care about flavor anymore.

But Smitten chocolate tastes like chocolate. It's so rich, even my worn-out old taste buds can get the message. It's so good, it actually tasted worth the effort of waiting in line for half an hour.

Maybe you just eat ice cream for toppings (which Smitten has, but I didn't try), maybe you're deeply into grocery store ice cream's guar gum and polysorbate 60 (which Smitten does NOT have), and maybe you prefer cute ice cream parlor decor (Smitten works out of a cargo container). But I just want the best-tasting ice cream I can get, and Smitten delivered.
author: Brian S.

description:
I finally got around to stopping by yesterday evening excited to try this place. Unfortunately, while waiting for our orders we were told that they had run out of nitrogen. Talk about a booming business!

A lot of times you can tell the calliber of a place by how they handle surprises. The cashier was on the phone with someone and was quickly authorized to either refund our money or offer us the pre-made ice cream sandwiches in lieu of our original orders. 

The employees were super nice and apologetic and quick to rectify our disappointment as best they could. The ice cream sandwich was great, but I will definitely be back to try the salted caramel!
author: Judi S.

description: I would give zero stars if I could. It is ridiculously expensive, and not even good... The ice cream had a weird consistency. I have never paid $10 for a cup of ice cream and waited so long. And what irritates me more is that there is such a long wait but the guy behind the counter keeps talking to his friends!!!
author: Leslie N.

description: Don't really understand what the big deal is. It seems like another slick, hipster filled over priced joint with the novelty that they make the ice cream on site using liquid nitrogen. The flavors and ingredients are fresh and probably organic and locally sourced and all that jazz, but the end product seems rather thin, almost more like ice milk than ice cream. I prefer Mitchell's, whose store front is much more humble but whose product is well, just tastier and creamier!. Oh, and as for the novelty of the liquid nitrogen? It is totally lost on me, since I equate it with my grad school days when I used it to flash freeze mouse brains...
author: 和子

description: Texture of their ice cream is very smooth, but melts faster than others. They usually only have a few flavors. I prefer Humphry Slocomb and Mr.& Mrs. Miscellaneous
author: Jimmy C.

description: Best ice-cream ever.  They made it from fresh milk in front of you in less than 5 minutes. It tastes great and the way they make it using liquid nitrogen is really cool. I would highly recommend this to everyone. won't regret it.
author: Reza F.

description: Dont' get the strawberry!  Or any other flavor!  I took one bite of my friends vanilla and had to rethink my whole life.  Soooooo good.  It reminded me of the ice cream my mom used to make when I was a kid with the rock salt machine.  Nothing beats nostalgic vanilla, nothing.  Yelpers, do not regret your decision, GET THE VANILLA!
author: Veronica D.

description: Smitten is my favorite ice cream ever! The liquid nitrogen that they use to make the ice cream makes it so smooth and rich! They  have the best combinations, and sometimes they are really weird. I love their vanilla, salted caramel, and the gingersnaps. I had one ice cream with ginger snaps inside of it, and it's so good!!! Whenever they have cookies in their ice cream, it is delicious. Their toppings are also so good, so try those. You have to come here every week to try their different flavors. f only Smitten was closer to where I lived, I would go here very day. But the hour drive is usually worth it for such delicious ice cream. :]
author: Catherine N.

description:
It's really good, authentic and in the perfect location for enjoying the local park. You get to see them making it in front of you, so there's a bit of a show as well. For the neighborhood, the ice-cream is about on par in terms of pricing. 

I enjoy coming here quite often.
author: Stephen C.

description: Was taken here by friends.  Had never even heard of the place before.  The chocolate ice cream was the best I have ever tasted.  We had to wait 15 minutes because it was selling out.  But it was worth it.  If you like ice cream this stop is worth the journey the price and the wait.
author: Don M.

description: Fantastic ice cream that is made fresh with LIQUID NITROGEN! They only have four flavors at a time because they only have four machines: vanilla, chocolate, and two rotating flavors. I tried a brown sugar flavor which was pretty good, nice and creamy. If anything it's a good novelty to try once or twice, I was sitting on the bench watching them make the ice cream for a good ten minutes.
author: Kenny C.

description: Went here for the first time yesterday, definitely an interesting experience. Ice made to order! But in my opinion, the ice cream itself was just average.
author: Margaret H.

description: We stumbled upon this place tonight after dinner nearby, and we were blown away - in a very good way. We tried the vanilla and also the Tcho chocolate with the spicy caramel sauce - it was absolutely heaven.  I'm sorry we don't live closer, it was smooth, tasty, and absolutely delicious.  Can't wait to go again.
author: Julie W.

description: This place is so yummy! They don't actually make the icecream until you order it. I mean from start to finish they even freeze it in front of you with this liquid nitrogen device, which is way cool to watch. This place only does it with organic products, and preservatives, which is a plus. I kept it simple and ordered vanilla and it was soooooo verrrryyyyy creammmmmyy! Geez, I don't know even know what to say, it was just that good! I mean just writing this makes me want some right now! Can't wait to go back! Was a perfect ending to the hubby and I's routine date night!
author: Brandi W.

description: I saw a special on tv about Smitten and when my friends and I made plans to stay in San Francisco I knew I had to go. After a long day of many miles walking, riding buses and more walking while getting lost we finally made it to Octavia St and just to our left we saw Smitten. To say that this treat was well deserved is an understatement. To say this is the best ice cream I've ever had is not. Watching the ice cream being made is magic unto itself. I had the brown sugar ice cream with TCHO chocolate crumbles. The ice cream was sweet and creamy with hunks of brown sugar that was sublime. The chocolate crumbles only added to the bliss of this wonderful treat. I know ice cream makes everyone happy but the people we were sitting around were especially nice and helped a couple of lost tourists make it back to our hotel. I'll gladly get lost and walk all over San Francisco  again to have another helping of Smitten.
author: Denine H.

description: It's good old-fashioned ice cream with a dash of hipster. What's not to love?
author: Max H.

description: I have only been here once, and, to me,  ITS THE BEST ICE CREAM EVER!!!  I had a small size vanilla and it was the best.  I will be back to try other flavors, but don't want to go alone.  Who wants to join me?
author: Tom D.

description:
got tcho chocolate ice cream. really good, some of the best ice cream i've ever had. 

tried a friend's mint chocolate chip as well but didn't like that one much. still giving this place a 5 because they made it clear it's going to taste like REAL mint...and it does...but I guess I don't like real mint.

cool watching them make the ice cream
author: Aneesh S.

description: Pretty good ice cream in the Hayes Valley area, and it was somewhat entertaining to watch all the liquid nitrogen in action. Every time my husband and I went there, there was always a line, but not too bad. Last time I went was with a few of my old high school classmates (we had a mini reunion) and decided to get some dessert here after dinner. I would've given them five stars if they didn't mess up on my order. Everybody got their ice cream except me. I had to remind them after waiting for a long time that I ordered but they apologized so all's forgiven, especially when I started eating the ice cream hehehe. The TCHO topping was bomb! That was the most memorable part for me. I also gave four stars because it's really more of a kiosk like place with some benches, but you can really hang out for a long time with some warmth, unless you want to freeze to death! You have to wear thick jackets at night because it is cold in SF. We didn't have problems with street parking either since we always found parking right away.
author: Cindy S.

description: My bf loves this place, in particular their chocolate ice cream in a waffle cone.  Since we live near this place, I think the only thing keeping him from going more often is the expense.  I loved their strawberry white balsamic flavor, apparently only available in May.  I also really like their mint flavor, and once I had an apple flavor that was quite good.  There are usually a lot of the more sweet, rich flavors offered, but many times the fruity flavors don't seem that fruity (the exceptions being strawberry and the apple flavor).  It's fun to watch your ice cream being made, and the enclosed area with heating lamps is great on the chilly days that you still want some ice cream.
author: Andrea T.

description: Super yum. Brown sugar ice cream on waffle cone. Amazing.
author: Annie W.

description:
I give this place a solid 3.5!
Since I am a super ice-cream addict fan, I had to try this place! After all, who wouldn't want to see and eat ice-cream that's made right in front of your face!?! It's such an amazing experience to see the fog rising over that little machinery! When I went here I tried the TCHO chocolate flavor which was INCREDIBLY CREAMY! I have never had ice-cream THIS creamy!!! It was such an interesting texture since I wasn't used to the ultimate creamy-ness! It looks like it gets crowded often because of the ultra long wait but I totally understand that they are making it and you gotta give them some time to concoct your magical cup of happiness. The downsides to this place is that the ice-cream is unaffordable. It's very costly, which shouldn't discourage you from trying this place but just know that you will be spending the amount of money that can buy you a gallon or two at safeway... You also cannot mix flavors if you get more than one scoop. (just a little bit of a warning) 

I honestly don't think I'll be coming back unless Im in the area and Im in the mood for ice-cream scoops the size of a golf ball...but overall still such a cool concept!
author: Susie N.

description: Who doesn't enjoy liquid nitrogen made ice cream on a waffle cone?
author: Bryan L.

description:
When I saw a long line plus growing crowd, I wonder why. As I hang around the park, a kid noticed and wanted to have one. Started to wait 10 minutes.....15 minutes before the order was taken then additional 15 minutes to get them. Long waiting time for a kid. The kid didn't understand why she has to wait after the order was taken. 
Chocolate ice cream has a rich flavor and creamy. $3 for kids size. Can't taste the advantage of freshness. I think about Bi Rite Creamery, so as the kid.
author: Vicki S.

description: Best ice cream in SF. I had the mint flavor and I must say I felt like I was just eating mint leaves, not the best flavor. However the vanilla is wonderful, I didn't let my choice in a flavor ruin the place. The ice cream is unbelievably creamy and worth the wait.
author: Madeline S.

description:
Smitten is located in a cute almost makeshift like booth and it is worth it to go just to watch them make the ice cream. I have to admit, although I was disappointed with the limited selection, the salted carmel was wonderful. The only bad part was it made my stomach pretty upset because it was very creamy. Yes, I know ice cream is typically cream but this was a slightly different - a little thicker than I'm used to.  I also thought they would have unique flavors (I scoured out the website beforehand), I was looking forward to the butternut squash (I'm a huge fan and wanted to try it in ice cream form). However, they only had chocolate, salted caramel and green tea (which I am not a fan of). I decided to go with salted caramel, because that has become a new classic favorite (trendy also). 

After it made my stomach upset, I of course had to give it another chance because I didn't eat a lot that day. Since then I have had the strawberry and vanilla, which I am a fan of but it didn't blow me away. I also ordered them in kiddie size because it was a perfect size for my mood and cheaper. I might go to Smitten again since I live so close by but I would chose Byrite over this place any day - sorry Smitten but I might like you more if you expand your flavors.
author: Ellie C.

description: Creamiest ice cream I have ever had. Delish. Prices are a bit high but the texture and mix ins make it worth it. Fun to watch them make it too. Great location as well.
author: Mark M.

description: 1 order of the TCHO chocolate and 1 order of the Passionfruit w/ meyer lemon caramel please!
author: Dorothy L.

description: I am smitten with Smitten - how many times has this line been in a review? But it's true.  It is such a fun ice cream spot to go to.  My favorite is the tcho chocolate.  Do not question it - just order it.  My second favorite and I think it is seasonal so you better go quick is the mint chip.  Talk about a party in my mouth!  When you eat this ice cream you actually feel as if you took a bite from a mint leave.  That is how fresh and awesome it is.  My boyfriend who is a repeat offender of the chocolate had a bite of my mint chip and had to order his own.  Smitten rocks!
author: Vagabond V.

description: I know it is gimmicky in technique, but truely wonderful, simple ingredients make the experience well worth the wait.  Recently I went on a cold and rainy weekday just before Xmas, and there was still a line of about 5 people.  This place is popular for a reason.
author: D M.

description:
Very, very fresh ice cream.  The crowd outside of Smitten's somewhat temporary ice cream "shed" led me to believe that I was going to be knocked off my feet by the flavor.  Sometimes I think San Franciscans stand in food lines just for the sake of standing in line.

I had the coconut ice cream with blueberry swirl.  Tasted good, but nothing amazing.  In fact, the cool while-you-wait process actually got old after waiting for my small scoop of ice cream for about 20 minutes.  I would probably give them 3 and a half stars.
author: Shane C.

description:
Smitten Ice Cream has the winning combination of delicious and fun ice cream that is made right in front of you.  

I got to try a yummy cup of the caramel at the public opening of Smitten Ice Cream at Soul Carnitas' Call to Flavor festival for food carts at Precita Park.  Food cart is a bit of a misnomer since it is literally an ice cream wagon, fully loaded with ice cream making machinery!

When you order, the mix is poured into this one-of-a-kind ice cream maker that pulls in bursts of liquid nitrogen to whip up a bowl of ice cream in front of your eyes.  Flavors of the day were caramel and salted caramel, which meant you got to top it off with melted caramel goo and salt

Will be psyched the day that there's a regular store front (or wagon parking space) where I can have ice cream on demand :)
author: Aki N.

description: After reading so many rave blog posts and reviews about this magical ice cream maker, I stopped by on the opening night of Biergarten for a small scoop of pecan vanilla. It was alright, definitely novel but not the tastiest ice cream I've tried and not very flavorful.
author: Tatyana K.

description: For me, Smitten was a bit of a disappointment.  I had heard so much hype, and had always seen the line wrapped across Patricia's Green, so I guess my expectations were too high.  Don't get me wrong, I see why people love it, but I just don't.  The ice cream was a bit to sweet for me, although I like the various brittles they offer.  I would have to say that Bi-Rite still has my heart.
author: Bridget B.

description: The ice cream is different, but good.  Yes, it's bit pricey, but where else can you get liquid nitrogen freezed ice cream?  Because of the process, they don't need to use as much gum arabic so the ice cream literally just evaporates in your mouth-- there's none of the stickiness leftover in your mouth.  So, it's definitely worth trying, but not necessarily something I'd crave.
author: Christine L.

description:
was incredibly impressed by Smitten on a recent Saturday afternoon stroll of Hayes Valley.  The line was minimal and the ice cream incredibly decadent.  This is not your Ben and Jerry's run of the mill flavor overload.  Smitten uses the freshest ingredients to create simple but incredibly tasting treats.  I had their Farmer's Market special which wasn't overly sweet, but naturally smooth and amazing.  My friends had the TCHO which was out of this world and amazingly rich.  Not for the faint of heart!  Will definitely be going back there.

My only complaint is that they please get rid of the screen covering the store.  would be nice to more easily communicate with the friendly staff
author: JJ O.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had! The location is very cool and their idea of using liquid nitrogen is neat! The salted caramel topping is great.
author: Deckel I.

description: I'm a fan of the brown sugar ice cream in a cup, ask for the cone on top.  Their ice cream is whipped up right in front of you with liquid nitrogen. The consistency is slightly on the soft side, but I don't mind it. The brown sugar served with a bite of their soft waffle cone are great together. The seasonal rhubarb is excellent as well, if you're lucky enough to see it.
author: Dave H.

description:
Delicious ice cream.  Fun concept - I get the hype.  But they cannot (yet) combine flavors, regardless of the size to buy.  And they don't have toppings.  I realize they're new, and it's definitely fun to see them making fresh ice cream with a Kelvinator in a shipping container.  And it's nice that they use a combination of ipad, Square, and post-it notes for order production.
We had a Salted Caramel and a Chocolate.  Both were super yummy.  And both made me wish that we were at Bi-Rite Creamery where we could combine flavors and then have toppings.
This was on a Saturday night around 8pm, and it wasn't really crowded.  Lucky us, because I know how busy they can get...
author: Michael S.

description:
This is competent ice cream with good ingredients.  However, as may people who make ice cream at home can tell you, fresh-churned does not equal="better" ice cream.  Given time to age ice cream overnight under the proper temperature, flavors come together better, smooth out, and cohere.  The flavors here tend to be a bit bright and flat.

The creaminess and texture here also really depends on the person operating the machine.  I've had icy bits and clumps from scraping down the sides, and overchurned, broken ice cream as well on a number of occasions.

Better ice cream, with more sophisticated and rounded flavors, can be had at Three Twins, Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, and the like, and I would patronize all of those places, but will not continue to give my money to a gimmick.
author: C H.

description:
summed up in 4 words: simple. delicious. expensive. gimmicky.

a little more explanation:  I appreciated the clean flavors using simple and fresh ingredients.  I also liked their simple chalkboard signage listing the flavors of the day and the ingredients that go into each.  I think they offer 4 flavors each day, they were erasing one they ran out of as we walked up.  I will forever wonder what flavor that was! ha.  each of us got a scoop of the remaining flavors. brown sugar, vanilla, and chocolate.  (I didn't like that you can't mix flavors when you order multiple scoops, that doesn't seem fair.) The chocolate was by far the best of the 3 (and this is coming from a non-chocolate choosing person in terms of ice cream flavors)  It was creamy and dense and very smooth dark chocolate flavor.  The vanilla was standard, creamy and sweet.  The brown sugar was my least favorite (it was the one I chose. boo).  It was thinner and lighter in texture than the other two (it did not have eggs listed like the others) and the flavor was more like a burnt milk flavor than a rich brown sugar sweetness.  It also melted really fast compared to the others.  At $4 each for a small scoop it is not cheap, but I think people pay for the gimmick of the Kelvin machines and the made to order aspect of the treat.  Which brings me to my final point/ding.  The night we went they were not making the icecream to order.  Rather they were making batches so none of us got to watch the process and ohhh and ahhh over the liquid nitrogen magic.  Not such a big deal to me, but my brother in law complained loudly, pointing out that he's paying for that gimmick so he wasn't happy they gave us premade icecream.  whatever.  I eat icecream probably 2 times a year, and this was decent and fun.
author: Sj C.

description:
My Smitten experience was great. Love the cool concept and the whole science behind it, but what I really love is that you get your ice cream to order, made right there as you order.

Also the ingredients they use are super fresh and local which really translates into flavor.

I really like their caramel flavor...the ice cream was smooth and had me craving for more.

They were really nice and explained how the whole thing works...will definitely make Smitten ice cream one of my favorite spots for this summer :)
author: Gimena P.

description: Best ice cream I've ever tasted but crazy expensive, like 4.50 for a scoop of ice cream. Still... its pretty fricking good.
author: claire l.

description: Recently moved to the city a couple months ago and fell in love with this place immediately.  I love how you can watch them make your ice cream on the spot.  Granted they don't offer tons of variety in flavors, I still can't get enough of the smooth ice cream they make.  I always get the brittle as well, yum!  Love love love it!
author: Love U.

description: It's really good, but not life changing like I expected it to be after reading all the reviews. I made it a point to go twice during my trip, interesting concept, really fresh flavor and that pretty much summarizes it for me.
author: Sergey Z.

description: Smitten was an ice cream experience, but when rated next to other Bay Area hot spots (Ici, Bi-Rite, Penny's Ice Creamery), I was not impressed with this overpriced treat.  I am giving as many stars as I am because the concept of made-to-order resonates with me.
author: Gretchen E.

description: I can't say I was totally smitten with Smitten. No, I was more adequately pleased. I did not get the butterflies in the stomach or the wobbly knees from this interaction. I tried the nectarine and honey which was good, but compared to other places (i.e. Tara's), this romance is not as passionate for a gal like me. Very rich, not uber sweet, and the nitrogen is more of a novelty for the "ooooo, aaaahhhh" factor than anything. Not a bad option, but I think I will continue to date around to find a true lactose romance.
author: Kim S.

description:
PRO: Super creamy/fresh tasting ice cream-best I've ever had!  
CON: long lines, no parking
author: Shumaila P.

description: Classic Vanilla with strawberry sauce with honeyvinilla shortbread topping! Yummm!!!
author: Angel A.

description: Great ice-cream with very few ingredients. Made right in front of you there. It is probably one of the best ice-creams i've ever had. Dress warm, as it's a little cold but have heat lamps inside.
author: Callie T.

description: In my opinion, some really tasty ice cream. Some of the best I've had in fact. Every scoop is handmade to order using liquid nitrogen. They have a sign explaining that this process results in smaller ice crystals and creamier flavor -- I definitely noticed this ice cream is quite smooth and creamy. The salted caramel is arguably superior to Bi-Rite's and the chocolate ice cream can definitely stand on its own as well. Altogether, this place is definitely worth a try and I'll be back for more soon.
author: Aaron V.

description: Innovative & yummy. The ice cream is very creamy but tends to melt fast. I would recommend a cup over a cone to make sure to take advantage of every bit.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
This place was a gem. I wish it was warmer when I went. But then again the consistency of the ice cream was just right on our slightly chilly day so if it was blistering it may have turned to soup too quickly. Regardless, the ice cream was delish. Each of us got a different flavor and we conquered the menu with no problem -- there were 4 flavors. My favorite was the salted caramel but be warned, the flavor is full so if you want something more mellow stick to vanilla. The way it's made was different  and the little park with the chain lady just across the street was too perfect.

It was a perfect way to wrap up our afternoon.
author: Molly G.

description: Very cool process in making this Ice cream, you can stand behind the glass and watch it from beginning to end.  Then comes the delicious Ice cream, very tough to beat, and the unique toppings put it over the edge in my books.
author: Wade V.

description: They aren't kidding when they explain the process of making their ice cream and how it leads to a smoother cream.  Generally, I don't even like ice cream, but this I like!
author: Erica D.

description: The sweetcorn ice cream with blackberry sauce cured my homesickness for Texas in a bite. Awesome!
author: Anne K.

description: I tried the mint ice cream with TCHO chocolate chip and was underwhelmed. They make the ice cream fresh with liquid nitrogen but I wasn't impressed by the texture or quality of my ice cream. The mint was fresh and very fragrant but it just didn't taste thick or creamy like how I normally like my ice cream. It  tasted bland to me except for the chocolate chunks. For around $6, I expected a little more. I guess if you don't like your ice cream really creamy, this may be the place for you. At least now I can say I tried it.
author: Victoria N.

description: Definitely an interesting place to go based on how they make the ice cream, but the actual ice cream is meh. Of all the flavors ive tried, ive liked the chocolate one the most.
author: Moby K.

description: I know ice cream. Liquid nitrogen is a great way to make ice cream. This is some of the best ice creams you can get- great favors and it is amazingly smooth. Smitten only having 3.5 stars shows how much ice cream education is lacking these days.
author: Robin S.

description: Yes, I was totally smitten. I loved the experience as well as the ice cream. I'm not quite trading in my absolute love for bi-rite, but this place is legit.
author: yana Z.

description: This place is fresh and very good. Each flavor is quiet amazing though they have a bit of restrictions. You can only get one flavor at a time. It is outside in a make shift hut. Yet the flavors they do have are amazing! The ice cream is ridiculously fresh as it is made form liquid nitrogen on the spot. The spicy syrup is great!
author: Natasha M.

description: Yum! Sea salt caramel was excellent. Mint flavor made with real mint leaves I had previously was to die for!
author: V H.

description:
Incredibly delicious ice cream. Great little location convenient to a park with benches and tables. My daughter loved watching the ice cream as it was made with the liquid nitrogen. One of the ice cream makers was extra friendly and was chatting with us about how it was made and worked. 

For photos of our Smitten adventure, visit: 
http://www.jacksonfuller.com/2011/04/30/smitten/
author: Matt F.

description: Very cool idea with the nano batches of ice cream made in front of you. We ordered the sweet corn with blackberry sauce and the tcho chocolate. One of the better chocolate ice creams I've had. Super creamy and rich. The sweet corn was very good as well without the overpowering flavor that actually makes you feel like your eating corn. I tried to go back the next day but ran out of time. I will be back
author: Kyle M.

description:
This place is so adorable! It's made in front of your eyes the good old fashion way, with liquid nitrogen duh, it's fresh w/o preservatives, it's simple, and classy.  They use basic ingredients to its core and really, shouldn't all food thrive to be like that, to use only simplest ingredients to bring out the flavor of food. Did you know that their "shop" is actually a recycled shipping container! Smitten's philosophy just captivates me. 
The salted caramel was good but the most surprising flavor that I happen to stumble upon by chance was the sweet corn ice cream. I hesitated to try it because I love sweet corn and thinking a ice cream flavor of it would be weird. I tried it anyways and it's taste exactly like sweet corn in a ice cream version. I know that sounds stupid b/c the name of the ice cream but it could go wrong in so many ways but I'm glad it didn't. It fulfilled my expectation. I crave for it sometimes and just my luck, I never encountered it since. Til I meet you again sweet corn ice cream! GRrrrrr
author: Vu D.

description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=cYiSHEZFlYo
Amazing place in a recycled shipping container serving fresh made ice cream by the scoop. Delicious 5 stars!
author: ArtIfact G.

description: I don't know how you can dislike any ice-cream place.  This is another winner, granted with less creative flavors compared to some of the other popular spots in the city.  That being said, I loved the dark chocolate and thought the liquid nitrogen concept was cool.  Great price for the small sizes too!
author: Kim K.

description: They make their instant ice cream with liquid nitrogen. Vanilla ice cream and cone are great...
author: Ali E.

description:
Gustatorily benign, spiritually off-putting.

I'm sorry to say that Smitten Ice Cream just takes the joy out of ice cream for me. The rigidity in their operating procedures doesn't add any appeal to something that has had it in scoopfuls for hundreds of years, and though the ingredients stand out as being of superb quality and taste, the execution falls short of extracting the harmony that is so obviously fated for the components.

I was Smitten's first customer of the day, so thankfully the wait was minimal. But still existent. Smitten's website claims it takes its machine 60 seconds to churn cream and divine, unassuming add-ins into a rich, heavenly concoction, but from order to scoop I'd guess that it was an eight-minute-plus affair, all told-- prepping the machine, ceremoniously gathering all of the ingredients of my olive oil-lavender-shortbread order (and to great pomp, at that), hooking stuff up and then revving up the machine. Imagine a crowd of twenty going through the queue.

The ice cream itself was promising. Perhaps the richest I've ever had (a bit too much, even for me), the product was very subtle in sweetness with top notes of spicy lavender, a dull crunch of the shortbread that didn't add much in flavor, and then rounded out by very high-quality, extremely fruity olive oil. So fruity was the oil that combined with the floral lavender and the dense creamy backbone, there were almost tropical, melony notes in the finish.

But it could be so much better in so many ways, and the basic philosophy of the business is what is impeding all of these improvements. Why shun tradition when your flavors could be uplifted by embracing it, Smitten? Flavors are mixed in with cream to order, which cockblocks any melding of flavors that could be coaxed from thickening and infusing a custard, lovingly churning it all as one for certainly more than 60 seconds. I assume this could be mostly remedied by making each component special and chock-full of flavor, but my chalky shortbread wasn't very convincing. So, is it more efficient? Is it more cost-effective? More delicious? More fun? Nope, nope, nope and nope (once you get past the coolness of freezing stuff with liquid nitro, you're crestfallen at the realization that this means no sampling, no combining flavors in one size, a long wait, etc., etc.). What you get is inferior flavor loaded with highfalutin concept that, to me, is kind of just a bunch of hoo-ha. I am all for local, sustainable and slow eats, but it doesn't contribute anything if it doesn't come with at least a smack of sensibility.

I'm no smarty, and I don't know but would be curious to find out whether Smitten's use of nitrogen helps to cut back operating costs in any way and whether it is more environmentally friendly than using conventional energy sources to produce ice creams. These are things I'd really be interested in knowing, but if Smitten is going to advertise the main focus of their operation as flavor and texture-- well, they've lost me.

It's a sad day when ice cream, the most joyful and joyous of treats, becomes a chore. And you'll have to do a few chores to afford Smitten's fare, at $4.75 for a small (and they ain't mincing words here). Though the ice cream is by no means offensive, my feelings towards the operation's philosophy is so staunchly antonymic to its moniker that I can confidently say I will not be returning anytime soon, even with its extreme proximity to my work.
author: Nuri K.

description: Really cool concept and fun to watch them make this ice cream from liquid nitrogen. It's really nice to have this in the neighborhood where we live int he middle of the hood. Sometimes it takes a few minutes to wait on your ice cream, but we typically don't mind too much because it's fun to watch. it's also fairly easy to pay as they take credit cards on their iPad, which is convenient. It also seems fairly "green" in that all of their waste is compostable. Cool concept and nice to support a local business.
author: Brent T.

description: Great ice cream, very smooth but it takes so godddang long to get one scoop produced!  This is ok if you've got time on your hands but usually I'm driving and parking is impossible and yeah...well it's good but it takes toooooo da&* long to generate a scoop of goodness.  Can they hire more keeblers?
author: Mel S.

description: Good, but they were out of a lot of the toppings when I got there.
author: Stephen C.

description: Yes yes yes please!!!!!! Best ice cream in the city!!!!!! I've tried 4 different flavors, all so creamy and yummy! ....ok, awkward....but anyway, try it, love it. Service is great, and they use almost all local and or organic ingredients.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Great concept for an ice cream shop, and they have delicious smooth ice cream. It's a little pricey and they only have a few seasonal flavors to choose from, but an overall fun sf experience.
author: Sam G.

description: The novelty of this location is that they actually use nitruos oxide or something along those lines to hand freeze each scoop on the spot. I had the caramel ice cream and it was pretty good except it was a little too sweet with the tcho chocolate syrup. I personally wouldn't come back unless it was a date.. The ice creams is too soft and I'm easily content with your frozen containers found at the local grocery stores.
author: James H.

description: Favorite ice cream in the city! I really like the salted caramel, in a cone of course.
author: Jen T.

description:
I really like the operation they've got going, making fresh to order ice cream. I tried the vanilla--which was delicious if not too sweet-- and strawberry--which was more tangy. The ice crea does come out more like soft-serve than the type you'd get at a regular ice cream shop. 

It's fun to watch how the ice cream is made, nice place to take a date or friends.
author: katrina w.
