description: The way the ice cream is made is what makes this a novelty, but the ice cream itself is ok. It's certainly smooth, but it tastes like gourmet ice cream I can get elsewhere. I liked the waffle cone because it was buttery and eggy, but after a while it was too rich.
author: Cindy H.

description: Fun place - a new experience to watch your ice cream made in front of you, inside a re-purposed shipping container. You can take your ice cream and sit in the park on Octavia Street.  The ice cream is tasty, but even if it weren't, Smitten would be a good place to spend a sunny afternoon.
author: Mandy H.

description: Smitten definitely gets cool points for the concept - liquid nitrogen ice cream!  However, the resulting ice cream is pricier and less tasty than other ice cream places in the city, including Three Twins which is only a few blocks away.  I enjoyed my malted vanilla, but I don't see myself coming back with all the competing options.
author: Cathy Y.

description: I wanted to like this new Smitten Ice Cream parlor on California and Fillmore but today I got a small $6.25 mint chip cone and it was drippy soft and it tasted as though I crushed mint from my garden into some cream. Really the worst mint chip I have ever had. There were about 7 people behind the little counter and only 5 or 6 people in the store - yet it still took 10 minutes to receive a drippy overpriced cone. Other people had good looking hard ice cream near me but I obviously got a newbie who didn't quite know how to work the nitrogen. Disappointing to pay so much for a crappy cone.  I usually love gourmet ice cream and have sampled really great ice cream coast to coast - this one just missed the mark. I will likely try it again - perhaps another flavor - coffee maybe? Hard to mess up Blue bottle coffee. I guess I prefer my mint chip green and artificially flavored with mint because I threw this one in the trash - waste of money - just wasn't worth the calories and I hate drippy icecream. Feel like they owe me a free cone next time. Why so overpriced ? You can get great ice cream in the mission for half the price.
author: Ann W.

description: Best ice cream I've ever tasted.  Smooth, clean,creamy, delicious. The price and wait time in line are the cons but give it a try and judge for yourself!
author: M M.

description: Can't say I went too often, but I love this place. I recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco because it's an experience to be had.
author: Mari V.

description: It really does taste like "fresh" ice cream.  It is very creamy and it really tastes like it was just churned.  Rhubarb crisp flavor was amazing, way tastier than it sounds.  My ice cream didn't melt quickly either, as others have experienced.  I also did not have to wait in line.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Taste:
The Ice-Cream is made the old-fashion way right infront of your eyes (which is cool)
I've tried the salted caramel and creme fraiche pear caramel, so far... the creme fraiche pear caramel is my fav -- for the moment.  The pear & caramel compliments one another and neither components overwhelms or over powers in taste  ;)  perfectly balanced...


Environment:
Walk-up and order, outside facility with a open patio with roller shade... bench--like seats, near a nice children/dog park...  gets crowded on a warm SF sunny day so expect delays.. 

Price:
now this is why my rating is 3 stars...
The small cup size is equivalent to 4 ounces by volume.. You receive 2 scoops, small scoops, (teaspoon-like scoops) for $4.79 or a total of $5.10 with tax. ...

Customer Service:
Friendly, works hard to expedite orders...


No doubt, the place serves good old-fashioned Ice Cream, but dont feed into the hype or long lines.. this place should give you more quanity for the prices that they ask for..
author: LoLa L.

description: The line is long and it's quite expensive for ice cream but damn it's good! The line goes by quick so it's not so bad. I like the fact that their ice cream is freshly made right in front of you as you order. I had the salted caramel and it was super creamy and rich. I'm glad I had the small cup because if it was any bigger I don't think I could have finished it. If you have a sweet tooth or if you're a fan of ice creams this is the place to go.
author: Yong Jae C.

description: Smitten is awesome. It's over-priced for sure but hey it's in Hayes Valley in SF. People gotta make rent right? Their Lemon Gingersnap is the BOMB. So fresh, so tasty. Will be back for sure!
author: George L.

description: It's a fun experience and the finished product is nice and creamy, but it seems a little bit excessive - the amount of time, energy, money, and compressed air it takes to make one serving of ice cream.  It's a craft to be savored on a nice sunny day in Hayes Valley, and not scarfed down with shame out of a carton at home.
author: Jenn C.

description: Tchoco Chocoloate with Sweet tooth expresso from Rituals next door is heavenly.  Skip the pistachio brittle; it's too sweet.
author: Byron L.

description:
05.27.11

smitten [smit-n]  - adjective
1. struck, as with a hard blow.
2. grievously or disastrously stricken or afflicted.
3. very much in love.

With Smitten Ice Cream, I'm going with definition number three.

Each scoop is made to order via Kelvin (the machine that runs on liquid nitrogen).

Must try: TCHO 60.5% Dark Chocolate.  And make it a "hot" chocolate by adding jalapeño slices!

Total damage: $3.25
author: Jenny L.

description: the ice cream is smooth and creamy.  the flavors are also good, though not particularly memorable.  However, it's the wait that will deter me from coming back to get a scoop.  a long wait for slightly better than average ice cream just doesn't do it for me.  i'd rather stand in line at bi rite or mitchells or mr & mrs misc..
author: Yayu L.

description: I'm not an ice cream guy.  I never buy it for home... I very rarely eat it, but I tried some from here... It was like $4.75 for a small.. kinda pricey... I got some salted caramel.  I ordered it, got it, ate it.  I REALLY liked it.  Some people on yelp said it was too strong... I dunno.. it was exactly what I was looking for...I really liked it!.
author: Easter E.

description:
It's true, their ice cream is pretty good. But is it any better than ice cream at BiRite, Mitchell's, Naia (technically a gelateria, but whatever), or any of the other famed ice creameries in SF? Nope! 

They had 3 flavours the night I went: vanilla, green tea, and salted caramel. Being a non-vanilla person but wanting to try multiple flavours, I got a kid size of both the green tea and salted caramel (and effectively ruined my appetite since this was right before meeting friends for dinner =P). Both were creamy and yummy, but a little on the sweet side and nothing all that special. I've had more flavourful green tea ice creams at Japanese restaurants and the salted caramel at BiRite is just as good, if not better. They also included wedges of their pizzelle cone in the green tea ice cream. It's not as crunchy as your typical waffle cone, but still pretty good nonetheless.

The whole liquid nitrogen thing is more gimmicky than anything (well, that and a genius marketing strategy). But if you take that away... you're still left with good ice cream, it's just not worth the hype.

PROS:
-- Tasty ice cream

CONS:
-- ... but not THAT tasty.
-- It's PRICEY: At $3.5 for the kid's size and $5.5 for the regular (plus $0.5 if you want it in a cone), it's more than I would have to pay at BiRite, Mitchell's, Naia, etc. And you only get one flavour (at least for the kid's size, not sure about the regular). 
-- The WAIT: Because the ice cream is made to order, you have to wait for the LN2 to do its magic. 
-- MELTED ice cream: The ice cream doesn't stay cold for very long since it's not kept frozen but is *just* (barely) frozen. Mine melted a little faster than I could eat it and I was soon spooning ice cream soup into my mouth.
-- The CONE: It's not rolled up very tightly so there's a gaping hole at the bottom, which is a problem when the ice cream melts so fast. I like my ice cream in my mouth, not on my pants =(
-- LACK OF FLAVOURS: Understandable since they're so small and have to make everything to order, but it's still a disadvantage. Not sure if you can sample either.

Bottom line: I'm glad I tried it but I likely won't be a repeat customer like I am at BiRite, Mitchell's, and Naia. Call me old fashioned, but I prefer my ice cream made with an ice cream maker!
author: Steph L.

description: It's pretty good but very expensive for a scoop of ice cream. The good thing is that since it is so expensive, it limits the intake and so you don't need to think to much of the calories! For the chocolate lovers, this is definitely the bomb. The taste in the ice cream is very vibrant and taste like a heavier ice cream. You will need a bit of patience as each serving is made as it is placed, hence the expensive pricing. It is worth a trip or two....
author: Jay S.

description: No samples and only 1 flavor in a small $5.  Kid's size plenty for $3. But they exchange it if not satisfied.  Choc was awesome;  vanilla was mild but good;  mint chip was so delicate it was almost not there.  But the choc was awesome.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Tastes like Humphrey's Slocomb.  It leaves you with that buttery feeling on your lips.  Olive oil ice cream is freakin weird.  I couldn't finish it.
author: Fatty A.

description: Chocolate ice cream with Tcho chocolate sauce!!!
author: Thiago S.

description: I had the fudgesicle. It was SO GOOD. I would never have believed it was dairy-free- it was smooth and creamy and ridiculously chocolatey! (It was also gluten-free.)  :D
author: Erika B.

description: Most of my coworkers have tried Smitten.  I finally had time to drop by and try the white nectarine flavor. It tasted a bit more like frozen cream with nectarine bits rather than ice cream.  The ice cream is made in less than 60 seconds by using liquid nitrogen to quickly cool the mix.  $4.75 for a small scoop.
author: Stacey L.

description: I'm not a fan in the least.  I don't like that there were limited flavor options and what I got (lemon) had a very strong metalic taste to it.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Was in SF on business, and had an early dinner with an ex-beau.  " i have a surprise place for us for dessert", he said, with a twinkle in his eye. "You'll be smitten."  We drove to a very hip 'hood - I think it's called Hayes Valley - and parked, then walked to a white tent.  Hmm - a tent? Oooookay.  The chalkboard menu offered four flavors: chocolate, vanilla, salted caramel, and pumpkin.  You only live once, so I insisted on trying both the caramel and the pumpkin while he ordered the chocolate.  Then the fun started.   The ice cream does not get scooped out of a container -SF is far too evolved and cool for that.  Clearly, they got the memo about molecular gastronomy, and this is dessert with a side of showmanship.  You place your order, and the flavors are poured into small metal containers with dough--hooklike inserts.  They infuse it with liquid nitrogen, and the machine whirls away while the nitrogen spews smokelike from the container.  Its sort of like your own personal mini- Krakatoa exploding right before your eyes. 
   I tasted the pumpkin first, since Halloween is mere hours away.  It tasted like frozen pumpkin pie, with all the distinctive flavor of pumpkin perfectly spiced with cinnnamon, allspice, nutmeg, ginger. There's something in ice cream called overrun, and I believe it has to do with the amount of air whipped into the ice cream.  From the little I understand about the science of ice cream production, there's no excess air in this treat; it tasted like I would imagine home-churned ice cream would taste -heavy and rich mouthfeel, intense flavors, small amount satisfies because it's so rich.  
    I continued the orgy with thesalted caramel, which was an elegant balance of salt and sweet, and a slightly smoky undertone that was very sexy.  If youcould make Issac Hayes singing into ice cream, it would be Smitten's salted caramel.  And the chocolate..... Oh yes. Oh yes.  It had the richness, the complexity, the essence of top quality chocolate all summed up in a small scoop, and the power of the flavor at first spoonful is a bit shocking.  Each spoonful until you reach the bottom of the cup continues to be a guilty pleasure. 
    I am smitten! Run, don't walk to this delightful place, and you will be smitten too.
author: Diana S.

description:
I made the trip here with my family and we all got different flavors (vanilla, tcho chocolate, and sweet corn with blackberry sauce) so we could try a bit of everything.  There was also salted caramel that day, but my mom said she had tried it before and liked Bi-Rite's better.

None of the flavors really came through, and everything was way too sweet.  We liked the sweet corn flavor the best because of the tart blackberry sauce, but there was only a small bit drizzled on top of the ice cream, so it was gone after a couple bites.  My parents had tried the chocolate before, too, and said it was better (and more chocolatey) the last time they were there.

The texture was a little off-putting, as well.  The ice cream was too rich and creamy--it was almost like eating cold butter.  (And I'm one of those people who always says butter makes everything better! Well, not this time.)

I'd give this place another try, but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
author: D E.

description: I have never heard of this type of concept at an ice cream shop before.  Ice cream completely made to order?!? WOW.  It takes a little bit to get your order and its also crowded but I would have to say its worth the wait.  I got the TCHO chocolate with almond brittle and it was pretty damn amazing.  I have had better ice cream before but not many.  If you are looking for crazy flavors don't come here as they only have 3 normal flavors but the novelty of watching your ice cream literally being made in front of you and that it tastes great is worth the trip.
author: Scott G.

description:
3.5 made-to-order ice cream is an interesting and cool concept, but just seems a little difficult to keep every individual batch standardized, esp. with weather fluctuations and this tiny contraption with overflowing liquid nitrogen evaporation "steam"
tried salted caramel (only 3 flavors were avail and a double can't be mixed since it would take making two separate batches)
well, the ice cream is very smooth, soft, not that cold; thus mostly melted
the caramel flavor was very strong and nice but kinda one note--didn't really have that burnt complexity and not as salty as i thought it should be
the homemade cone was sweet and just too soft and crumbly.  not good.
i think this place will have its fans, but i haven't been won over yet
author: Rob C.

description:
great ice cream, crazy high prices.
all in all a good time.
author: Fred A.

description: my favorite flavor is mint chips with cameral sauce.Perfect!
author: Momo G.

description: Truthfully great idea poor execution.  SUPER slow but friendly service.  Also the flavors are a bit hit and miss.  If you crave a flavor you might be disappointed.  Our day was chocolate or vanilla...boring.  Also, the wait was way too long.
author: Charles K.

description:
Food - They make the ice cream fresh in front of you.  The ice cream tastes delicious and they have lots of options for toppings.  The only downside is they have a limited amount of flavors they cycle through.

Price - Pretty typical prices for ice cream shop.  It's $6 for a regular size ice cream.

Service - Friendly staff and efficient.

Other - Great atmosphere and right across the street from a small park where you can enjoy your ice cream.
author: Manny F.

description: Eh.  Trendy.  One flavor per serving.  No mixing flavors "because it's made to order."  Now, this would be amazing, if you had a dozen flavors that could be made on the spot.  But THREE flavors?? Just make a tub for each of your "THREE" flavors, then the line wouldn't be so ridiculously long, for no realistic reason.  45 minutes of my life I wish I had back.  Two cones, two flavors and some topping...$15??? First and last time.  I have better things to do with my time...and my money. What is it with people???  Faddish beyond faddish.  What happened to everyone being lactose intolerant???  Miraculously everyone waiting in line isn't anymore. LOL
author: Jon C.

description: Fresh made ice cream. It was fascinating to watch them make it. The vanilla was delish n not too sweet. Went well with the pistachio brittle. You can enjoy your ice cream at the park, across the street.
author: Bernie C.

description:
I guess they are still in soft launch so some things may improve- Hence 2 stars instead of 1 star.

1- Wait times are obscene and it was cold and rainy. We waited 15 minutes (only 10 people in front of us) to order and 10 minutes for our ice cream. The woman taking orders (owner I think) warned us about the wait on the salted caramel, so we got vanilla instead.

2- I think I got a small when I paid for a regular. Annoying, but didn't care as I didn't really want to finish the one I had. 

3- Taste- Vanilla wasn't as good as Haagen Daaz. Strawberry was good, but, probably not any better than a good gelato shop. And, the mouthfeel was not anything to write home about. It wasn't icy at all, which is nice. But it was almost like little pellets on the vanilla- a bit like the ice cream dots at carnivals but not as extreme. 

4- It's fun to watch your ice cream being made in the very cool machine. The problem is, when you are waiting for a very long time, and you see all the people you know are in line ahead of you and then you see how long it takes to make just one cup, you start thinking the machines are the bottleneck and why can't they make 3-4 scoops at a time instead since there's 50+ orders to fill. 

5- The ladies that work there seem very nice, so I hate giving such a bad review. They knew the wait times were not ideal and they were trying to make it work, but they were at the mercy of the machines, which are the whole differentiating point of the ice cream shop. I wish them all luck, but won't be back.
author: Vidya R.

description: We ordered a Root Beer float, mint chip ice cream, and Classic Vanilla ice cream. Best stuff I've tasted! Next time we're in San Francisco, we'll be back!
author: Tony M.

description: Of course it's cool seeing this ice cream getting made, but it takes too long for what you get. The ice cream is not as good as you'd expect and it's also over-priced. It's not terrible ice cream, it's just average for the cost/wait you put into it.
author: Amy S.

description:
It's pretty irresponsible to give Smitten anything lower than four stars. Is its ice cream a little too buttery? I think so. Are its flavors a little less exciting than Bi Rite et al.? Yeah. But they take ice cream ingredients and pour them into a machine and make you an individual serving of ice cream WHILE YOU WAIT. And the ice cream is good. Like, very good. And, yes, while you will pay a bit more of a premium for individual ice cream servings made to freaking order, it's not like it's that much more expensive than any other trendy ice cream place. I had some rhubarb pie concoction there once that was really fantastic, so if that's available, try that. 

Oh, and it's right next to a bunch of food trucks and a beer garden. Why does this place not have four stars again?

Everything is amazing right now, and nobody's happy.
author: Brian C.

description:
ehhh...i like smitten. i really do. but i think it's more about the novelty of eating ice cream made with liquid nitrogen than the actual taste of the ice cream itself. any edible science experiment is always kinda cool. 

i do appreciate smitten's methodology and their scientific, yet "artisanal", approach to ice cream. each of their scoops are made individually in this liquid nitrogen mixing bowl. but because of this, waits can get long, esp on those perfect sunny days in the city.

is it fair to compare smitten to places such as bi-rite, humphry slocombe, mr & mrs misc, etc? i don't know. but i will say that i would probably prefer the latter places over smitten if that's worth anything.
author: stefanie h.

description: Just okay. I guess this is what happens when a place like this has developed high expectations. After running around my hood (Hayes Valley) on an unseasonably warm Sunday I stood in line for the small-sized cup of tcho chocolate. I thought after reading all the reviews this ice cream would knock my socks off. It didn't. There is no question that the story behind the founder is endearing and that the product is high quality, local, natural, etc. It just didn't do it for me. The ice cream melts quickly and was a tad on the extra sweet side.
author: Jessica S.

description: I loved this place!! Tried it for the first time last night. The wait in line was not too bad and it was totally worth it. Plus, you get the free entertainment of watching them make all the ice cream orders ahead of you with the liquid nitrogen. At first I was surprised to see only 3 flavors available, and the prices were pretty steep ($4.75 for a a small?). I just got the plain vanilla but it was soo delicious, and not boring! Definitely the creamiest, smoothest ice cream I can remember enjoying. My friend got the sweet corn with berries and I tried a bit. It was yummy as well. I also liked the little story boards on the inside explaining how Smitten got started and the theory behind the liquid nitrogen. Overall a really cool experience and worth a trip for sure.
author: Becca S.

description: pear carmel creme fraiche was awesome! Love the live mixing of my ice cream on the spot. Not scooped from a container like other places... Whenever I'm in the city i will do my best to make a stop here for the sweet treat!
author: Johnny K.

description: I watched the birth of this place on TV; how the machine was invented and how they freeze the ingredient right then and there. Who would have thought of making fresh ice cream with liquid nitrogen? Until last night I finally had a chance to try. I had honey nectarine and fresh mint chocolate chip. I asked them to skip the chocolate chip on mine. The mint taste like fresh spice and taste so different from what you know and expect. I am in love with Smitten, refreshing and delightful. Not the same as any high fructose & artificial flavor stuff. It's a must try but expect long line. I would rate 5 stars for the invention and the gimmick. 5 stars for the fresh and smooth creamy goodness, 5 stars for the staffs and service....5....OK, 3 for the line. =(
author: Edy C.

description: So, the first time I went to Smitten last summer I ordered the peanut butter ice cream with honey as a topping and it just blew me away. It was probably the best ice cream I have had in years. But the last 3 times I've gone there were at night and in the dead of winter and the ice cream had a different texture. The first time it was dense and creamy and perfect but the other times it was a little crumbly, if that makes sense. Maybe it has something to do with the weather. I wish they would bring back the peanut butter flavor, I've been waiting very patiently!
author: L. L.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had!!  Rich, creamy goodness!  Plus engineered diagrams?!  I am smitten with Smitten! :)  It is a bit expensive but the product is worth the price. Definitely worth a try and regular returns!
author: Win L.

description: Smoothest ice cream I have ever eaten.  There was no hint of ice crystals.  The thing that knocks it down one star for me is probably due to my taste buds, but the TCHO chocolate was just really rich...a little too rich for my taste.  But overall, it was pretty good and I would probably try the coffee one next time.
author: Lawrence E.

description: Pretty good ice cream. I love that they make it on the spot. We went when they ran out of a a lot of the flavors which is why I'm giving this 3 stars. But I got strawberry ice cream with white balsamic syrup..it was good and creamy. For the price, its pretty small but it's okay for me since I don't eat that much sweets. But for others, they prob don't think it's enough. It was a cool place and def will try their hand rolled waffle cones:)
author: Angela C.

description: A group of friends and I went here yesterday after leaving dinner.  It was late so, we ended up going to Smitten for dessert.  The ice cream here is made to order and the cool part is how they make it using liquid nitrogen, viola you have instant ice cream.  I ordered the brown sugar ice cream, another friend ordered the olive oil ice cream with lavender short bread batter.  The brown sugar was very tasty but the olive oil ice cream didn't sound so tasty.  I would give them four stars but they lost one because of the wait.  One of my friends ordered plain vanilla ice cream and it took  10-15 minutes to get his ice cream and he ordered his before me and one other person.  By the time he got his ice cream everybody in our group had gotten their ice cream and was finished.  Besides that everything was good.
author: Nekiba M.

description: Ice cream is pretty good but it melts super fast. It's a little pricey for scoop but I think it's more for novelty. It's not GREAT it's just good. The line can get supering so be prepared for a wait
author: Jewlz L.

description: This is a must have if you are visiting San Francisco. The flavor and texture of this frozen delicacy is something you have to try!
author: Robbie K.

description: Absolutely amazing.  Had the vanilla with a chocolate sauce.  Like silk in a cup.  It's pricey but, as with all good food, you don't need a lot to be satisfied.  The shop is cute but go for the ice cream.
author: Kris W.

description: Visiting the area, I was very curious to try this place since there seemed to be a good number of people buzzing about. I ordered the lavender ice cream with bits of short bread folded in, drizzled with olive oil, and served in a homemade waffle cone. I was not at all disappointed! I'll definitely be back to try other flavors in the future.
author: Stephen R.

description: A unique ice-cream process, part of the fun is watching the liquid nitrogen smoke out of the mixer. Fanciful toppings such as coconut brittle makes this ice-creamery stand apart from others in SF. I did not care too much for the cone other than its decorative pattern though.
author: Liz L.

description:
This was a cool place to try out.  The ice cream is quite good, and the wait wasn't too bad, I think the only knock is it is a tad pricy.

I had the TCHO chocolate and the ginger peach.  I enjoyed both.  The ice cream was just really soft and creamy, more so than any other place.  The chocolate had a great flavor and the ginger peach tasted really fresh.
author: Larry C.

description: I like the concept of using liquid nitrogen to make icecream right in front of you, but the icecream tasted just like a generic safeway icecream.
author: Jessica N.

description: Really good Ice Cream. Very popular. Can't go wrong with the Vanilla, but the other ones are good too (tried tcho, mint). I haven't found anything to pick on, so 5 stars! :) I'd definitely go back and try other flavors. Doesn't hurt that there's also the $5 paypal deal for smitten!
author: Edison T.

description: I tried sweet corn flavor and it was the best ice cream ever. Not too creamy or sweet. It was just perfect!
author: Sushi L.

description: Smitten Ice Cream is Delicioso and the have VEGAN Popsicles right now too!!
author: Tigre T.

description: My friend took me there on a Thursday night about two weeks ago. It was cold, and there weren't a lot of people there. We both got the seasonal flavor, cinnamon apple crisp, and she added burnt sugar caramel. Service was quick as our cones were ready right after we finished paying. The ice cream was really good - flavorful and not too sweet. I tried the caramel, and it was good too. Combining it with the ice cream was awesomely delicious. The cone was yummy. It felt slightly thicker than most, and it held up really well. The cone stayed crunchy and dry the entire time it took me to finish, which was about half an hour or more! That amazed me. I can't wait to go again to try more flavors and get the everlasting cone! (Okay, I just realized weather might have helped that one.)
author: Glo T.

description: Smitten makes their ice cream super fresh. I mean literally in front of you, made to order. Their menu isn't the most extensive but that's because they're not giving you scoops of pre-made ice cream out of a tub. I got the mint, chocolate chip and I thought it was amazing. The mint tasted like a real mint leaf, and the chocolate chips were delicious. Prices were good and they're nearby a coffee shop, and a play ground so there's plenty of places to sit while you eat, enjoy your day, or people watch. Fantastic place. I'll be back.
author: Ken C.

description:
The BEST ice cream around!

My friend lives in the neighborhood and every time I go to her house, we go and get Smitten's ice cream! I LOVED the mint chocolate chip and also had the chocolate (preferred the mint chip but I always do).

I crave this place all the time and wish there was one in my neighborhood!
author: Shoshana B.

description: Finally got to try this place and had their salted caramel.  The ice cream is made right in front of you with liquid nitrogen and is fresh.  I thought $5 for this small cup of ice cream was over rated.   The flavor I had was special and I never tried salt with caramel...lol.
author: Patrick C.

description: Ice cream could not be fresher, more natural, and richer than if I made it at home. This is how ice cream was meant to be created and gobbled up immediately! Yummm!
author: Chris C.

description: This place is unlike any other ice cream spot in the city. They have few flavors, which change everyday, all of which are unique an delicious. The ice cream is made right in front of you in a matter of minutes. The store is based out of an old shipping container right in the heart of hayes valley. Although it's not something I would get on the regular, it's definitely a spot I would recommend to try at least once.
author: Tracy L.

description: YUMYUMYUM.....Perfect day for ice cream!!!! it was such an interesting location to have this ice cream place but definitely worth venturing out to that neighborhood!!! Had the fresh mint ice cream with tcho chocolate.  You can just take the fresh mint...almost as if it was just picked....also tried the salted caramel but found it a little tooo sweet....but definitely cant wait to go out and get some more.  The ice cream is not thick and clumpy like how some ice cream places are after it's been sitting in the freezer for a while.  I wish they come up with some more flavors!!! Oh...and if you like pistachios you must add the pistachio brittle...makes everything sweeter!! :)
author: Mee-stique K.

description: I'd say go for the entertainment factor alone.  Where else can you get the ice cream made to order and watch liquid nitrogen in action (that's not on TV)?  The vanilla was the best, it's super creamy.  I'm not a huge chocolate fan, but my gf is, and even to her, the chocolate was way over the top.  It was like drinking chocolate - the ice cream version.  It's good for a bite or two, but that's about it.  Check it out once, then go to Bi-Rite or Humphry for the real deal.
author: daniel m.

description: The whole liquid nitrogen thing is a cool concept and does yield some pretty smooth ice cream, but I'm not sure if it's worth the wait. The vanilla was good, but it wasn't the bestest vanilla I've ever had. The salted-caramel was a bit too caramely and not enough salt in my opinion. But the people there are very nice, and it is cool to see them make the ice cream right on the spot! I just wish they made the ice cream in larger batches so we wouldn't have to wait so long. Anyway, this place is definitely worth trying out once, just so you can say that you've had liquid nitrogen ice cream =)
author: Jeff Y.

description: Meh, not sure what people love about this place. I get the novelty, but the ice cream's just so-so and it's not cheap. Probably populated by the same fools who thought dip'n'dots were cool.
author: Chris M.

description: This would receive a perfect five stars if the vanilla flavor didn't taste like it came straight out of those giant plastic bottles of cheap extract you get at Costco. The texture, the sweetness, and the fattiness of this ice cream was next level perfection however. One of the best ice creams I've ever had in my life
author: Jay B.

description: This place is great.  Yeah you pay a lot more, but this is San Francisco people.  Drinks cost $8-$10 so you pay a bit more for some super ice cream with top of the line ingredients using liquid nitrogen to freeze it up.  Had the malted Vanilla with Tcho chocolate syrup, my son had Tcho chocolate ice cream with butter brickle cruches.  Simple choices, but complex tastes with original ingredients.  Great consistent texture of cool creaminess.  Oh yeah, my son loves the "chocolate smoke" as the ice cream is made.
author: Michael B.

description: Oh my god. I love this place! Their ice cream is so smooth and creamy. I tried the Tcho chocolate and the mint with Tcho chocolate trips. The chocolate was one of the best I ever had. I can't wait to go back.
author: Amy N.

description:
what i ordered... classic vanilla

...you go at this joint just for the kicks to see how ice cream is made using nitrogen and............. how it lightens your wallet without filling your tummy. 

ice cream was good but not as creamy as haagen dasz and/or double rainbow.

ambiance... great (not there tinnie shack but the nice playground next to it)
service... ok
cost... $+(really expensive)
author: Gors P.

description: Woot! Ice cream how it should be! I got a pint of the tcho chocolate with spicy caramel and tcho krispies in it and enjoyed in for almost a week! However, the ice cream has no preservatives in it so i ended up tossing the rest because it isn't shelf stable for long periods of time an the texture kind of degrades after about a week (as per label sticker on pint). This ice cream is incredibly rich and has a very creamy texture that doesn't melt down to wateriness after it melts, so I would advise a small portion. They do have a kids size that is perfect for someone with a sweet tooth that doesn't want to eat too much ice cream. The way they make it is awesome to watch, an it's always nice to know that something is FRESH. The seasonal flavors are awesome, and follow what's seasonally available...including corn, pears, lavender, nectarines, blood oranges...and the list goes on. The girl at the register was super informative and even helped my friend with sulfide allergies order ice cream to make sure it wouldn't cause any reactions. I found them accommodating and fun loving. They were even singing and laughing when they were working. Yay ice cream!
author: Rachel L.

description: My friend says this place has the best ice cream ever and make sure that you get the homemade toffee. I don't do dairy so I am so happy to say that they have vegan popsicles that are also out of this world.  Get what you like and enjoy sitting at Patricia's Green!
author: Storm A.

description: Definitely going back. Delicious ice cream with quirky named toppings,  where the liquid nitrogen is definitely adding a fancier feeling to the ice cream you are about to taste. A nice distraction while your friends stand in the long line to the neighboring Biergarten :)
author: Jie C.

description: i don't usually get reg chocolate ice cream but smitten's chocolate ice cream is SO GREAT HOLY SHIT. and you cannot go wrong with their salted caramel best one I've had
author: Erika P.

description: I noticed the line and was curious at how they made their ice cream. I tried the coconut ice cream w/almond brittle. Super good,i should've gotten a bigger size!!! There's a bit of a wait,but each flavor is made to order. I can't wait to try more flavors next time.
author: Patricia S.

description: Ok so my awesome clients told me I needed to go to Smitten Ice Cream since I live only a block away and even tho they know I'm not that big of an ice cream fanatic. So last night, decision was made...off we go to try it out and see what the hype is all about. I was in awe over the actual process. Liquid Nitrogen...really? and decided to go w/mint and choco chip. Watching them go to work making my ice cream was worth the money alone and then I took my first bite. Holy Fashizle my Dizzle! This is amazing. Honestly. I was in a dreamlike state for what seemed like hours. Thank you Smitten for making me a lifer. I have a new vice...and it doesn't give me a hangover :)
author: Maryanne D.

description:
i LOVE this place. ice cream - liquid nitrogen in front of your eyes. entertains the kids.

minus 1 star b/c when we got the cone and had toppings - the person tried to make the toppings stick but NONE or very little stuck, so I felt ripped off

wah. they need better quality control - or to realize if I pay for toppings, I want my toppings. 

But the ice cream is yummy yummy. we come here as often as we can.

yeah. the cone was OK. not as good as the crunchy brown kind at 31, but it was fancy?
author: Sophia Y.

description: I got the fresh mint chip with carmel sauce (as recommended by the cashier) and my hubbie ordered the vanilla with cinnamon shortbread cookie crumbles.  I liked his choice much better!   The mint was just too garden-minty for my taste.  I should have ordered the ginger peach!!!
author: Carolyn P.

description: I have been here once and it's really really good. Like your ice cream is made to order. There are large tubes, which I can only imagine carry liquid nitrogen in them, that go across the ceiling of this place and drop down into the 4 or so stations that you order at. You order your flavor and then magically you see this amazing display of fog form from a bowl by the window and cover the station and the seeps out to the ground you are standing on. Cool setup (see what I did there). They have interesting flavors and really friendly service too. Salted Carmel for the win. It's got a nice location and a really good product.
author: Greg G.

description:
Ice Cream made to order with liquid nitrogen? 
My first expression was to try it and wonder if the long lines was worth the wait. Apparently they change the flavors of the ice cream frequently though classic flavors such vanilla and chocolate are always on their menu. My day's flavors were vanilla, TCHO chocolate, nectarine, and lemon verbena. I ordered a kiddie size of lemon verbena and maybe I chose the wrong flavor or something, but I was quite disappointed. It tasted quite gross and while I was thankfully glad I ordered a small size, my friend who ordered vanilla had a great experience. Anyway, service is slow, but that's because the ice creams are made to order. For the time spent on waiting in line, limited flavors, no sample tastings, the amount of ice cream given, and the price itself, it may be worth the experience to try liquid nitrogen ice cream. But I rather have ice creams from other shops that carries more varieties in flavors, given in bigger quantities with less the price paid at Smitten.

I was not quite 'Smitten' with my flavor, but I might want to try other flavors for myself to see if I could see it happening.
author: Kim L.

description: Ice-cream made to order with some crazy scientist machines (using liquid nitrogen). Only 3 flavors, rotating weekly. Where foodie meets nerd meets hipster. A mandatory stop on any gastronomy tour of San Francisco. If only to experience the concept.
author: Ruben K.

description: Wow I thought I was watching an episode of Top Chef  when they make Ice Cream but the even use an ice cream machine. The texture was a bit weird but I guess that's what fresh ice cream tastes like. One star off because you cannot mix flavors (it takes longer to make and it would melt fast apparently...)...
author: Chris D.

description:
As a scientifically and gastronomically inclined college freshman, I experimented for many a spring afternoon with liquid nitrogen.  That stopped when the Stanford police caught a couple of my friends taking liquid nitrogen from a lab at 4am.  Oops.  At some point, we came up with a business plan for a liquid nitrogen ice cream stand.  But that wasn't anything that any of us were willing to abandon school/our regular jobs for.  Smitten Ice Cream is sort of a realization of our halfhearted dream.

The ice cream itself (I had the chocolate) was good but not particularly memorable.  It was rather fluffy, not really what I was expecting based on past experiences.  They have pizzella cones, which weren't really what I expected either--usually pizzelle are somewhat crispier.  

Also, the ice cream is kinda expensive relative to the taste.  I enjoyed coming here for the novelty (they have pretty cool machines, which are like stand mixers but with a liquid nitrogen feed), and novelty is a big part of what you're paying for.  But it's probably not my first choice for getting my expensive ice cream fix.

Idea:  There's a Ritual coffee on the other side of the building.  You could make a LN2 ice cream affogato!
author: Frank F.

description: A must have if you're in the area...it's all natural and they make it fresh just for you...a little on the pricey side but well worth it...
author: j m.

description: This place is special in that it is located in a salvaged shipping container and the ice cream is made with liquid nitrogen which makes the ice cream smooth. That being said, there is a down side in that you can't try the flavors before you order them. Boyfriend got the chocolate and I got the blood orange. We both got a caramel drizzle on top for $.50 each. The drizzle wasn't really worth it, it was more decorative than anything else. On the bright side, it is next to a very cute park that I loved.
author: Dar E.

description: Ice cream on-demand via liquid nitrogen.  Try it on a cold evening, no lines.
author: K W.

description:
I really wanted to like Smitten! I realllly did. I'd heard nothing but great things about it. However, I ended up throwing my half-eaten small mint chocolate chip away. :(

things that were awesome:
- watching them make it! the liquid nitrogen is so cool, and logically it sounds like it would make for creamier, way better than normal ice cream.
- there was no line. from other reviews I've read that's been a problem.
- I like the simplicity of only have a few flavors to choose from. 
- they were doing 80's trivia night. 
- the guys working behind the counter were nice.

things that weren't awesome:
- the mint tasted a little too much like I was biting into a mint leaf. 
- after five minutes, I threw it away. It left a really gross creamy filmy residue in my mouth. I don't know if it was how it was made, or what. But I've never not finished my ice cream! I'm an American. 

Sad to say, but I won't be going back. Humphry Slocombe forever. Huzzah!
author: Molly P.

description: I've had LN ice cream before, so the novelty is not factored into this review. Tonight, after a big meal in China town we decided to try out this place. The salted caramel is very good. It's nicely balanced, although a touch salty compared to Tin Pot. As expected, the texture is very smooth and the cone excellent (firm but crumbly, almost like biscuit).
author: Tan V.

description: Good stuff! Very creamy ice cream and very creative flavors, but you can't go wrong with just regular vanilla ice cream! It is a bit on the expensive price for ice cream, but hey, you are paying for the experience as well! Give it a try!
author: Sappho C.

description: I wasn't smitten over Smitten. Decided to give it a try since my friend kept on raving about it, and I wasn't all that impressed. Sure it was an experience checking out since they make their ice cream out of liquid nitrogen, so watching it being made was a pretty cool process, but other than that, you pay a pricey $3 for a kiddie sized scoop of ice cream that has the texture of a fudgesicle. I give it one star for having TCHO chocolate ice cream, and another star for a pretty creative concept. Otherwise I would prefer my calories/fat to come from an ice cream joint like Humphrys Slocombe.
author: Peylin F.

description: All I can say is wow this is the best ice cream place I've ever tried in my life not knowing about how famous this place actually is I was passing by in San Francisco and decided to stop and I am happy I made that decision I'm not usually a big ice cream eater but this is hands-down the best ice cream I've ever had they have very exotic different flavors and toppings it is a little on the pricey side for ice cream but again it is so good it is worth it
author: Julie A.

description: The rumors are true-- they have the smoothest ice cream. Not the best, but the smoothest. Limited flavors encourage repeats. $10 bowl too much for one person.
author: Inigo M.

description: On a beautiful Friday afternoon, and after a trip to the dentist's office, I wanted me some ice cream.  I've been searching and tasting many SF local legit ice cream shops (none of those chains like Baskin' Robbins, Double Rainbow, etc.) and Smitten was a go-to on my list of ice cream places to try.  Liquid nitrogen does makes a difference.  A bit on the pricy side, but hey, what can you say?  $6 for a regular (3 scoops of ice cream) made with liquid nitrogen, and the only shop that makes ice cream with such a chemical?  Definitely worth the treat.  Today's menu was a bit on the "regular" side: vanilla, early grey w/milk chocolate chips, salted caramel, TCHO chocolate...nothing interesting that stood out to me.  I was hoping I'd be able to mix/match, and after telling the cashier I wanted 2 different flavors, he said I couldn't mix flavors :/  But then again, all the ice cream is made to order (perhaps why no mixing), which is a PLUS in my book.  I ended up ordering the early grey with milk chocolate chips.  The texture itself: VERY smooth as most would say; flavors: I was able to taste the earl grey flavor but chocolate chips did stand out more than the ice cream flavor; I guess generally early grey tea doesn't have that strong a flavor.  Other than that, earl grey ice cream is one of my  newer go-to flavors.  If I compare both Smitten and Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous's earl grey ice cream, I'd say Smitten over Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Jessica S.

description: This was honestly the best ice cream I have EVER had... and I have tried a lot of ice cream in my life.  Even more impressive, they had me hooked with their simple, yet perfect chocolate.
author: Courtney H.

description: walk-by with friends...and tried the vanilla...it was absolutely delicious...freshly made.  first time in ages I didn't have a reaction to ice cream!  not sure if it was b/c it was freshly-made, or lactose/gluten-free?  regardless...it was just delicious.  good staff, good location, good ambiance...definitely would go back!
author: Ara L.

description: Delicious!!! But kind of expensive, and not many places to sit. Go for the ice cream, and the experience, but not for the ambiance or to stay.
author: Juliana S.

description: I would go here again, but I think it is a little over priced and I don't think the counter people are very nice.  I was there last Sunday with my parents and I ordered four things, two cones and two cups.  The chocolate ice cream was really good.
author: Carlos P.

description: Cute shop with a modern concept, however, the product left much to be desired.  I had Lavender with Vanilla Honey Shortbread which initially tasted delicious, but left a funky film in my mouth--ick.  Also this place is pricey for ice cream. My $3 kid sized ice cream scoop was the size of a golf ball. I would say check it out to see the Kelvin machine (which runs on liquid nitrogen) make your to-order ice cream, but beyond the gimmick of this gizmo, I would recommend going elsewhere.
author: Natalia K.

description: When we visited only two of their machines were working so they only had vanilla and chocolate. I really wanted to try the more unique flavors but we ended up trying what they had available.  They do the classics pretty darn well, particularly vanilla. The caramel sauce was good too. Would love to go back and try more flavors. Neat store concept and area. Pricey but worth it as an occasional treat.
author: Chanda E.

description: I find the texture doesn't live up to the hype and the flavors just don't hit the high notes. And pricey. I do however like that they've made a better waiting space. I worried about kids getting hit by cars.
author: Rachel H.

description:
This is, hands down, my favorite ice cream place in San Francisco. Granted I've not been to every single place so I can only compare to Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe. 

I love the idea of having the ice cream made right in front of me, but must admit that I don't have the attention span to stare as it happens. Plus, I usually busily chatting away with my friends while we wait for our order. 

The quality of the finished product is really why this place is my favorite. With the exception of one time, I always get the Tcho Chocolate with the candied jalapenos.  It's like eating chocolate butter. It is incredibly rich and smooth and dense. The chocolate is not too sweet, which is ideal. Seriously, it's like eating chocolate butter. Cold chocolate butter. Yum! Recently, I added in the strawberry syrup and that incredibly made it all even better. The strawberry syrup was freshly made and just went so well with the chocolate. The only downsides were that there was so little of the syrup and that it was a little too runny. I like adding the candied jalapenos mainly because they add an interesting texture to the ice cream experience. They are a vibrant green and red, not noticeably candied, and not at all spicy. I got the ice cream in a cone one time, but I didn't like that too much. I found the cone a little too flimsy and it ended up just getting in the way of my enjoyment of the chocolate. 

I like the pop-up shop in Hayes Valley, though I hope they get a more permanent location soon so that I can sit inside somewhere to enjoy my ice cream. Were I not so insane for this ice cream, I'd be fine with living through the winter months without ice cream, but as it is, I want this ice cream now but it is just so cold to be eating ice cream outdoors... I'd still probably do it though, as the first time I had this ice cream, it was in the rain. Pouring rain. 

I'm pleased that they accept credit card and that they use Square which simply emails or texts my receipt to me. 

I don't like to experiment too much with ice cream flavors. I really really like the chocolate, so I'm really only there to get the chocolate. The one time I experimented was because I went late in the day and they ran out of almost everything.  They talked me into getting the Lemon Verbena, which I was skeptical about but decided to give it a chance. As they make the ice creams to order, there is no sampling.  The first taste of it was a little weird, as I'm not used to ingesting verbena, but it got better and I quickly finished the rest of it. However, for the rest of the night, I was burping up verbena and that was definitely not pleasant. It was as if I'd chugged a bottle of Bath and Body Works lotion. Blech! So no more experimenting for me-- I'll stay conservative with my ice cream choices (this applies not just to Smitten but to Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite). 

Fair warning, the wait can sometimes be long when you add up the time you are standing in line to order and then waiting as your order is made. However, the wait is totally worth it.
author: Jia min C.

description: This place is so overrated. We waited in line for about 40mins, not worth it.  The ice cream is freshly made, but too sweet for me.
author: Emmy P.

description: Tcho choclolate ice cream for those chocolate lovers! Topped with lemon caramel, absolute perfection.
author: Sepas K.

description:
Yes, everyone raves about Smitten, but I can't seem to figure out why. The location itself if nice - right in the middle of Hayes Valley next to the Beer Garden. It is a cute stand with an enclosed seating area and an open kitchen so you can see your ice cream being made. Of course the liquid nitrogen is very, very cool, I'll give them that. But in the end, I came here for some ice cream - not matter how it is made. We ordered the Horchata and the Quince, and at first, I was ooooing and awwwweing at the magic of the liquid nitrogen. Then I tasted it, and my ooooing and awwwweing was replaced by a giant case of diasppointment. The ice cream was not cold, and I'll tell you it is strange to eat not cold ice cream. It was very creamy, but the flavors were dull and the texture reminded me of styrofoam. I really wanted to like it - I really did! I appreciate Smitten's quality ingredients, innovation, and overall "cool" factor, but it is just not for me :(

Eat it. Meh. Try not to repeat (maybe just stroll by to watch other people's ice cream being made!).
author: Jenna s.

description: I absolutely LOVED the ice cream here. I'm sad I didn't get a second chance to go before returning from my trip. I got the chocolate flavor in a cone (2 scoops). And the ice cream and cone were both divine. I  love that their ingredients are organic. They make the ice cream right in front of you, hence the long lines. But it's quite worth it. Yes, it's a bit expensive and you can't mix flavors, but I still loved it. Besides, I like that you get to fully taste one flavor instead of mixing it with a bunch of different ones. The ice cream doesn't make you feel full afterwards. It's not too sugary either. Recommended for sure!
author: Kelly P.

description: The Burner who made my ice cream was a joy but his coworker who I believe was of Indian descent needs to work on his customer service and demeanor.  It's a ice cream stand not a mortuary!
author: Eric J.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed watching each serving of ice cream being individually frozen by liquid nitrogen freezers right in front of my eyes. The shop is well designed, and the neighborhood is welcoming and fun.

I ordered vanilla with a strawberry syrup topping. The ice cream's texture is velvety smooth, like soft-serve, but firmer. Not as firm as at many other ice cream shops though. The strawberry topping wasn't very memorable.  Overall, the ice cream was pretty good.
author: Tim D.

description: Omg very good ice cream. Went one night after dinner tried the blood orange and my friend has the salted caramel. Needless to say we both got a second scoop to try other flavors and I went home with a large blood orange to go. Only thing is price is a little high for amount you get. But that could just be my gluttoness nature showing
author: Lani P.

description:
My wife had been reading about this place long before it actually opened and placed the bug in my ear as to what she had heard.

She was really eager to try it so we went and braved the crowds and paid the high price for this "freshly made" ice cream.

Color  me unimpressed - I had the TCHO chocolate and the texture was off (chalky), there was a total lack of creaminess and it  was way too dense.

My wife had the Salty Carmel, and while it was an improvement - it had the requisite creaminess - it was far too sweet.

I think the problem with this made-to-order/small batch method may be that quality control goes out the door.

I may give it some time and try it again later but for now I'll stick with Humphrey Slocumb, Hagen Daz and McConnells.
author: Bingo T. K.

description: The ice cream was amazing. It was a soft serve consistency but then so much creamier. I had the sweet corn with berries and what an awesome and different flavor. The corn ice cream was definitely a savory flavor but with the sweetness of the raspberry drizzle it was a perfect combination
author: Stephanie C.

description: Ice cream on the spot for you? How nice is that. I got their chocolate ice cream. so creammy, so good. They make ice cream as you order it with liquid nitrogen (don't worry, it's not toxic). But yeah, so cool!!!!
author: Khanh V.

description: Fun to see your ice cream made on the spot. But the prices are pretty steep, you can only get one flavor per order, and the cones need work. My ice cream was dripping through the gaping hole at the bottom of the cone so I devoured my ice cream fast. So fast that I freezer burnt it.
author: Judy L.

description:
yeah, i waited  30 minutes for a scoop of $5 ice cream. but, you know what, it was worth it. plus, it was sunny and i needed a tan. 

it's simple, straight forward goodness. super creamy, super delish.
author: Marie A.

description: what can I say except that i am definitely smitten by this place. they usually have 4 to 5 set flavors for the day that you can choose from. if you are more of a savory over sweet type of person this is going to be your go to ice cream shop. everything is so light and airy. when they say mint chocolate chip, you will definitely taste that mint. definitely not a bad thing; it is different from your typical Haagen daz, dove and Ben & Jerry's type of ice creams. smitten ice cream does not leave  a heavy  and sluggish feeling once you've consumed your dessert in its entirety, but you'll definitely be satisfied. definitely a place worth seeking out, at least once. all i gotta say is, liquid nitrogen is at work here. yup, i said it. now go check them out. ;-)
author: Germaine L.

description: Pretty tasty vanilla ice cream though there are better ice cream shops in the city.  I guess it is more about the experience since you get to watch the ice cream go from liquid to creamy goodness.  But for $4.75, it is better to see the show from the side window for free.
author: Aaron K.

description: Gimmick or revolutionary... I still can't decide, but the whirling cloud of liquid nitrogen did make the smoothest, creamiest ice cream I've had. I guess no ice crystals does make a difference. The flavors are uniquely San Francisco and this place made me a believer... I now demand all my ice cream be made to order... haha.
author: Steve K.

description: Interesting, different. The teco chocolate was more like a moose because it was so creamy. It wasn't bad, but for ice cream, I can find better.
author: Ed Z.

description: I don't know why people are complaining that this place is so pricey. I believe you pay for what you get. Every scoop of ice cream is made to order. They don't make your ice cream until you order it. You watch them make it. I believe it's worth every penny that I paid for. My boyfriend got the vanilla and I got the chocolate with almond brittle on top. We also decided to try the hand-made cones. The ice cream was so so creamy and rich, the almond brittle was sooo good. It was great topping. The cone was ok, good but not something I'd get again. Great place for hand-made ice cream and worth a try. Would get it again if I was in the neighborhood and needed a sweet treat.
author: Ada S.

description: Excellent spin on ice cream and salted caramel.  The process is quite impressive.  I suppose this is a unique spin off of Ferran Adria's work at elBulli.  Molecular gastronomy at its finest.
author: E L.

description: Delicious! Much needed addition to the Hayes Valley.  Be prepared to wait, though.
author: Peter S.

description:
This place is pretty much the Philz Coffee of ice cream: expensive, individually made, delicious.  At $6 for a standard size- this place ain't cheap.  It is, however, an experience to say the least.  The garbage disposal and I came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon with the god squad in full force.  We probably waited in line for about 10 minutes (I thought it'd take quite a bit longer!) and then waited another 10-15 min for our ice cream.  I got standard vanilla while the disposal ordered brown sugar.  His basically tasted like a snicker doodle- which was tasty, but a bit over the top.  Mine, however, was awesome!  Never underestimate vanilla!  YUM!  So creamy and perfect!

Bottom line- this place it worth trying at least once because it's fun to watch them make your ice cream from scratch.  Be prepared to pay inflated prices and wait in line- but also come with an appreciation for a new spin on ice cream!
author: Cersei T.

description: This is a temp type outdoor tent.   Nice location and the ice cream is great.   Great place to let your crazy kid run wild in the park while you load up on the calories and go into a diabetic coma.   Located right in Hayes Valley.
author: H D.

description: Stopped by for ice cream for the first time here on 12/27/11 after lunch at Absynthe.  The salted caramel and TCHO chocolate were both really good.  Creamy and smooth texture.  The kiddie size was just the right amount and worth the three bucks.  Plus, it was fun watching the liquid nitrogen.  Would definitely be back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Wendy K.

description: Pretty yommay stuffs here. And fun to see the liquid nitrogen contraptions making your ice cream right before your eyes. Cute lil place.
author: Diana C.

description: Made to order ice cream with a selection that changes everyday, thanks Kelvin!
author: Mark F.

description: AWESOMELY SMOOTH.  I love how it is freshly made per order with local & seasonal ingredients.  I happened upon it when I was looking to bring my cousin, who is in a home (w/alzheimer's) and he gobbled every last drop.  I got him chocolate with chocolate syrup.  I went back later and got myself vanilla w/chocolate syrup.  I  don't usually get 'real' ice cream but this was worth every calorie.  And that's another thing I like is the serving size is human size so you can appreciate and enjoy it without feeling sickly afterwards.  Check it out!  Love it!
author: Anne W.

description:
This place is great for people new to the city/area. The ice cream itself tastes a bit above average. Better than your big chain Bruster's or Baskin Robbins but not as tasty as Haagen Daaz.

It's mainly a cool experience to watch them make the ice cream with nitrogen. There's also some pretty interesting flavors they make like Strawberry w/ Peppercorn or the like.

However if they don't already have your flavor made, it takes a while for you to actually get your ice cream. Don't plan on making this a quick ice cream stop if there's a line. Prepare to wait 10-15 min after you order to actually get your ice cream if the line's long.
author: Klaus t.

description:
they have a great idea and they make, no doubt, good ice cream.  the texture is wonderful - silky, like soft serve - and the taste is as rich as that of hard ice cream.  but the flavor came up short and the celebrated liquid nitrogen made-to-order science fair-feel process was understated.

show off the novelty of this!  involve the consumers!  nobody has seen this anywhere else and its your central selling point.

we tried two flavors of the three, skipping chocolate but having vanilla and caramel.  the vanilla was so unpronounced that sweetened cream would have been a better name.  the caramel, on the other hand, was so intense as to pretty closely mimic hard butterscotch candies.  either way, our impression with both made the tiny portion sizes seem appropriate.
author: Justin B.

description: Delightful little ice cream shop, with interesting technology and off-the-wall flavors!  I got the Tcho Chocolate with Almond Brittle and my wife got the Olive Oil & Lavender Sweetbread with Meyers Lemon Caramel. Both were very good and we'd definitely come back again.
author: Nate M.

description: I'm smitten with smitten....most of the time. I wish I could give it 3 and a half stars, its better than ok, but not always great. The textures are inconsistent as are the flavors. I love the peanut butter, malted and salted caramel but just as strongly disliked the brown butter and the green tea. Its a shame they can only offer a few flavors at once because I've walked away if they don't have one I like. That all being said, the three I love, I love enough to keep trying.
author: Susie D.

description: Plain ol' vaniilla is the way to go if you're in doubt. What a treat, even on a cold SF fall day!!
author: P G.

description: I'm not a native SF person son I don't know if this location is good or not, but at least it looked good.  Very different type of creation in terms of design.  Very creative way to make a great treat.  We tried the Mint Tcho and the brown sugar w/ graham cracker.  Both of them were more then outstanding.  It tasted as if I was eating mint leaves.  Only thing I thought that was a little odd was the inverted plastic cartons as chairs.  There is a animal park right next too it though for better seating.  Staff was friendly and funny.  They also use an Ipad as the register, which I thought was a nice thing to see.
author: Scott D.

description: Fun new indoor/outdoor ice cream place near Octavia square in Hayes Valley. TCHO Chocolate our fave, but skip the Coconut. And we'll come earlier next time for the new Biergarten next door 2p-8p.
author: Peter H.

description: Not have again: Tyco chocolate ice cream was ok, but I was expecting something really great. It was very smooth and very chocolaty, but just not something I'd get again. Funny place: I stood there for several minutes watching two of the three people just standing around and finally had to ask if I was at the right window for ordering, which I was. I'd rather go to Bi-rite Creamery for unusual ice cream.
author: Keith R.

description: I'm in love with this ice cream. It's the creamiest ever. If you are unsure about what to order you can never go wrong with the chocolate. I recently had the spicy version of the chocolate and came back for more later the same week. I loved the malted vanilla with pistachio brittle, and the meyer lemon with sugar cookie topping. LOVE. LOVE. LOVE.
author: Malia D.

description: Totally not worth it. Literally $7 for an ice cream cone. Granted they make the ice cream in front of you, which is a cute idea for almost any other type of food, for ice cream, nobody wants to have to wait 40 minutes for a cone, expecially if you're with kids. Cute idea, poorly executed.
author: Emily G.

description: Tried this place over the weekend on an incredibly hot day during the Capsule Urban Air Market ... the line was long and ridiculously slow.. probably because each cone is actually hand crafted made to order and it does take a lot of effort to make this "fresh" ice cream.  I do like that it was preservative free though.. and hence the high price tag as well.  it is an awesome experience to watch them make and scoop your ice cream out of the metal tins.  I ordered the sweet corn with bluberry sauce.. it was OK.. it tasted really unique but yes.. like frozen cream of corn soup!.. just sweet not salty.  never had anything like that before.. my friend got the brown sugar with cinnamon cookies.. that was really good.. tasted like snickerdoodle! overall a good experience, kinda pricey but delish.. however, still prefer bi rite. =)
author: Margie C.

description: Yeah, the prices seem jaw-dropping at first, but this may be the best ice cream I've ever had... I've tried the fresh strawberry + white balsamic; tcho chocolate (OMG), fresh mint with nibs.  Spend $3 (on the kiddie size) and just try it!
author: seema s.

description:
got the TCHO 65% chocolate ice cream.
so tasty and worth the wait in line.
mmmmm
author: T H.

description:
This is a one-of-a-kind place I would give a chance just for the experience.
The serving sizes looked tiny so I ordered two scoops of the Malt to share with my better half. The Malt was surely....malty, but in a good way. Those little cups fooled me, because I was dying trying finish the last dozen bites. Six bucks is still a bit pricey for ice cream made with "science", but it was worth the try & well worth the fun. 

Always go to Smitten with friends, it enhances the sweetness of the ice cream.
author: Naomi S.

description: TCHO chocolate was great, very chocolately, and smooth, almost like frozen custard. The vanilla was good, topped with blueberry sauce - it was ok, but the chocolate was better by far.
author: June W.

description: When I make it at home, it is a three day process. Not at Smitten, you can get instant gratification.  The clever ladies at Smitten have created a kitchen aid mixer/liquid nitrogen pump franken-freezer that can create ice cream to order.  Strawberry is my favorite ice cream flavor on earth. Smitten's version is nice, light and a bit on the tart side which is fine by me.
author: Monica L.

description: It was really good, and the smiley girl who helped us was nice and informative without being annoying. Creamiest ice cream I've had, she said because it's made using liquid nitrogen there's no ice crystals that form, and it's true, it was like silk. The tcho chocolate was a little too rich for me, but the mint and the vanilla were both super yummy and the chocolate nibs were a nice crunchy contrast.
author: Harmony N.

description: Yesterday, and friend and I went on a 6 location ice cream spree.  Smitten was our fourth stop.  The shop is located in Hayes Valley and is operated out of a recycled shipping container.  Their ice cream is made on the spot when you order via a machine that uses liquid nitrogen that gets poured into the ice cream mixture.  A very interesting but unique concept for producing the frozen desert. They were offering three different flavors and I ordered the Lemon Verbena.  I got the kiddie size, which was almost $3.  Since they make the ice cream as you order, it is fresh as you can get.  The texture of the ice cream is creamy, yet light.  This place is definitely a winner and a must try for ice cream enthusiast!
author: Shad B.

description: Really great ice cream. The wait just kills though. Definitely worth trying at least once. Where else are you going to get ice cream made on the spot for you.
author: Fouzi H.

description: Good ice cream...bad service.   The first time I got ice cream there they were out of the waffle cones.  O.k , maybe it was a busy day.  The second time I went they were again out of waffle cones.  I was a bit shocked what the person behind the counter said to me when I expressed my frustration.  She said "Well, you should get here sooner."  I suggested that since the cones are made fresh it seems reasonable that there should be batter and a warm waffle iron ready to make the cones on the spot.  An ice cream shop with no cones seems like poor planning and business.   Don't think I will go back mainl because of the poor service.
author: Jace L.

description: Went to SF for a little food trip over the xmas holidays.  I have heard so much about this place and with all the hype around liquid nitrogen all of the sudden, I thought I would give it a try.  First, parking was a nightmare.  So my friend had to drop me off.  Once inside, the staff was very nice.  Yes, the flavors were limited (I think there were only 3 at the time?)  I ordered the salted caramel.  I stood there and watched the magic happened through the clear glass.  I was expecting an icy texture.  Boy was I wrong!  It was very creamy and flavors were well balanced!  My sister ordered the some kind of chocolate flavor.  It was very creamy and very chocolaty but not too sweet.  It was like a ice cream party in my mouth!  I would definitely go back!
author: Viv L.

description: The ice cream is delicious. Take note that if they say it tastes like something, it tastes like that actual thing. For example, mint ice cream tastes like ice cream with mint plant in it. My favorite part is the cone, but they often run out. Their brittle toppings are also fantastic.
author: Justin S.

description:
I thought about this and I had to come down on the 3 side. 

Would I wait 15 minutes for this like I would for Bi-Rite Creamery ice cream? No.

Would I make a special trip? It was fun for once, but...no.

If I were in the neighborhood and I wanted ice cream would I stay here and eat Smitten or head over to 18th Street for Bi-Rite? Depends on how much time I had and whether I needed the exercise.

Is it worth the premium price to have your ice cream made to order? Probably not.

Is it good chocolate ice cream? Definitely yes, but not stellar and not as good as Bi-Rite. I liked the creaminess. I agree, why would anyone complain about creaminess in ice cream? And it seems to obey the laws of physics in terms of time-to-melt, so no complaints there. But I didn't eat it and go wow!

Would I eat it again? Definitely yes.

Pleasant and helpful staff.

I checked no under "good for groups" because, given it's made-to-order and you need to eat the ice cream when you get it, it takes a lot longer time to serve a group, so the first person would be done long before the last person got their ice cream. I am open to being proven wrong.

Outdoor seating is across the street in the mini-park, which is nice. The park gets 4 stars.

chocolatelyness score 5 on a scale of 1 to 10
author: Charles B.

description: Smitten is a great ice cream place for families, techies, and all people. The process of them making it is fun to watch and great for kids. Sometimes, finding parking and the location can be a drag but once you finished your ice cream you will be a happy trooper! Overall, it is a cool place and many hipsters hang out around it but it is a great stop for families.
author: Ethan B.

description:
Tempted by the line, the story of handmade ice cream, and the great location next to the park, my friend and I got in line.  We waited 15 minutes to order.  We were told we could not have two kinds of ice cream no matter how big the cup because they want to serve their ice cream fresh right out of the mixer, and didn't want one to melt before the other was ready.  It turns out this comment was prescient.

So I ordered butter pecan; and she, chocolate.  My butter pecan came out in about 10 minutes and I waited politely for hers to come out so we could walk to the park and eat there.  We waited for 20 more minutes and my ice cream completely melted to soup: pecans sitting in milk.  Then she went up and asked how longer hers would be.  They asked her what she ordered and how much she paid.  We thought maybe they would give her a refund for having to wait 45 minutes for ice cream.  They didn't.  They got her ice cream immediately (relatively), and were only asking about how much money we paid so they knew what size to get.

They didn't apologize for us having to wait so long.  Our plan to eat ice cream together in the park was ruined.  We didn't have any more time anyway.  It was ridiculous that they wouldn't give us two flavors in one cup because they come out at slightly different times, but then they make us wait 30 minutes for hers while mine melts.  Also we are used to waiting in line at Bi-Rite, but at least that's the line to order and once you pay your money, you get your ice cream.  But Smitten made us wait 30 minutes AFTER we ordered, and even then, we had to complain that mine was melted and could they please make hers.  They didn't care we waited for a total of 45 minutes, nor that mine was completely soup by the time my friend got hers.

Great location, cool idea, ok ice cream, really bad customer service.
author: R F.

description: The salted caramel is not as good as Bi-Rite, the fresh mint is not as good as Treats in Nevada City.  And it's $4.75 for a cup, add $1 if you want a cone so it's more expensive than either of the other places.  Knowing it's made with nitrogen shouldn't blind you to the fact that it isn't really special.  Friends say the Meyer Lemon is very good but they always claim something else is better after you've had two mediocre flavors.  This review is for the one in Los Altos.
author: Diane D.

description: If I lived here - I would get Smitten ice cream every day.  I had the salted caramel which was awesome - but was kind of jealous of my husband's TCHO chocolate - it was incredible.  Expensive - but definitely worth it.
author: Kristen Z.

description: Deliciously smooooooth.  So glad they opened a location in the Los Altos Whole Foods.  Now we don't need to drive to SF for it.  Been there twice already since they opened last week.  TCHO chocolate was intense, but the Meyer Lemon+gingersnap didn't quite work for me as the bits of crushed gingersnap kept interfering with the texture of the lemon.  Wish they could make Meyer Lemon by itself.   4 stars because it's really very expensive and they were "sold out" on two of the six flavors when we were there. by the way, also yummy waffle cone.
author: Karen Y.

description: Good ice cream joint.  I still prefer bi-rite over this place but if I'm in the area I'll definitely pass by and pick some up.  I had the brown sugar ice cream which was very good.
author: Brian A.

description: $3 for a kiddie size. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but it's worth it. Malted Vanilla, all the way.
author: Stacey J.

description: OMG this is amazing ice cream!!  I got the brown sugar and it had cinnamon cookies crumbled in it.  I should have gotten the large...almost got in line to get more but had to show some restraint!  The employee told us they rotate flavors and I can't wait to go back!
author: Vaishali S.

description: I went during opening week so they didn't have the TCHO flavor yet. Tried 2 kiddie sized flavors: strawberry/white balsamic and the salted caramel. Salted caramel was easily my favorite of the two. Also, they use liquid nitrogen to freeze the ice cream in front of you...seemed gimmicky to me.
author: Justine S.

description: Tasted the chocolate and vanilla flavors on a sunny day.  Rich, tasty and make sure to try the homemade waffle cone.  Excellent location and busy. Wished there was less of a wait but overall great experience. Enjoy.
author: Annette C.

description: Crazy long wait, but delicious ice cream! I had the salted caramel and it's just mouth watering. It's definitely a must try, but not sure how often I'll return until the lines shorten a bit after all the hype. Can't afford to lose 30-40 min in line for 1 scoop of ice cream (although crazy tasty!) Looking forward for the hype to die down a little so I can return to try the chocolate w/ hot peppers
author: linda t.

description:
wow. ess deleeshus...
4 flavors on the menu. but creative they are. me & my boo boo muffin had the brown sugar with cinnamon shortbread...omg... what a fantabulous choice. and that fragile, melt in your mouth cone... lucky us, we were visiting my friend tiffany and it happened to be her day to make the ice cream mix. great job tiff!! and you are awesome for saving them thousands of $$ by knowing how to roll a damn cone!
author: Mel J.

description: I was skeptical at first, but it was really good. The cones are amazing. They almost taste like a deep fried crepe. The small size is a decent portion too. I hate spending $5 on ice cream just to get a decent portion, so I was pleasantly surprised when I got my small and found that it was plenty for me.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
i was super excited for smitten to open a more permanent location after seeing their website. made to order! organic cream! liquid nitrogen! amazing flavor combos!
